I called hoping to have the $3.00 taken from my bill when we planned on going and nothing. I called 6 times, got through once and got another call back but no acknowledgment of the 3rd party charging customers double for a reservation and no sympathy at all. 

I know it's only $3.00, but there was also no acknowledgment in the course of 2 months. So 3 stars (2.5 but I'm rounding up) for customer service.
author: Megan L.

description:
I am officially obsessed with Lovejoy's! I live a few blocks from here and after begging A for MONTHS to go on a tea date with me, he finally gave in and we were able to make a reservation. I will say that I think we may have gotten in earlier had we been able to walk in but Lovejoy's is too popular. I think the reservation process is a bit opaque, however, since you have to request a reservation without knowing which times are available. I wish they were on OpenTable or Resy or at least had a more detailed calendar but I guess there is some charm in having to go through a bit of effort.

Anyways, we requested any available time but noted that we preferred earlier in the day on Saturday rather than later. To our luck, we got a reservation at 11AM right when they opened. When we got there, the place was already pretty full and there was a wedding shower going on at one of the long communal tables. Lovejoy's is SUPER cute on the inside and they have all of these adorable hats you can wear during your tea party. A was not about that AT ALL and felt a bit self-conscious in the admittedly feminine space.

Anyways, we had a difficult time ordering because we didn't want to over-order. We settled on getting one Queen's Tea ($28) and split the bottomless tea pot (+$2) since we both wanted a black tea and it didn't make sense to spend an additional $10 when we would have ordered something similar if not the same thing. We also split the Tea Sandwich Plate ($12.95). The 4 tea sandwich choices we chose between the Queen's Tea and the Plate were the Roast Beef & Horseradish, Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad, Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese and the Pear and Stilton. We liked them all with the exception of the Pear and Stilton which had a weird taste. Both sandwich plates also came with a mixed green salad and cabbage slaw both of which were okay if not standard. The Queen's Tea also came with a scone, a crumpet and a petit four. The scones at Lovejoy's are AMAZING. It was served warm and was flaky but not dry. We devoured the one that came with our tea so we ordered another one for $2.95 and did not regret it at all. The crumpet was satisfying and the petit four was cute and the perfect end to our meal. Was it cheap? No. Did A leave hungry? Maybe. But even in the end, he was a convert to the joys of high tea and wants to go experience it at one of the fancy hotels in the city! I cannot wait to come back to Lovejoy's in any case but I wish I could just stop in and get a scone to go :D
author: Carrie W.

description:
The service was excellent.  We were able to relax without being rushed.  The Tea was oh so good.  I  had the cucumber sandwich with cream cheese
Hummus and cucumber, crumpets with lemon curd,
Serving was just right.  This is a casual and wonderful place to visit.  I ordered the Queen Tea.
author: Margaret C.

description:
Quaint, but actually rather disorganized and messy. The 12.00 minimum per person on the menu is tacky. 
"We're "Haves", we don't have time for a person who just want's a single cup of tea and a scone".
Service is not their strength either. 
Can you say "elitist"? Ick.
Good scones and British Tea.
author: Angela B.

description:
I had a very unpleasant experience with a waitress some time ago. I'm still giving this place 4 stars because it's usually all very good. Here's what happened.

My fiance and I came here once and ordered our usual high tea - which among other things includes 2 sandwiches and 1 pot of tea each. The waitress takes our order and returns some time later with one pot of tea. I was surprised. We always get 2. I asked her nicely if we could get another pot of tea. She was not happy with this, and said something along the lines of "well, since it's the same tea and the table is small you only really need one pot." I guess that makes sense, I can see the logic there. I told her that I understand and I was sorry to ask again I really would like for us to both have our own pots, we have always had our own pots because that's what we're paying for. Plus, we like the tea really strong. 2 people sharing a tea pot would dilute it immediately. This waitress gets really snappy with us and straight up tells me, she's not bringing us our own pots, sorry, it's the same tea, the table is small, etc. At this point I'm indignant. What do you mean? We are paying for 2 pots. You're not only withholding a pot, but you're actually arguing with me that the size of the table is the reason (if we ordered 2 different teas we would have gotten 2 different pots!!) At this point I'm annoyed. I basically have to beg this woman into adding some fresh tea leaves at least. She grudgingly agrees and walks away, leaving us confused and grumpy. To put it short, our tea was watered down, I did not taste any added strength to our tea, and I walked away feeling like this human put up an unreasonable fight. I believe she's a red head. Anyway, I haven't seen her since (if she's still there, please address this because it was rude).

Another side experience happened about a week ago. I asked an elderly waitress if the salad dressing was vegan. She told me she didn't know. That's alright. I asked if she could check for me. She said they used some french dressing, the can was in french, she'd have no way of knowing. I literally had to ask her multiple times - is there a label? Can you please check for me otherwise I'm not able to eat it. She said she didn't know and just walked away. As a restaurant providing a service, your job is to be familiar with ingredients. She came back some time later and showed me the can (in english) with the ingredients. I'm grateful she did that - I'm just upset I had to wrestle her for it. A simple "i'm not sure - let me check for you!" would have sufficed.

All this aside, this place is delicious, it's cute, and generally a wonderful experience. The staff is usually very nice and the english woman at the front desk is very accommodating and kind.
author: Julia C.

description:
This is the cutest place for an afternoon tea party! My cousin made reservations way ahead of time, because we had about 15 guests that day. It was for a special occasion. They allowed her to decorate the tables and dining area we were sitting. Their decor itself is super cute. They definitely know how to make the place look absolutely adorable. 

Food:
I believe she chose the high tea menu, but I could be wrong. She had planned this tea party way beforehand, and had selected a set menu with Lovejoy. There were many selective mini sandwiches; everything was different. Scones were very delicious, especially with the lemon spread. Yum! The teas were really good. We had two kinds of teas. One with caffeine and one non caffeine. I do not remember the names of the teas. Both were delicious. I will definitely come back here again for a tea party!

Service and staff were amazing. They were all very friendly. They would constantly come over to check up on our tea kettles and refill. Overall, an amazing first-time experience.

Parking: it sucked for me. It's just regular street parking. Our reservations was on a Saturday @11am. I circled around the area for 30 darn minutes.... Luckily, I ended up finding parking 3-4 blocks away. Beware of weekend parking! *sigh*
author: Lucy L.

description: Let's start from the beginning.   Try getting a group of 6 to decide on the date and time.  Once done, go online to their website and fill out the form.  Then i get an email to confirm date and time with Lovejoy.  Then gave them my credit card to reserve this time and date.  I was told as long as i call to cancel my credit card won't be used.  Closer to the date i got a reminder text and a reminder call.  This reflects how much they want us to show up..  Unfortunately, only one could not come.  I wasn't charged and they were super nice about it.  We got the queen's tea and healthy tea.  $2.00 tea charge for each person.  We got the caffeine free berry tea and ceylon decaf.  This was a 4 pm reservation so we watched our caffeine intake.  Ordered a side of sausage puff which was delicious. Love the lemon curd, almond paste petit four, homemade scone and crumpets, loved the ambiance, the bone china,  and the tea strainer.  Extra scone is 2.95.  Crumpet was spongy and warm.  Devonshire cream was yummy.  Tiny cup of coleslaw.
author: Helen L.

description:
Been here 3-4 times and it's still the best high tea I've had in the city. I've had crown and crumpet, dartealing, and sip as well. Haven't tried the bougier spots like rotunda. 

For $29.95 you get the queens tea which includes all the items you need - 2 sandos, scone, crumpet, fruit, cookies, and a few more. I like that the price is reasonable and you get your tea refilled as well.

The interior is very cozy and intimate, and I personally love the mismatched cushions and tea sets.

This place gets packed on the weekends so book ahead! Also I'm thrilled they now have an online Rez system where you don't have to email them for time slots.
author: A Y.

description:
OK, I'm going to split this into a two-pronged attack!

1) TEA WHORES

If you are a true tea connoisseur and lover and you have at least 5 loose-leaf teas at home in proper temperature controlled and vacuum-sealed containers that did not come to you as a gift in a gift basket, you are a true tea lover. Being a generic tea lover, however, is separate from being a Western-tradition high tea lover, in that, there's East and West. Dimsum-style East, high tea-style West. If you have participated and explored the tea rituals of the west frequently -- you will not see this as five-star place, but you will enjoy it. 

2) GENERAL PUBLIC

It is quaint, it is charming like all the reviews say. The teas are good. Not amazing, but good. The service is ... good enough. It's San Francisco, the place isn't huge. The prices ... are as expected. The ambiance is your dotty grandma's house, stuffed to the gills with tea paraphernalia and family photos, doilies and crochet-work cuddling up the dusty old lampshades. The bathroom is clean and spacious (a rarity in the city). It is filled with many groups of women at various stages of life, from celebrating engagements to graduations to gossiping to catch up. The petit fours are freshly made and moist (I was surprised and impressed by this). The scones are freshly made, as they should be. They do provide proper clotted / Devonshire cream, and luxurious preserves to smear on your scone. They have a good-sized savoury menu aside from tea service.

If you're not a tea whore and don't really take your high tea very seriously, and you rarely do this sort of thing, you'll be satisfied with the environment and you will have fun, and one tea service will generally make you stuffed and happy.

If you ARE a tea whore, you will notice some thangs. They aren't major, but cost the fifth star:

- Service: This place has been around a while and is extremely busy and popular, and it's in the city, so I get the "French maitre'd" vibe that has happened. Let's just say that the vibe I expect when I go to High Tea is generally about ensuring you are calm, comfortable, looked after, and delighted. We had touch points with multiple staff members and only one staff member was happy and pleasant toward us; the rest treated us like they were busy lor annoyed and that worrying about how busy they were was more important than worrying about the experience for the customers they had. They basically expect that making the food, putting the tea in front of you, the decor, and checking on you once suffices. It does not. I highly recommend that if it's possible all the staff members attend a proper tea (I have yet to find one in SF actually, even at highly rated hotels) and once they have their mind blown they'll get it. It's hard to explain. It's about the experience, the ritual, and being catered to, tea time is sacred in England. Originally, it went on for hours. If you are really trying to recreate that experience, you're not there yet. If you're making your own Cali version ... it's good enough.

- Pricing: A quality tea service doesn't charge you extra for a "bottomless pot of tea." It's included in the price of the service. Also it's SF, so I wasn't surprised by how much you pay for what you get, but it's a little on the stingy side (I was letting it go for the foodstuffs but I got offended that you're paying extra for the tea, since that's the whole point of being there).

- Food: For 3 people, they don't give you particularly generous portions of clotted cream or preserves. We are all trying to watch our weight so we didn't ask for more and made do. Salad is generous. The caraway seed (I think that's the spice) is FAR too overused in their coleslaw salad and I'd frankly they not include that salad and expend that on a free petit four for everybody by default. Quiche looked good; we didn't get to try the crumpets. Scones were good. Sandwiches were on the small side so if you order a tea service with 2 included per person I recommend you order one more for the table to share. Cream cheese is nothing special / has nothing in it (no herbs or seasoning) but the salmon tasted fresh. Basically the sandwiches are super simple and more like tea at home that auntie made versus tea at a fine tea house. Tomato and cheese is straight up tomato and cheese - you could make it at home.

- Tea: As mentioned, good, not amazing. If they spent money on real high quality tea they'd be broke of course, or prices would have to go up significantly. They have a pretty broad selection. I just went with the House Blend, which was okay. Friends ordered other types and were pleased with theirs. The staff made note of how long we should steep the tea, which was great to see.

If you ever want to have a tea experience that blows your mind -- Brown Hotel in London. DO IT.
author: Miriam W.

description: Always lovely. A cute place to have English sandwiches and pastries that are all yummy. They treat you nicely and ready to put together a set exactly the way your heart desires. A fan of Downton Abbey? This is the place for you.
author: Faaro M.

description: Excellent as always. Service was great. The scones and crumpet were so good. I will definitely be back again and again.
author: Rude G.

description:
Lovejoy's is one of the cutest places in SF! I went here with my book club and had such a great time! We ordered variations of the tea service and all got the "bottomless teapots". I got the "Light Tea" with the cucumber sandwiches and loved everything on my plate! The sandwiches, scones, and fruit were a perfect amount of food. It was also so fun to learn more about tea amidst the eclectic decor!

The servers were very sweet and took great care of us. One even shared a heartwarming story about how she got the infamous "cat teapot." Apparently you can request it :)

Love Lovejoy's!
author: Nicole W.

description: Love this little spot. Have been here multiple times through the years and it never disappoints. They have so many teas to choose from and they have options for sizes of tea as well. No matter if you're coming in for a light snack or a meal they have something that fits your needs. The service and food are excellent.
author: Leslie W.

description:
Almost five stars.  Almost.  I just attended a party here for a friend's wedding.  The food was great, though I believe the waitress hates her job.  She almost never smiled, and the couple of times she did, it was like she was remembering that she was supposed to, so it was a grimace that lasted a quick second.  

The food, as I said, was great, but here is where they messed up.  Two of us ordered the Queen's Tea, while everyone else got the cream tea.  The two Queen's teas were put on one double layered tray, which might not have been a problem, but we were not sitting at the same end of the table.  So I never got any greens, or lemon curd, or what not.  One of the other ladies gave me her cream tea platter and helped me grab my tea sandwiches from the main tray, but that table was way too cluttered with the different pots and such to make passing that multi level tray back and forth.  So it stayed where the waitress had put it, at the other end of the table out of reach.
author: Sandra P.

description:
I loved my "High Tea" experience at Lovejoy's. As you walk into this tea shop, it's as if someone vomited tea paraphernalia into every nook and cranny. Big ol' hats and other role play costumes are available for wear during the tea experience, books on tea etiquette line the shelves, little doily tablecloths everywhere - it's cute as heck in a stuffy way. 

I have a mild suspicion some of the food items are from Trader Joe's - the mustard on one of my sandwiches reminded me so much of Trader Joes mustard. Aside from that, I loved the neatly cut, super cute little sandwiches and my floral tea pot filled with yummy tea of my choice. 

What I didn't like: the butter cookie. Nothing special and not tasty. 

Small upside - "bottomless tea" - get wild ladies!
author: Irina R.

description:
Love this cute tea place.  Been here a few times and can't wait to come back.  Queens tea for two ... warm scones are so good and my fav is the tray of petit four they bring out at the end


Make reservations at least two weeks ahead.  They book up quickly on weekends.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
A great place in a tony San Francisco neighborhood to act as if you are a citizen of Great Britain, thanks to the many options they have here, as you can enjoy a spot of tea as well as the traditional British-inspired dining options that accompanies them, Lovejoy's Tea is great place to kick back and hang out with friends or have a calming moment to one's self. 

A friend had been dying to enjoy a traditional tea room in San Francisco and I had sent him a list complied by the website SF.eater.com of the best places to enjoy afternoon or high tea in the city and Lovejoy's was one of their top picks for their unique yet homey ambience with a wide variety of traditional English teas and sandwiches. After doing some reading some reviews from my fellow Yelpers, I knew that Lovejoy's would be the perfect place to enjoy a pot of tea in the city for the very first time. My friend got a reservation for Thursday afternoon at 4pm, which turns out we didn't even need it as it wasn't packed at all at this time of day.

There are a lot of great options at Lovejoy's for tea and sandwich lovers alike. Since we were newcomers to all of this, we asked our server what she would recommend for two tea lovers who also wanted to try a lot of traditional British goodies and who also wanted to just sit back and take it all in. She suggested we get the High Tea which consisted for our choice of two tea sandwiches served with organic spring greens, cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, a warm scone served with preserves and Devon cream and a tea biscuit to boot. At $21.95 for all of that, we felt that that was a very affordable deal. Since she knew we were going to stay a while she suggested we get one more sandwich (at an additional $3.95) to go with this combination to satisfy our taste buds. We agreed and although all of the sandwich options looked plenty good but we knew we had to get the traditional sandwich that pairs perfectly with English tea, cucumber and cream cheese, in addition to the roast beef and horseradish and ham and English mustard options.

Served on a two tiered cake stand, with the scone on top and the sandwiches and salads on the larger bottom tier, everything tasted amazing. I loved the scone especially when spread with the Devon cream and preserves. The sandwiches were so tasty, I especially loved the traditional cucumber sandwich made with real English cucumbers. The horseradish gave the roast beef a real kick, so be wary when biting into them. The sandwiches and salads paired very well with our tea, which was also selected with our server's advice, when we asked what went well with milk, we went with the Yorkshire Gold Black Tea which was a high quality blend of teas from Africa, Assam and Ceylon, it was a bold and brisk, full bodied tea with a smooth and even flavor. My only issue since Lovejoy's prides itself on using a wide array of porcelain serving ware, my cup was way too large for a traditional tea steeper and promptly kept falling into the cup! Oh well I guess the tea leaves just made my drink stronger and therefore only taste better!

We were so enthralled by the food we wanted to try a couple more items after we feasted on our high tea meal. So we went with a chicken apple walnut sandwich and since our day was not all about cold mini sandwiches a my friend really wanted to sample some of Lovejoy's pub fare, so we went with the sausage rolls which were puff pastries with a sausage filling. The rolls were decent tasting, nothing truly spectacular here, as once again the sandwich was a highlight when sampled with tea. And what a wonderful tea it was, perfect with milk and sugar, they kept our tea pot filled with plenty of water as we drank all afternoon long. Just be forewarned they charge two extra dollars to split a pot.

I really love Lovejoy's with its interior filled with British inspired kitsch and wide variety of traditional teas and sandwiches. When the place isn't packed with customers, it is the perfect place to sit down and relax and contemplate life in a comfortable environment. You can check your cell phone from time to time, but this is a place to enjoy the tranquil beauty of stillness or actually converse with your drinking mate so to speak, so what people tend to do in a traditional coffee shop is a no-no, as well it should be. In the end, our bill literally came out to twenty dollars for each of us which when you come to think of how much food we ate and how much tea we drank is a pretty good deal. I think it actually cost me more to take public transportation to get to the Noe Valley location of Lovejoy's and I can't think of anything more quintessential San Francisco than that!
author: Jason F.

description: Changes at Lovejoys are making me reconsider whether to frequent this place as often as we have for the last twenty five years for special occasions and just for fun. This was our go-to place. We miss Gillian and her partner, Muna, who were gracious and not chintzy. We ordered five Queens tea and got one teasize cup of coleslaw, one small lemon curd and one small devonshire cream for six people. The waitress said she could give us one more cup of coleslaw for an extra price. Later she brought over a cup of coleslaw for no charge. I asked if they would put sandwiches on different trays, but said no even though we are sitting at a large table that could accommodate two other trays.  What happened to Lovejoys? The food is still good, but the atmosphere has changed.
author: Jo M.

description: This is a wonderful spot for a special lunch, brunch, or casual tea time. They have an excellent selection of delightful caffeinated and decaffeinated teas. Very welcoming and friendly service.
author: Sabrina P.

description:
I've been to Lovejoy's for the last 20 years and enjoy meeting up with my friends over a great pot of tea and sandwiches/scones.  I really like the tea room blend - a black caffeinated tea but there are plenty of other teas to choose from.  The sausage rolls are delicious and my favorite sandwich is the chicken and asparagus.  Don't forget the scone with clotted cream and jam.

It's a wonderful place to go to and I hope to enjoy it for the next 20 years or more!
author: Vali G.

description:
There are so many things I enjoy about high-tea... the option of lots of different sandwiches, scones with cream, pretty plates, dainty cups. I met my parents at Lovejoy's feminine little tea room, one of the few open for tea mid-week. The place was full and the staff was hopping!

Mom and I both ordered high tea. We each got to choose two sandwiches, sliced into 4 triangles each. Lots of filling options to pick from, they came between a slice of white and brown bread, crusts removed. I went with smoked salmon and cream cheese (YUM!) and Branston pickle chutney with cheddar (nice cheddar, but a bit skimpy on the chutney). Mom let me try a piece of her hummus and arugula, which was good, though not as good as the salmon. I didn't try her ham and mustard, but said the mustard was nice and spicy. Dad seemed happy with his roast beef and chicken sandwiches- again, not a sharer. :-(

The sandwiches were arranged around a mixed green salad, fresh and kicked up by the mandarin oranges and a sweet/tangy dressing. The two tiered tray also had a bowl of cabbage salad- a slaw really- with a creamy caraway seed dressing that was also good. 

My fave of the bunch was the currant filled scone which I slathered with devon cream and a bit of raspberry preserves. The tea biscuit was just ok to my taste buds.

We each got a pot of tea. I ordered the chestnut which had a lovely maple aroma, but was a bit weak for my liking, even after steeping quite a while. Glad she didn't add any extra hot water to my pot. I tend to drink a lot of water and the staff was too busy to keep my glass filled. Glad I brought a bottle of my own!

All in all, a nice spot to try if you haven't been before.
author: Ryen B.

description: I love this place. Especially to bring my daughter. Though she is a teenager, she still enjoys coming here. Just disappointed in the hostess having such a rude attitude today. We were late for our reservation. Showed up and told her we were late, but could wait for a table, whenever one was ready. She made a noise and said we were lucky there was a table available. Man, I thought businesses were lucky to have good customers like us. Not the other way around.
author: BK T.

description:
After coming back from London a few months ago, I found myself missing the city and all its delights. Naturally, all I wanted to do for my birthday was drink tea and eat scones, so I started hunting for a British tea room in the Bay Area. My search led to my discovery of Lovejoy's Tea room, where I easily made a reservation online.

The entire shop is charming and reminded me of one of the tea rooms I went to while in London. There's even hats for you to wear if you want to perfect your outfit for the occasion with headgear! We ordered 2 high teas (with my favorite Earl Grey and also Lady Grey tea) and a shepherd's pie. Everything was delicious, especially the scones and shepherd's pie. The servers were nice and even surprised me with a little cake at the end!

I can see myself coming back for special occasions and when missing London for sure.
author: Lily K.

description: This was my first time enjoying high tea.  My first impression was that it was visually too busy for me with all Victorian decorations everywhere but was happy to see that as heavily decorated as it is, the place seemed very clean.  For me it was definitely more about spending time and enjoying a nice conversation with my friend than the food.  We had the Queen's Tea which is $30 dollars. We added  a sandwich which is essentially two slices of bread with trimmed edges, $10 dollars. As you can see on the picture, it includes fruit, two small sandwiches, some greens and a bottomless pot of tea.  The sandwiches are tasty but small for the price I thought.  If you love high tea and you want the experience then Lovejoy's Tea Room is the place for you.  You'll most likely need a reservation as it can get pretty difficult to get a table  and there is a limit of two hours stay even with a reservation.
author: RosaMaria C.

description:
Love the ambiance here! The tea room is quaint and cozy, though can get a bit too packed sometimes. That's ok though, since service is still attentive. 

I usually order the Queen service. It comes with a pot of tea and your classic three tier service. One tier contains sandwiches (two types of your choice) and salad, another contains scones and tea cookies, and the uppermost is filled with fresh fruit. I always feel like a princess whenever I'm here! There are also hats and a vanity in the center of the room where you can choose your accessories to go with your tea. 

The most recent time I went was for my mom's birthday, and they brought a little piece of dessert for her with a candle. I thought this was super thoughtful of them! Mom greatly enjoyed her first time at Lovejoy's. 

Parking may be difficult around the area. I've always happened to luck out, but I can see how parking could be a headache around the area. Make sure you check out their store across the street! They have their teas for purchase, as well as other cutesy items for you to host your own tea party at home. Your bill comes with a small discount should you wish to purchase from their store across the street. I would advise making a reservation a week in advance as space is quite limited. 

High tea is always pricey so I wouldn't frequent here unless there is an occasion for me every now and then. However, when I am in the mood for one, I will definitely choose this Lovejoy's!
author: Kristi T.

description: Had such a great time here with friends. The service was really good and the waitress was knowledgeable. We had gluten free, vegetarian, and vegan among our group and she was able to suggest meal items for each. There was a lot of food! We were really stuffed. So many options for tea and it was really delicious. There were a lot of unique sandwich options and the flavors were fantastic. The fruit was ripe and delicious. It was nice that they cared about the quality of things. I had such a great time. Our tea was kept hot and she was great at keeping it filled. It was a little too warm inside and parking could be an issue. I got lucky and found a parking spot nearby but I suggest carpooling or it might be a struggle.
author: Lisa A.

description:
*****Afternoon Tea!*****

So, what do old British men with hairy noses and ears have in common with little girls? High Tea!

Old British guys and little girls are not wrong. While many places are gimmicky and cheap,  there is absolutely nothing better than a good afternoon tea with great company. Lovejoys serves up a great tea time with delicious finger foods and solid tea! You can sit on quilt ladened couches amongst fluffy pillows, frilly girlie things, teddy bears and tea pots.

~High Tea and Wee Tea-5 Stars!
The Wee Tea is designed for the little one. I ordered High Tea. We shared. Black Tea with Summer berries and White Strawberry with notes of vanilla, berries, and mango. Delicious warm scone with jam, hand crafted select sandwiches including chicken chuteny mango cream cheese sandwich! The food and Tea were amazing and "as good as it gets."

~Service-4 Stars
Our hostess was a little short and not very friendly.

~Atmoshphere-5 Stars
I prefer sitting on a chair with a normal table. However, the little one lived the couch and all the girlie and fluffy things. She said the two top highlights of our trip was her company and the tea time!

While the interior does seem a bit girlie, this place does offer man food. The menu includes hearty food such as shepherd's pie.

Overall, the only tea time I had better was in Canada and this place is as good as it gets in the U.S!!
author: Nick H.

description:
I have been coming to Lovejoy's for decades! I remember it's original location when it was on the other side of 24th Street. The atmostphere and high tea experience have not changed a bit.

I am writing this review because I recently came with 8 of my friends.  Historically I have always ordered Earl Grey as my tea selection.  However, this time I made a point to try all the teas my friends ordered.  And, to my delight they were all very good:

Tea Room Blend = good strong flavor
Vanilla Rooibos = nice full bodied option for an herbal tea
Apricot (decaf) = reminded me of potpourri
Genmai Cha = green tea with toasted rice and popcorn ( my daughter's favorite) very tasty
Forest Berries and Rose Hips = herbal tea that tastes like candy (my other daughter's favorite)
Chocolate Truffle = very yummy chocolate flavor 

We each ordered the High Tea and were stuffed beyond belief.  

The staff is always on top of making sure your tea pot is always full of hot water!  Thank you!!
author: Jen A.

description:
So my best friend and I have been wanting to try this place for a while now. Unfortunately we didn't realize how packed they would be and didn't manage to get in last month. However, I took the experience and booked for an early appointment yesterday, about 3 weeks ahead! I wasn't sure what to expect, but we definitely had a pleasant time.

We only tried the Queen's Tea set, and a quiche since neither of us is a big eater. We liked most of what we got, and it was surprisingly filling. The tea was great, the set was nice, and I quite liked the quiche. Everyone was very nice, and we felt welcomed there. Oh, and it was a nice bonus that their restroom smelled lemony... not a big deal, but a plus in my book because I've never been to anywhere else with a restroom that didn't, well, smell like one. We're definitely planning to come back at another time.
author: My N.

description: Arrived at 5 PM, "but the kitchen is closed" since 4:30. Why advertise that you're open until 6 PM? I don't even want food. Does it take an hour to boil water and serve me tea leaves?
author: Jonathan K.

description: This was my second time coming to lovejoy's tea room. I love how shabby chic it is and how so many different types of events can be held there. Yesterday there were little girl tea parties, bridal showers, baby showers and just regular tea time guests. I went for my birthday with my boyfriend - thankfully, for him, there were other men there (but the patrons are overwhelmingly female). We had the queens tea which is the best way to experience the tea room fare. It comes with your choice of tea, your choice of two types of tea sandwiches (their list of sandwiches is fairly extensive as is their tea list), a scone with preserves Devon cream and lemon curd, fruit, a salad, coleslaw, crumpets and a petit four after the meal. I left stuffed and full of tea. If you ask they will happily refill your pot. Yesterday I got the afternoon Darjeeling but before I had gotten the China rose petal which I think I liked better and ended up buying a bag across the street at the attic. I loved the scones they're so flakey and hot and I loved loading them up with lemon curd and Devon cream as well as the jam. Overall I can't wait to go back. It's just a very nice way to spend the afternoon. My only issue is that there is only one bathroom - it is a tea room so there is always a line and it is also pretty noisy at peak hours especially with the large groups so it is a little hard to hear if you are with someone who is soft spoken. But I still enjoyed it and am craving their scones today.
author: Josie C.

description:
Been coming here for years bringing various friends, but today was my first negative experience..
When we were seated, I immediately noticed a long hair entwined in the table runner!  I told the waitress as she took our order, and she simply ignored me, even after saying that that was disgusting.  I had to ask her to switch it out. Not sure if I'll be going back for obvious reasons
author: Mary B.

description:
We didn't have reservations, but were told to wait until the next seating to see if someone didn't show up. 
We were lucky enough to get seated for the 3:30 seating. 
What's great about this restaurant is that it's a complete mish-mosh of stuff. From the chairs, to the silverware, to the tea cups.  NOTHING matched, & that's what makes it charming!
If you're able, request a seat towards the back of the restaurant. It's much more quiet & somewhat private. 
The staff were fantastic & on top of everything.  The tea was only left empty towards the end of our meal. Other than that, it was refilled and reheated when needed without asking. 
They pretty much forbid the use of cell phones, which is quite a nice change!  We saw at least 3 different signs. 
My only complaint would be that it's somewhat difficult to share one tea service. For example; one scone, one petit four, one coleslaw, one crumpet, etc.  it ended up working, but cutting things in half with a friend is awkward. I'd rather skip the crumpet for 2 scones. Or skip some fruit for 2 coleslaws. Or vice versa.  Also, the scone was old, dry & crusty. It was difficult to cut in half. I should have asked for a fresh one. 
It's no wonder why Lovejoy's has such high ratings. We had fun, the food was tasty & filling, and the staff are really nice. 
I posted this in tips, but here it is again; if you don't have reservations, don't panic. They'll seat you if they have no-shows. That's how we got seated & it was easy. You need to show up at the beginning of their "seating time". 
I'll definitely go back.
author: Reed S.

description:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! I've always really wanted to take my daughter out to tea, so I decided to see what I could find on Yelp. After reading all of the rave reviews for LoveJoy, we decided to give it a try and we loved it! Great customer service, yummy sandwiches, warm DELICIOUS scones, and the Rose Petal tea was heaven! After all of this goodness, they came out with crumpets for us! The girls had peanut butter and honey sandwiches with hot cocoa and whipped cream on the side, and they LOVED it! At the end the brought out petit fours for dessert, I normally don't like petit fours but these were so yummy! 

I definitely plan to come back for more mommy daughter dates here, such a fun treat!
author: Magdalena L.

description:
This place is awesome. My favorite items are the scones, devonshire cream, and the preserves. Super yummy. I had my baby shower hosted here and it was lovely. My whole party had a good time.

Only a few things to comment on for improvement. The place is very busy with groups one after another. Our waitress was polite, but not as attentive as she should have been. A few times she would set things down and quickly walk away and we would have to call her back. It was also disappointing that each person was not asked what tea she wanted. I have been to Lovejoy's in the past for other showers and was always offered my own pot of tea. We were provided a couple of starter pots and those were refilled, but we were never offered our own pot or choice of tea which was part of the tea package my host paid for. It is a tea house after all and there is such a vast selection so that was disappointing.
author: Trudie S.

description: Best tea in the world. Riley is the best server in the world. Be sure to give her a treat tip! The food is really good and the scones are amazing!
author: Stephanie H.

description: My place hang out with my sis in law. Love their scone, and decaf mango tea, I come here almost every week. Best tea room in the city.
author: Qing L.

description: I've been coming here for years. My go to place for high tea with the girls. Delicious food and tea. Wide selection of teas. Very comfy and quaint as if you're at home. Clean and service has always been great. See you again soon!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Every time I have family & friends in town or a celebration I will head to love joys. It's the cutest little gem in San Francisco for a cute girly day out. I normally get the queens tea, everything is tasty and well presented. The scones are a must and the vanilla tea! Book in advance as it gets booked up so fast!
author: Sinead M.

description:
Dr. Strangelovejoy's Tea Room
Or: How I Learned To Stop Hangrying And Love The Bomb.Com* Tea

#tl;dr Was expecting to like this place more. Accommodating. Good service. Food simply didn't #thrillernight me like other local tea rooms.

(^_^) Chocolate Truffle Tea #madewithbitsofrealpantherchocolatetruffle
(^_^) Chicken Curry Sando
(^_^) Horseradish Beef(?) Sando
(-_^) Chicken Apple Walnut Salad Sando
(-_-) Sausage Roll
(-_-) Bay Shrimp & Mayo Sando

I think skip the combos and just pick a gang of sandwiches + some tea. *No teas are available iced* due to no ice machine, but you can bring the temperature down a notch with the cream / milk they serve alongside the tea.

*That's the 1st & Lst time you'll see me use that worn out phrase (which has long since been superseded by missile.cissile, grenade.crenade, et al).
author: Dan B.

description: Lovejoy's was fantastic. We enjoyed high tea in a party of four, and got plenty of food. The price was a little high, but you go to experience high tea. Our server was friendly, and the tea and sandwiches were fantastic. If you enjoy scones, tea, and petit fours, you'll enjoy Lovejoy's. It is a very old fashioned place full of beautiful antiques. Very cozy feeling, but not fancy. Great!
author: Kelly A.

description: We love coming here all dressed up in hats and gloves.  All their teas are wonderful and so are all the sandwiches, scones and crumpets.  Service was great! Parking isn't bad, it's street parking only but not bad.  I recommend this place highly!
author: Nanette D.

description:
Lovejoy's is my favorite tea place! It's a wonderful tea place for hosting bridal parties or any get-togethers. I love the stellar customer service here. The wonderful ladies are always checking to make sure our tea pots are filled. 

I usually order the High Tea (~$20) or the Queen's Tea (~28). The finger sandwiches are quite delicate, and my party and I usually order ones that we would not make ourselves (chicken and asparagus, artichoke and arugula). The scones are golden, crispy, and delicious! You can pair them with a light, Devonshire clotted cream, or a sweet strawberry jam. Finish off with some berries to cleanse your palate, then have a petit four to sweeten the deal. Lovejoy's is a treat, and well worth it, in my opinion.
author: Joanne K.

description: My mom and I went here for my 22nd birthday since I've been craving high tea and I am so glad we did! It's such a cute and cozy little spot that has great customer service and great food. Our server (I forgot her name) but she was so sweet and even gave me a cute complementary petit four with a candle. All in all it was a great experience and I would definitely go back again!
author: Leeana B.

description:
Time to dust off your Sunday hats, fascinators, and polish up those pinkys! This place is your ultimate tea time location. I wonder if they do a Alice in Wonderland themed decor...hmmm. I came here for my cousin's golden birthday (she turned 26 on November 26) and we came ready to sip on some tea. 

Unfortunately for me, I came with other attendees and we were severely late, we came about 30 minutes before they closed. My cousin and the rest of the attendees were there on time, so they were able to enjoy. The hosts, however, were kind and allowed us to stay at least an hour (probably more) past closing. I really appreciated that, thank you Lovejoy staff! They were friendly and very attentive, and patient is definitely an understatement.

The ambiance was a mix of London tea meets a southern belle's Sunday brunch. There was a red London phone booth, hats available to change your style, and decorative tea sets. The music selection was great as well, they played the Dream Girls soundtrack to Tina Turner (I had many breakout singing moments). There were seating opportunities for couples and large groups like ours.

The tea party spread was a delight. The tea variety consisted of lavender, vanilla, green, and passion fruit. Scones and finger sandwiches were served with the teas. The scones were delicious, soft, fluffy and warm. There were horseradich, tuna, and cucumber sandwiches. That may not sound like much, but let me tell you it will fill you up. Make sure you grab a scone before anyone else does ahaha.

Come here and enjoy a warm cup of tea and a tasty treat as you listen to good music!
author: Cherise N.

description: The crumpets were just okay. The salad and dressing were good, as was the fruit. The petit-fours dessert was just okay. The truffles were the best I think. The marzipan cake so-so.
author: June B.

description: I love this incredibly cute place! We were a group of 6 girls and all chose to do their "high tea". We chose various teas and sandwiches so everyone could sample something different. The sandwiches were good, the teas were great, but the scones were Amazing!  I might just go back for just tea and scones!
author: Emily C.

description: The venue was AMAZING. It's is small and on a busy day I felt packed in and it was hot. So excited to get some Tea sandwitches and Lovejoy's we're just okay. Nothing to rave about. I enjoyed my time but wouldn't return. Recommendation eat before and just enjoy some tea in a beautiful venue.
author: Jillian S.

description:
For a 4.5-star rated tea room, I expected WAY more from Lovejoy's Tea Room.

Ordered High Tea for 2 and for sandwich selections, we ordered cucumber & cream cheese, chicken apple walnut salad, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and chicken & asparagus.  I must say, I was very disappointed in the sandwiches.  The only sandwich I thought was decent was the smoked salmon & cream cheese while the others were far below average.  There's something wrong when you feel like you can make better sandwiches at home than the ones served here. 

The cabbage salad (i.e. cole slaw) wasn't good at all and the cumin seeds didn't help the taste one bit and the organic green springs was nothing to write home about either.  I agree with the masses that the scone was probably the best part of the meal.

I've been to a tea room where they give you a thick pamphlet of teas to choose from so I was certainly not impressed with the selection here.  My biggest gripe with this tea room is that they put all the tea leaves INSIDE the tea pot and make you filter your own tea each time you pour yourself a cup.  This makes the tea really really dark and bitter towards the end, unless you can somehow drink mass amounts of tea in a short period of time.  I would have preferred that they put the tea leaves in a filter on top so that we have the option to choose how dark we want our teas.

Also, what happened to this excellent service that everyone was gushing about here?  There was certainly no 'pampering' here.  As a matter of fact, some would even consider the waitresses to be aloof and nonchalant but I didn't particularly mind despite expecting more.  Overall, I thought the experience was disappointing and overpriced, and I doubt I'll ever make a second visit.
author: Mango T.

description:
We've been back to Lovejoy's a goodly number of times but thought it was high (tea) time for an update

I was genius & scheduled the fam for Easter-Brunch

Unfortunately it was raining so didn't get to sport our Easter Bonnets but they happen to have a whole table of fun Fascinators & Hats.....we didn't partake but the table next to us did & it was fun watching them try on the adornments

Queen's Tea all around & it was SO MUCH FOOD!  (in the best way!!)

Sandwiches choices: (PS it's awesome that we can choose our *own* sandwiches & there are a ton of veggie combos!!)
 
*  Cheddar & Pickle (this is a staple for all our high teas & the tangy-tart Branston pickle was awesomely paired w/ the cheddar)
*  Pear & Stilton - sweet pears w/ lots of blue - delish!
*  Cucumber & Cream Cheese - nice cooling & creamy
*  Cream Cheese & Mandarin Oranges - sweet & juicy oranges paired so well w/ the creamy cream cheese

Scones were out of this world buttery w/ lots of currants & totally loving the clotted cream!!  We were extra piggy & asked for more!

Lots of salad w/ a tangy, balsamic vinaigrette 

Checkerboard Tea biscuits - lovely choc & vanilla shortbread

Fruit was extremely ripe, juicy, & there was a lot of variety

Crumpet was a lovely, spongy vehicle for the slightly sweet lemon curd

Petit Fours were out of this world good!  Mom chose the gluten free truffle w/ lemon cream; sis opted for the pineapple petit four; the Mr chose the coconut & I chose the milk choc......all winners!  Loved the creamy, almost melty marzipan

Teas ranged also all over the place & everyone was happy w/ their decisions - Mom chose a berry somethingorother while Sis & the Mr chose the white vanilla lavender.  I chose a dark chocolate truffle

Thanks for the lovely time, the dainty treats & absolute abundance of food!  As we waddled out of there, the sun was coming back out - next year, I'm wearing my Easter bonnet!!  Happy Easter indeed!!
author: Adrienne G.

description: My family goes to Lovejoy's every year for a Christmas Tea and we always love it! They outdo themselves each year and we look forward to it as our family tradition! Great food, great tea and their desserts have improved this year.
author: Ali M.

description:
Very cute place with great service. Fun for a celebration of just because.

-Ambiance: cottagey feel with trinkets and a cozy, cluttered atmosphere. The seats and tables are tight.

-Service: super friendly and quick. We had a large group and the waitress was so kind to take photos from both sides of the table and took quite a few, even prompting us to raise our tea cups. That one came out really cute!

-Tea and eats: each person gets their own pot of tea (unless you are sharing a flavor; to save space). The food was not the best that I've had at a tea venue, but the scones were soooo good.
author: Susan G.

description:
Let me start off my saying u need to book a reservation in advance! 

It was me and my friend Valerie's first time ever for high tea we had no idea what we were doing but very thankful for out server to help us and tell us what to do.

Once we got everything all situated, we picked out the type of tea we wanted. It was delicious and very fast too!

I love the whole place it is adorable, cozy, and it is a great place to catch up with friends! I am definitely coming back here!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
The reservation process was so tedious; there were many emails back and forth before I was able to book a time about 4 weeks out. I was persistent and checked in for cancellations and luckily was able to get my time moved up by 2 weeks. They don't always answer their phones on busy weekends so email seems to be the easiest way to go. I wish they would have an online booking process and they can even consider holding a credit card if they are concerned about cancellations.

Anyway, when the day finally came, all 4 of us made sure to be on time. The menu was a bit overwhelming for a first timer like myself. We ended up getting high tea and I chose Pear & Stilton and Egg & Onion sandwiches with my course. There are dozens of tea options and the server recommended the Tea Room Blend, which I ended up liking. The snacks were alright; the scone was probably the best part. The experience was really fun and I'd recommend Lovejoy's for a girls' get together. At ~$22, the price is reasonable for everything you're getting.
author: Yi Z.

description: I've been meaning to try Lovejoys as I make my way to all the tea parlors. I'm not sure what all the hype is about... The staff are very friendly and they have a huge menu however nothing really POPPED out for me. The Sandwiches I felt like they could have more spread in-between. I got the China Rose Tea but did not taste the rose at all. I thought maybe it's because I added milk and sugar and masked the "rose" flavor but then I tried it black and did not taste it then either. I've had rose tea while traveling through Asia and even with milk or with sugar I've never had this issue. Maybe it was just a super watered down batch? Not sure... I'll probably come back if Dartealing (my favorite tea parlor) doesn't have room for me - which is rare.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Really enjoyed my time here.  Cute atmosphere perfect for couples and a friends get together. If you're looking for a well done afternoon tea experience without it being super pricey, this is the place to go. Definitely recommend, especially for tea time newbies. 

~~details of my experience~~

Order (for 2):

Ploughmans Lunch ($16.95) - cheese platter with salad, fruits, hummus, toast and chips. Very tasty and pretty filling. Nice as a sharing platter. 

Savory tea ($14.95) - 2 sandwhich options w/ choice of tea. Had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, which was a bit much for me. Also got smoked turkey with Dijon mustard, which I loved.

"Me" tea ($15.95) - basically the option to mix and match what you want w choice of tea. I choose to get a scone and crumpet served wit lemon curd, sweet butter and raspberry jam. All very tasty. 

Fruit salad ($8.95) - very nicely put together although did not come with as much fruits as expected. A bit pricey for the amount of fruits served.

Tea choices:

Darjeeling - A good complement with the food. Not a too heavy tea. Quite enjoyed it.

Tea House Blend - A nice blend w a slight bitter aftertaste. Not one of my favorites but adding milk and sugar still made it pretty tasty. Slightly heavier tea flavor. 

Service: 

Fantastic service. Servers were warm and attentive. Food arrival was fast. Tea pot was constantly refilled without having to ask. 

Atmosphere:

Cute, old-timey and comfy. If you are looking for classy and luxurious, I suggest the Laurel Court afternoon tea at the fairmont in SF, but if you are like me, this lovely quirky little tea house is perfect.

Overall: 

One of best afternoon tea experiences. Many tea places lack quality food, but Lovejoys has both the tea time ambience that we look for and the well prepared food items. Really recommend a group party to go with the Ploughmans lunch.
author: Christine C.

description:
I love this place! It's super cute and decorated - I kind of wish I could decorate my room like this but whenever I have a lot of clutter it just looks messy... Lovejoy's does it right though. I think this is the perfect place to hang out with some girl friends. Dress up too, it's fun. ;)

This place is walkable (4 blocks) from the 24th St Mission BART station. It felt relatively safe walking there, plus there's a really colorful pink house on the way here! 

My 2 friends and I made a reservation on Thursday afternoon for a nice get-together. We ordered 2 sets of Queen's Tea(~$25 each), which is the perfect amount for 3 people. I ordered a hot chocolate (~$5), and that was the most delicious hot chocolate I ever had! It came in a huge cup with fluffy whipped cream and chocolate syrup on top. For our 2 Queen's tea sets, we picked 4 choices of sandwiches, which I thought tasted okay (good, not amazing). The salmon was my absolute favorite, and note that the ones with mustard are slightly spicy. The set also came with scones (yum!), 3 types of spread (lemon curd was the best), shortbread cookies, fruit, coleslaw, crumpets (super "spongy", but I wasn't really fond bland/buttery things), salad, and dessert chocolates (s'mores was the best). My favorite item was probably the dessert chocolate and scone + lemon curd, but the overall package was great! I'll be back again!
author: Sarina C.

description:
Tea for too many? Yes, this is a San Francisco institution...Rooms full of women in funny hats playing tea party isn't my cuppa. I love tea..and scones and clotted cream and lemon curd...not in a zoo like environment.
Women flock here for special events...hence, the crowds. noise and reservations are a must! A further buzzkill parking is a challenge.
author: Laurel G.

description:
Had my first time here yesterday after years of staring at photos online, and it certainly did not disappoint! I had imagined it to be two stories for some reason, and it's a little smaller than I expected, but the decor is so beautiful, charming, and quirky, like straight out of a Victorian storybook with a modern touch (mismatched tea cups, saucers, teapots, and plates).

My friend and I had Queen's Tea. I didn't see it offered on their Yelp menu, but on their menu at the table, it was listed. It's an awesome deal and can certainly be split between two people, along with add-ons (extra scones or petit fours) without it being too pricey. (I looked at the High Tea option. If we had chosen that, and then had extras, it would have costed more than the Queen's Tea with extra). Scones, fruits, salads, crumpet, YUM!

For tea, we got China Rose Petal. It's as delicious and beautiful as it sounds. The staff and waiters were so friendly and courteous, and were very kind to help me and my friend get photos of us even though they were closing up at 6:00 (my friend and I had a 4:30 reservation).

I really recommend everyone who has appreciation for tea and Victorian aesthetics/culture to visit this place. What a gem! You just have to drive over a bunch of crazy narrow streets and scary steep San Francisco hills.

My sole critique would be reservation. At the time of this review, only phone reservations are accepted, and I booked between a month to 2 weeks in advance, with the option of 11:00 AM or 4:30 PM on the day my friend and I wanted to come here. I would have liked to reserve online for simplicity's sake, and also not to have to play phone tag with staff (nothing wrong on their end. I left a message, and they called back when I was luckily not busy).

I'll be back here! This is a lovely place for a fairy tale tea getaway! :D
author: Jo W.

description:
Queens Tea for 3 please! 

I have always wanted to have high tea, but I never had anyone that was interested in going with me. Lucky me it was my anniversary with my husband so he had to go with me. I'm glad that we chose to go to LoveJoys as our first high tea experience. We brought our daughter and she loved it as well. She's a little young for high tea and I probably won't bring her back until she's older.

We had the queens tea and a sandwich platter. We had the Royal Blend tea which I highly recommend. It was delicious. Since our daughter is too young for tea they gave her a teapot of milk. It was so cute and they even had a little cup for her to drink out of. We tried 4 different kinds of sandwiches. My favorite out of everything was the scone and lemon curd. I loved my entire experience here at LoveJoys. From the decor to the food and the service. Everything was amazing for a first time experience and I can't wait to come back. 

This is great place to bring your loved ones to celebrate a special day.
author: Olivia W.

description: Went there yesterday with an online group.  There was a glitch in the reservation (problem with the computer at the online group) and I got there an hour before the changed reservation.  They were SO nice!  They let me sit for an hour and drink tea while I waited for everyone else.  Also, the scones were fabulous!  I have never much liked scones, because they are usually so dry, but these were moist and SO TASTY!  Also loved their raspberry jam and clotted cream.  The sandwiches were also great and our whole group left feeling very full and satisfied.  There were many teas from which to choose, including ones without caffeine (I love caffeine, but it doesn't love me), so I was able to drink more than a couple of pots while I was there.  All in all, a wonderful experience.
author: Ruth L.

description:
I was super excited to try this place out seeing as how they have 4.5 stars with a ton of reviews! First off, finding parking in the area during the weekend is TERRIBLE. I had to circle the blocks for 25 minutes before I could find a spot. 

Did high tea for 2 and sampled the following sandwiches:
1. Smoked salmon and cream cheese: Classic. Yummy.
2. Salmon Mousse: Can you tell I like salmon? A-OK.
3. Chicken apple walnut salad: didn't taste any walnut and just tasted like chicken salad to me. Meh.
4. Artichoke Hummus: good but so SALTY.

The tea sandwiches are TINY. tinier than the majority of tea rooms I've been to and I wasn't really terribly impressed with any particular sandwich.

The scones though are a different story and probably on my top 3 scones I've ever tried. Freshly baked, crumbly, flaky, buttery, light, just enough moistness and not softness. If you're not looking to try the full tea service, at least try their scones.

For my tea, I tried the black lavender vanilla tea. Really yummy! You can really taste the lavender and vanilla and it went so well with the savory sandwiches.

Pretty affordable as far as afternoon tea services go. The high tea for two cost $50.
Make reservations ahead of time. They get really busy especially during the weekends.
author: June Y.

description: Lovejoy's Tea Room was my first attempt at having a classy tea experience. The atmosphere was great, the decorations were cute, and the tea pots and cups were adorable. The staff was also great at explaining the menu to first time customers. My friend and I both decided to get the Queen's Tea because we really wanted to try as much as we could. The Earl Grey was great, but I also really enjoyed the Royal Blend. Though the sandwiches and crumpets were both delicious, the scones were the true stars of the meal. Overall, this was a great tea room and I would love to go back and try more teas.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: I love this place! Celebrated my daughter's 16th birthday with a few friends- they enjoyed it thoroughly.
author: L S.

description: Always a great time! Coming here is just like stepping into an English grandmother's living room. The tea options are all delicious, and the food is surprisingly really good!
author: Skyler L.

description: Always a pleasure to go there. =). Fast, efficient service.  Yummy food can't hurt either.
author: teatzar s.

description: The food was delightful. I had one of the best scones I've eaten. The staff was very friendly and thoughtful.
author: Aylin B.

description:
Made reservations a month early for a Friday just in case. They say is right away next to the telephone booth. The staff was super friendly. We ordered two high teas & the teas, sandwiches & scones were all delicious! We got the house blend tea & the Japanese green tea. For sandwiches, we got the smoked salmon, smoked turkey, roast beef & salmon purée. I scarfed down those sandwiches since I thought they were so tasty! Finally for dessert, we had the scones with jam & Devon cream. One of the best scones I've ever had! Will be definitely coming back!

Two high teas came out to $45. Parking took about 5 mins to find. Make sure to make reservations bc they can get pretty busy! Also, try one of their fancy tea hats to have a tea-riffic time!
author: Trisha G.

description: Best best best tea with best best best friends. I love the little sausage pastry rolls and the fresh salad. The scones are delicious as are the chicken walnut sandwiches. You can get any sandwich you wish but I love all of them
author: Cindi W.

description:
My girlfriends and I had a lovely high tea on a Sunday afternoon here. This place is pretty decked out with all sorts of knick-knacks, teapots, lace galore, and accessories. We were able to borrow extra hats they had to really add to the high tea vibe, and when our server saw me using my fan to legitimately cool off from my bike ride, she brought fans for all of us! 

THE COST: $20 total for 2 Queen's Teas and 1 Light Tea. This was a filling afternoon snack shared amongst 5 of us. They bring out sandwiches, salads, scones, tea biscuits, and fruits first. The crumpets come next so they're warm and fresh. Last they bring around the tray of petit fours. 

THE SERVICE: Great. Even though the staff all look very hipster (read: tattoos, funky hair colors, piercings) and maybe could've fit in better in a coffee shop on Valencia, they all embraced their floral aprons and seemed to enjoy every minute of their jobs as much as the customers. The guy who brought out our tiered platter was also nice to offer to take photos of our group, taking several and offering tips like having my friend tilt her hat a certain way so her face would show up better. 

MUST-HAVES: If you're getting a Tea Service and like strong cheese, definitely get the The Pear & Stilton when you're choosing your Tea Sandwiches. For the Petit Fours, choose the rose water. 

Our platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg

TEAS: 
Violet - My fave. A light sweetness that still mixed well with the herbal flavors of a tea.
Vanilla Rooibos - more sweet, but leaves a bitter aftertaste in my mouth.
White Peach - fruity and light.

TEA SANDWICHES
Best: Pear & Stilton by far! The intense blue cheese paired incredibly well with the sweet pear.

Everything else was quote bland and "safe":
Mediocre: Daily Special (roast beef & mustard), Chicken Apple Walnut Salad (though 
Too plain for me: Cucumber & Cream Cheese, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, Salmon Mousse

* Organic Spring Greens, Cabbage Salad in a Caraway Cream Dressing - 3 stars
Pretty simple, the only accent flavor being little mandarin orange slices, and there wasn't quite enough of that. The dressing seemed like a balsamic vinaigrette and the sharpness of that complemented the greens and the orange pretty well. I did wish the salad was colder; it seemed room temp, even warm later on.

* Fresh Fruit - 3 stars
Pretty, but not much beyond that. The winter melon was not ripe and a bit hard. Strawberries, blackberries, and kiwi were nice. 

* Petit Four - 4 stars
full platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#JSpHOzIStSs32UFby1oYIw
cross-section of our choices: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#k3_KeW_0tv5f41UvRFRtJw
We got a dark chocolate/lemon, as well as a rosewater. The chocolate one wasn't great, the jelly-like lemon filling not as sharp as I'd hoped. The rose-water soaked bread-like filling of the other one was great, and we all liked that one much more.

* Tea Biscuit - 3 stars
Not much here, like those generic hard, buttery Italian cookies. 

* Crumpet with Lemon Curd - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Fj33P7RuOhTOwxyb5OtVJQ
LIke an English Muffin, but a little more dense, not so airy/fluffy. The outside is a little more crisped as well. Great with combinations of the lemon curd, butter, and blackberry preserves!

* Warm Scone with Preserves & Devon Cream - 3.5 stars
Not quite warm. Tasty but a little bit on the dry side. Love the combos of cream and blackberry preserves, that's the way to have it!

Tea Room Menu Top Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#vFpyqGqPd3Y8rupGqEqLkA
Tea Room Menu Bottom Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Y5Hot1gL66ruNvftbceu-g
Black & Black Flavored Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#tWZwzJRJcZ60PfCdcf0TWA
Decaf, Green/White, Tisanes Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#hDdEmd8WwMj2wwDd8t7gTQ
author: Ziyan C.

description:
It is sad to see that the new owner does not have a clue about how to run this potential gold mine.  Never be short staffed.  Never fill the whole restaurant at once and only have 2 servers.  Never offer less than what the previous owners had all the regulars used to, like your choice of a tea with every high tea! Today, upon getting seated we were "graced" with a black tea and a vanilla roiboos, but who ordered or picked those two?  How pretentious of them to force their choice of tea on a patron!  Then,  the crumpet for the queen was served as an afterthought.  The sandwiches overall, were great.  The chicken walnut salad sandwich tasted funny, like tuna fish and a tad sour.  The cucumbers were not fresh.  Only one of the persons at the table was offered a petit four! The rest of us were left speechless.  We know they are extra and not included with a high tea but we always used to get tempted at the end of the meal!

To add insult to injury, I ordered a chicken and asparagus tea sandwich to go and when my son opened the box to eat it at home it was turkey with mustard!  no asparagus! what????? So for that measly insult of a sandwich and two scones and a miniscule scoop of watery double devon cream I paid the exorbitant amount of $13+.  Oh I miss the ladies that for decades really knew what they were doing with this place.  It takes one person to bring it to ruin.  Sigh!  

Go to Lovey's in Pacifica, perhaps you will get lucky with the servers there.
author: Emilia G.

description:
Came here for a mini bridal shower.  I found street parking in 5 minutes, about a block away, which isn't bad for SF.  The food was delicious.  I had the high tea set with the Daily Special (Coronation Chicken, I think) and Cream Cheese Cucumber sandwiches.  The decor is very cute, with the pink, tea sets and all.  

I took 2 points off for the following: 
- My tea (genmai cha) was lacking in flavor, so I felt like I was dranking hot water the whole time even though I let it seep as instructed.  I probably should've stuck with non-Asian tea at non-Asian restaurants.  
- We felt rushed by the waitress.  She came by multiple times within the first 15 minutes of seating even though we told her we were waiting for one more friend to arrive before placing any orders.  She did not appear happy about letting us wait...After placing our orders, we didn't see her again until "dessert" time and she placed the check on our table shortly after we declined the desserts she offered.  About 5-10 minutes later, she reappeared to "remind" us that we have 5 more minutes left in our seating.  So, my friends and I quickly paid and left.  

I would recommend management to train the staff to let the customers know that there is a 2 hour seating limit when they're placing the orders, so the customers are aware of it.  And, perhaps, also train the staff to be more discreet and polite when reminding customers of the time limit.
author: Icy H.

description:
This is an adorable little spot. The decor is quirky with tea cups and kettles plus assorted British bric-a-brac covering the walls and shelves. 

The staff is so cheerful and helpful. They squeezed us in last-minute before an appointment and recommended some great sandwiches: the Stilton (pear and blue cheese -- sounds unusual but tastes amazing!) and the tomato cheddar. 

The tea selection is wide and varied too. I tried tried the mango black tea, which tasted like candied mango (great if you have a sweet tooth).

My favorite part was the scones though. They were warm, flaky, buttery with small raisins and tasted great with the strawberry preserves. Extra kudos for the preserves too. They tasted just like ripe strawberries -- no artificial flavors here! -- and were so easy to spread over the scones. 

Looking forward to going back :)
author: Sophie B.

description: Horrible experience !!! Came with a party of 6 ladies . Waitress was not friendly from the beginning through the whole 1 1/2 . Didn't come back to check in or anything . I've been a server for the past 2 years and in the restaurant industry for 5 so we tried to give her tons of chances but enough is enough .We were ready to leave and had to ask another waitress for the check since our walked out and went on her break without saying anything to us . We waited a whole 30 minutes for our check to be processed. We had to deal with the manager the last 30 minutes and she was very unprofessional and took no responsibility for the waitress actions or anything , talk about crappy service . We wanted to split our check but she acted like it was almost impossible and like I said took forever . Will NOT be coming back due to service unfortunately !!!! The tea was amazing but service was horrible !
author: Anjelina M.

description:
Came here for a tea party for my friend's birthday on a Sunday afternoon. When she originally made the reservation, only 11AM was open but she was able to secure a better time for us later on in the day (4pm).

We arrived promptly at 4 (you can find street parking in this area) and were seated at one side of a long table which we shared with another party. My friends and I decided to order the Queen's tea, which comes with a lot of variety of food to munch on. We each got to order our own pot of tea and I got the White Peach. I really like the nice fruity flavor. With the Queen's tea, we also got to choose 2 different sandwiches. I chose the Chicken Salad and the Salmon with Cream Cheese. When it comes out, you get 2 quarters of each sandwich

The tea came out first. It's fun to add the cream and sugar in it to get different flavors/taste. The birthday girl had ordered the Tea Room tea (the house tea? I forget) and when she mixed hers, the end result tasted like HK style milk tea, aka really good.

Then our 4 layer platter of food came out. 
Layer 1: Variety of Fruit
Layer 2: Scones, spread, and miniature cookies
Layer 3: Sandwiches and Salad
Layer 4: Sandwiches, Salad, and Coleslaw

Next, the crumpets came out (still warm!)

We finished off our tea party with little cake (one per person). I chose the strawberry shortcake.

The tea party was an overall success. I enjoyed the scone the most and really liked all the various spreads that came with it. 

We paid for the bday girl so the total per person ended up being somewhere are $45 (there was a total of 4 of us). 

I would definitely recommend celebrating by having a tea party here!
author: Michelle C.

description: Two hours at Lovejoy's is better than a weekend at Asilomar in Monterey. You step inside and the worries and cares of the world fall away. A good pot of tea arrives, little somethings to nosh on appear, and the conversation with your friends and loved ones flow and heal. What could be better than a place that feels like your grandmother's kitchen table wrapped in your mom's loving arms? A magical place in San Francisco.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Just from one visit, I could tell the owner indeed has a love of joy. Probably not what the name was intended to be, but it was what I felt at Lovejoy's! 
Took my bestie, Kelly D. here for a catch up and I felt like it was the perfect place, and I have been obsessing over tearooms recently. 

.::Atmosphere::.
Spot on classy but heartwarming, traditional yet fun.  I absolutely adore the decors. Its  so detailed and cute, you can tell they put a lot of time and effort into putting this together. Mismatched tea sets here and there, unique hats, pink curtains, etc. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg#mVntZj0oO-nMkmQn-BdggA

.::Service::.
I got SO scared because the morning of, I read the yelp reviews and saw that reservations were a must or else there would be a 2.5 hour wait. So 5 minutes before they opened, I left a message wanting a reservation and they called me back half an hour later with a reservation at 12:30pm!!!!! So super KUDDOs for that! Waitresses were all super friendly and welcoming! 

.::Food::.
Queen's Tea $26.95: Two choices of sandwiches served with cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, organic springs, a scone with preserves and devon cream, a crumpet with meyer lemon curd, fresh fruit, a petit four and a tea biscuit. I chose the shrimp with mayonnaise and my friend got the smoked salmon sandwich. It was enough to fill us up pretty well! We got the white peach green tea with the set! Absolutely refreshing all around!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg#B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg#Fi8bMHC4bKIvIIZYRQzldg

Maybe a bit pricier than what I would like, but I can definitely see why with the atmosphere and a better quality of food than the other tearoom I have been to!
author: Chena N.

description: Love this place! The mango tea goes perfect with their scones. Omg the scones are to die for !!! LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE
author: Jazman M.

description: Came here to celebrate birthdays with a close friend. I made reservations online a little while back by sending them a message on their website. The process was pretty easy, it's just not instant but they're very responsive. We both got the high tea and the teas were great. Overall, I thought it was a nice cute experience. They even brought us a mini petite four cake with candles at the end. It is quite expensive for high tea, but your other options in the city are just as expensive.
author: Annie Z.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place out because I love high tea just as much as I love brunch. Came on Wednesday early afternoon and got a table for 2 without a problem. We got the Queen's tea which we shared (see picture) with an extra pot of bottomless tea. It is a lot of food and finishes off with petit fours. $45 in total + tips which is a great price for high tea. It's super kooky and vintage decor, mismatched tea pots and cozy vibe. The best thing is they were able to do the entire high tea gluten free for me including scones and biscuits and sandwiches which I am extremely impressed with. 
I highly recommend the salmon and cream cheese sandwiches and the black vanilla tea. 
Definitely coming back!!
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
My first tea room experience!

A bunch of ladies for a bridal shower.  The place has really cute decor, and has the woodsy old town British vibe.  The staff was super attentive and amazing.  Even though it was a packed house everything came out in a timely manner and the ladies were so patient with us.

Their tea sets are absolutely adorable.  The crustless sandwiches were so good along with their crumpets. Love Love Loved everything about this place!!!
author: Erica C.

description:
The interior is gorgeous! Every little thing and detail in here fits in all together. Place isn't really big so best to make a reservation. But a really nice place to just have a girls day and just relax and catch up. 

The scones are the best! I've never been a fan of scones because they are typically dense and cold and hard but theirs is complete opposite  (of course you should eat it while it's still warm once it comes). It comes with double Devon cream and a jam. It's already perfect by itself.

My friend and I got the High Tea, so we each got our own choice of tea and each high tea comes with 2 choice of sandwich so we were able to choose 4. 

Overall, the service was good. Making sure we're doing okay and explain to us what the daily special sandwich was and explain each section as our food arrived
author: Angela L.

description: The atmosphere and service is quaint and charming, just as a British tea house should be.  The highlight for me and friends is High Tea with delicious sandwiches.  I love the Earl Grey and the teapots they serve it in.
author: Jane F.

description:
Planned my godson's baby shower here and I chose the Peter Rabbit theme for him. 

We got our cupcakes from a place in Emeryville called teacake bakeshop. They didn't mind us bringing those and our own decor. I'd say we all enjoyed ourselves! The tea was so yummy, the teapots were a huge hit.
