Lovejoys was great at communicating before the event and were helpful.  The environment is quirky but classy, and I the atmosphere is really fun. I highly recommend it.
author: Didi S.

description:
What an amazing time. Our daughter's party was delightful, as was the service. My wife and I took a separate table to leave the girls to themselves, and were struck by the knowledge and friendliness of every single staffer.

The tea service was exemplary and the scones out of this world.
Two thumbs way up.
author: Mike K.

description: I super love this place. Felt like Alice in Wonderland sipping my tea. This place is magical and love the mango and fruit tea, good service & good food. This is probably my favorite place I have been in SF. Will come back for more. Also next door, Lovejoy's Attic, im super inlove.
author: Taryn M.

description:
Pinkies up!

After a long flight, Lovejoy's was the perfect place to reconstruct myself into a new human being. The rickety furniture, crocheted wall hangings, and mismatched china gives the whole place a grandma chic feel. When you walk in, you immediately feel like the walls are closing in you to give you a big, warm, hug.

We made reservations beforehand but SF traffic and ....me being me...... made us 30 minutes late. Luckily the gracious hosts were able to accommodate us immediately and a few minutes later we were swimming in tea and carbs. 

Since I'm a go big or go home type of person, I went for the Queen's Tea which included two tea sandwiches, scones, crumpet, fresh fruit, petit fours and a bottomless tea pot. I'll start off now by saying, this is way too much for one person but it was very good to be able to taste a little bit of everything. I was especially impressed with the scone which was light and airy especially with the dreamy clotted cream spread on top. It was so good, I would (and probably did) give up my left artery for more.

For tea, I went with the standard darjeeling but I was really happy to see that they had such wide and varied choices like chesnut (which my dining partner got) and all of my favorite types of Japanese green tea that I get at home.

Service was relaxed and two hours was plenty of time for us get all of our girl gab on. Don't forget to pick up souvenirs at the shop across the street!
author: Kimberly S.

description: Note: I haven't been back to Lovejoy's since the change in ownership, so this review is for my experience under the previous owners. You really must go here to fully appreciate it, and you really must go here in general! It really does feel like having tea at your grandmother or great aunt's house (your grandmother or great aunt who happens to love knick knacks). The whole experience is so lovely. Having tea is a tradition my friend and I have started that is one of my most favorite things to do now. Sitting down and talking over delicious tea and tea snacks turns out to be incredibly fun! What surprised me about Lovejoy's that was how good their tea and food was -- I guess I wasn't sure based on all of the tchotchkes, but it's really high quality! Our favorite tea is the strawberry one, and you can't go wrong with any of the different food options. The scones and clotted cream are particularly delicious.  Be sure to make a reservation before you go -- they tend to book up pretty far in advance.
author: Amanda S.

description: This place is adorable! I loved all the decorations and books. Perfect for a mid-afternoon tea & snacks chat. We had the Queen's tea set with white peach tea, which was fruity and light. The sandwiches were tasty, but the scone was the clear winner for me. It comes out warm and is delicious with the butter and jam spread!
author: Jenny K.

description:
It smells! it smells! smells..... I have to say it three times!!!! I know it's suppose to look vintage and old, but it does not mean it should smell that much! I have stayed at old Victorian houses before and I  think I am familiar with that old grandma smell, but at love joy it was very strong. I could not bend my neck , because that smell could  kill my appetite. furnitures , especially cushion look dirty :(. But bathroom was clean, I think they never change furniture nor fully clean them.
Overall food was average, no red flags, but the scone was probably the best I have ever had. However, it's still not enough for me to come back. Love joy, I think it's overrated :(.
author: Pink M.

description: Wonderful gathering spot for 3 Generations from 2 coasts! Window Table was set and ready for our reservation. Quirky, eclectic table settings and decor lent to a fun and indulgent excursion! I loved my Light Tea selection that came with my selection of a cucumber and cream cheese finger sandwich (childhood bliss) and the best freshly baked red currant scone I have ever had in my life! Add Devon cream, fresh fruit and a pot of Earl Grey--delightful.
author: Linda A.

description:
Came here to treat my editor out for lunch, and by the looks of it, I didn't know there was a prerequisite of knowing Downton Abbey to eat here.

Woman near the restroom: "Do you watch Downton Abbey?"
Me waiting in line, minding my own business: "No."
Woman near the restroom: "Oh, EVERYBODY WATCHES IT, dear."
2nd woman queuing up; there's only one toilet: "Oh, I heard you mentioning Downton, oh I love that show..."

The next 5 minutes was a blur as they chatted back and forth over what seemed like the game of Clue. There was a butler, a rich man, a maid, and murder.

Thank goodness I was here for their tea. And speaking strictly as someone who's father is British, and from all my travels to London and back, I love this place.

I usually get The High Tea and not the Queen's Tea, only because I don't like Petit Four's. Nasty cake covered in sugar. No offense to Lovejoy's, I dislike all Petit Four's alike.

My favorite sandwiches are their Salmon Mousse, Chicken Salad, and Egg Salad.

The service here is always top notch, they refill my honey, add more water, etc without me having to flag them down.

But, my all time top 20 food comes from this place, and that's their scone with Devon cream. Even the Brown's hotel in London doesn't have scones and cream this delicious.

And, at least the lovely staff doesn't require any prior knowledge of Downton Abbey before they seat you.
author: Jack R.

description:
Felt like I was in a dream here! Loved everything about this place from the decor, to the staff and of course the tea! Never felt stuffy at all too. My friend and I sat in the corner near the teapots, which made me really want to buy one of my own.

This is a fun place to go with the girls. To chat it up over tea and delicious pastries. You can also play dress up too! 

The blueberry scone was yummy and moist. And Carrie, our server, was wonderful! :) My friend and I had no clue what to order and she recommended a few teas for us according to what flavors we usually go for. She knows her stuff because we both loved the tea she brought out for us. Would definitely refer this place to others and I'm coming back when I'm back in town :)
author: Miss D.

description: We had an exceptional time at Lovejoy's Tea Room.  My mother and I had The Queen's Tea for two and the food was delicious and beautifully presented.  Service was prompt and attentive and the atmosphere was just lovely for us to enjoy each others' company over seeping tea and tasty sandwiches, scones and crumpets.
author: Marcia Y.

description:
Not very friendly service.

Decor is awful.

They give you a lot of food, but I wouldn't come back because of the staff.

Every time I called I was always forwarded to the STUPID VOICE MESSAGE THAT IS 3 MINUTES LONG!!!!

The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars is because the scone was good.

Every other aspect of this place sucked.

It didn't help that there was a bridal shower of something that was going on. They were super loud and didn't have their own room, which I wish they had...
author: Hazel J.

description:
This is my second time at Lovejoy's and I can't wait to come back! I wish that "tea time" was an American tradition - I wouldn't mind taking time every day to sip some tea and eat some crumpets. There's also a comforting feeling being in a tea room. You are in a relaxed environment and genuinely just enjoy your guests company.

You feel so fancy with all of the delicate china that I think it makes you eat slower or more "lady-like" which enables you to really savor and enjoy your food. The food itself isn't too filling, but you fill up on the bottomless tea. The darjeeling tea was my favorite. 

The food comes out on these cute tiered plates. What is it about food being higher up that makes it so fancy? They come out with itty bitty sandwiches with the crusts cut off. I mean, c'mon! Too adorable. My favorite was the pear and stilton cheese. The currant scones with the lemon and raspberry spread are amazing. The crumpet was nothing to write home about. To me it just tastes like a plain waffle. Let's not forget about the petit fours they bring out at the end. Petit fours are basically baby marzipan cakes which are thee perfect bite. 

If you're meeting up with an old friend for lunch, maybe planning a bridal shower, or just in the mood for some good ole tea - Lovejoy's is the perfect spot.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Oh Lovejoy, just the mere mention of Parisian-standard tea is enough to make every girl excited. Its one of the best picks to celebrate a day with your lovely ladies such as  bachelorette's, bridal shower or simply when you wanna dress up n feel fancy.

Came here with 5 of my friends for a bachelorette kickoff with high tea.  Made reservation at least 3 weeks in advance as this place is super busy on weekends.

Play dress up for the fun of it. Make sure your girls pick their choice of hats from the hat stand and do a role play from Downtown Abbey. 

Decor -
You are sure to be transformed to the British la la land. The decor is sure to melt your heart like candy floss. So charming with lace, hats, florals and everything antique chic.

Food -
We ordered the High tea and the Queen's tea. Served in absolutely adorable tea sets!

Tea comprises of sandwiches, scones,fresh fruits, biscuit, fresh fruits and bottomless tea. 
- The warm scones served with raspberry & lemon curd jams were buttery deliciousness.
- They have a variety of flavorful teas such as Rose, Summer berries, Violet, White Peach,etc. We went with the choice of rose tea which was highly fragrant and refreshing. 
- For the sandwiches, our favorites were - salmon cream cheese and chicken asparagus.. All sandwiches were super delicious.

Service - 
Excellent. Everything came on time.They always made sure our tea pots are filled.

Price - 
We paid $25 each, for a group of 5. Not bad.

This place was just perfect and a 5 star. Everyone had a great time.
author: Payal B.

description: I've heard this place is amazing, but the service is what's bringing my review down. Got the Queen's Tea. The server seemed to rush my sister and I through our "brunch." She kept coming over lots in the beginning, and afterwards we never saw her (when we actually did need her to refill our pots, etc.). Chocolate Decaf Tea and Rosepetal Tea were both great. The food was good, but not amazing. The scones are the one thing to die for, along with the clotted cream. YUM!
author: Christie L.

description:
In the game of scones,
This is the iron scone.
The one scone to rule them all.

----
Do have high tea. I loved the white strawberry flavor.
Did I mention the scones?
So buttery and scrumptious!
author: Catherine K.

description:
The Eccentric Ladies Hat Club loves Lovejoy's! Twenty-two of us stepped off of a charter bus on July 9th. Lovejoy's had our table ready and waiting. The food was delicious, and very fresh - not a hint of dry bread or wilted lettuce. The tea was piping hot! They provided a gluten-free tray for one of our Ladies. And, they had no trouble keeping up with all of our extra orders. Though we were a very large group, we never had to wait for more tea. The service was impeccable!

Hats off to you, Lovejoy's Tea Room! We will return!
author: Josephine M.

description:
This place is a-mazing.

I felt so sophisticated, posh, elegant and English when I was high tea-ing here. Satisfied my adult tea party cravings!

I'd recommend you call and make reservations. Book 2 weeks in advance because it gets booked out easily....almost all their tables are reserved. 2 hour seatings.

I got the queen's tea. Go big or go home folks. 

My favorite out of all the sandwiches was the chicken and asparagus! Asparagus never tasted so good in my life. 

For tea, I recommend the white peach as it paired very well with the food and experience. Light, mildy sweet, very enjoyable.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Such a cute little cottage!!! Haha. I loved the unmatched tea sets and the oddities of the decor. So fun!!!

Had a large party of about 15. We had a big round table and a rectangled on attached to the side. They even had a Victorian couch! So CUTE. 

The sandwiches were yummy but nothing outstanding. My favorite one was the scone. Perfectly made. Sweet and fluffy. It came with 3 sauces: raspberry lemon butter. Lemon was too lemony. The butter WITH the jam was delicious!!! Then we had the crumpet. It was hard on the bottom. I didn't finish it. Then the pastries came out and sadly they weren't what I expected. Too sweet and felt like it wasn't made there. Kinda disappointing. 

The tea was really yummy. I liked the fruity flavors more so than the plain black teas. I was just in a sweeter mood. 

It's all about the experience though and I had a great time!
author: Lynn C.

description: Way too cramped, was so muggy and smelly when I first walked in. There was condensation on the windows. We requested a seat in the back, it seemed a little less noisy. We all ordered the High Tea. The tea was yummy, I ordered Strawberry White Tea. The scone was tasty. The sandwiches, salad, and slaw were blah. We ordered the chicken salad, cucumber, salmon, and cheddar chutney. The chicken was the best tasting but lacked flavor and had barely any chicken salad. The salmon one, nope, the cucumber was blah no dill... and the chutney was disgusting! Tasted like super strong ketchup.
author: Audra M.

description:
Thanks to the Yelp reviews, yesterday was my first visit for mother and daughter time. 
This place is amazing! Mismatched furniture, tea cups/saucers, tea pots and an array of antique china/decor. Perfect for a girls day or mother/daughter time. The food was amazing. Be warned, the Queens Tea (for two) is more than enough food to share for 3-4. Opt for a a simple Queen Tea and add an additional pot of tea. Lovejoy's tea room is a must if you love tea and want to have a lovely tea party.

I adore this place and will be a frequent guest in the upcoming year.
author: Andrea W.

description:
I took my Mum for a tea time date! The tea room super cute, service was good the gals did a good job taking orders down and topping of our tea pot.

The finger foods were delish, not heavy just right. 

I do know I will be coming back.
author: Conchita B.

description:
This is the PERFECT place to have a good time being ladies with some girlfriends. Don't expect to be "full" from this but I was definitely full from the tea. Me and my friends had the Queen's Tea for two. The best tea sandwiches so far were the smoked salmon and cream cheese and the salad was light and fresh. 

The scones were the BEST SCONES I HAVE EVER TASTED. They are light, airy, warm, buttery. When spread with the lemon curd or the raspberry preserves. I literally heard angels sing. I am definitely coming back again for the scones!

I usually like my teas light so i opted for the green tea white peach. It was very delightful and light that I ended up going across the street to their store and purchasing their loose tea leaves. Definitely a wonderful experience with great scones and teas and will come back again!
author: Helen J.

description: Had a great time coming here with my friends. YAY for having gluten free options! (Even it does cost a little more) We ordered 1 light tea, 1 high tea and 1 queen's tea. It was more than enough for 3 people. We were a little sad that they didn't have macarons, but they did have a lot have cute hats that you can borrow to take photos in!
author: Michelle C.

description:
I was SO excited to try this place! I've had high tea in London and it was amazing. I also just had a tea party of my own a few months back and it was a delight. I was so eager in fact that I insisted we go to tea before we even handled the errands that brought us to SF for the day. 
The tea room itself is adorable. I love how none of the cups, saucers and pots match. The eclectic decor gives it a really authentic feel and even the bathroom is done up. The antique furniture is great too. We were surprised that there were a lot of kids inside the business and it was actually rather loud and noisy. 
The staff was nice enough, but not genuinely warm. 
We each had a pot of tea. I chose the Vanilla black tea and my fiance had the black currant. I don't know why he chose that and it tasted bad (as I expected it would) with a bad aftertaste as well. Can't blame them for that. We just kept drinking out of my pot lol. 
We got 4 sandwiches with our high tea for two. I had the special which was a fig and goat cheese and I also ordered the pickle chutney. My date had the hummus and artichoke as well as turkey with dijon mustard. When the sandwiches came out they were TINY which is too be expected at a tea. But still, these were exceptionally tiny so we resigned ourselves to eat a real meal somewhere else later. Unfortunately, the sandwiches were inedible. The flavors were overpowering in the worst way and they smelled and tasted rancid. Honestly, there were all terrible with no consideration for anyone's pallet. I was very disappointed. 
The warm scones were good and the raspberry preserves were delicious. I could eat that on it's own. The "salad" and slaw on the bottom of the tray were minimal and flavorless and the dressing was no help. 
The real reason we came was for the petite fours! I have loved them since I was a child and could not wait to have my fiance taste one :) I was overjoyed when they brought out the desserts; both for the petite fours and because we were both starving! Although they are small and were $2.50 each, we got 3 just to sample. I heard the server advise that they were Marzipan, but after biting into the first one, I almost spit it out. My fiance bit into his at the same time and the look on our faces spoke volumes. It was terrible! I tried to eat them but they literally made me feel sick. We had to put napkins over them so we could get our check. I felt so bad. Last night I had to order some real petite fours online to try and "un-traumatize" my fiance and let him know they aren't really disgusting. 
Sad to say, but this place is just a novelty and I should not be rated as highly as it is. I would give our experience 1.5 stars.
author: Dale S.

description:
This place gives me the heeby-jeebies, something about grown ass women wearing little tea party hats and gloves eating food in baby portions weirds me out.  

Alas, it is still fun to do once in a while, I guess it's not my cup-o-tea (see what I did there).

I do have to give them props for getting us seats without reservations, though, that was awesome.  There were four of us on a Sunday and couldn't initially accommodate our party size, however, called me back and gave us a table that was meant for three. 

We ordered two queen's tea services, and it was for sure not enough for two girls and two guys.  I'd recommend at least three services for four people, or one per person to play it safe. 

The scone was delicious as well as the marmalade, jam and butter it was served with, however, wtf was that crumpet?  I don't think I've ever had crumpets before but it was like a really airy spongy pancake that took forever to get to our table and only arrived in my mouth to deliver disappointment and longing for something more satisfying. 

The salmon and cream cheese sandwich was really good, the asparagus one was aiiight nothing amazing, and I think the chicken salad one was a favorite as well, however, I didn't try it myself. 

We ordered a vanilla black tea, it was good!  It's hard to go wrong with tea though. 

Overall not impressed for the price you are paying.

We went to McDonalds an hour later.
author: Christina L.

description: Loved everything about this cute little place!  Not only did they get us in after we called to make a reservation on my birthday, but they treated us like royalty, I felt like I was in England!  We each had our own tea & tea sandwiches, fruit, salad, scones, cookies, lemon curd, raspberry preserves, it was so nice!  I highly recommend this place & will definitely be going back, thank you!
author: Marlene C.

description:
Best, most buttery biscuits and perfectly toasted crumpets I've ever had! 

The atmosphere is super cute, make sure to call ahead for reservations.
author: Jess C.

description:
Beautiful, old-fashion-looking, tea room serving some good 'ol afternoon tea!

Crowd: for weekends --- go online for reservation. You won't be able to get in otherwise. There are set entry times as well. I think the max stay for each party is 2 hours. You will need to put down a card for the reservation as well.

Location: right next to the muni stop on Church, J line goes through here.

Tea set: you order tea, each person can get his/her own tea, and then depending on the price range, either 1-2 tea sandwiches, salad, crumpets, scones, cookies, etc. All the sandwiches are decent, but I won't say extremely outstanding. After all, I don't think an afternoon tea is about how extreme their sandwiches are :) You're really just there for the nice atmosphere, pleasant decor, warm and nice food, and chit chat. 

For those with kids: strollers will not fit inside. No room for highchair. OK to bring infants that can be held/wrapped and are relatively quiet. Not suitable for small children who can't sit still.

Experience: We went with a party of 6 on Sunday 1:15PM with reservation a month in advance. Promptly seated. We all ordered "high tea" which comes with two tea sandwiches, salad, crumpet, scone, cookie. Don't be fooled by the tiny sandwiches. You WILL BE FULL by the end of the 2 hour meal! Service is good and there's really not much to complain! 

Compare to other tea places in SF:

Dartealing is a little better in terms of tea uniqueness & sandwich quality, but overall these two are my favorites. Fairmont hotel afternoon tea is more expensive, has more fancy decor, but the sweets are actually worse. The Rotunda downtown is more noisy, fancier looking, more expensive, and also less refined. Samouvar is not really the same type of place, so no comparison.  I have not been to Crumpet.

So really, Dartealing and LoveJoy are my top 2 recommended afternoon tea in SF. Very affordable and very good!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Serendipity and spontaneity are in a perfect alignment this afternoon when yours truly and the boy she loves roll by Lovejoy's for a chance to be seated without reservation to guarantee us a spot. But it has all worked out. The nice lady hostess fits us in for a 90 mins tea service and all is well. 
Since this is my first time at Lovejoy's, we choose to go with the Queen's Tea with all the lovely tea sammies, crumpets, scones with clotted cream and lemon curds to go with the Royal Blend black tea. The ambiance at Lovejoy's is just lovely and inviting-it's no surprise that reservations are hard to come by so I feel quite lucky to have this tea service as soon as I walk in today. 

As for the tea, the Royal Blend is pleasantly smooth, with a hint of orange and vanilla-but I may want to try other tea options on our next visit. There is quite a selection on their tea, tea sammies, and the petit fours. For our tea service this afternoon, we opt for the bay shrimp and mayonnaise, and turkey and dijon mustard-what dainty little tasty sandwiches these are... The scone, lemon curd, clotted cream and the raspberry jam were also nice and adequate. 

Overall, for a tea service, I would grade Lovejoy's Ambiance and friendly and attentive service to be 5 stars, taste of food at 3.5. I find their pricing to be quite affordable and would likely try to come back if the gods of tea service would kindly bless me with another spontaneous seating again since reservations are so difficult to get.
author: Taffany H.

description: Everything was so good and I especially loved the scone and the decaf chocolate truffle tea.  I highly recommend that tea.
author: Denice Arielle M.

description:
I've come here twice and the service is always the best. All of the workers are very friendly and inviting. This place is a bit pricy, so as a college student I won't come without my mom or something. 

Across the street is the antique store where you can buy a whole bunch of different items. They also carry tea in this small room at the back where I bought my favorite tea that they sell China rose!!! 

Love this place will come here any chance I get. My mom loves it too so hopefully I can come many more times.
author: Kaitlin V.

description:
I was seriously envisioning giving Lovejoy's Tea Room a glowing 5 star review because I love all the cutesy quirky decor, but my best friend and I got the serious runs after visiting this place! I made a reservation for 2 at 2pm on a Thursday afternoon and my best friend and I arrived 15 minutes before our reservation. We were seated right away, but I was a bit disappointed that we were sitting so close to the party next to us because we could hear every single detail of their conversation. We were going to ask if we could move, but the place was packed and we didn't want to seem like snobs!

As per the suggestion of the server, we ordered the High Tea for one and added an extra scone and 2 extra sandwiches with the Yorkshire Gold Tea. The sandwiches we chose were Smoked Turkey and Dijon Mustard, Bay Shrimp and Mayo, Chicken and Asparagus, and Lovejoy's Daily Special, which was probably a ham with some sort of mustard. My BFF and I looked at each other thinking "this is just an appetizer" because the portions were very tiny. Yes, I do understand that tea is supposed to be light, but seriously, the portions were way to small! The Yorkshire Gold Tea was fantastic and definitely enough to share between 2 people. Also, the scones were some of the best I've had!

As we were eating and chatting about life, I noticed that I felt a tad bit hot halfway through. Thinking it was the tea and lack of ventilation on our side, I ignored it and started to feel this way throughout the remaining portion of our tea time. We paid, left, and my stomach started making odd noises. I ignored it until an hour passed and my BFF and I ran to the shiny porcelain throne and girl, let me tell you, it definitely felt like we were reenacting the scene from White Chicks when Brittany or Tiffany Wilson was holding on for her life when she had the quiche. Definitely NOT  a pretty look! It was my first time taking Pepto Bismol and I was not happy.

Again I really do hate to be that person giving 2 stars on a highly rated establishment, but Lovejoy's, you let me down. Would I come back? Probably not!
author: Joyce E.

description:
I have never been to a Tea Room before and I thought LoveJoy's was a perfect place for me to start with. I went there this past weekend with the women in my family for a mother/daughter get together. It was so cute! Even though the place is a bit tiny it didn't feel cramped. The service was great. They always made sure your teas were topped off and the food was so good.

My favorite part of the meal was the scone, it was so good I came back the next day and ordered some to go.  *Note: I don't think they answer the phone normally so if you wanted takeout you would have to go there, order, and wait.
author: kat r.

description:
This is such a quaint place. Small but cute. Make sure you reserve because this place gets packed.

My friends bachelorette party/bridal shower ended at this location. It was on a Sunday and it was packed. The staff was very helpful and super nice. The bride was running late, like 1.5 hours late and even though there was a reservation after us, our server did not rush us and kept checking in on us and was nice enough to cut our coke and box everything up! 

It was about 28 per person but they add on a gratuity fee as well as a cake cutting fee of a party of 10.

The sandwiches were delicious and they were served with scone like biscuits and salad, all very delicious! The teas were delicious as well, make sure you use the strainers they provide to avoid from getting leaves in your cup from making the tea.
author: Monica G.

description: Best high tea place ever! There's so much character here in Noe Valley, San Francisco! Lovejoy's hits the spot. It was the first time for my little lady and I wanted to show her the best. The owner gave us marzipan petit fours and rose petal lemonade. I love the eclectic decor. We tried on hats, played with teapots, ate divine treats. Just a great 'lady day' with my special little girl. A new tradition! Go!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Lovejoy won me over with their pub fare menu. Yup, it was that simple. 

I'm not a high tea person. I don't normally drink tea. I don't like eating dinky portions. But it's one of those get-in-touch-with-your-feminine-side things. And of course, it's about being in the company of good girlfriends. 

The place felt crowded and cluttered. It was overloaded with pictures, posters, hats, and all sorts of dainty things! Still, they were all interesting to look at. Service was quite friendly and attentive given how busy they were. 

Out of 7 girls, 4 did tea service while 3 ordered from the pub fare. I don't remember the exact tea service, but it came with delicious looking tea sandwiches, fresh fruits, fresh scones, and more. But I would say the winners were the shepherd's pies and salad from the pub fare menu. 

Shepherd's Pie (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw#TO35VWsTkBqeB_BW3eXzHg): Minced meat and mashed potato baked in a large dish. Served with mixed greens. Not only was the portion huge, it tasted so good! So flavorful and hearty!

Pear & Stilton Salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw#QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw): Spring greens with pears, strawberries, oranges, blueberries, walnut, stilton cheese, and strawberry balsamic vinaigrette. Served with slices of grapefruit and pita on the side. The salad was also huge. But also very refreshing and delicious! 

One of the girlfriends and I originally made plans to go eat in the Mission afterwards, thinking we won't be full. We ended up going to the Mission to walk off our stuffed bellies.
author: Marti L.

description: So much fun! They have a great selection of teas (I really liked the Chestnut) and some really tasty sandwiches! As far as high tea goes, it's very affordable! I loved the English Cheddar and Tomato sandwich. Also, the SCONES!
author: Lizzy B.

description:
Tea is one of my favorite things because it is a relaxing way to enjoy the company you are with without lifting one finger! Also, I am a stinker - I do not count tea as one of my 3 squares. . . it's a "snack" (it isn't a snack - it is a meal). 

I phoned and made a reservation for my party of 4. When we arrived parking proved a challenge, so allow for time to park when you come here. 

We waited for a little while because the great window table they reserved for us still had folks finishing out their time (Lovejoy's smartly limits your time to accommodate everyone). 

The service is great! These ladies work really hard to make you feel pampered! 

We ordered an abundance of delicious food to go with each of our individual pots of teas. The sausage rolls and the Shepherd's Pie are great add ons to your tiers of sandwiches, salad, and fresh fruits. 

Lovejoy's supports one of my favorite SF charitable organizations that I support: Muttville - senior rescue dogs. I love that! 

Keep your eyes peeled for a discount coupon to their store across the street - Lovejoy's Attic when they hand you your check. 

An afternoon with my girls and my good friend... chatting away, enjoying delicious bites. . . life is good.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
If you are looking for "ultra-posh" Tea Service, try the Fairmont Hotel. It isn't any better than Lovejoy's fare, but you can pay more and not complain about the charming mismatched antique tea sets.The place may be a collage of eras and furniture to match, but it doesn't "smell" bad. The reviews that say that are hyperbolic.

Even the neighborhood is a bit out of time, more like the SF of yesteryear, quieter, charming, more contemplative than most, including nearby 24th street, which means you can park if you need to drive. 

Lovejoy's embraces an informal aesthetic with staff that are incredibly friendly and attentive. I couldn't fault the Tea Service (High Tea) and I left satisfied. It's a smallish place--and very popular--so plan to get cozy while knowing there is still plenty of space to enjoy a conversation with a close friend or two.
author: Tao G.

description:
Came for my sister's bridal shower. Rooibos tea was tasty, and they had great scones, but I wasn't so much a fan of the finger sandwiches (since the bread was ordinary, like grocery store wonder bread almost..and the fillings weren't super special or tasty. Also, the salad was just haphazardly on one layer of the tiered plate). 

Nonetheless, cute place for a tea party - this is better for the ambiance/environment I would say rather than the food. But definitely try the scones - they're buttery and rich, and perfectly lightly sweet!
author: Kristie C.

description:
I came here for my sister's baby sprinkle in a party of ~ 8. It was my first time experiencing high tea, and I didn't expect anything great; I mean, it's just tea and some overpriced biscuits. How great can it be, right?

Well, I found out that it's pretty darn great! First off, everything was adorable, from the mismatched plates and saucers to the homey, antiquey decorations around the tea room. It reminds me of Alice in Wonderland, just a bit! The service is also wonderful. She always came around to keep our tea pots full and to make sure we were doing okay. 

The menu is extensive - you're definitely not limited in food, as there's salad, fruit, crumpets, scones, sandwiches, and other pastries. I ordered the Queen's tea with a pomegranate black tea and shared it with my cousin. It's seriously a lot of food! My favorites were the buttery, delicate scones, crumpets, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. They were heavenly when paired with the tea. I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it. Also, when you choose your petits fours at the end of your tea ritual, I would suggest avoiding the salted caramel truffle unless you like your truffle EXTREMELY salty. Everything else seemed fine, though.

Overall, I'd definitely come back when I'm in SF. Seeing as how brunch has become pretty basic (but I'm still a huge brunch fanatic - does that make me basic?), I say skip the eggs benedicts and mimosas and have a tea party date with your girlfriends at Lovejoy's instead!
author: Kim D.

description: We love Lovejoy's. We've brought out of town guests, celebrated birthdays and holidays here and each time the service has been great.  They have a good selection of teas and food, even for those that aren't in love with tea.  It's a popular place so they book up quickly, but they let us order to go (had to order there as they rarely pick up their phone) so that our out of town guests could try their amazing scones.
author: Nicole D.

description:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is too stinkin' cute. You do feel like royalty when you visit here and stay for their tea service. We no longer live in California, so when we visit my daughter insists we come to Lovejoy's each time. We brought Grandma for afternoon tea, and we had a ball. Just us girls. Three generations. 

Now for the tea service. Their scones are AMAZING. Order as many as you can and layer on their preserves, Devon cream and lemon curd. Not all at once, of course. Or you could. Why not? They're so good! We also had cucumber/cream cheese and smoked salmon/cream cheese tea sandwiches with fresh fruit. As for tea, we each had our own pot of Vanilla Rooibos, Earl Grey Cream and Afternoon Darjeeling which is my new favorite. 

The mismatch of tea cups, saucers and plates add to the charm. I wish their space was just a tad bit bigger. Tables and chairs are quite close to each other, but this shouldn't be a reason to not visit. It just makes the whole tea room feel quite cozy. My daughter is a huge fan of Lovejoy's and now we've made a fan of my mother too. Make sure you also visit Lovejoy's Attic across the way to purchase those lovely tea blends. Reservations are required. To the tea room. Not the store. You only live once. Treat yourself to Lovejoy's. And often!
author: Claudine D.

description:
After hearing about this place for awhile, I was finally able to try it out. Keep in mind, this is a few blocks away from the 24th mission! ( and you have to walk uphill!) . My advice is either drive, uber, maybe the j muni line! 

You definitely need more than an hour here and make sure to make reservations! We came on a Thursday and it was packed! ( thank goodness for reservations!) 

We got the high tea for two ( 21 dollars per person)! It comes with two sandwiches of your choice ( we got four types), one scone, salad, coleslaw! A lot of food! We also got two pots of tea!

The only con about this place is their lack of desserts!( perhaps they come with a different tea set)! I'll definitely come here again but not during my lunch for sure!
author: Josie H.

description:
My 200th review goes out to Lovejoy's Tea Room! It was a tough debate between  Lovejoy's Tea Room, Lovejoy's Attic, and Koja Kitchen. 

Lovejoy's is located on the corner of Church & Clipper St, right across from their sister store, Lovejoy's Attic (cute place for tea sets, etc. btw!). This tea room is one of the better places I have been to - it's cute, the food & tea taste great,  and the service is awesome. Parking in the area may be tough, depending when you come. 

It's highly recommended to make reservations in advance. Book 2-4 weeks in advance; depending if there's a holiday coming up. I came here near the holidays and I couldn't get a reservation 2 weeks in advance, but they do allow walk-ins. If you're a walk-in like me, you will have a set amount of time there. The time limit for my friend & I was about 2 hours. Sadly, it did feel like we had to rush the end of our afternoon tea because the 2 hour was ending. If you're in a hurry to go somewhere, I suggest you to give yourself a 3 hour time frame to relax. 

My friend and I got the Queen's Tea ($28 pp). This comes with your choice of two sandwiches, served with cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, organic spring greens, a scone with preserves and Devon cream, a crumpet with Meyer Lemon Curd, fresh fruit, a petit four and a tea biscuit. 

The Petit four will be served at the end and you get  your choice of ONE dessert; if you pick two, there will be an additional $2.50 charge on your bill (my mistake). Their petit fours were adorable as it had a Christmas theme to it :) I think my favorite of the two sandwiches - smoked salmon & cream cheese and one of their daily specials, was probably the smoked salmon & cream cheese - you can never go wrong with that! It was delish, though I can't describe in detail, since it's been awhile since I last went.

I'd love to come back again, when I can find a lady-friend to come with! Miss you Carmen, and our fun tea adventures! Come back from LA soon! :(
author: Mandy G.

description:
Location: It's on the corner so you won't miss it and it is street parking!


Customer Service: Friendly staff and very attentive.


Decor: Very cute vintage and antique feel! I love the decor actually, it feels like somebody took a box and put in all these memorabilia with cute old school furniture and shook it up and bam you got the love joy tea room!


Presentation of Food: Very cute and everything you'd expect in a tea party setting! Cutest thing was the mismatched tea sets gave it a different feel compared to other tea spots!


How did the food taste?: This is why I gave it two stars! The sandwiches were plain and nothing to rave about? I tried the chicken walnut sammy and it had no flavor! Their sandwhich of the day had turkey cranberry etc and you'd think it's be good because it's the special of the day but it was too sour and just wasn't what I had expected. The salad was bleh also, the dressing was just so bland! the only thing i did enjoy were the yummy scones but other than that everything was dissaponting especially because of the raving yelpers that attracted us to even try this place out );!!! Btw we ordered the high tea! I will say though is that they had good tea.



Overall Experience: It was just eh....


Would I Come Back?: No there's other tea places I target go to!
author: Rosh E.

description: This is such a cool unique place to go. Definetly a price lunch but the atmosphere and whole experience make it a worthy treat. Everything is delicate and fresh. The scones are to die for
author: Katherine Q.

description: First time here, love everything about it. Service was very good, great relax environment with reasonable price. One of the best Hi Tea I have had. Would love to come back, a must try place!
author: Mack A.

description:
My friends and I come here every other month for special occasions and when we just want to have a nice cup of tea and sandwiches. For special occasions, we usually get high tea. The warm scones and raspberry jam are always amazing. My favourite sandwiches are the chicken apple walnut and salmon and cream cheese. Their sandwiches are always delicious and the bread is soft like clouds. 

For birthdays, LJ's gives a special small birthday cake petit four (all the other petit four flavours are incredible as well- especially the lemon and strawberry ones).
I love the "endless pot o' tea" -- my friends and I always find ourselves drinking two or more teapot-fulls! 
As for tea, China rose petal and Forest berries and rose hips are my absolute favourite.
Lovejoy's is perfect for just hanging out with the girls or for birthday parties. I have seen a post-wedding celebration take place at Lovejoy's as well. I highly recommend for all ages and just about any occasion.
author: Cat B.

description:
Had high tea here this afternoon, very quaint and cute little tea room.  Lots of books and general clutter around but in a cute "grandma" way.

Servers were amazing, tea and scones were delicious.  

Between the two of us we had 4 sandwiches, the only one I would skip is the salmon and cream cheese.  We had the daily special which was a curry sand which and was delicious.
author: Eileen H.

description:
Great little tea room for lunch. I ordered the white peach tea and it was smoooooooth. My GF had the black vanilla lavender tea which she said was fragrant.

Tried their high tea and me tea. I was starving and my high tea portions filled me up. I've had better sammies (cucumber cream cheese and bay shrimp) elsewhere but their scones are the best. Dense, moist and flaky. 

Good service. Cute setup. Clean bathroom (it's important!).
author: Julie L.

description:
Takes me back to England! Even though my fondest memories were in England, drinking tea is a global phenomenon that many people from all the different parts of the world partake in. When I was in college, I studied abroad in England and one thing I miss most is the amazing tasting teas & the tearooms! Pinkies up! 

Of course, tearooms are more widespread in the land of the monarchy, but it's nice to know one of them is a 10-minute drive from my place in SF. Parking is very easy to find even on the weekends. We were able to find street parking a block away. Beware of street signs if you park in the afternoon on weekdays. The tea room is only open Wednesdays to Sundays until 6PM. Last feeding (their words not mine) is at 4:30PM. I would highly recommend making a reservation, especially on the weekends just so you secure yourself a spot in this quaint and cozy little tearoom. You can reserve up to 2 hours in advanced if you're not quite sure of your schedule until the day of. They usually don't pick up, so make sure you leave a message & they'll return your call right away. 

When we arrived we were seated at this cute little table by the window and on the table, there was a sign that said "reserved for royalty". I know at one point I wanted to marry Prince William, but that hardly makes me royal. Regardless, that made me feel very special. The tearoom is small, probably fitting only about 7-10 tables tops. But I think this creates a very intimate experience. Our waitress was very attentive and I felt like she was able to get us everything we needed, which was probably because the space accommodated a handful of people (a plus!). Our waitress was also very knowledgeable about the teas and didn't mind waiting until we perused through the extensive menu that included over 20 different teas! 

We ended up ordering the high tea and "me" tea with black vanilla lavender tea and darjeeling tea-- both of my new favorites. What I loved about the tea was that it was loose leaf, which is definitely the healthier type of tea (tea bags contain added chemicals that aren't good for you). With the tea, we were able to order sandwiches and a side pastry. I ordered the darjeeling with the chicken and asparagus & salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. My brother ordered his vanilla lavender tea with the daily special sandwich-- which was cranberry and turkey (reminded me of Thanksgiving). Along with my sandwiches came a delicious scone with a side of strawberry jam and butter; while my brother chose a crumpet, his personal favorite, with a side of lemon spread. The sandwiches also came with a salad and vinaigrette. I think the food was excellent and it paired very well with the tea. 

The tea is a bit pricey (bill was $40 for 2), but I think it was worth it given the wonderful experience that my brother and I had. I definitely want to come back another time with family and friends. It was such a lovely and nostalgic experience.
author: Brittany D.

description: What an adorable place! Perfect for a date with the girls. This was by far the cutest tearoom I have been to in SF. The tea was excellent (and unlimited) and the put together sandwich and dessert tray was delicious. I especially like the blue cheese sandwiches.
author: Alina F.

description:
Adorable!

Look, I consider myself a pretty typical guy, i.e. one who does not go to tea rooms, not that there's anything wrong with that.

In fact, there is absolutely NOTHING wrong with that! Lovejoy's Tea Room is the most precious little place I've ever been to.

My girlfriend and I had had been wanting to check this place out for a while but never managed to time it quite right. We finally snagged a reservation this weekend and it ended up being the highlight of our weekend (and it was already a good weekend!).

We shared some chestnut tea, a couple of scones (one being gluten-free, yay), fruit and some marzipan sweets. I'm not a huge tea fan and I don't have much of a sweet tooth but I absolutely loved everything!

The service was top-notch, the decor is incredibly cute and cozy and the prices are more than fair. I will definitely be back.
author: Teiki K.

description:
I absolutely love LoveJoys, I just wish they were open more days of the week. If you want to get a good time make sure to make a reservation in advance they may not be able to seat you even during the week.

It's a great place for a bridal shower or baby shower or just a mother daughter outing. The teas are great and so is the hot chocolate. 

My favorite sandwiches are the chicken apple walnut and smoked salmon, but make sure to try the special sandwich.

Service here is always fast and speedy. You pretty much get food right away. The scones are perfect as are the crumpets. I even take the scones to go. I can't rave about this place enough
author: Maryam T.

description: I had the best time here for my birthday party. I never had afternoon tea and this was such a great experience. The owner was super sweet and even gave me a complimentary birthday keepsake. She accommodated my party even though we were all late because of the heavy traffic from the rain. My favorite teas were the vanilla and the lavender one. With some milk and sugar it was simply amazing. The tea sandwiches and scones were delicious as well. I was really impressed by the service and would definitely recommend it to everyone.
author: Evelyn A.

description: Great place for tea! Must try white peach tea.  Sandwiches, salad, scones were fresh and yummy!
author: N L.

description: Had a excellent experience here. My daughter & I stopped in with no reservations & lucky for us they were able to sit us shortly after our arrival. The tea, food & service was excellent. We will definitely return!
author: Jeanette R.

description:
ambiance//***
it's fine....a lot of quintessentially british items
borderline kitschy
to see it done well check out shakespeare's corner shoppe in San Diego

service//*
service was very mediocre, almost borderline unfriendly
deducting a star for tossing my check on the table at me

food//**
for high tea the portions were disappointingly meager
also, i'm not a fan of marzipan for petit fours which is the only theing they had available
~*~
don't know what the hype is about =\
author: Donna S.

description:
In true Judy fashion, I have a new obsession: English afternoon tea. I've never been this excited about something British related since the Spice Girls. Yeah, I'm bringing it waaay back. 

I experienced my first afternoon tea sesh at Lovejoy's Tea Room with my two besties on a gloomy Sunday. We were ooh-ing and ahh-ing over their adorable and vintage tea sets, the cozy yet regal decor, and the impeccable sweet and savory finger foods.

My friends and I each ordered the Queen's Tea Set which includes two sandwiches served with cabbage salad (coleslaw), organic spring greens, mixed fruits, one scone, a crumpet, a Petit Four (small dessert), and a tea biscuit. Essentially, it is a buffet with petite foods. How cute! And let's not forget the bottomless tea pots (it is called afternoon TEA). I decided on the White Peach which paired well with the food because it was not overwhelmingly strong. A light and sweet drink to accompany our little delights.

Now for the tea sandwiches! My friends and I divided and conquered. We sampled six different tiny crustless sandwiches (* denotes favorite):
- Cucumber & Cream Cheese
- Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad*
- Salmon Mousse
- Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise 
- Chicken & Asparagus*
- Lovejoy's Daily Special* 

I can't remember what was in their special but there was chicken involved, and it was simply delicious. You can't go wrong with any of the sandwich choices. All of their daintily cut sandwiches are packed with massive flavors. We also loved the blueberry scones, which were soft and light. Spread some of their tantalizing strawberry jam and you are in sweet pastry heaven. The crumpet was the only thing that we weren't crazy about. It's a waffle-cake hybrid: part waffle in texture but tastes like pancake. It was also very fluffy and hard to cut. We were presented with an assortment of Petit Fours after our meal. I had some type of mocha confectionery--a dense brownie coated with mocha. Mmmm, diabetes!

Loyejoy's is the perfect spot for an afternoon with friends, a romantic date, or a classy bridal shower. We were smitten with the perfectly mismatched china and eclectic setting. This place is essentially an antique shop that serves tea. I'm pretty sure if my grandmas were British, they would be sitting in a place like Lovejoy's sipping on some tea and petting their furry kitties.

Quick tips:
- Make reservations because seating is limited and due to its popularity, Lovejoy's accommodates very few walk-ins. 
- There is a two hour maximum seating time and they will kindly inform you that your time is up and you need to bounce (not in those exact words).
- Use the restroom before you leave! Trust me, with all of that tea you're gulping down, you don't want to risk it. 

Pinkies up!
author: Judy H.

description:
Invited some birthday Princesses here to help celebrate another year of their lives. Seating is every two hours so we reserved the first spot first thing on Sunday morning (11am). This place felt a bit mature and I felt like I was back in England having tea with my elder neighbors. 


What we swallowed:
QUEEN'S TEA: You get two sandwiches so I ordered the salmon/cream cheese with capers and the turkey with cranberry and walnuts (my favorite of the two). They brought our crumpets out fresh out of the oven. The scone was simply delicious. At the end, we were able to choose from a platter of Petit Fours. I choose the strawberry cheesecake, which was rich and delightful. For tea I choose the Decaf Lady Grey: apricot with Earl Grey that was full flavored with great apricot flavor. I tried a cup of my friend's Chocolate Truffle tea and that was delicious also: very smooth and good chocolate flavors, perfect with sugar and milk.

Lovejoy's was a great experience. It was fun to catch up with the ladies and gander at all the doilies, lace and trinkets around the room.
author: Vivian A.

description: Lovejoy's is wonderful. The servers are always so very nice and accommodating. We didn't have a reservation so we asked if it was possible to get seated anyway. The woman was very nice and told us to wait a little bit because they were fully booked. No problem. About ten minutes or so later she came out and we were seated. The food is delicious and they make THE best scones. They are on top of everything and friendliness means a lot to me. Every server we've ever had in all the times we have been were fantastic.
author: Keeva L.

description: Calling all queens!! This is the cutest and classiest tea room in town. Took my mama here for Mother's Day and it was the best decision ever. The tea was great, the snacks were great, and most importantly, they gave us hella cute hats to wear while enjoying our tea! The gift shop next door has great goodies to take home and I even found a great pair of earrings there!
author: Farah E.

description:
I finally had a chance to try Lovejoy's gluten free Queen's Tea and I have to say that (aside from the "crumpet") it was amazing.

Yes, this place gets crowded...the place was packed for their 11 am seating on a Sunday and people were lined up outside 15 minutes before the place opened. It's crowded for a reason. The food is great and the kitschy-ness makes it so fun to have tea here.

Our server was very friendly and always made sure our teapots were full. The service flowed seamlessly.

The gluten free scone was warm and soft. It had a nice flavor and the lemon curd, preserves and clotted cream complimented it well. 

The gluten free bread was seriously THE BEST gluten free bread I have ever eaten. In fact, I'm not even sure if it was gluten free (okay, I am...the bread was brown in color and still had the crusts on; my dining partner had wheat flour based bread and the crusts were removed). But seriously, THE BEST gluten free bread I have ever eaten. I had the cucumber cream cheese and one of their daily specials...I think it was a turkey and chutney. I'd skip the turkey and chutney concoction and head for the salmon mousse to go along with cucumber cream cheese next time. 

The cabbage salad with caraway is a favorite of mine. I've always enjoyed it. I've tried to replicate it at home...but I can never make it the same. 

I always enjoy the delicate green salad with the vinaigrette. 

The fruit was fresh.

The tea biscuit was tasty. 

The crumpet...well...the crumpet was actually an english muffin from Kinnikinnick. A good try, but no match to a real crumpet. I didn't finish my gluten free version...and I almost always finish everything on my plate...so that's saying something. Not bad, but not really worth eating toward the end of my tea service. 

Instead of a petit four, I received a gluten free cake pop...and to my delight it was lemon. I love all things lemon, so this was perfect. It was moist and lovely. It was actually the first cake pop I ever had. They weren't popular back in the days when I was eating gluten and now that they've made their way into many markets, I hadn't had a chance to try one until I had the Queen's Tea at Lovejoy's. 

In short, a lovely tea experience. I am already making plans to head back. 

Call at least 4-6 weeks in advance to get the weekend seating of your choice. They're often booked many weekends in a row and if you're hoping to get a last minute reservation, you might just be out of luck. 

I highly recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room. They're my favorite tea room in the Bay Area...even before I was gluten free...and now that they have such a wonderful gluten free tea service I am beyond a fan. 

GO! Make a reservation NOW!
author: Jennie C.

description:
Put my name on the wait list and they responded within two days that there was an open slot for Saturday. Cute place to have brunch with girlfriends before heading out to shop. We decided to BART over from Oakland for our 11am reservation, it's about a 10 minutes walk from 24th/Mission,( those hills tho!).
They'll give you a 10 minutes heads up that your 2 hour limit is up.
author: Y C.

description:
Tea! Sandwiches! Scones!

Part of me wants to keep this place a secret from my friends, but the other part of me wants to tell the world how interesting, unique, and delicious this place is!

AT and I arrived just after it opened today (11am on a Sunday) and snagged the last available table. I highly recommend making reservations unless you want to risk waiting 1-2 hours for a table. We both ordered the "me tea"--AT got the black tea blend, apple and Stilton sandwich, and the scone. I got the spiced citrus tea, chicken apple walnut sandwich, and the scone. We both really enjoyed every part of the meal (although the part that we both kept raving about was the scone with the double cream and raspberry preserves) and agreed that the size of the "me tea" was plenty (maybe even more than enough) for one person. Plus, the tea continues being refilled throughout the meal!

We can't wait to be back--with reservations!
author: Julia N.

description: This quaint little spot in the adorable Noe Valley is a super fun way to spend a relaxing afternoon with friends and/or your moms. My friends and I love getting dolled up, putting on big hats and stuffing our faces. It's tea time & dress up for grown ups (oh but it's great for kids too). The staff was very nice and attentive, food here was super yummy, their menu was had variety, and the interior decor and ambiance was dreamy! I really couldn't imagine a more quintessential English tea experience.
author: Shayan S.

description:
I came here for my friend's baby shower  yesterday and loved it! It's a wonderful place to enjoy afternoon tea. 

Ambiance: Cozy, fun, warm and welcoming. Lace topped tables, mismatched floral porcelain tea sets, cute curtains and the carefully cluttered look...definitely makes you feel like you're in Grandma's dining/sitting room. The hat stands with an assortment of fun and unique hats completes the quaint shabby chic look. 

Food: Best scones I've had in America. Buttery, creamy, tender and flavorful currant scones served with real Devonshire cream and jam. These scones are the closest to the ones I've had in the tea shops of Cambridge and London, England. We had the High Tea service which also came with sandwiches, cabbage salad, spring mix salad and tea biscuits. The sandwiches, spring mix salad with balsamic dressing, and cabbage salad were good, pretty tasty. The chicken & asparagus and the tomato & cheddar sandwiches were my favorites. The tea biscuits, cookies really, melt-in-your mouth buttery. The scones were truly the highlight for me, a definite must! 

There's quite a selection of teas to choose from, all loose leaf. We enjoyed several teas but my favorite was the white peach. It was the perfect complement to the sandwiches and scones. They definitely know how to brew a proper pot of tea here.

Service: Friendly and quick. We were served shortly after everyone was seated. I don't believe we ever ran out of tea. The waitresses even offered to take our group picture at the table and outside by the mural, a nice touch. Usually you have to ask so it's really nice when they offer. 

I'm definitely coming back with family and friends. This is a great venue for a baby shower, birthday or brunch with friends. 

Don't forget to make reservations because this place was jam packed. 

Parking: Street parking only. Surprisingly, I was able to park on the same block. I saw several other spots close by too.
author: Marivic T.

description:
Lovejoys is great! 
I threw a baby shower this weekend and last week the caterer I had planned on cancelled. To say I was upset is an understatement. 

A quick yelp search sent me to lovejoys. (Why did I not just go there in the first place?) 
Samantha helped me out and with like 3 days noticed helped me plan food for 45 people. It was so reasonable, delicious and wonderful! 
I am so thankful for lovejoys and would use them again and again for catering.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
My love for tea houses has grown incredibly since I tried this place yesterday. It was just like having a tea party as a kid, but an actual sized tea set and real food. 

They have a wide variety of teas. I tried the Black Vanilla with Lavender, and it was like getting a hug in your stomach. (All teas should make you feel as zen and comforting as this.) Their food selection was too perfect. With the Savory Tea package, you get two sandwich choices. I chose the classic Smoked Salmon with Cream Cheese and their special of the day, the Prosciutto and Pear. Their portions may appear rather small, like they always do at tea parties, but they definitely fill you up. Their crumpets come with a lemon curd, and they both definitely complemented one another. Lastly, the scones. Those will be the primary reason (besides their teas) as to why I return probably next week. And the jam that came with them completed their already perfect taste. 

It's a cute, little quiet spot to hang out and have afternoon tea whether you're with friends or having some me time. The next time I go here, I'll probably be flying solo for a bottomless pot and their amazing scones.
author: Alexis G.

description:
The decor is so adorable!  I love it!!!

This was an excellent experience with my little lady.   We both love teas so this place would be perfect for us.  The decoration in the tea house was very nice and cozy.  

I'm not quite sure if the sandwiches were all that great.  However, the scones were yummy.  It was a bit overpriced, but overall I had a great time with my cute date  #mommyandbabytime
author: Sheena P.

description:
Can you say CAYOOT with a capital Q? First and foremost, I'm an avid Downtown Abbey viewer so I love the idea of high tea in all its fancy glory. This place is in the heart of Noe Valley, walked by it a million times but finally came around to trying it. The decor reminds me of the Shabby Chic collection with the crocheted pillows and floral patterns. I've been to Crown & Crumpet in Japantown before but the food/tea here is WAY better.

Normally, there's a long wait but if you get there early enough you might be able to skip the line. We got there right when it opened so we were seated immediately. We ordered the "High Tea" service with the Mango, White Peach (my favorite), Chamomile and Peppermint teas. I loved the sandwiches and the scones were ultra fluffy and yummay. I wasn't a fan of the crumpets with the lemon curd but then again, I never have been a fan of crumpets to begin with. Also, I normally wouldn't have opted for the "Pear and Stilton" sandwich but it was delicious! The waitresses are all very friendly. Perfect place for a date with your girlfriends.
author: Tania S.

description:
Product: high tea service - This place is a breath of British Victorian fresh air.  The only thing missing is a garden in the back with soft white butterflies fluttering around while sipping some tea and eating some crumpets and petit fours.  Though this place can seem a bit pretentious due to the nature of British high tea, the staff and the atmosphere that the place brings makes it more like having tea with grandma and telling her what's going on with life.  The sandwiches are divine and this place alone can sell itself with the fresh made blueberry scones and warm crumpets with their spreads.  My sister and I had the chestnut tea which is my favorite and the staff made sure that we were never without tea and good fine service.  Definitely a go to place for morning brunch and afternoon tea time.  "It's divine, it's delectable, is de-Lovejoy's!"

Service rating:  The staff at Lovejoy's is nothing but wonderful.  Very friendly, very respectful to not interrupt conversation when refilling your teapots, and makes sure that everyone in your party is enjoying their tea time and snacks.  Whether you're in your best floral Sunday brunch dresses, button down and designer jeans, or even just shorts and a sweater they make you feel like you belong and either are really great at hiding judgment or are just quite humble and amiable.  

Ambiance: Granny from Wales who likes to bake, have tea, and then go hunting in her Chanel or Burberry hunting ensemble post afternoon high tea.  This place is really great at keeping itself authentic to an old fashioned Victorian tea time saloon.  They offer afternoon tea, high tea, and Royal tea service which I find very refreshing and proprietary.  

Recommendation: Clotted cream or spotted dick, YUM! Other than that, I hope they keep it as it is and I hope this place keeps attracting customers.  I plan to bring my future children here for afternoon tea or Sunday brunch one day!
author: Edgar I.

description:
Great tea sandwiches, many gluten free options, and a wide variety of well prepared teas. 
I usually try a few different sandwiches and the specials are always great. Awesome for gluten free peeps trying to get a teahouse fix!
author: Josh F.

description:
I liked it. It's a special occasion kind of place, and definitely not for those who want big hearty meals. 

I do wish they were more considerate with the portions of the pastries. We got the Queen tea that had a total of 4 sandwiches (hummus and cucumber and green apple and cream cheese). 

The scone came with a lemon curd and raspberry jam that accompanied the platter. Near the end, we got one crumpet and a petit four. The vanilla one was fantastic but sadly, it's $2.50 to add another. 

As for the tea, the black strawberry tea was quite enjoyable and fragrant. Note to share the tea, it's an extra $2. 

Over all the place is quite cute and something to do once in a while. However, if you don't want to get rushed near closing, go sooner in the day; the kitchen closes half an hour early.
author: Bahar A.

description: Loved loved loved this place! I've only been to two other tea places in San Francisco and this by far is the BEST one. The staff is so welcoming and super sweet! The tea room had such a delightful ambiance! I would highly recommend coming to the place for a yummy cup of tea and delicious pastries! I will be definitely be coming back again! :)
author: Marissa S.

description:
What a delightful experience!

The perfect spot for some well-deserved lady time!
Following my friend's recommendation, our group of 5 ordered Queen's Tea ($28pp),
and each selected two flavours for our sammies, and one type of tea.
I personally picked artichoke hummus and bay shrimps for my sammies,
and the delicious herbal tea-of-the-day, which was Cherry Pie.

You are greeted very cordially,
take your time with the menu,
enjoy some perfectly steeped tea,
allow yourself to be girly,
slowly work your way around the tower of noms.
Your tea will be topped off multiple times over the next three hours,
so sit back, and enjoy a calming afternoon with great company.

I originally thought about ordering a pot pie to go with my Queen's tea,
good thing I did not because our group barely finished our food,
and we LOVE our food as much as we HATE leftovers (or just being wasteful).
That just means I will have to come back and try out all the pub favours another time.
All the baked goods were hot and fragrant, and I developed an instantaneous
addiction to their lemon curd. I would put that on pasta and rice if I could..
Service was absolutely outstanding, and the entire tea room, including restroom,
are decorated with great attention to detail and care.
I cannot wait to return, and will make sure my friend-who-had way-too-much-caffeine
pick something decaf next time... after all, we did end up averaging 2.5 pots of tea each!

Note for the workaholics: phone reception was really poor, so that actually stopped me
from looking at my phone every 5 minutes during my 3-hour stay. Bonus points for that!!

Cliffs: Make a reservation, be ladylike, relax, and enjoy the tea, bites, and company!
author: Jade T.

description:
5 stars : Partly because of the food and partly because I ate it with my significant other during Valentine's. WEEEEEEEEEE

I have been meaning to come to this place for the longest time after I saw pictures on Facebook from my friends. I am so glad we came here. We made reservations beforehand and had a lovely seat by the window. I had the High Tea that included scones, salad, coleslaw, and sandwiches. 

Scones: YUM! I am usually not a huge fan of scones since they are often too dry and flaky. However, this was absolutely delicious. Do not forget to use their raspberry jam and devon cream on the raisin scones as well! As I write this review, I am still thinking back to that first bite of my raisin scone...so delish.

Sandwiches: We had the Salmon Mousse as well as the Lovejoy's Special, which was a Chicken with Arugula, coupled with curry sauce. The Salmon Mousse was great, but nothing special or out of the blue. The chicken sandwich was very special as you usually wouldn't come across curry as a spread on sandwiches. 

Tea: Black Vanilla with Lavender. I decided to try something more relaxing since it's a date and I wanted something relaxing. I couldn't really taste the lavender but maybe because my taste buds were masked by the amazing raspberry jam. The servers kept making sure that we had enough tea and poured hot water to ensure warm tea. 

We ended up staying for 1.5 hours because it was such a cute place! I remembered that a fellow Yelper described this place as "your crazy aunt's place where none of the cutlery or plates matched". This is incredibly true. Yet, this "crazy aunt" must also be such a lovely and homely aunt because of all the picture frames on the wall and cozy little cushions. The table beside us (a group of retirees) even dressed up for tea, with little hats and bows to match their dresses!

I will definitely come here again if i am by the area.

One more thing - while the menu states that each person must spend $10.95 minimum, my bf and I only ordered a high tea for $19.95 and were not asked to follow this "minimum," which was great because we were so full by the end of our meal.
author: Jinyen Y.

description: Delicious tea sandwiches and sweeties.  The pots are constantly refilled.  I loved the mix matching of plates, pots, and tea cups.  Charming interior that is a tad shabby but in a good way and very grandmotherly also in a good way...  My only complaint is that it is a bit expensive.  You won't escape with out paying at $30.  It is a nice treat though...
author: Keeping It Real K.

description:
The cutest English tea room I've ever been to! 

The service is fast and they serve the finest scones, sandwiches, and tea. I suggest ordering their "Light Tea" choice if you are wanting a satisfying, yet lighter type of lunch. 

The meal fees are pricey, but it is certainly worth it for the serene ambience, elegant décor and furniture, and marvelous tasting tea food this place provides. 

Also, be sure to make reservations a week in advance. It will save you time and is far more beneficial in the long run.
author: Anna B.

description:
This place is super cute. Love the decor feels like I'm in my grandmas's house Lol. 

I ordered their high tea since I came here with my 3 year old. She didn't eat at all. But I requested they make half of the tea sandwiches for her- cream cheese/strawberry jam which I ended up eating. It was yummy. The hummus sandwich I ordered was bland. Tea was good I ordered their berry fruit tea with Rose in it. Over all it was okay. The upside was their scones. Yummmmmmy!
author: Jade D.

description: Great ambiance and worth the drive to the city!! The Queen's Tea is soooo worth the $28 and the crumpets with lemon curd are to die for!
author: Sarah T.

description:
Why You Should Have Your Bridal Shower At Lovejoy's:

1)  Even though it is difficult to get them on the phone, they usually call back promptly.  

2)  They will accommodate random requests like a side table for a bridal shower scrapbooking project and a gluten free tea service for your gluten allergic guest.

3)  You will be welcomed by a sign that proclaims that this table is "Reserved for the Queens."

4)  A fabulous tea selection like black tea with Chestnut, a not too floral Vanilla and Lavender tea, and plenty of herbal options like a Vanilla Rooibos.  All are served in cute mismatched tea pots, cups and saucers. 

5)  With the Queen's Tea, you'll get a huge platter of flavorful and dainty sammiches like egg with capers, chicken salad, chicken and asparagus and bay shrimp.  You'll also have a fruit selection, salad greens with balsamic dressing, and caraway sprinkled coleslaw.

6)  A platter of warm scones with a generous pile of clotted cream and raspberry jam followed up by another platter of warm crumpets which go great with lemon curd.

7)  A choice of adorable petit fours.  Loved the chocolate raspberry one that I got and I also tried a lemon marzipan one.

8)  If you bring a bottle of bubbly, they will pour it for you and graciously take photos.

9)  They will give the bride a tea spoon as a memento and $5 coupon for Lovejoy's Attic across the street where you can purchase teas and other tea themed goodies.

Nothing but LOVE for Lovejoy's!  (And for D and M.)
author: Amy C.

description: I was instantly charmed and the scones were delicious! Here for a bday party and I had so much fun and the servers are excellent at pacing and offering to make the experience more special. Thanks Carrie (our server)!
author: Regina C.

description:
Quaint, charming, and whimsical place for a fun afternoon tea with your girl (and guy) friends! The decor made me feel like I was in some English lady's closet/house. 

Most of us ordered the High Tea (~$20) which comes with your choice of 2 sandwiches, 1 scone, cabbage salad, mixed green salad, and a cookie biscuit. The sandwiches are pretty standard, but the scone was so good, and I usually don't like scones at all! It's served warm with jam and clotted cream, and not dry at all, but flaky and buttery. I ordered green tea, and the tea itself was very light in flavor, I prefer mine a bit stronger, but it didn't really deter from the overall afternoon tea experience. I've only had one other afternoon tea experience in the city at Neiman's, and Lovejoy's is definitely a more laid-back (and economical) affair. 

Reservations are in 2-hour blocks which can be a bit of a downer if you're having good conversation with friends. I'll probably want to check out other afternoon tea places in the city before I come back, but it's overall a great place to relax and enjoy yourself in good company.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Love this place! We have been coming here for years now. It is our Christmas tradition to have tea with my mother in law and my daughter.  My mother in law is British and we have tried many places, and we find this is the closest thing to home.  The sandwiches, service and atmosphere  are great!  It's like your sitting in a antique store.
author: Yvonne J.

description: Cute little place for tea. They have antique cups and plates for your tea and food. Very unique place. The portion is size for food is perfect for tea. So you can indulge in tasting your tea.
author: Sally L.

description:
Came here with my mom. We both had a queens tea and it kept us full for the rest of the day. 

The waitress was well informed about the teas and suggested the chestnut. I loved it. 
We had a selection of four different sandwiches: salmon, salmon paste, turkey honey dijon, and hummus. My favorite was the salmon and hummus. We also got a salad, scone, crumpet, biscuit, and chocolate each. There scone is the best thing I have ever tasted. 

I would go back just for there scones. They are that good.
author: Azeena H.

description:
I'm a really big fan of fruity and sweet teas so it's no coincidence that I really enjoyed my Lovejoy experience. They have a wide selection of teas as well as savory dishes and their delectable scones. I personally enjoyed their Mango and Passionfruit teas because of that distinct fruit flavor. Although it tasted fine on its own, I liked adding a little honey just to add some more sweetness. 

We also ordered some scones as well as some petite sandwiches. The scones were amazing! They were soft and flaky and paired well with the lemon curd/butter. I also enjoyed the sandwiches (Roast Beef & Chicken/Asparagus), but the scones still came out on top.

When I came, there was a short wait. Fortunately, out group had a reservation so we were quickly seated. This is why its wise to make a reservation to secure a table. I hope to be back to Lovejoy's very soon!
author: Jessica E.

description: Everything was as amazing as I thought it would be. The food was great, but the scones (with clotted cream and raspberry preserves!) and tea were heavenly! My friends and I didn't have a reservation, but we decided to try our luck and just showed up. The staff was super friendly. They had just one table open and we were seated right away. I will definitely be back, and with a reservation in case the place is packed again.
author: Andrea P.

description:
Good for the price. Not the best tea I have had but one of the best for the price. We got the Queen's Tea and the High Tea. With the two combined, we had a total of 4 different types of tea sandwiches, 2 pots of tea, salads, 2 scones, 1 crumpet, 2 checker cookies and slices of fruits. My favorite was the scone. It was buttery and of the perfect texture. Everything else was tasty but not mindblowing. Service was great though. I loved the hostess and our server. Also, very cute tea sets with quirky tablecloths and decorations. 

Call ahead at least 2 weeks in advance to make sure you can get a reservation.
author: Judy L.
