description: This place is super cute. This is the first tea place that I have ever been to and I decided to come here because of all the reviews and the pictures. It was not a disappointment but it was quite expensive. Most tea places are and you get what you pay for. I will definitely come back again.
author: Jenny T.

description: Great experience and something different to do for brunch. My friend and I split the Queen's tea and got a few extras. I didn't realize you can split a tea before coming here. The Queen's tea included 2 sandwiches, a scone, a crumpet, a petit four, the 2 types a salad and a bottomless teapot (they just top it off with hot water) for $29. To this we added an extra scone ($2.50) and an extra sandwich ($4), we also got charged $2 for the extra person using the tea. Overall a great and unrushed experience. Seems to be popular for baby showers and such and when these groups are present it tends to get a little loud.
author: Alisa Z.

description:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is such a pretty place. My experience there was as lovely as the company that I was in. You are never too old to play tea, I mean have tea with friends. lol.

It is the perfect place for tea and lunch with your girlfriends, when you want to feel like the Queen, a Princess or a Lady. Invited by the lovely Elle Q. for tea and a late lunch with the ladies, I was eager to stop by the little Tea House I pass almost every day. 

The interior reminds me of my grandmother's the cute kitschy collections of things. Pretty crocheted pillows, figurines, beautiful mis-matched china and floral patterns everywhere, my eyes wander around the room because there is so much to look at. 

I ordered the High Tea, which comes with a bottomless pot of tea, two sandwiches,  coleslaw, green salad, scones and spreads. I had the Afternoon Darjeeling, which I drank two pots of. My favorite tea.

The salads were pretty typical but good. The sandwiches were dainty, crustless and cut into fours - you could totally inhale them (but I didn't - that's not very lady like). The scones were fluffy and warm, served with devonshire cream and preserves. 

Next time I would like to come back with my mom and sister, I know they would love this place as much as I did.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
The perfect venue for a girly birthday, bridal shower, baby shower, mother's day, or just a cozy hangout with friends. :) For my 26th birthday, I wanted to celebrate with my friends and do something a little bit different than just a fun lunch or dinner. I also wanted to do something that would give us a chance to catch up and chat :). Lovejoy's Tea Room was absolutely perfect for this.  

I made my reservation 2-3 weeks in advance and they were able to seat 7 of us no sweat. We had a big round table near the window with lots of comfy pillows. I think the term "Shabby Chic" was invented to describe the quirky, frilly, cozy decor in this lil tea shop! A sign reading "Reserved for the Queens" was sitting on the table when we arrived. *Does the Queen of England Wave.*

Their menu features ala carte items (including pasties ($9.95), shepherd's pie ($10.95), and quiche ($10.95)) and an assortment of combinations, ranging from the "Cream Tea" ($14.95) which comes with scones, fruit, and a bottomless pot o' tea to the "Queen's Tea" ($26.95) which comes with two types of finger sandwiches, a coleslaw type salad, a green salad, scones, crumpets, fruit, petit fours, shortbread tea biscuits, and, of course, a bottomless pot o' tea.

My friends and I split 5 High Tea's ($19.95) among the 7 of us (see picture for the tower o' treats!). This came with 10 different types of finger sandwiches, 5 different pots of tea, a green salad, coleslaw, scones, and shortbread cookies. They have many different finger sandwiches to choose from. My favorites were the smoked salmon and cream cheese, the special chicken and pesto, and the pear and stilton (blue cheese). They also have an assortment of teas. We tried the vanilla lavender, a green tea, the spiced citrus, and the teahouse blend. Our favorite was the Vanilla Lavender so definitely try that one when you go :).

Thank you so much Lovejoy's for such an adorable, fun, and laidback way to spend my special day with friends!
author: Eileen E.

description:
4 stars for its ambiance -- Victorian and quirky, imagine Ms. Havisham from the Great Expectations. If she had a tea room, it would look something like Lovejoy's... filled with lace, Victorian furniture,English tea pots, etc...

3.5 stars for the tea -- My friend and I both got the "high tea", so we tried each other's tea. One was the Tea Room Blend and the other one was the Royal blend. I prefer the Royal blend, because it was sweetier and fruitier. However, both types of tea go well with some milk and sugar. 

3 stars for food -- The sandwiches were pretty average, nothing amazing. The scone was amazing, especially with the raspberry preserve! 

Overall, a good experience for $25 (tax and tip). I'd probably come back for another birthday party or if I am ever in the mood for a girly tea party.
author: Cassy H.

description: Came here for the first time a couple weeks ago with a group of girlfriends (4 ppl) for a belated bday celebration. It was a lot of fun and I think everyone enjoyed themselves! I'd def recommend going for the Queen's Tea so you'll get a bit of everything. We all ordered the Queen's Tea, sausage rolls & a quiche. I'm not surprised that we finished everything!!! I want to try the Shepherd's Pie next time! :P I think the scone and spreads were my favorite part lol! I can't wait to come back!
author: Michelle L.

description:
When you think about high tea this place for sure meets what anyone would imagine. Walking in you immediately recignize the quant decor and style and the chintzy table ware. It gets you excited actually that you are really about to have a tea time... I'm a dude and I got slightly excited waiting for my wife and I to be seated. I wanted to try everything. Lol. The menu is vast it felt like. It being our first time having high tea we were slightly intumidated butnwoth coaching and underatanding of the menu it was quite simple... thanks waitress! The tea was good and different. Maybe because it was fresh loose leaf and new to us. We got the biggest food option, it was to feed 4, and it was more than enough. The food was okay. Standard finger foods but for the teas perfectly. The space was kind of small but still felt alright. The furniture matched the decor so it full immersed you in the experience.  Our waitress provided great service, but refill requests wained after a while. The returns to our table slowed down which felt like we were being hinted to leave. 

Overall I'd come back. A little pricey but in SF and for the type of experience you are seeking it matches the price. 

Reservations highly suggested!
author: Jay V.

description:
This place is SUPER CUTE... and i mean super. It's like walking into a someone's house there it's all decorated in an old fashion tea house style sorta way. You will need to make reservations here in advance.  My friends and i ended up sharing two orders of the High Tea for two.  Our sandwich selection included Chicken Apple Walnut sandwich, bay shrimp and mayo, cucumber and cream cheese, and smoked salmon.  I have to say, all their sandwiches, were a bit small, but still very tasty! My favorite sandwich will have to be the Chicken Apple Walnut sandwich.  If i didn't have to share, i swear i will get all the scones! They are served warm and it's so fluffy and buttery! Their tea selection here is huge.  It took us a long time to decided what we wanted. However, i'm not a fruit tea type of girl, but if you like that, you will love all the selections here

I highly recommend you making reservations there in advance.    They don't take walk ins on weekends
author: Belinda C.

description: We came here for a baby shower and it was great! I have a special diet that they helped and accommodated with, the food was delish, the tea was good and lots of variety, and just a great experience.
author: Marisela S.

description:
My sister took my mom and I here for tea for my birthday. It was awesome, cute, and delicious. We all had the Queen's Tea. This means that you get to select a tea flavor--and it's bottomless, you get to pick two types of sandwiches (each sandwich is cut into four cute little pieces), you get a layer of fruit, a scone, a crumpet and a petite four cake. 

They have a great selection of tea, I got the China Rose Petal tea--its a black tea, and taste good with a little sugar. It has a floral sweet taste YUMM. My mother got the Chestnut Tea-- black tea, it's rich in flavor and she had it with a little cream and sugar--similar to dessert :)  Lastly, my sister got the Black Lavender Jasmine Tea, this taste so good and smells amazing. We all had each others tea and were pretty hydrated by the end .

THE SCONE IS THE BEST, MAKE SURE IF ANYTHING, YOU GO HERE AND EAT A SCONE!

Also, their service is really good, they can answer all your questions and are so accommodating. If this is your first time, this is the place to go!!
author: Myra H.

description: Very cozy and charming. I only gave it four stars because they really ought to have more than one bathroom for the entire place. I waited for a while to use theirs.
author: Eve R.

description: I love this place!  The ambiance, the food, the people and the patrons.  My friends and I are always ready to visit Lovejoy's.  We make up excuses to get a group together, hats on heads.
author: Beatrix G.

description:
This is a very charming, lovely place to sit down and have a cup of tea. They can seat you as a walk-in, or you can make reservations for a specific table ahead of time. I got the light tea, which included a bottomless pot of tea of your choosing, two sandwiches of your choosing, and a warm scone with cream and preserves. The staff are very nice, the food and tea are lovely, and afterwards you can go across the street and browse their collection of antiques.
Overall, going here was a very enjoyable experience, surprisingly kid friendly, and we will definitely return on a later date.
author: Virgil W.

description:
I was very glad that I spent my first teatime at Lovejoy's Tearoom! The ambiance was nothing short of elegant. As you walk in, you are immediately approached by kind staff and seated accordingly wether you have a booking or you were lucky enough to get available seating. This place is great for groups ranging from younger children and the more elder. Do becareful of the lovely mismatched china sets! Not only is the extravagant Tearoom decked out with beautiful antiques, the bathroom is as well, (it really is a powder room.) The tea is of amazing quality, as well as the hors d'oeuvres and sweets. Although not cheap in price, you really pay for quality here :) I higly suggest this place and can't wait to come back again. I suggest you call ahead for reservations because it is quite popular , though that isn't a surprise !

Cheers!  Dani
author: Danika J.

description:
With access to this place, I could so totally forget that I have other things I have to get done and that carbs and sugar are the devil!  

Somehow, someway, time STOPS at Lovejoy's Tea Room and I live in a fragrant and comfy world where white flour and sugar and globs of butter and clotted cream dance merrily about with non-stop chatter and floral chitz and mean harm to no one.

Hypnotizing!
author: Adrienne A.

description:
This review for Lovejoy's Tea Room has been in my yelp! draft folder for quite sometime.  

High Afternoon Tea is a habit I acquired whilst on holiday in the UK; London, England specifically. When I returned, having high afternoon tea was the method my mates and I spent time together. We would go to the high street hotels for high afternoon tea. Places like the Stanford Court Hotel, Sir Francis Drake, St. Francis Westin Hotel, the Ritz Carlton, the King George Hotel, and Lovejoy's Tea Room. 

Lovejoy's Tea Room was one of the mate's find . . . it was a change and a less expensive option from the high street hotels. I was impressed by my mate's find to have another resource for high afternoon tea that was not in the high street. :-))) A very cute, charming, and quaint tea room. The cups, saucers, and plates are not the typical matching set, they do not match at all--yet they are coordinated.  The service is charming, our teapots were refilled. The sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets with butter, clotted cream--ooh la la!!!!

It has been awhile since we have been back to Lovejoy's Tea Room. The token male of our group, the husband of one of the girlfriends, decided to opt out. As far as he was concerned, we girls could carry on without him. 

Lovejoy's Tea Room is not the type of place to drop in for tea, a reservation is a must. A le must piece of advice from me.

It has been sometime since I have been to Lovejoy's Tea Room. Must make a "I shall return visit" since I am jonesing for high afternoon tea--Lovejoy's style a la UK.

Fresh Review #9 of 100 Yelps! for 2013.
author: Chiara A.

description: I made a reservation a month in advance for some high tea with my ladies. Unfortunately, they were unable to find my reservation, despite the fact that I received a confirmation. Nonetheless, they were still able to seat us. 3 of us ordered the high tea, and 1 of us ordered the Queen's tea. I had the black vanilla tea, which was pretty good. It had a subtle vanilla flavor. As for the sandwiches, I selected the chicken salad and the special that day, which was turkey and cranberry. The sandwiches were pretty tasty, but I especially liked the scone. Flaky but not too dry. I'm personally a big fan of high tea (although I learned that "afternoon tea" is the correct term). The decor is very cute, and I love their cute teapots and teacups.
author: Karen L.

description:
An out-of-town friend came to visit and I wanted to surprise her with a tea get-together, and she was simply blown away by the experience at Lovejoy's Tea Room. It is a magical place, with so much attention to details. Yes, it's filled with estrogen and who can blame a girl for gathering all of her friends around and having a decadent, "queen-worthy" tea experience while chatting about anything and everything in the world. 

The setting is superb, and the sandwiches and scones were tasty. My favorite is the smoked salmon and cream cheese - it's simple but filling. My favorite tea is Dragonwell - calming and light. The service, the food, the place all seek to  maximize your enjoyment of the a tea experience, while preserving, to a great degree, a certain pseudo-British charm that touts closeness and quirkiness rather than decadence and luxury. 

Next time you want to round up your best girl friends together, this is the place.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Tea party anyone?

Came in here feeling like a little girl again. The eclectic design brings back so many childhood memories. Since Crown and Crumpets was closed because they were relocating, this was the next best thing. 

We came in on a Sunday afternoon. There was no wait, although I did make a reservation. The place is a little cramped for me, but still worth it. 

We had the "Queen's tea" ($27). It included the following: choice of 2 sandwiches (turkey and shrimp sandwiches), spring salad, scone, crumpet, Petit four, and shortbread biscuit. 

My niece had the "Wee Tea" ($16) which included the following: cream cheese and jelly sandwich, scone, fresh fruit, Petit Four, tea/hot chocolate.

My sister's bf had the "Tea Sandwich Plate" ($13) which included salmon and cucumber sandwiches. He also had a side of large coffee.

Our total came about to $70-ish (pretty hefty, if you asked me).

My faves were the crumpet and the lemon curd spread.. yum!!! (i love anything lemony). At the end we were asked to choose 2 Petit four, which is basically a dessert. It's very small, but packed with sweetness. I wanted to eat all of them since they looked so pretty, but sadly only two had the pleasure of my taste buds.

Overall, great experience, but pricey! I would come here again with my girls.
author: Karla Marie D.

description: Been to majority of tea rooms in the Bay Area and I'll say this was my least favorite. Food and tea selections were blah.... atmosphere was old and dusty. BATH ROOM WAS SCARY. FOR SURE. Was really surprised that the prefix tea menu didn't include tea.... and they charged you extra just to share a pot.. I was confused. And refills were not free which they usually are. I also noticed this place was so over priced for what we got. At other tea rooms like English rose in Pleasanton and Tudor rose in Santa Rosa, you definitely get more food and it comes with tea so it's worth it. But here, what we got was so sparse. We won't be back.
author: Daisy S.

description:
I've finally found the best high tea room in San Francisco! Everything was lovely. I came here with a group of ladies today and received the special treatment of royalty.

We all ordered the queen's tea which consisted:

2 sandwiches of your choice, cole-slaw, greens, assortment of fruits, currant scones, crumpets, a petite four, a small white and brown cookie, your choice of a pot of tea and 3 spreads: lemon curd, raspberry-blackberry(?) jam and this amazing white clotted cream which tasted like a sweet butter.

 I decided on the salmon + cream cheese sandwich, as well as the bay shrimp + mayo. Both were delicious! The fruits had a wonderful selection, all the spreads were delightful, even the salad dressing was yummy. But what really stood out here was the freshly baked currant scones, OMG. These were amazing! Hands down the best scones I've ever had.  They were soft, flakey, buttery, moist and full of flavor. I wish they sold them in bags to go! I also decided on the strawberry tea which was a nice and refreshing taste. I really liked my friends China rose petal black tea though. Also, the interior of the tea room was gorgeous, really, a girl's dream. 

I just wish they had sugar cubes.
author: Laura T.

description:
Another perfect mother-daughter tea time. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/crown-and-crumpet-temporarily-closed-san-francisco#hrid:6FAE-J3uCt0c9lpTUeTBMQ)

I bought my mom a gift certificate for High Tea for Two (http://www.yelp.com/biz/lovejoys-attic-san-francisco#hrid:I-uCa9YzHcHbGTS7M9ewMA) but upon arrival, and after a quick peek at the menu, both my mom and I and our mother/daughter friends decided to go big with the Queen's Tea. 

*High Tea ($17.95; additional people $17/each): A bottomless pot of tea with choice of two sandwiches, coleslaw, spring greens, scones, preserves and devonshire cream, and a shortbread biscuit.

*Queen's Tea: ($24.95; additional people $24/each): Same as the High Tea but with the addition of fresh fruit, a crumpet with lemon curd, and a petit four. 

We each ordered a different tea so we could taste four different ones. I picked the Genmai Cha which I had taken a whiff of across the street at Lovejoy's Attic. It is a green tea with popcorn and rice in it. Yes, POPCORN and RICE. It sounds strange but it is now one of my new favorite teas. The popcorn and rice add a subtle nutty flavor. I also enjoyed a cup of both the apricot tea and a rose petal tea that two of my tea companions ordered. 

My mom and I ordered four different sandwich options to share. We got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, pear and stilton, chicken and asparagus and the special which was a turkey salad sandwich with cranberries and pecans. I like that both their High Tea and the Queen's Tea come with mixed greens with balsamic and coleslaw. Their coleslaw is light with the perfect amount of mayo and the surprising addition of caraway seeds. The fresh fruit included honeydew, orange and grapefruit slices, kiwi, strawberries and blackberries. 

Even though I was full after consuming the fruit, salad, coleslaw, sandwiches, and mass amounts of tea, I managed to make room for my scone (with currants) and crumpet. Both were delicious with the devonshire cream and lemon curd. I took my shortbread biscuit and petit four to go. They bring out the petit fours near the end of the tea service for each person to pick one. I chose a little hazelnut and chocolate cake which made for a delightful snack later that day. 

As if the wonderful tea and foods weren't enough, service was wonderful and the quirky mix-n-match furniture and table settings create the perfect ambiance for time spent with fabulous company.
author: Emily J.

description:
Cuteness and lace doilies explosion. When you enter this adorable space full of pink frills, tea hats, crumpets and everything inbetween, you will be feeling very "Hi, your majesty. May I pour you another glass?" This is British High Tea, done right. It's the perfect cutesy brunch, afternoon with the girls, little girl's birthday party, etc. etc.  

Share a bottomless pot of tea with your best girls for $9, +$2 per additional person to a single pot. Or opt for $19.95 High Tea service, including 2 tea sandwiches, a scone, coleslaw, and some other goodies. We ordered 2 tea services for 4 of us ladies (2 per single person serving) and were stuffed.

The sandwiches were delicate and delectable, my favorite being the Chicken Asparagus (surprisingly!) and the Cucumber & Cream Cheese! They have such great mixes of sandwiches, and many traditional ones with an interesting twist. The Roast Beef & Horseradish was also very tasty.

Scones were good, but standard. They have devonshire cream, and while I prefer clotted cream, this was also tasty with their jam. 

We tried the "Afternoon Darjeeling" for our tea and it was DELICIOUS. Highly recommend it!

Had a splended time here, and will definitely be back! 

Tip: while you wait, there's a cute store of tea-related accessories across the way "Lovejoy's Attic". Scout what you want, then have your tea, and go back, because at the end of tea they give you a nice 10-15% off coupon for the Attic store!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Came here with a large group for a bridal shower, we had a reservation and were seated promptly when we arrived.  It's a cute cozy and well decorated place.  My only complaint is that the menu had too much to choose from and the menu was like reading a two full page newsletter article.  After reading through the two pages and distinguishing the type of "package" they offer, you'd then need to decide on the choice of sandwiches and type of tea.  We ended all coupling with a gf and splitting a queens tea.  One item to highlight is the scone, it was fluffy, warm and served with a delicious preserve.  I would go back just for the scone.  The rest of the items were quite forgettable.  The queens tea came with a small pouch of tea leaves to take home, which was a nice touch.  Overall, i've been to other high tea places of same calibre with less fuss.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
My friends and I decided to go there for a weekend tea party, and OMG! This place is so lovely! There are so many vintage detailes all around the place and you will serve your tea/coffee in a beautiful floral cup. I loved the atmosphere there. You are not suppose to use your cellphone while you are there, but we used ours to take some photos. I like this kind of idea. You don't want to be there with someone who is always playing with the cellphone and makes you feel alone. You go there to have some tea, a light lunch/brunch and hangout with your friend.
We had three kinds of tea and all tasted and smelt wonderful. I hade the China Rose Petal tea and it was great!
Will definitely go there again.
author: Sahar J.

description:
I brought my British friend here (more like, forced him to teach me the ways of High Tea), and he was amused, to say the least, by the cutesy, lacey decor and the mismatched dishware. Let's just get over the fact that the decor is, well, a bit over the top, because the service and food are both excellent!

We ordered Queen's Tea for two: 
- Yorkshire Tea (amazing -- apparently quite difficult to find in the States, because I've been looking for this stuff ever since. Really, this is the only tea you'll ever need)
- Apricot Tea (paled in comparison to the Yorkshire tea)

- Chicken walnut salad sandwiches were delicious! Half white and half whole wheat bread, which is a nod to both tradition and current standards. Also had Branston Pickle Chutney and Cheese, which sounds strange, but is absolutely delicious! Would highly recommend those two sandwiches
- The salad and coleslaw was okay -- they were skimpy on the mandarins, and the Caraway Cream Dressing was oddly bitter? Mayonaisse-y? Not my favorite part of the meal.

- I learned, finally, how to eat scones properly. And have a proper scone. Which aren't the scones from Starbucks, or wherever you get them. These scones are large and studded with blueberries and are warm, not flaky, like you'd think a biscuit sort of thing should be, but are meant to be cut down the middle, like a bagel, and spread with Devon cream (which isn't normal butter -- it's thicker and whipped and DELICIOUS) and then preserves. Amazing! Absolutely delightful. I'll never have a Starbucks scone again. 

- Crumpets. Oh my god. I don't even know what to say about these. There aren't American corollaries, but think of a biscuit, but not flakey. In fact, holey. And warm. And delicious. And should be slathered with the butter and the lemon curd, while the crumpet is still warm. The butter will soak through the crumpet. And so will the lemon curd. It's worth upgrading from High Tea to Queen's Tea to try this sucker out. 

- Fruit was good, pretty fresh and ripe, well cut
- The tea biscuit (which is just a lil tea cookie) was a bit disappointing
- You get to choose a Petit Four from a platter of many, and they were quite delicious! 

Don't forget to make reservations, at least a week or two in advance! They fill up quite quickly, and it's worth the brunch out with a date or with friends.

Overall, worth the experience and quite authentic, according to my friend.
author: Courtney N.

description: Love this place and family tradition for different celebrations. I love sandwich selection, salad and dressing and scones. Clotted cream and lemon curd are the bomb. All comes together for a great experience and fun atmosphere. If you want to spend more money at big hotels for high tea then this place is not for you. It's a completely different experience and I appreciate the mismatch of china and funky interior. I always feel taken care of and when I come here it's usually for a special celebration: of friendship, girlfriends, coworkers or my husband on an afternoon date. I used to bring my daughters here after the ballet or symphony. Book ahead. I can't have caffeine and they have a good selection of non-caffeinated teas. Shop across the street is adorable and something for everyone.
author: Katrena M.

description:
I came here for a Baby Shower Tea Party and I do not think I could say enough of this place. Charming, adorable, cute, quirky are just a few ways to describe it. Reservations for larger parties are a must. We had a mixture of couches and chairs to sit on - let me say the couch is dangerous you sink into it and don't want to get out!

There is such a variety of tea's to try and they will happily bring out multiple flavors. I was in love with the white tea and there was an earl grey fruit mix I cant remember. Im not even an earl gray fan and i loved it.

As far as food - THEIR SCONES ARE LIFE CHANGING! and that clotted cream! OMG! It was the best scone I have had in my entire life, EVER. I wish i could have it daily. THe clotted cream and jam is the best touch to it. We were also given an awesome selection of sandwiches with the crusts cut off - tomato cheddar, smoked salmon, cucumber, asparagus and turkey, pesto and procutto - really great selection with different flavors. There were also a couple of side salads which were a nice addition. Very happy with it. There were also little tea biscuits on top of our tower. Very filling and delish!

The staff was really on point with their service. Attentive and even offering to go outside to take group pictures of us. 

So loved this place!!! Don't miss out on Lovejoy's attick across the street to pick up some of your own tea party essentials!
author: Lucy F.

description: Great service and atmosphere! You feel like having tea in London. The sandwiches are surprisedly yummy, I believe I had the ham with mustard.
author: vsa L.

description:
This was a unique and interesting thing to do on a Sunday morning...

We had their "High Tea" for 3 and everything was good - selections of tea, sandwiches, fresh fruit, salad, scones, petit cookies, crumpets and petit fours.  Amazingly enough we left very satisfied, but it wasn't an extremely heavy meal.

The ambiance is fun and quirky with a nod to the Victorian era...very cool spot.
author: Ken G.

description:
Definitely an ADORABLE girl date spot!
Love the decor & the costume/accessories you can put on just to get in the 'tea vibe' or take pictures.  
Also loved the huge list of tea to choose from - delicious.
author: Sylvia N.

description:
Kawaii! When you step into Lovejoy's, it's like a free pass to let your imagination go free. With the tea-time atmosphere, you can imagine you're in a Lolita Cafe in Japan. Or, you can imagine you're Alice in Wonderland, or having tea back at Grandma's, or even back a century ago, or...

Once you've taken all of that in, explore the menu. A myriad of sandwiches (which are small enough that if you choose a flavor you're not crazy about, there isn't too much to eat through anyway) and tea--go ahead and be adventurous. I love how at the end they walk by with the desserts so you get to see them all before you get to choose. Believe me, it's a difficult decision when you've got a whole bunch of cute sweets laid out in front of you!

The staff is also nice here. They were sympathetic when I was running late for my reservation and they made sure that the other members of my party who showed up on time got a little bit to eat before I got there!
author: Brittany L.

description:
I came back last week because I wanted to show my friend how cute this joint was and my experience this time revolved around the service.  The hostess was cheerful and sweet, and told us that seats were scarce, but if we came back in 15-20 minutes, we might catch a table because there was a cancellation.  We thought that was so kind of her, and then we come back in about 20 and she had a table all set up for us - cool, right?  Yeah, but as we're enjoying our time there, completed our order, got our dishes, and nibbled on our treats, she reminds us that we have to leave our table within an hour and a half because that is their policy.  

There were so many empty tables by this time, yet she was adamant that we leave within our time frame.  

I was also reminded that each customer has to have a $10 minimum, which kinda sucks because if you're coming here for just tea, you'll actually end up getting a lot more food than you have to.
author: Julie C.

description:
This place has charm and character and I love that I live nearby. The quaint little tea room was inviting and yesterday was the perfect gloomy rainy day to have high tea.  I dragged the hubs and he initially was wary because he thought it was going to be cutesy and pink like a little girls tea party but once we arrived he was relieved to see that it was not. We didn't have reservations and all tables were booked but they let us sit at a table that was reserved and the party wasn't arriving for awhile. 

We didn't go w/ the recommended teas but went with a black one that we thought sounded great. We ordered some finger sandwiches, some crumpets with lemon curd and a Pear & Stilton salad that was large enough for two to share. The finger sandwiches are tiny so if you are hungry make sure you order enough and order some of the other "Pub Fares".

I loved the decor. This place had the an old vintage antique shop feel with the mismatched tea pots/cups. They had ladies hats hung up on a dresser situated right smack in the middle of the tea room with a red British phone booth behind it. Service was quick and friendly.  I absolutely loved everything about Lovejoy.
author: Esther A.

description: I went to high tea with my friend on 7/14/16, and it is our first time there. In fact, their pastry and sandwiches are good! Except the strawberry on the top tier didn't look fresh, there was an insect came out when I picked up the half piece of strawberry, and I killed it on the spot on their tablecloth. It kinda freaked me out. Then, I told the lady and should check on their remaining strawberry for other orders. They only replaced the piece of strawberry afterwards. I thought at least they should have some kinds of service recovery for our table, but nothing. It gave me chill to just think about an insect on the fruit.
author: Miss S L.

description:
Being in Lovejoy's Tea Room is like being in your crazy Great Aunt Grace's kitchen.  She has a cozy home with tons of knick knacks and the like.  The kitchen, though.. oh boy, the kitchen.

It's not very clean, looks like a little bit of a disaster but the food is ALWAYS made with love.  So I hated that I had to knock off a star, but I was here yesterday and experienced awful food poisoning.  I started to feel hot, clammy and my stomach was talking to me.  Let's just say Pepto was my new best friend.  It's too bad because the Coconut tea, salmon & cream cheese tea sandwich, tea biscuits and raspberry petit four were all delicious.  

The service is very good and this is such a cute place for gatherings.  I also adore the store across the street with tons of cute items for purchase.  Their Chestnut and Coconut teas are divine.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
They took very good care of us here. The teas were decent, and the sandwiches, scones and salad were tasty too! My favorite was the egg salad followed closely by the cucumber (a classic).

My friend OD'd on clotted cream and who could blame her. It's hard not to love butter with the consistency of whipped cream! 

The only minor complaints with this place is:
1) It's TINY and they cram too many tables into it. People had to squeeze by, and whenever anyone in our party had to use the ladies room, everyone had to get up and shift around. 
2) Since they're so strict with their tea times, everyone felt like they were constantly watching the clock to make sure we didn't go over time. It didn't bode well for a relaxing Sunday tea. 

My strong preference is DarTeaLing in SOMA, but if you're in Noe, this will do.
author: Shachi B.

description: What a cute little place, we did have a lot of joy at the places. As other reviews mentioned, the scones are to die for, we kept ordering more :) and the cucumber sandwiches- we got addicted and have been making them at home ever since. And most importantly, they have really good teas. An evening well spent :)
author: Aanchal J.

description: Lovejoy's is a delightful and romantic place for Afternoon High Tea. The Queen's Tea is my all-time favorite. You have a choice of two tea sandwich selections: LOVE the delish Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese / Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise sandwiches served with coleslaw, organic spring greens, a scone, a crumpet, fresh fruit, a petit four and shortbread tea biscuit.  The tea room decor is quirky and whimsical filled with mismatched tea cups, saucers and teapots . Excellent attentive servers.  I highly recommend this "hidden gem" for high tea located in Noe Valley.
author: Susie L.

description:
Absolutely incredible experience. Super relaxing and enjoyable. The food filled us up. We tried the chocolate truffle tea and the passion fruit black tea. Both amazing. 

The sandwiches are great. The scones to die for. 

Drop what you're doing, and come before 5!  =)
author: Daniel G.

description:
"Can I offer you a cup of tea, love?"

My toes curl (in a good way) when I hear that phrase.  It takes me back to visits with family and friends in England, where tea seems to be on offer as a symbol of hospitality, conviviality and friendship.

It's fitting then that Lovejoy's is all of those things.  It's the perfect cozy little tea house to meet and celebrate with a friend, with doilies, mismatched china, and that feeling that you are visiting your aunty's flat in Notting Hill which she hasn't updated in over a quarter of a century.

Food consists of all the traditional fare with some edits: tea and finger sandwiches, crumpets with lemon curd and cream, fruit, herb salad with balsamic dressing, and for a splurge, petite fours.   It's a generous tea offering at the price, and your guest (mom, grandma or little girl) will leave full and happy.

I hosted a baby shower here too for a good friend, and Lovejoy's is a great spot for special events.  Reasonable compared to a hotel tea (like Sheraton Palace Garden Court) and quirky, local and fun to boot.  We had a reader Lovejoy's recommended come to read our tea leaves, as a bit of a laugh, which was a blast to be sure, but many left brained ladies were thinking how eerily accurate those "fun" readings turned out to be.

All in all, Lovejoy's is a great spot to sink into a Victorian couch,  nibble on sandwiches and enjoy some tea and company.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Afternoon tea is one of my favorite pastimes, especially when visiting another city. San Francisco, in particular, seemed like a wonderful place to explore this little touristic tradition of mine.

I was initially torn between Lovejoy's and The Rotunda, but now having visited both I am glad that I chose Lovejoy's. The two venues are complete polar opposites, so if you prefer something more cozy and low key, then LoveJoy's is for you.

I arrived early afternoon on a Thursday, having made a reservation in advance.

The ambiance of Lovejoy's is very quaint and shabby chic, which I enjoyed. The service was impeccable; very fast, very courteous, and they really take an interest in your preferences so that they can make appropriate menu recommendations.

For my High Tea I sampled:

- Apricot tea with a shortbread tea biscuit

- Two sandwiches: turkey with cranberry mustard and arugula, and hard boiled egg with onion and caper dressing. Both very tasty and neither too dry nor over-dressed. A little coleslaw and salad on the side.

- Scone with preserves and devon cream

I spent a good two hours just lazing about, and they kindly topped off my tea pot several times and took great pains to ensure that my tea wouldn't over-steep.

The best part of all? The whole thing was only $25, even after a 20% tip.

The worst part? Hard to identify one, but I will say that I found the tray of petit four a bit ambitiously priced at $2.50/each.
author: Lisa T.

description: Cute, quirky little tea shop. Great scones and clotted cream. They give you very little cream if you're used to proper british tea, so I'd always have to ask for extra portions. Nice selection of team, and great ambience for chatting and catching up with friends on a weekend afternoon.
author: Hua W.

description: Fantastic place.  Recommend it, no hesitation.  All the details are perfect.
author: Abigail J. M. M.

description:
This place is adorable! They have super cute teacups and random decor. It's a very homey feeling, with non-matching tea sets and lace tablecloths. 

I got the Queen's tea for 2 and it was plenty! Each set comes with its bottomless pot of tea, scone, salad, slaw, 2 sandwiches, crumpets, fruit, and a petit four. So much food! 

Tea: I got a black tea, which was very delicious and I got the white peach tea, which was fruity but not very strong. Highly recommend both of these. They are so awesome to give you strainers so you dont get the leaves in your cup.

Sandwiches: So cute and yummy! Salmon and cream cheese one was the best by far! Chicken salad one was also good. Pear and stilton one was not my favorite bc the stilton cheese (blue cheese) was too smelly. yuck

Scone: This was absolutely the BEST SCONE ever. Ive never eaten such a good scone. You'd think scones are dry and cold, but this one was warm, flakey and buttery, like a biscuit. Tastes super good with the lemon curd, devon cream and preserves.

Crumpets: To be honest, I dont know what this was, but I ate it anyways. Its not as good as the scone. It feels like a english muffin mochi. haha

Fruit: Just a variety of sliced fruits, from strawberries, blackberry, honeydew, orange, grapefruit

Petit Four: You can choose 1 out of their tray of desserts. A lot of them were marzipan ones, and there is also truffle and sugar cookie. Not a fan of marizpan. 

Salad and Slaw: Salad is regular salad with balsamic dressing and slaw was yummy 

Overall a very cute and fun experience with your girlfriends to dress up and chat. I would definitely be recommending this to my friends for birthday, wedding showers, etc. I had a really good time here, its so friggin cute!
author: Carmen C.

description:
I LOVE Lovejoys! 

A charming spot for a celebration with (girl)friends (and/or men who are comfortable with an abundance of femininity) ~ i.e. plenty of floral patterns, pinks and lace. 

My friend's baby shower brought me here and we had a lovely time. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the food and tea were a delight! As a group, we enjoyed the High Tea (++ selection) of assorted non-crust finger sandwiches, petite shortbread cookies, organic spring greens with Mandarin oranges, and scones with Devon cream + preserves (which I enjoyed the most). I can't remember the names of the teas we had, but they were all pleasant. The sandwiches are classic, on regular (white/wheat) crustless bread with fillings such as egg salad, cucumber + cream cheese, hummus, ham-tomato, etc.)

Tip 1: You can view their sample menu online: http://www.lovejoystearoom.com/Menu/menu.html

Tip 2: Single bathroom, plan ahead.

Tip 3: Reservations highly recommended.

Tip 4: High Tea food tends to be on the lighter spectrum. Don't expect to feed a Hungry Man.

Tip 5: Extended pinkies not required, this is an all occasion place. Good for dressing up or keeping it casual.
author: Cathy K.

description:
Lovejoy's is a charming tea room that everyone should take the opportunity to enjoy at least once. The mixed assortment of tea pots, plates, chairs, and tablecloths makes you smile. 

A group of elderly women sat prim and proper to the left of our table.  It was adorable and heart warming! i imagine they gather at Lovejoy's regularly to catch up over scones and pots of fragrant teas. Children and families fit right in too. Make reservations in advance! I think this is especially important around the holidays.

Super affordable in comparison to the Garden Court or The Rotunda. I'd compare it to Crown and Crumpets, minus all the pink.

An additional pointer... those little cute petit fours that come around on their silver trays are NOT complimentary ;)
author: Samantha L.

description:
Visited here for a bridal shower and I think we did the high tea service, which was pretty standard, food-wise. I liked the scones with devonshire cream and preserves, and all of the sandwiches were good as well -- my favorites were the bay shrimp and mayo, and the egg salad. Since the high tea didn't include sweets, we'd brought our own mini cupcakes -- they have a $1 cake cutting fee per person, but no cupcake fee, so yay for that.

The atmosphere, in my opinion, was just okay. The decor was sort of standard old-person's room, complete with sort of creepy photos. They were VERY crowded the whole time we were there (though I guess that's just a good sign for the place). It seemed like a lot of other bridal shower or similar event groups, and since the first "seating" all showed up at the same time, there was a bit of a traffic jam both at the beginning and end of our visit. We were crammed into pretty tight quarters, with very little room for our seats, as well as on the table -- we had to constantly move things around to find places to put everything, and it was almost impossible to do anything without elbowing people from my group on either side. They even had to basically rush us and kick us out at the end, which I suppose is necessary -- at least they were very nice about it. Still, would have been nice to have a bit more breathing room, both physically and temporally!
author: Shing H.

description:
I came here today for my birthday!! :D

Outside of Lovejoy's is the world of chaos (loosing cellphones, bus passes, your mind, and then getting locked out of your house)! My week was a totally mess! Day after day things didn't seem to get any better. I wonder what's going to happen to me tomorrow. Like my day can get any worse...

Soon the chaos is temporarily forgotten. Inside Lovejoy's is peace, laughter, cuteness, yummy foods, and delicious teas!

High tea for two: $34.00
- warm scones with raisins
- devonshire cream and strawberry jam
- shortbread cookies
- organic salad with vinaigrette dressing
- coleslaw with caraway seeds?
- choice of 4 sandwiches (16 quarter triangles)
 * pear & stilton cheese
 * chicken apple walnut
 * prosciutto & pesto (lovejoy special)
 * albacore tuna & capers (lovejoy special) 
- apricot tea
- pomegranate & green tea

Saturday, 12:30pm reservations: this place was packed with baby showers, bridal showers, friends getting together, etc. Our table wasn't ready so we walked across the street to the gift shop of Lovejoy's! And when our table was ready, Lovejoy's Tea Room called the store to let us know that we could walk back! haha

Tea time: I'd recommend coming with at least 3 people for a bigger table and more teas to try at once!! With our high tea, we were barely able to fit 2 pots of tea, a tray of sandwiches and salads and our tea cups and salad plates on our small round table and tiny side table. =\ Expect to be here for a good solid 2 hours. And after drinking all that wonderful tea, make sure to make use of the restroom before you leave!

Parking: we were able to find street parking around Clipper & Church.

Go Green: taken the J line
author: CeCe C.

description:
Oh how I love tea and scones.

I made a reservation for five at 1:30 p.m. about two days in advance; two arrived on time, and like proper ladies, the rest of us arrived around 15-20 minutes late. Lovejoy's is really the spitting image of grandma's place, only blown up and with more tables.

Our server was dressed to impress in an old school peasant dress and greeted us with a warm smile. The menus were just printed on paper, but whatever, we were sitting on floral couches and little chairs for chrissakes. Paper menus are perfect.

What we ordered: high tea for two ($34), cream tea ($12.95), and savory tea ($13.95). Each order came with a pot of unlimited tea, which was amazing. The tea cups, pot, plates and whatnot were impossibly fitting; matching tea sets with some mismatched but homey utensils. A couple tea stains here and there, but there's no complaining from me! 

I had the Dragon Well tea (green tea), but I also tried their Yorkshire Gold (black), China Rose Petal (black flavored - it's sweet!) and Darjeeling (black). They basically give you your pots of hot water and the leaves, and instruct you briefly on what to do, aka steeping it for a minute. Oh, and of course there's milk and sugar on the table.

Oh gosh, such good tea! The China Rose Petal turned out to be my favorite of the day, and don't even get me started on the scones with lemon curd and devon cream.... An absolute must try.

The sandwiches were light, cute, and oh-so yummy. We decided to get the cucumber and cream cheese (I don't really recommend it... You can make it yourself, but it's cute...) and their daily special, some sort of curry-like sandwich - which blew my mind. I wish I knew what the name of it was now. 
If you eat a lot, perhaps you should get your own order of sandwiches. 

The store's right across the street, and I've already promptly bought a jar of their lemon curd. 

Keep in mind:
 It's $1 to share your tea.
And calling in to reserve seats never hurt anyone.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Finally came here for brunch and the experience is really amazing.  I sampled the high tea set, which pretty much comes with everything.  I am not a huge fan of tea sandwiches, the ones here are good but nothing great.  I sampled both black and rooibos tea, both are delicious, although I prefer the rooibos.  Black tea just tasted like black tea?  The ornaments and decorations are cute and pretty.  I got to say it was a bit too cramped inside, I understand there's not a lot of space in SF, but I was expecting more white table clothes and white everything.  This tea room is really laid back and cozy.  

My favorite are the scones, these suckers are absolutely delicious!  Reminds me more of a buttery biscuit, but it has the perfect texture.  Slap on some of their famous marionberry jam and extra butter, you are in heaven!  The crumpets are also really good, crispy outside with a soft chewy inside.  If you order anything from Lovejoy's, get the Scone and Crumpet!  They constantly refill your tea, and you have about 2 hrs to chit chat..but really how much tea can your bladder hold?  For dessert you get to choose a marzipan chocolate, if you like marzipan you will lose these, otherwise it will be really sweet for you.

You definitely need to make reservations here, we got lucky and came 30min before they open.  We got lucky and got the only non-reserved table left.  There was a line even before they opened doors!  Scone and Crumpets are delicious, I highly recommend sampling them!
author: Terence N.

description: This place is so so cute, I came here with 2 of my girlfriends and we all enjoy and had a great time. We had the high and Queen tea, both 2 tea pots and a variety of finger sandwiches, fruits and some pastries. Is cute and is pretty expensive. It was a cute experience recommend people to host their bachelorette /bridal party here.
author: Yuri Y.

description:
Over the river and through the woods, to Grandmother's house we go... 

Lovejoy's reminds me of someone's grandmother's house - mismatched china sets,  eclectic decor, and endless charm.  

Came here to celebrate with the bridesmaids and bride and we were welcomed with amazing service and some of the most delicious scones and cookies!  We got the Queen's Tea, but if you're not hungry, I suggest the smaller tea service options.  Definitely get the egg and chives sandwich - one of the best on the menu. AND they have gluten free bread. 

Call and make a reservation. Tables are reserved for 2 hours.  Prices on menu are per person. 

Can't wait to go back and celebrate another joyous occasion!
author: Lisa L.

description: Oh, oh, oh -- what a treat! We had a graduation celebration with 17 guests at Lovejoy's today, and the service was impeccable. A delightful woman named Cassie was our waitress, and she made sure we had everything we needed. And the tea -- and the food!! I can't praise Lovejoy's enough. The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, salads, tea biscuits, and shepherd's pie we had today were delightful and paired nicely with Lovejoy's popular teas. If you haven't visited this San Francisco gem for a Queen's Tea yet, I recommend that you make a reservation today. Five stars all the way! I wish I could give six!!
author: Alicia N.

description: The atmosphere of Lovejoy's is a delight! The scones are amazing and even taste great after you freeze and reheat them in the oven. I have only tried the English Breakfast but have heard that the Tea Room Blend is also very good. If you are a tea lover then you must visit Lovejoy's!
author: Janani G.

description:
This place is my most absolutely favorite tea room to go to in San Francisco. It has been a tradition for my mother and I to come celebrate her birthday, Christmas, and now Mother's Day. 

Every tea reservation I have made has been fairly easy and convenient. The staff calls you a couple of days to a week prior to your reservation to make sure that the date and time is correct and confirmed. That is a huge plus for me since I tend to have a very busy schedule. 

The ambiance is very lovely with classic antique pieces such as clocks, paintings, and different tea sets to inspire the theme of the tea room. Some tables will have signs that state "Reserved for the Queens" or "Reserved for Royalty" 

My mother and I usually get the Queen's Tea which include two types of finger sandwiches of your choice, two salads, fruit, and your choice of tea. But, my most favorite thing to get is the scones. I have never liked scones until I ate them here. I prefer to eat scones only here because of the quality in taste. Buttery and Most. They dont' fall apart or have that extra glaze icing that turns the scones too sweet. 

The tea room has a store across the street where you can shop and purchase some of the food products that they make. 

Personally, I will continue to keep coming here and bring some of my close friends and family to enjoy a wonderful and memorable experience at Lovejoy's Tea Room. 

**Please make sure to book reservations way in advanced. They are super busy around the holidays. And, this place is not just made for women, but for males as well. So guys, don't be shy. Treat your lady out for tea once in a while**
author: Anastasia A.

description: I adore Lovejoy's. After putting off a visit for months ( I don't have any super girly friends in the Bay yet) I finally took a friend visiting me from PA for a little taste of England (without the rain). We had a great time and the tea service was the next best thing to the real deal. Petit fours were fantastic - I had the lemon, and could have eaten 10 more. The clotted cream and jam were delicious too, and the black tea was perfect. 10/10 will come again.
author: Lindsey P.

description:
I went there with a former co-worker and good friend from England that is touring the Bay Area. We met on Friday which was also my Birthday. We had a proper High Tea for 2 at 4. 

The food selections were simply marvelous. The scones were pure heaven and the crumpets just as good. My friend selected 2 sandwiches (classic cucumber and classic salmon) and I selected 2 sandwiches (savory chutney & cheddar and a lovely stilton & pear). I was saying mmmmmmm so many times!! We took a very long time to nibble and chat and eat. I did try to make room for the petit fours that were totally unexpected. I chose the lemon!

I do wish there were finger bowls to dip and cloth napkins as well, yet the experience was DREAMY!

Just near my seat was a lovely little book of birthdays so I read mine, and she read hers. Great fun!

The decor was fabulous and the little touches were just dreamy.
I do love the selection of hats to choose from while we experienced the joys of Love Joys!

I've been there before and will assuredly return.

p.s. The SCONES ARE AMAZING!!!!
author: Rick L.

description:
Its about time I should probably write this review...

Love joy is pretty great, and i love the brunch here. Go order the combos of Queens tea(for 2-3 people) and you will get why....They have a combo of sweet and savory delights which will make everything perfect on a sunday brunch. The only think id have to advice is to make a reservation. Otherwise, youd have to wait for an hour before getting inside. But then again, isnt that always the case with restaurants in SF?
author: Cavin T.

description:
Magical . 
The staff is exactly what a SF interpretation of an English tea parlor should be. The service friendly, attentive and professional. 
Tea sandwiches perfect. I have been here twice in a month . Love it .
author: Rose M.

description: you need to make a reservation pretty far ahead but everything about this place is SO CUTE and SO QUAINT. We got the high tea with mango black tea. The sandwiches and pastries were delicious! I would do five stars but the tea could be better.
author: Shelly M.

description:
My friend had been wanting to take me here for a while now.  Finally got to go here last month.

Lived up to expectations.  It was not easy to get a reservations but we were seated fairly promptly.  Really enjoyed the scones -- sandwiches were a little "too English" :)

Could not give it 5 stars because I thought that it was expensive for what was being served.  Going to try it again and will adjust my rating if necessary.
author: Judd J.

description:
I'll start with the ambiance. This place is very quaint, original, old Victorian. 5 stars for making me feel like I'm in old England. Mix matched furniature, tea saucers, cups, and teapots, lace table cloths, victorian floral couches, vintage bookshelves, chairs, and vanities. This all adds to the unique style that is Lovejoy's. I would say more velvet would be nice, but that's just me... 

The menu. 5 stars for being super delicious & beautifully arranged every single time I come here. I always get the Queen's Tea, which includes three tiers of fanciful goodies. The top tier has a varity of fruit, including grapes, pineapple, strawberry, kiwi, and orange. The middle tier has scones, double devonshire cream, strawberry jam, and lemon curd plus two cookies. The bottom tier has tea sandwiches of your choice (you pick two kinds), coldslaw, mixed greens with arugala, and their house vinegarette, which is pretty creamy & tangy. I usually always order the salmon and cream cheese, and either the stilton pear and cream cheese or roast beef and horseradish tea sandwiches! So delicious & flavorful. 

Let's not forget your choice of tea, which you will get with sugar and milk, all served in an assortment of fun, floral dishware & a huge teapot. I opt for black tea, preferably what is known as the "Champagne of all teas," which they call Afternoon Darjeeling here at Lovejoy's. In my opinion, it is one of the more sophisticated teas that exist, and it is amazingly smooth, and just feels good going down (get your mind out the gutter lil' nasty). Afternoon Darjeeling tastes like assam tea and oolong tea mixed together, but it is a thin-bodied, hence the smooth sailing down the piehole... It tastes like a vacation! They do have a large variety of fun herbal teas, black, white, and green teas. I have tried a variety of their teas. Wish I reviewed them back then. Sorry guys! But the rose black tea is also awesome.

Service: the servers are always very nice, not extra nice, but they serve you right. Sometimes it is very busy, and they don't have time to charm you because, well, the tearoom itself can entertain you and the company of your choice should entertain you. They do get 5 stars for service. They keep everything short and sweet! Your will arrive at your table "reserved for rotalty" with a pretty plate of hot crumpets and butter during the middle of your meal. This is when you drop whatever you have in your hand, pick up your butter knife, thereupon smearing your butter over your nice hot crumpet and enjoy while it's fresh and hot. Oh, believe me, it's worth getting enthusiastic about. It's like if Lana del Ray arrived at your door at night offering to sing you some lullabies. That exciting!!!! Notice she's my current and always and forever crush. Anyway, you can of course devour that wonderous duo of crumpet and butter alone or savor it with a bit of lemon curd or strawberry jam. You're royalty when you're here, so you can do as you well damn please ;) You will also get a petite four at the end of you're meal. They usually have the option of strawberry, white wedding cake (my fav), esspresso, rice crispy treat, chocolate and apricot, among others I forget at the moment. 

Come to this lovely little tea room, you'll notice your pinky will automatically go up as you drink your cup of tea. It's not a mystery, it will just happen. Don't question it. Enjoy!
author: Amethyst Popkiss A.

description:
This review is for Lovejoy's catering services:
I am having my first baby and my mom and aunts decided they would like to throw me a baby shower.  I live in SF, but they live in and around Washington, D.C.  I thought it would be much easier if I planned it, and I am SO HAPPY I found Lovejoy's on Yelp!  I knew nothing about tea parties and had actually never been to a tea before, but I liked the vibe and style of Lovejoy's: playful, mismatched cups and plates (I didn't know this was a "thing":), and very true to a British tea experience.  I would have been hesitant to do a tea like one that is done at a more expensive, stiffer place like the Ritz, for example. 
This was right up my alley and everything from the communication to the planning, pricing, setup, event itself and returning the dishware went very smoothly.  
Communication:  When I inquired about a month prior to the shower (I was lucky they were available, I'd recommend planning sooner), Gillian followed up in a timely manner and gave me her email so we could more easily communicate specific items my mom and I wanted. We had several questions and Gillian answered each one thoughtfully and thoroughly.  When the date got closer, she had Nicola, the onsite staff who would set up our tea and food, contact us about logistics.  
Planning: It was slightly tricky because I was the main point of contact until my mom was able to join in on the email communication, and she wanted quite a bit more food than I thought we needed, and she had the foresight to ask more questions about dishware, setup, cleanup than I did!  That was fine and Gillian adjusted quotes as we went and had no problem with the multiple changes we made.
Pricing:  Everything was VERY reasonable, and  though I did not look into other places, I'd have a hard time imagining that other catered tea lunches providing the same level of service and quality of food and tea would be this inexpensive.  We had 20 guests and we rented ALL of the dishware and flatware AND we had the caterer setup for an hour and pick up the items the next day.  
Setup:  Nicola arrived a little over an hour before the event, explained what everything was and how to serve the tea and crumpets with simple, yet specific instructions.  Everything looked beautiful!
The Baby Shower:  So many people commented on how delicious the food was, from the sandwiches to the scones (even the gluten free ones for our wheat intolerant guests!), truffles, petit fours, salad and dressing, to the fresh fruit!  We had the event in a 2 bedroom suite at the Ritz Carlton Club and Residences where my parents were staying during their SF visit, and many people said they assumed it was a Ritz Tea.  The quality and presentation were both top rate.
I had a such a great experience that a few of my girlfriends and I from the shower plan to go to the tearoom for a lunch date.  Thank you Lovejoy's, my baby shower was wonderful and you played such a big part!
author: Spice O.

description:
There is nothing I would love more than to write a positive review about Lovejoy.  Unfortunately, the only way to make reservations is to call them; well, called and called I have, no matter what keep getting voicemail.  Leave voicemail and no call back.  So call again, leave another voicemail.  

And, another voicemail ignored.

Not sure if these folks just service a few Noe Valley elders every weekend and therefore cannot accept other reservations, or what.  

I dunno.  I want to go a place that actually wants my business.  I've never had to work so hard to give my money to someone.
author: Michael D.

description:
This was my location of choice for my birthday last November, 2013. Serving tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, along with lemon curd and devon cream - Lovejoy's is the most authentic British tea room in the city! 

We were so impressed with their menu and atmosphere that we hired Lovejoy's to Cater our recent Vintage Afternoon Tea themed wedding (Sept 2014). Our wedding was a memorable event - full of smiles, joy, and happiness. Lovejoy's presentation was fantastic and their contribution was far above expectations. Gillian & Amanda from Lovejoy's assisted in all aspects of the event, including set up (which was admittedly a bit chaotic). Everything went smoothly and our guests enjoyed themselves immensely. I cannot possibly imagine pulling it off without their hard work, organization and event skills. 

The food was also amazing (of course). The sandwiches were all fresh and delicious and I heard so many compliments on the scones. I have no doubt they have a number of new fans singing their praises.

We definitely plan on being back.
author: Nina E.

description:
Great spot for afternoon tea with the girlfriends if you're in the Noe Valley/ Mission area. Portions are generous compared to other tea rooms.

Tip: Call a few days - a week in advance to make reservations.  This place books up fast!
author: Grace C.

description:
It is grandma's attic, but somehow, it still surprises me to see so many mother daughter combos. I've come here a couple times because the feminine overtones are toned down in comparison to places like Crown & Crumpet.

Service here is generally nice, but I noticed the underbelly of a commercial operation the last time I stopped in. I heard an older woman, who looked to be a manager, telling staff something like, "Only an hour per table." Someone came over and up-sold me a dessert on top of the "Light Tea" I ordered.

Then a staffer asked that I get off my cell phone, which I suppose would have made sense if it was a quiet day. But it wasn't. And I hate people on cell phones pretty much everywhere, so I understood, but it happened to be my birthday and I was sitting alone, so a friend called to take pity on me. I told the waitress, and she gave me a free dessert with a candle. *And* they took off from my bill the dessert they hocked. So, good on them for trying to right the situation.

This place tends to book reservations a week in advance, so call early. Having said that, I came in on a weekday without notice and they sat me immediately. The food is overpriced but delicious. The tea is fabulous. I don't ever feel rushed, even if I get the sense they might be rushing.
author: David S.

description: They have a good variety on their tea and sandwiches selection. I like their crumpets! Great interior design.
author: Ange G.

description: Go 20 minutes early before they open or wait 2.5 hours seems like the normal rule of thumb. A bit over the top on the inside but the teas are good and the hazelnut one I had was SUPER STRONG. The service is very friendly and helpful. We also just got the high tea breakfast and the coleslaw was very good and you can't go wrong with any selection of sandwiches. The scones are very fresh and good and I should have just ordered more while I was there.
author: Lily P.

description:
First time at Lovejoys, with a party of 8, and I was curious to see why this place is booked so much.  The decor is nice, the teas seemed good, the food was ok, although the scones with devon cream were really wonderful.  I had to give this two stars because of the following: 

-My group felt like we were being pushed to finish up before closing time.  We were told we could take our time at first, but later the waitress invited us to take our picture outside of the restaurant, but it seemed more of a way to get us to pick up our things and leave.  At other tea places they have left us alone until we were ready.  Don't expect to hang out too much past closing.

-I came home to open the to-go box of leftover sandwiches, and when I opened it I find a damp dirty napkin on top of the sandwiches for some reason, along with a crumpled receipt that did not belong to our table. Very dissapointing to say the least, I had to throw the box away. 

I've had a better experience at a previous tea room, I think I'll just go back there...
author: Patty S.

description:
OMG!  lovejoy's was AMAZING!  AMAZING!

i went on a friday around 2pm and it was packed.  they sent us across the street to their little boutique and called us in about half an hour.  watch out for the boutique.  it's over priced and everything is adorable.

i went w/ one other person.  we both had the queen's tea.  she had the turkey and roast beef sandwiches and i had the roast beef and egg salad.  she was luke warm about the turkey but LET ME tell YOU! the roast beef sandwiches and egg salad sandwiches could not be beat.  i'm SUPER fussy about egg salad but something told me it was gonna be good and something did not lie.  the queens tea also came with this amazing, tangy slaw.  i always hate slaw b/c it's hardly ever perfect but this was far beyond.  there was also a green salad, fruit, cookie, crumpet & scone (as if a crumpet or a scone isn't enough.)  at the end there was a petite fore, i could only eat half of the little thing.  i was just stuffed.  i had it with the house tea which was amazing.  oh, and they served clotted cream (which is like butter...but better) with the crumpet.

when i left i had a food coma.  from there the food coma turned into a food hang over.  it was decadent.  it's kind of funny b/c you don't really see men in there.  i don't know why that is.  but you know what?  good! more for us ladies.  you're not manly enough for lovejoy's tea, you don't get any.

it's a really nice thing to do for a special occasion.  the service was great, the food was delicious, the atmosphere was just right.  it was a food experience.
author: lori s.

description:
As fantastic as it ever is! 

I've been going to Lovejoy's for almost five years. It is one of the few experiences in SF that I can not do enough. Every time I go I feel like I'm experiencing it as a new person all over again. The quality is top notch and never wavers. In all this time I have never had the women at Lovejoy's make a mistake. The baked goods are always fresh and yummy, the sandwiches are always perfectly cut (never crushed!) and ultra flavorful.

The decor might seem a bit kitschy to some, but I feel like they do it in the best way. The decor becomes part of the experience and in that way it becomes special. 

I also LOVE how they make even the guys feel comfortable here. Over the years I've watched more and more men show up (both with their girl and boyfriends!) 

And the fact that they do their best to accommodate requests is awesome. 

Go here! You won't be disappointed!

PRO TIP: Get two more sandwiches then you think you want, trust me, for $2.5 each to add to a high tea, you're getting a bunch more food and the opportunity to try more!
author: Cori N.

description: This is a super cute spot for a ladies lunch date! The sandwiches and tea were both superb, and the interior of the place is shabby-chic-vintage! Very girly :) I would recommend having a reservation, as the wait times can be quite long without one.
author: mary g.

description: We didn't make a reservation and was told we had to wait over 2 hours. but luckily for some reason we got a table after 30 minutes of wait. I would suggest that if you plan to pay this place a visit especially in the summer to make a reservation. If not you might as well make other plans or wait around a hour or so. We got The Queens tea with smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches and the daily special mango and ham sandwich with the blendroom tea and peach green tea.  Perfect  this place is perfect for catching up with old friends and especially my sisters.
author: Amy L.

description: Tried Queens Tea for 2 for my moms birthday & it was like living royally! The scones are too die for (especially paired with the Devon's cream) & the orange petit four (bittersweet chocolate with orange & marzipan) was the perfect set treat to end on. Would definitely recommend for small parties or tea for 2 W/ grandma or daughter :) the service is great & has a very homey feel - though you're not out of place when you dress up. Definitely coming back.
author: Katherine H.

description: I'm from the Silicon Valley, where we have Lisa's Tea Treasures, so I thought it'd be fun to check out what sorts of high tea shops San Francisco has! Be warned: you MUST make a reservation no matter what. I I arrived here at 10:50 A.M. for my 11 A.M. reservation, and there was already a long line of other folks who had made reservations. After we were all seated in the crowded shop, there was hardly any room left for non-reservation customers to see if they could squeeze in a spot. The ambiance here is very artsy and hipster, with a touch of Victorian (typical San Franciscan artsiness), and the staff is super friendly and nice!!! However, the quality of the food and tea was what disappoints me about this place. The sandwiches had too much mayonnaise in them, and the desserts were far too sweet for my liking. The teas were bland and stale, but the scones were top notch!! Additionally, I like how they serve their food on the tiered plates, which Lisa'a Tea Treasures does not do. I'm sad to give this place 3 stars, because I really want to give it a higher rating, but the food and teas fell short of my expectations :( still a very lovely place!!!
author: Taehyun P.

description:
This place is simply adorable! I came here for a bridal shower, and it was perfect. They serve these little finger-food sized sandwiches on a 3 or 4 level tower. There are 5-6 different types. I think everyone's favorite was the roast beef and horseradish although they were all good - egg salad, ham, cheese, asparagus, all kinds of good stuff.

Their English Breakfast tea was fantastic. We also had some mango tea (my favorite) and chestnut. I was wary of the chestnut at first, but that was pretty decent as well. Had a great time here.
author: Jenn C.

description: Had tea for my birthday and it was perfect!  Love the kitchy feel of the team room. Food and tea were delicious.
author: Gina D.

description:
My friends and I have been planning to come to Lovejoy's for a year now. However, every time we made a reservation, we always had to cancel it. 

This time, we came for our friend's bachelorette party. She loves tea so it was the perfect place for her. If you get off at 24th St BART station, it's about a 20 min walk. The other way is to take public transportation. Since I was already going to be out in the city, my husband dropped me off.

The place is small, with a table for every corner to accommodate the guest size with space for guests and employees to get around. For me, it's not as spacious as two of the tea places I've been to. One of my friends (who happened to be one of our other friend's bridesmaid) decided on the high tea menu. We had a variety of tea sandwiches, salad and scones (with jam or butter). Everyone was able to have at least 8 tea sandwich slice. It was actually more than enough. I think this is the first time I've seen salad served.

For tea, we had decaffeinated tea, vanilla tea, passion fruit tea and mango tea. The last two, we ordered from the tea list. The passion fruit tea was actually a favorite. Most of the guests were there for hanging out while there was one other party for a baby shower. At the end, my friend was given a spoon for a memento.

Overall, I think all the guests had a wonderful time. On the other hand, my friends and I were happy that we finally made it. It's a nice place if you want to hang out with the girls or have a small party. I would love to come back here again.
author: Jenn D.

description: Awesome experience. The place is adorable, with so much to look at. They have fancy hats for you to borrow and the table setting is so pretty. We had the high tea, the tea was exceptional and the pretty little sandwiches and scones were delicious. It was filling. Staff is exceptionally kind and gracious. Check out their shop across the street for cool gifts/mementos.
author: Robin C.

description: Lovejoy's is under new ownership and they have changed things.  Be aware that they do not take group reservations that have more than a few people in them.
author: Richard O.

description:
My friend Connie came here before and told me about how great it is. Last year we went to Crown and Crumpet. I thought their teas were tasty and their food too. It is a bit hard to compare two different styles. 

I made reservations about a couple days in advanced for Saturday at 4pm. I called a couple times hoping to talk to an actual person but always getting voicemail. I left a voicemail stating my reservation information and left a contact number. Within 30 minutes I got a call back to confirm. Hint: Although they open til 6 the last seating is 4.30pm. 

I am really glad I made reservations as when I got off the J train it looked like there was a lot of people. 

We ordered the light tea for two since both ate lunch. 
Light Tea - Your choice of one sandwich, served with a scone, preserves, and Devon cream, Fresh fruit and shortbread tea biscuit $17.95 (Additional light teas can be added for $17.00) 

I like how you can actually pick your sandwiches. I picked the shrimp and mayo whereas my friend cream cheese & mandarin oranges. Both was good! Tasty! The crusts were removed and the left overs are cut into fourths. At Crown and Crumpet, we had to cut those 1/4 sandwiches in half so we can both try the different sandwiches. It sure is a lot of work to cut small sandwiches even smaller. 

The scones really filled me up but they were really good. I like the scone and the short bread. 

Overall, the food was good and surprisingly filling. We didn't eat anything else for the rest of the night. 

The teas got really bitter fast! The herbal forest berries/rosehips was very strong. It reminded me of those ice teas you buy at walgreens. I didn't like it. 

The service here is good but I felt like we were rushed out. Who wants to work longer than they have to? I can't blame them.
author: Sarah C.

description: We had a great time here for our friend's Birthday get together. The teas were delicious and food was good. They are pretty short on staff, so don't be in a rush while you are here. Just relax and enjoy this super cute place. I love the homey decorations and comfy couches.
author: may q.

description:
Loved the ambiance, the selection, and the service! 

My sister and I both ordered the High Tea ($19.95).  When I had looked online, their menu had a High Tea for Two but that is no longer on their menu.  It is now just a High Tea and add additional High Tea for $19.  I think it ended up being a couple more bucks.

We ordered the Apricot Tea, which was tasty, especially with milk & sugar. I did not realize that we could have each ordered our own teas so I will do that next time.

The sandwiches were great: smoked salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, pesto & prosciutto, & a chicken salad sandwich.  The salad was fine... the dressing helped.  The cold slaw was interesting--a little basilly if you like that. The scones were hot and fresh and delicious-- way softer than others I've had!  The jam was also delicious.

We ended up taking 4 pieces of the sandwiches, some cold slaw, and salad home. I just ate it for my leftovers at work--still good! 

I would highly recommend for a ladies afternoon or special occasion.  I recommend making a reservation in advance... we walked in (only 15 minute wait) but were lucky.  Dressing up is totally optional, but can be fun!
author: Roya B.

description:
Cutesy Brittish Grandma Tea Time!

The wait was ridiculous on a sunday afternoon.   they told us 15 minutes so we waited outside for about 20 minutes then asked again how much longer the wait would be.  apparently they put our names off to the side of the paper and forgot about us... i know we are some dark asians but daym!  good thing we checked!
