the whole staff was all dolled up like toys u see on tv when little girls have a tea party.  all the furniture was antique, the decorations were creepily old and the tableware was fancy shmancy.   the service was quite friendly.  it made me want to just drink tea with my pinky up and talk in an english accent.  i refrained because i did not want to embarrass myself.

for a party of 3 we got:

Tea for Two: 
- 4 Sandwiches.  thoughtfull that they take the time to cut off the crust on these tiny delecate sandwich quarters.
  *Chicken Apple Walnut Salad: tastes like the kind you get at the cafeteria.  not too shaby.
  * Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese: the salmon was not too salty and the cream cheese was soft.
  * Artichoke Hummus: probably the blandest hummus ever made.  its never really a good idea to order hummus in a non-middle eastern place.
  * Lovejoy's Special - pesto with goat cheese and some sort of meat.. the best sandwich!  did not taste the pungent goat cheese at all and it was delicious!!

Scone
- the most moist and buttery scone ever.  it was like a biscuit, except scone flavored!  (with nuts and berries and such) - verry delicious and it was served with devon cream ...what i like to think of as a cross between butter and cream cheese

Cole Slaw + Salad
- not too impressive but a healthy addition to all the butter you are getting.  basically the salad is the Costco baby green mix (that one you get in the plastic box) and the cole slaw is sliced cabbage with light mayo (non-sweetened...such a difference from KFC) and very plain tasting

Crumpets:
- its like one of those vietnamese coconut waffles except in the shape and color of an english muffin.  it was nice and fresh, but slightly soggy when it cooled down.  we had lemon curd on the side - it was like liquified lemon merengue pie.  

Mango Tea was not very fruity...it also had a bitter aftertaste
Vanilla Tea was very smooth and fragrant, and left no bitter aftertaste

I would totally recommend this place if you want to eat at a very unique place.  there are very few places who bring you back to 100 years to have a tea party.  also it's great if you are trying to get skinny.  all the food is delicate and eaten slowly so u get full off of a few bites...  
 - get the Lovejoy's special sandwich
 - enjoy a scone
 - get some vanilla tea
author: Tina A.

description: It felt like being in a crowded local cafe. Perhaps I have this wrong illusion of high tea being a little bit formal. I wanted the experience to be a treat. Although, I must say that the prices matches the experience. I would not pay more. The place is a bit cluttery for my taste. It didn't help that a big group was present and was very loud. To their credit, the service was fast and the staff were friendly and accommodating.
author: Carmencita S.

description:
A friend of mine had her baby shower here a couple of weeks ago. Our reservation was from 11-1, but the guest of honor was running a bit late. Since it is a tea service the waitress wanted to bring out the food as quickly as possible, we asked her to wait until the mommy to be arrived. The waitress seemed displeased with this and after that the service felt very rushed and it was apparent the waitress was unhappy with our group.

The food was however quite excellent and the tea was great.

The food came on three tiered trays filled with, scones, butter cookies, cole slaw, salad, and a variety of finger sandwiches. My favorite being the turkey and cheese with whole seed mustard. The coleslaw was also really good!

My favorite tea was the pomegranate green tea. 

The atmosphere of this place is really cute and perfect for an afternoon tea with your favorite ladies.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
There will never, ever be a time that I will say no to Lovejoys. It's a great place to go when you want to have a special place to go with food that isn't too heavy. It's not the place to go if you're going to do something serious, like work on a novel or have a business meeting. Save that for the busy, crowded coffee shops and your break room.

Weekends are generally booked until forever, but they will always take walk-ins. Be prepared for a long wait, but it'll be worth it for two to three things: 1) excellent tea, 2) the yummiest scones you will experience while in a fancy chair whilst feeling like royalty, and for those who like to daydream up stories, 3) the service and the occasional English waiter or waitress. It's the perfect whimsical Alice-in-Wonderland-esque place to have a grand old time with your friends, family, significant others, or handsome strangers.

I've never been disappointed in the tea. It's freshly brewed and loose leaf, and the flavors they have all work so well with all the tea services they offer. I had the Royal Tea, and it's by far my favorite - it's got a touch of grenadine! Oh yes. They always keep your teapots full and the servers make sure to take care of the tea so it always steps evenly. Much appreciated! Plus, I love the extra fanciness of all the random china that's used - I had a friend who described the place as, "It looks like a little old lady threw up all over the place with all the mismatched china and decor. It's awesome." That's pretty much the most perfect definition for Lovejoys.

An added bonus is the people-watching: I love seeing how folks dress up for their version of a tea party. Overall, a good time, and totally worth the wait if you love yourself a cuppa. Just remember - last seating is at 4:30 and the kitchen closes half an hour before Lovejoys does, so being early is not only good manners, it's just going to work out in the long run. Pinkies out, y'all.
author: Robbin A.

description:
I'm at the point in my life where everyone I know is having babies!  And with babies come baby showers.  I've been to so many I can't count them on both of my hands. 

When one of my close friends told me she was having her third baby, I mentioned that I would be happy to help her out.   She picked Lovejoys Team room as the place to host her baby shower.  I was excited because this would be my very first time at Lovejoys and I've heard so many good things about it. 

We hosted the event on a Sunday and there were people lining up outside of Lovejoys 30 minutes prior to opening.  I was impressed!   

Everything was set up for us when we checked in and the service was great!  
The sandwiches were delicious.  I only wish they gave us just a bit more time to host the party.  We were there for 2 hours and it felt so short but it was still tons of fun and the food/tea was great!  

Such a fun place.  The parking can get crazy in this neighborhood so definitely allow at least 15 minutes to find parking.   So fun and definitely a great time to be had with your girlfriends in this place.  Will definitely return.
author: Christine P.

description:
A cute and cozy place for tea time with your girlfriends! 
I got the Light Tea Set. The roast beef and horseradish sammy was delish. English breakfast tea was awesome with milk. Their scones are addicting and the cream/jam I kept on piling on!

Overall, it is kind of expensive for tea  ($17.95) but it was a fun time before going off to see Beach Blanket Babylon :)
author: Angela D.

description: These tea folks bent over backwards and twisted in a tea pretzel to give us an amazing birthday tea for 9 people. Gluten free? No problem! One partygoer is vegan? Voila, with no notice vegan service appears! Gorgeous setting, all perfectly turned, tasty, attentively served. Run don't walk!
author: Murphy C.

description: Love love love!! The ambiance at Lovejoy's is so quaint and unique. It was foggy the day I ate here and it made me feel like I was at a sleepy little cafe in London. The little vintage tea pots and decor are touches which make a huge difference in creating a very unique atmosphere. The tea I ordered was so comforting and really complimented the cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches. The salad was delicious and I was surprised by how the food and tea filled me up. The service was excellent, the girls were sweet and attentive. I need to make time to come here again. Thanks Lovejoy's!!
author: Victoria C.

description:
Such a cute little spot in the city! We came here for my friend's bridal shower.

- Several varieties of teas
- Cute finger foods: sandwiches, cookies, scones, pastries

I loved this experience because the ambiance took me back to when I was a little girl playing "tea party"---except this time, it actually was a legit tea party! Having a group of girl friends and cute cups/snacks gave me a warm/homey feel. I wish we had these when I was growing up!

I'm definitely coming back here if I'm in the city with some girl friends, and i am for sure taking my kids/nieces here when I have them! :D
author: Stacey K.

description:
Came here for tea with my lovely girlfriends.  Who said mix and match are not fun?  This place is exactly that but it all came together perfectly.  It feels like you just walked in one of your friend's house and chit chated about life over tea and snacks.

A lot of knick knacks all over the place so your eyes and conversations will sure be entertained.

Reservations only!

I had the high tea - choice of two sandwiches, salad, scone and biscuit.  If you don't care about the greens, you can get the light tea, that will come with fres fruit.  The scone is heaven with the cream.  My friend says you can only find it at one grocery store in SF.  I need to remember which one ggrrrr.   Our afternoon tea was served with bottomless tea.  

We also ordered some sausage rolls but it felt out of place and the taste was so-so.

For $20, why not spend a couple hours at Lovejoy's with your besties ;)
author: Pam S.

description: Have only been to a handful of tea rooms but this is probably one of my favorites, especially because it's affordable. For ~$25 (if I'm remembering correctly), you get a lot of goodies -- tea sandwiches and a variety of pastries, and at the end, they bring you a tray of petit fours to choose from. Very packed on the weekends, so make reservations (even calling a week in advance, they were almost full). Cute decor and very friendly staff.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Great tea little tea room. They were able to seat us during this busy holiday season and we did not have reservations.  I do recommend that you make reservations if you plan to enjoy a delightful tea service. We should have but thought that maybe we would be okay because we came earlier on a Thursday. 

Service is wonderful. There are a variety of tea services, teas, and tea sandwiches available or you can order a la carte.  The scones are great and so is the fresh fruit. There are also heartier dishes available if you or someone else is not in the mood for tea sandwiches. I didn't really care for the crumpet or the petit four, although the petit fours are very pretty.
author: Emily Y.

description:
I recently hosted a baby shower catered by Lovejoy's. From start to finish they were a pleasure to work with. Although I went in on a fairly busy day, they were immediately accommodating, sending someone over to answer our questions and share in our excitement. Because the tea room itself can only accommodate parties up to 20, my co-host and I decided to cater the shower at a home instead. The catering menu is available online and Samantha helped us square away the details via email in the weeks leading up to it. The prices were reasonable, they were amenable to last minute changes and provided helpful suggestions throughout. You can include a server and a tea leaf reader for your party too, if you're so inclined!

We didn't lift a finger the day of. Our wonderful server, Carrie, was warm and kind. She arrived on time and set everything up for us. She brought mix matched plates and cups and saucers and tiers for serving the tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets and petit fours we'd ordered. The egg and onion sandwiches were the best, the scones were incredible with the cream and preserves and the White Tangerine tea was a definite favorite. Carrie warmed the scones, toasted the crumpets, poured drinks, continually restocked the food and tea and otherwise  welcomed our guests at every turn. She left the kitchen in great shape and the leftovers in the fridge. All in all, it was a perfectly adorable and shabby chic little ladies tea and our guest of honor loved it. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or use them again.
author: J G.

description:
The ambience is really the draw (for me) chez Lovejoy; it feels as if you are visiting both an eccentric great aunt's house and a tea party in Wonderland at the same time.  I love the mismatched teacups, teapots, furniture, etc., and there's enough floral brocade to keep my Victorian-era obsessed soul happy.

The tea itself is delicious -- during my most recent visit, I ordered green tea with kombucha; another time I had the blood orange tisane, and both were excellent. 

We showed up with a party of 5 -- and no reservation -- at 11:00 on a Sunday morning. They weren't sure if they could accommodate us, but they managed to squeeze us in by 11:05, which was lovely. We ordered the high tea (there were five of us) with ten tea sandwiches -- the chicken asparagus is my favorite, followed by the artichoke hummus and turkey with dijon. The accompanying salad was simple but good, and I love the scones; the Devon cream is delicious. The bill came out to around $25 per person -- a bit pricey considering it's not a meal, per se -- but I think the experience is more important. Service has always been very friendly, and the space is cozy and intimate.

Food: 4/5
Ambience: 5/5+
author: Katie M.

description:
Pretty good place. I like that they have quite a few options on the menu, especially that my gluten free vegan friend had options as well!

The sandwich options were great. I ordered the cheese and chutney one as well as the pear and stilton. Okay, the pear and stilton was to die for and the other one...well, it has potential. The chutney is really good, but it is super strong. The cheese on that sandwich doesn't stand a chance. A more strong cheddar would be perfect for the sandwich to pair up next to the chutney.

I ordered the Queen's Tea because I wanted two sandwiches. It came with cole slaw and salad which are both a little random. Could have passed on both. I like those things, but not for tea. The crumpet was delicious and loved the fruit on the top of my tower.

There were less tea options than I am used to, but plenty to choose from. I had a green decaf since it was already mid-afternoon. It was delightful. Service was also great..she came by to refill out tea pots.
author: Amy O.

description:
Miss Eliza Doolittle, would you care for some tea?

Oh yes, that is exactly how you feel when you're at Lovejoy's. You're in a period drama, adorned in a soft, romantic dress, speaking in a British accent, lifting that dainty pinky as you gently lift your porcelain teacup to your lips, enjoying the vintage details of lace and florals surrounding you. 

My best friend and I always have high tea here when she visits from the East Coast. We made reservations (a wise thing to do) for the 4th time this Easter. The sandwiches are delicious- I never get tired of the salmon and cream cheese and do check out their special. They have an amazing selection of tea. My favorite one is the forest berries/rosehip- it's a deep rosy color, citrusy, sweet. So delicious with your scone, devonshire cream and strawberry jam. I strongly recommend it!

Do bring your daughters here. Do have a bridal shower here. Do catch up with a friend here. Do bring your Mark Darcy here ;)
author: Tes Y.

description:
I went with here with my fellow yelper, Desmond C.  We ordered their house special tea along with some sandwiches, petite fours, and scones.  I really enjoyed their house special tea with some sugar and milk.  The petite fours were also awesome and the sandwiches were surprisingly pretty delicious for what they were.  My favorite one was their salmon and cream cheese, sounds simple--but it was surprisingly satisfying.  

I really liked the decor of this place and I felt like I was in London (even though I've never been there).  

Also, go right when it opens or better yet, make a reservation so you won't have to wait too long!
author: Kristen T.

description: Perfection. Planning my mom's surprise birthday party with 11 of her best friends was absolutely seamless and stress-free with Samantha's help. And today, we had a wonderful table, great service, delicious sandwiches, and ahhh, the scones . . . just when I thought I couldn't love this place any more, they just outdid themselves--even suggesting we take a group photo in front of the mural outside. Love you, Lovejoy's!!!
author: Emmy M.

description:
Fun, great service, reasonably good  food. I went for teatime with 3 friends. They got the teas and sandwiches, and I got a ploughman's lunch, because one can subsist on crustless diagonals for so long. My lunch came with 3 good cheeses (their menu said they sourced from Cowgirl Creamery--great choice), some pear and some apple, toast and butter, salad, crisps, some very authentic British pickle (meaning chutney) and hummus. If eaten at the pace of teatime, it proves to be just the right amount of filling.

As previous reviewers have said, the interior is charming. Lovejoy's is meant to feel like what we'd imagine a British tearoom to be, and I thought it largely succeeded. Our party was seated at a pair of comfortable couches, instead of a table, and everything was covered in slightly weathered lace (don't look too closely at the upholstery). Each teapot was unique and darling in its own way, and everyone got individual strainers. Food was served in tiers or on platforms. Our spots were marked "reserved for royalty," and the waitress was the perfect amount of peppy, attentive, and patient.

I would recommend reservations. We came on a Saturday afternoon with a reservation and we still had to wait for about 15 minutes. Once you're seated, take your time. You're paying as much for the experience as you are the food/drink.
author: Robert A.

description:
Lovejoy's brings you back to those days when you used to play "house" and pretend to host tea parties when you were a little girl! You can do that here but this time it's all for real! Lol. So cute/quaint and gives you such a warm feeling. The sandwiches were all amazing... I have no complaints. Came here this passed weekend for a bridal shower and it was the perfect spot. The decor is unique, classic, and so damn cute!!!

The food came out in stacked trays with slices of a variety of sandwiches, scones with jam and butter, and salad. I definitely enjoyed the smoked salmon sandwich the most, but seriously everything was delicious... and who would've thought those little sandwiches would be so filling!

The tea was delicious. My favorites are the mango and earl grey. Nothing was too sweet/bitter/etc... everything was JUSTTT RIGHT!

I definitely recommend this spot for any girly occasion! I would love to take my mom  here for mother's day, host a baby shower here, or have another bridal shower here as well.
author: Elysse P.

description:
My friend and I got the Queen's tea service and left very full and with leftovers! A note: if you love crustless triangle sandwiches, they give you a LOT of them.

My choices that I enjoyed: China Rose Petal tea, chicken curry (special) and cucumber sandwiches, and the lemon marzipan petit four.

Besides the excellent food and tea, I appreciated that they keep a waitlist and will call you if there is a cancellation for your desired day and time (there are set seating times on the weekends).
author: Lauren T.

description:
A room full of girlfriends having tea.  Rebekah T. is right, "you're never too old to play tea, I mean have tea with friends." =)

My two girlfriends took me here for a quaint celebration. We each ordered the Queen's Tea - a menu comprised of coleslaw, salad, sandwiches, scones, fresh fruits, and biscuits.  A wide variety of sandwiches and tea to select from.  I thoroughly enjoyed my apricot black flavored tea.  Yum!

I love how each cup, plate, and pot, were mis-matched.  Each chair seem to have it's own shape and style. The room has a lot of character - cute and charming. =)

Thank you, V and Ti...for a wonderful time!
author: Diana M.

description: I just went here for the first time and it was awesome! I was surprised how good the food was. The warm scones with butter were fabulous. We loved trying on hats and taking ridiculous pictures.
author: Amanda H.

description: I was a virgin tearoom patron and could not have  been more pleased at Lovejoy's. Was there for my cousin's baby sprinkle (as opposed to shower). We were a party of eleven adult ladies, 3 twee tea drinkers and 1 very well behaved 7 month old. The atmosphere was very quaint and welcoming. We were treated like Royalty as our place card stated. The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, and of course the tea, were all magnificent. My favorite tea was the "Rose Hips".  I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back. The only reason that I didn't give 5 stars is because I've never been to a tea room to compare to this one. I've read reviews of tea rooms in Solano county where I live and I have a feeling that the others don't measure up to this one.
author: Cheryl M.

description:
I came here with my mom to celebrate her birthday, and it was a really fun and quaint experience.  The decor is very old fashioned, cute, and a little bit quirky... I almost felt like I had stepped into a different world; Lovejoy's is really like no other place I've been.

We ordered the Queen's Tea for two; to drink I had the special- strawberry herbal tea which I quite enjoyed, though I have to admit I was most impressed by all the beautifully presented snacks.  I absolutely loved the fresh warm scones and crumpets, the clotted cream & lemon curd were both divine, and all of the little sandwiches were very tasty!  Between us we ordered the cucumber & cream cheese, pear & stilton, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and turkey & mustard sandwiches, and they were all very enjoyable!  The fresh fruit was lovely as well, but the salad and coleslaw didn't do much for me.  (Still, I very much enjoyed the meal overall.)  The adorable, sugary, and delicious petit fours at the end were a delightful note to end things on, though by the time we got to those I was already stuffed!

I definitely enjoyed the experience, the tea, and all the tasty treats, but I do feel like the prices were a little high.  Still, it really was a charming and different experience, and it's definitely worth trying at least once!
author: Emma M.

description:
High on tea:
I have never tried high tea, but I have heard tis most civilized.  When I discovered Lovejoy's Tea Room online, I decided I had to give it a go.  I was not disappointed.

We were greeted most courteously and seated straight away.  I ordered the Me Tea which comes with a bottomless pot of tea and neat little sandwiches.  The tea was loose leaf, and the sandwiches dainty and fresh.  Although the menu is not extensive, and the teas offerings did not include my favorite oolongs, I did enjoy my meal and experience.  The tea room is decorated with British nick nacks which give it an informal vibe.  I felt like I was visiting my British great aunt for the afternoon, but I am not even from the UK.

I highly recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room for a sampling of high tea.
author: Audrey C.

description: I came here with one of my girlfriends for tea last weekend and it was so adorable!  Service was great, food was amazing, and the tea was wonderful.  It was quaint and quiet and perfect for a girls lunch.  We saw a bridal shower and a baby shower while we were there... it's a perfect location for either event!
author: Brooke S.

description:
I've been to Lovejoy's four times in my life.  Some men may never have the high tea experience and I'm lucky enough to have been here so many times.  Since my friend lives in the Diamond Heights neighborhood, she had known about Lovejoy's long before they became super popular.  

My first concern when coming here was about whether I'd still be hungry when I left.  Well, having ordered the High Tea and the Queen's Tea many times, that quickly became a non-issue.  The variety of sandwiches to choose from, the scones with jelly, and the appealing pub fare menu looked and tasted equally appealing.  On my last trip here, I remembered seeing a Shepard's Pie on the menu but not a Chicken Pot PIe.  I could have sworn that I had a chicken pot pie here long ago...maybe it was a special request or they don't do it anymore.

As always, the biggest challenge is to get a reservation here on a weekend.  A fourteen days in advance reservation call to them is highly advised.  They usually have two walk-in tables for people without reservations so whoever gets to the door first before they open will get those tables...and possibly any tables where the reservation party didn't show up.  Since my group got there forty minutes before they opened, we were lucky to get the first walk-in table.

Since it is a small room, the higher volume of ambient noise does make it difficult to talk and seating around your table could be a bit snug.  But after a few minutes, these small issues will pass through your conscious mind after pouring your first cup of tea and enjoying the first few bites of a tasty roast beef and horseradish sandwich.

I definitely won't mind coming back to Lovejoy's because this English style tea house was my first introduction to the tea experience.  I can't imagine going to any other tea house unless they could surpass what Lovejoy's brings to the table...and I highly doubt that any locale in SF can do that.
author: Ben H L.

description:
This is my favorite tea room in California: no-fuss, welcoming, and delicious. Their reservations fill up quickly around holidays, but if you plan ahead you won't have a problem finding something that works for you. I've come with small and large groups, and everyone always has a blast. 

First-timers never fail to comment on how cute the space is itself. You feel as though you've walked into a Victorian grandmother's parlor. With mismatched furniture and English china, framed sayings and hats on the wall, Lovejoy's provides plenty of pieces to keep the conversation going. Once the food is served, however, all attention goes to the edible.

For $17-20 per person, the tea service is surprisingly filling. Typically, each guest chooses a service which comes with a personal pot of tea (unlimited refills included) and a range of tea snacks from biscuits and scones to salad and sandwiches. They serve their scones fresh and warm with an authentic Devon cream that melts in your mouth. If your afternoon tea is also your lunch, I recommend the High Tea which comes with 2 sandwiches, salad, a scone, and a shortbread tea biscuit. My favorite sandwich selections are the cucumber & cream cheese (a tea time classic) and the chicken apple walnut salad. Since I gravitate toward floral tea flavors, I always order the China Rose Petal black tea and add some milk.

For those with a sweet tooth, the tray of petit fours can be irresistible if you still have room after your service. I have only tried the Victorian Wedding Cake which tasted very much like a standard vanilla cake pop but was a slightly bigger portion.

The lovely ladies who run the place are ever the gracious hosts--checking in for questions, constantly refilling tea pots, and never rushing the party. As I write this, I'm already thinking up an occasion for my next tea time.
author: Catherine A.

description:
I and my girlfriends try to get together every month for an afternoon tea to catch-up and of course gossip. It has now become a tradition that we hit up all the tea rooms in the city until we are ready and have polished our tea etiquettes before the pièce de résistance of the tea-tradition in SF(the Fairmont Hotel). 

Lovejoy's Tea Room offer tiers of smart little crustless sandwiches, delicious scones, clotted cream, curd, sweets and heaps of tea. Making a reservation might be quite hard as they book up pretty quickly but it is worth the wait. The service is fantastic (they even brought out a pastry with a candle for my friend because it was her birthday). Overall, I find this place quite delightful and will definitely be back in the future.
author: J M.

description:
Tip: You must make reservations for this place or they will not seat you! Reservations more than a week in advance recommended too!

My best friend and I are really into tea places. We went to Crown and Crumpet a few months back. She suggested to bring me here for my 25th birthday because she's been here a few times and thinks it's better than C&C. The place is small and has a quirky mismatching decor all around. The service is exquisite.

We sat down and our server was warming. She took our orders and answered all the questions I had. We both ordered the Queen's Tea with an apricot tea and china rose petal black tea. I love the apricot but milk and sugar was needed. It smells delicious though! Wasn't a huge fan of the china rose petal. I felt it was too floral. 

Our food came pretty quick and soon enough, I was munching on tiny triangular-shaped sandwiches. I got the roast beef & horseradish sandwich along with the smoke salmon and cream cheese. My BFF got a turkey and cranberry. I am usually not a fan of cranberry, but I took a bite of her sandwich and I think it was my fave out of the three. The roast beef was slightly dry and bland.

The scones and pastries were good and fruits were fresh. I loved the crumpets, as usual. Buttery and with extra cream on top! Yum!

This place is cheaper than Crown and Crumpet, but I do think the decor there is prettier/girlier/fancier.


We saw an elder pair of granny's and we hope that it would be us in another 50 years :)
author: Rosanne L.

description: I'd been Good experience but normally taste ! Sure Joy's tea room has romantic mood and many people love to it place but i feel soso as compared to such a thing!
author: Joo A.

description:
I love this place! It's more than just high tea, it's an experience. A girlfriend and I got dolled up one Sunday afternoon and stepped into quaint England in this little tea place. 

We had the Queen's tea service and we were so, so full afterwards but couldn't resist everything that was on the menu - from the crustless triangle sandwiches, scrumptious scones and fruit platter. The ladies serving us were so lovely - they talked us through the menu and when the fruit platter came and I realized that we had to change it as I'm allergic to kiwifruit, rather than whisking it away, they gave me a separate platter to eat and let my friend keep the one we had.

Definitely book in advance. A great alternative to a Sunday brunch.
author: Lisette P.

description: Food was okay and tea was tea. I had an okay experience there. But throughout my entire sitting, I felt like the server kept rushing us to finish and leave. Ill understand if they had other reservations after us and the place was packed. but nope, There was a few empty tables next to us. And the server proceeded to give us the bill when we were obviously not finished. It was a good try hopefully my next will be better.
author: Alice H.

description: I was looking forward to a special, pampering experience but left feeling underwhelmed and just ok with both the customer service and food. I didn't catch our server's name because I don't think she introduced herself but she seemed a bit uncaring and almost a bit snooty. No questions regarding our visit, familiarity with the menu or tea preferences. She just took our order and pretty much left us to ourselves except for when she refilled our tea pots once. She did not check up on us at all.  The food itself was ok, nothing special. The scone was delicious with the lemon curd but that's about it. My friend and I both had the Queen's Tea service. From pictures and popularity you'd think you'd walk away with a memorable experience. The first thing I'll remember is having the previous user's tea leaves in my filter and how none of the staff seemed to be smiling or enjoying themselves. My friend and I visited on a Saturday afternoon and the place was not packed, I'd understand if it was later in the day and if every table was taken but it wasn't. In the end I'm glad we visited as I've always been curious about Lovejoy's but for the price we paid and quantity of food I expected more in both customer service and dining experience. I left thinking "That was it? There has to be some place better."
author: Giants F.

description:
What an absolutely perfect place for brunch! The table set up, decor, and atmosphere are exactly what I'd hoped for in coming to a tea room - British shabby chic at its finest!

Rachel, our server, really made the experience for us too. She was so kind, friendly, patient, and prompt (even refilled our teapots to keep them just right!). Such a sweetheart!! The food was really fabulous too. All 5 of us got the high tea service, which was amazing. Plenty of vegetarian options, gluten free bread, etc. to accommodate our quintessentially San Franciscan table of dietary preferences! 

Be sure to make a reservation!! It was quite busy and we were glad we did. We will definitely be back!
author: Jo G.

description:
Lovejoy' s is the definition of shabby chic. It's completely charming and full of tons of character. The place is adorned with hats perfect for a royal wedding, lace, cuckoo clocks, vintage pictures, and of course tons of mismatched tea sets. I've been here before but most recently came for my Mom's birthday tea.

My Mom and I shared the Queen's tea for two, $27/person, and then added on my sister for $17. With the Queen's tea you get your choice of two sandwiches, salad, scones, cookies, and of course, tea. We had a huge pot of earl grey and I had the cucumber & cream cheese and tomato & cheese sandwiches. I also ordered a side of crumpets, because really, no tea party is complete without crumpets!

The scones and crumpets were probably my favorites! The scones were warm and fluffy and I loved the raisins. It came with a side of devon cream and strawberry jam. The crumpets were soft and light, they came with a lemon curd spread which was really sweet!

This is the perfect place to have a girly date with friends or with your Mom. Having high tea is such a fun experience and something that any tea and sweets lover should enjoy!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Two layers of food
Salad in the bottom tray
Difficult for fork to reach
---------------------
As mentioned before, I give high points for unique places, like Lovejoy's Tea Room, that enhances my options for a weekend lunch.  As evident by my Yelp ID, I'm not British, but I do like English style sandwiches - crust cutoff, cut into triangles, only a few slices of meat - which is very much like Japanese sandwiches (I don't know the historical facts, but I'm sure Brits brought the technique to Japan).  While I love mile-high sub sandwiches too, I crave for English sandwiches once in a while.  I've been disappointed with ones at On the Bridge in J-Town (http://www.yelp.com/biz/pLZFRsn8HjVzcITHqa8Yfw), so I'm glad Lovejoy's does it right.

As you enter Lovejoy's, it feels like you've entered Jane Austen's living room.  Along with chairs from your dining table, they have couches and antique chairs.  All their cups and pots are unique - none of them match.  As you may expect, 90% of customers were female, probably because male customers feels a 'tea room' would not provide enough food to qualify as a lunch.  I'll get into this later, but they do give you enough food for a full lunch.

Service was excellent as we were offered for tea refills (bottomless service) three times.  Host was quite friendly and explained which sandwiches were popular.  

FOOD:  We got High Tea ($16.50) and 2 sandwiches.  Although sandwich meal didn't come with a pot of tea, since my high tea came with a pot, by paying extra $1, two people were allowed to enjoy unlimited pot of tea.  See the pictures I uploaded for menu and High Tea as it shows how pleasing it is to the eye as it is to your tongue.  

If there is any CONS I have about this place, it may be the price.  High tea at $16/person and Queen Tea at $20/person seem a bit high.  But, note one thing: I have a fairly large appetite, but I became full with High Tea.   

You can easily make your trip to Lovejoy's as a weekend activity by spending a long time drinking their bottomless tea and later visiting their Lovejoy's Attic across the street. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/YN_Fm4paIod5jpnaAXATtQ)
author: トモ T.

description: Grandma love this place because it looks like her house exploded and landed in Lovejoy's. Its a tough reservation because the place is not big and people sit there for hours on end. The service is solid here and while I love high tea, this one is totally average. The crumpets were good and  scones and finger sandwiches are OK, but I'm pretty sure I got the 'Betes from the over-the top sweet Petit Fours.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
It's all about the experience at Lovejoy's. Yahh you could brew your own tea, make your own little sandwiches and bake some scones but really, you can't put it together like Lovejoy's does. All of the mismatched decor, teapots, teacups, plates, cutlery, and even furniture makes the tea party come alive here. The sandwiches are simple but they are good and there's a variety to choose from. The scones are warm and buttery when they are brought out but I'm not too crazy about their shortbread tea biscuits. They also have cole slaw and spring greens salad to accompany most of their tea service meals. I tried their mango black tea and their special of the day which was black vanilla lavender. I have had better mango tea but a yes to the black vanilla lavender! 

As most reviews note, service here is great. Lovejoy's is definitely a place to go with your gal pals. Also, I saw a couple of little girls celebrating their birthdays here which I thought was super special and adorable. Make some reservations and get ready to sit at a table "Reserved for Royalty or Queens!"
author: Maya S.

description:
6/4/11

It was such a delightful place for afternoon tea/brunch.

The decorations were really whimsical and each utensil (teapot,plates,spoons,cups; were different).

Their sandwiches, crumpets, scones (lemon curd & berry jam), and especially the tea are first rate (I had their Chocolate Mint & Black Currant).

I was extremely satisfied and filled (all that tea just kept coming, our waitress made sure the pot was full and hot), what more can I say - I'M COMING HERE AGAIN!
author: Alex C.

description:
So cute!  We had a baby shower here, and the Queen's Tea is the bomb.  The scones are TDF, loved the sandwiches (especially the roast beef with horseradish, chutney with cheese, chicken salad -- ok all of them!!!) and the crumpets are amazing as well.  They only bit I didn't like were the petit fours.  Highly recommend the ceylon tea (better than the darjeeling).  

Why 4 stars instead of 5?  It was in the low 70s outside, but in the 80s and humid inside.  They gotta open a window or install a fan or something!
author: Olivia L.

description:
This was my first ever experience of afternoon high tea, which was influenced by an instagram post by a Youtuber. I went with my friend and her foreign exchange student from Italy and were half an hour late to our reservation at 4:30 PM, which is the latest possible. The lot is not large nor is it especially tiny. I have never been to England, but this place is reminiscent of the Victorian era. Everything is mix-matched - from the tea cups to the chairs and tables. We ordered high tea for three, which includes two sandwiches each, three scones, and three bottomless pots of tea. Our favorite sandwich was the tomato & cheese. I LOVED the scones, omg so good! We chose two teas however I only remember the second one, which was White Peach. i highly recommend that one. It was sweet and flavorful, nothing over the top. I am British-obsessed so it was only time that I came to a place like this.

TRY IT OUT.
author: Joanne M.

description:
"Would you like some tea & crumpets?" I never thought I'd be saying that... and actually mean it! 

A Girls Day Out started here and it was actually fun. It was time to be dainty and ladylike while having some qt with your girlfriends! Cute and charming atmosphere. Bridal and baby showers, little birthday tea parties and girlfriends of all ages get together here. On this lovely day, a group of ladies had a mad hatter party- all dressed in the most hideous hats I've ever seen. I wish I had taken pics! 

Even though we had reservations, we still waited about 15 minutes to be seated, which meant picture ops on the bench placed right outside. 

When finally seated, we were helped by a nice lady who made a few suggestions. We ordered two "High Tea for Two" since there were four of us. We added crumpets, picked our sandwiches and the teas chosen were two black teas; Afternoon Darjeeling and Passion Fruit. 

With our pinkies up, we sipped from our teacups. The Passion Fruit tea was the best of everything! Yess, even out of the crumpets, short breads and sandwiches. We've never tried tea with cream, and I was a little hesitant mixing the flavors of cream and passion fruit together- but it adds just the right amount of sweetness. As for the food, great compliments to tea. Freshly made, but not so filling. You'll be hungry soon after. 

One tip: the tea runs right through you like some bad alcohol. Wherever you go after, make sure there's a bathroom. We went to Haight after and all of us were strugglinggg!
author: S Y.

description:
lovejoy's took me all the way back to when i was 5 years old playing tea party with my stuffed animals and serving them plastic cookies and pouring water as tea. except lovejoy's was far better than my imaginary tea and crumpets!

high tea was a very fun couple of hours on a beautiful saturday afternoon. a table with a sign "reserved for the queens" was waiting for us by the window. 3 bottomless teas: earl grey, passion fruit black tea, and pomegranate green tea. the teas had light flavors and were not bitter.

we had the following finger sandwiches, i'm listing them best to less than best. but they were all good.
1. pear and stilton (sweet and pungent)
2. roast beef and horseradish (tasty)
3. turkey and dijon mustard (the mustard seeds were like luxurious caviar)
4. smoked salmon and cream cheese (can't go wrong)
5. lovejoy's special which was turkey, cranberry, pecan (savory and sweet mixed together)
6. ham and english mustard (spicy kick from the mustard)

all the sandwiches were served on a bed of fresh greens and light dressing. it was very refreshing, especially with a few segments of mandarin oranges.

the scones were dotted with plump raisins. the double devon cream was just about the best imaginable thing you could possibly spread on a warm crumbly scone. it was rich, decadent, and pure love and joy. the strawberry preserves were full of fruit.

the crumpets were a tad rubbery and dry, but the lemon curd more than made up for it. the curd was smooth, tart, and not too sweet. i rolled my eyes back at first bite.

thank you lovejoy's. you've shown me royal greatness. my stuffed animals would have been green with envy.
author: Charmaine L.

description:
I am so happy to see so many great reviews of my favorite tea house in the world.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE Lovejoy's, and it is one of the things I genuinely miss about living in the Bay area.  We used to hop the ferry and the MUNI to get there from San Rafael, and it was worth the time, effort, and money to get there and enjoy the visit.  There was one previous visit to a recommended highbrow spot in a hotel in the City that was disappointing and insulting.  The staff were snooty, the prices were outrageous, and the servings were paltry.  Never do that again.  Once I discovered Lovejoy's, I was stuck on this place.  I've never had a sub par experience, not even once.

Great tea selection, including my overall favorite anywhere - Lapsang Souchong, which is not always easy to find.  There isn't a bad choice on the menu, as far as I'm concerned, but I favor the Ploughman's Lunch.  Favorite sandwiches: Oak smoked Finnan Haddock, and Duck a L'orange - it's been a long time, so I don't know if they still serve them.  I tried everything though over the years I was there and they were ALL good.  All the food has always been top quality.  It left a lasting impression enough for me to put up a Yelp, even after so much time.

My experiences were always pleasant.  Great service, and attention to customer wishes.  This is a Bohemian, cozy environment, not for large groups or rowdy children.  It's a good place for a relaxing break from the bustle.

Love to you, Muna & Gillian.  You have a real gift - thank you for sharing it with all of us and creating a bright little spot in this world to enjoy some finer things.
author: Tala S.

description: You can't go wrong with shepherd's pie. I loved it! I must try their other pubfare items. I'm not sure if I'll do tea here again. My first experience was slightly traumatic. One day, I'll be brave enough to try their tea deals, but for now, I'm good with other items on their menu.
author: Bianca B.

description:
Holy heart-attack on a plate, Batman!  Let me just preface this with a warning: if you get the Queen's Tea be prepared to be rolled out of this place from glutting yourself on sumptuous Devon cream and a sundry of other tasty, decadent bites!

I took my mom here recently for her birthday and dropped some major dollar for us to both have the Queen's Tea. For sandwiches we picked cucumber and cream cheese (classic), salmon and capers (amazing), chicken and mango chutney (daily special), and one other with a blue cheese that I can't recall.  For tea we chose the Yorkshire Gold, a favorite of my mom's.  Then came the three-tiered wonder with our sandwiches, cookies, fruit, greens and scones.  And of course, lemon curd and Devon cream.  

As if that wasn't enough, freshly baked crumpets arrived, taunting our already filled bellies.  And the petit four and brownie after that simply mocked us in our naivete!

The waitstaff are superb here and totally accommodating from start to finish. We arrived a little early for our reservations (which you will need!) and seated us at an empty table for a larger party that had not yet arrived while ours was being cleared and prepped so we didn't have to wait out in the cold rain.

Though this tea service does cost a handsome price, I think its well-worth the extra coin.  They also offer you a coupon for their antiques/tea shop across the way which we used to buy some Yorkshire Gold for the road as well as a pair of their dainty little tea strainers.
author: Marissa C.

description:
Food: 4.5/5
Price: $ (average)
Portion: 5/5
Appearance: 4.5/5
Presentation of food: 4.5/5
OVERALL: 5/5

This place was my first experience with British style tea. I came here with my older sister for her birthday and it was nice. Relaxing and cozy, the tea was good; we kept it with the classic black tea. Their blue berry scone was TO DIE FOR (we ordered two!). Will definitely be back.
author: Eva H.

description: This place is so cute. Great place for a girls day out. Their scones and sandwiches and delightful. Just make sure you make reservations a few weeks before because they book up fairly quickly.
author: Chiara M.

description:
I tried this with some girlfriends recently for my best friend's birthday. I never had a "high tea" experience, so this was pretty fun to experience for the first time. The tea room is decorated with cute little trinkets, pictures, etc, and is certainly catered to the female crowd. 

I have to admit you're paying more for the service and experience than anything else. We each ordered the "high tea" ($19/person), which included bottomless tea, 2 sandwiches, 1 scone, 1 shortbread cookie, and shared coleslaw and salad. While a lot of food, I don't think it's anything unique (the sandwiches I could have easily made myself). I didn't like the chicken and walnut salad sandwich, but the smoked salmon was tasty. However, the warm scone was de-li-cious!

Service was extremely friendly! The waiter/host gave the birthday girl a Petit Four when he overheard us saying "Happy Birthday" to her, which was a very nice personal touch. 

Definitely something every girly-girl should experience once!
author: Mina K.

description: This place is a must try! Good vibe, good tea/food, friendly staff, and great service.
author: Minu G.

description: Omg so cute! And delicious! And sadly (for me) so very very booked. Plan ahead if you want to take guests. Quite the pleasant experience.
author: Heather R.

description:
This is my favorite place to hang out with girl friends and family member. This place serves the best scone and devon cream and a wide variety of flavored teas! 
Always a pleasure being here!
author: Maricar F.

description:
LOVEJOY'S TEA ROOM was the first tea experience that i've had and it was tons of fun! i took my best friend and two of her roommates here as they visited me in the bay area!

first of all, RESERVATIONS are a must. this place gets jam-packed so make sure you make reservations and arrive on time. 

this place is extremely cozy! it's the perfect place for a sunday morning gossiping with your girlfriends over breakfast or lunch. after you make reservations, they have signs on your table that says "RESERVED FOR ROYALTY or RESERVED FOR QUEENS." it was cute because my best friend calles me her queen! 

anywho, this place gives that antique vibe and the decor is so unique. they also have a hat rack, so if you're feeling any piece missing, that's it! a tea hat!! :) 

they have a lot of options regarding what you want with your tea: sweets (petit fours and scones), fruit, smoked salmon, sandwiches, etc. You can order whatever you'd like and it comes with a bottomless refill of tea!! It was awesome. We tried each other's teas and they were all pretty good. 

Each of us had our own teapot and it ironically matched our outfits. I had their passion fruit and it was good! Also tried apricot, mango, and earl grey! 

If you use the ladies' room, make sure you check out the clipboard they have in the back! It's really cute. It's filled with inspiration and I remember seeing a quote "REAL MEN DRINK TEA." hahahaha thought that was funny. props to all the bold men that go here because it's filled with ladies. 

After tea, go to the giftshop across they street! They have a lot of cutesy stuff you can look at too!
author: Holly H.

description:
My friends and I had a great time here last weekend - had a party of 7 and they were able to accommodate us quite well. We had an assorted order - light teas, high teas, and separate orders and everything came out pretty speedily.  The staff was very friendly and attentive (but not intrusive, which I find very important) - our teapots were constantly getting refreshed and never sat idle for long.

The sandwiches were delicious - I had the salmon and cream cheese, roast beef, and one other that eludes me at the moment...

we also had an assortment of teas at the table - dragon well was my choice, and one of the gals had a blood orange that was just wonderfully refreshing. I'll probably have to try that one again when I return (and yes, it's just a matter of "when" and not "if"). 

My absolute favorite item, however, was the scone that came with my high tea... add on a dollop of lemon curd and it was just delicious. In fact I think it'd be safe to say that it's the best scone I've had yet.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I had a super time with a good friend here last month - my first tea party ever.

I really enjoyed the set-up, I automatically felt the gossip tickles coursing through my mind, perfect place for such debauchery. There really is something about doilies and a room full of chicks that sparks the gab nerve. The piece of tea pots, cups and saucers that cobble the entry way are a sincere touch, not to mention as cute as a button.

We indulged in the Queen's Tea - the finger foods were just perfect. Crust cut off the mini sandwiches (OMG the cucumber and cream cheese minis should be a staple in cafe's all over, not just tea rooms) and I had probably the best pot of herbal vanilla that has graced my bladder. So. Good. And the scrumpets? Don't even get me started. The Best. 

The sandwiches that had marmite (a true brit condiment) were not my taste at all, I just can't get into it. Ruins my taste buds.

The server was gracious, sweet and knew her stuff - overall it was two full hours of great time with a even greater friend, gossip, finger foods, pinkies raised, full bladders, loud laughs (but not too loud, it WAS a tea party).

Just perfect. We should go together!
author: Meghan W.

description: I had my bridal shower here in June and was very satisfied with the service, atmosphere and food. In total we had 14 people which we squeezed into the back of the restaurant (I think this may be their limit for party size). We had a full Queen's tea with a selection of 6 different types of sandwiches. All were delicious but my favorite was the pear and stilton sandwhich. The food came on huge tiered platters and there was so much left over that I took them back to my hotel and ate them before my wedding. It was perfect. The price was reasonable too!
author: Tricia K.

description:
Having never had high tea, I have no standard of comparison. I do drink my fair share of tea, but that's about it. And, uh, I have spent quite a bit of time in the UK, so that makes me absolutely completely no-more-qualified than the average person off the street to judge.

*cough*

So without further ado...

You walk in and it's charmingly quaint but-not-quite-antique in a very British way, down to the cobwebs on the lights, the pictures on the walls, the cliche British sayings. It's actually pretty awesome.

Tea selection is surprisingly diverse and very, very good.

The little tea sandwiches that us Americans laugh at (with our footlong pastramis from Togo's)-- well, the chicken and asparagus is seriously nom-worthy. The roast beef and horseradish somewhat less so, but the tomato and cheese is again surprisingly good. Who'dya thunk?

The tea biscuit with jam and butter (oh the butter!) is tasty too, and scones-- well, they weren't what we expected. They reminded us of a super-light, crispy pancake. If the thought of a super-light yet crispy pancake sounds good to you, well, it sounded good to us too.

I'll be in my kitchen tomorrow trying to figure out how to copy it... can someone bring the special butter and the jam?
author: Brian W.

description: Meh.  Nothing special.  I've been to a few tea rooms and Lovejoy's was my least favorite by far because nothing really stood out.  I think we liked 1 out of the 3 teas we ordered. The sandwiches were boring and SUPER tiny...half the size of a normal tea sandwich somewhere else. It was just OK.
author: Leanne J.

description:
The boyfriend wanted afternoon tea after late night, so we looked at Gridskipper's guide to "High Tea Places in Jolly San Francisco" at http://gridskipper.com/travel/san-francisco/high-tea-in-jolly-old-san-francisco-305421.php   

We rolled up and looked into Lovejoy's late on a Sunday afternoon to see nothing but girls -- sixteen year old girls, twentysomethings, families of girls (and maybe the odd forty-year old father-figure). I laughed. Apparently afternoon tea is a "girlie" thing here with cutesy mismatched china. Anthropologie the clothing store on crack was my first thought. 

But the food was pretty good, the service prompt, and the bottomless tea pot is perfect to combat the chilly San Francisco winter. This isn't the place to bring boys, but if you want to break out the floral skirt and have a super-girlie get-together, this is the place for you.
author: Angie C.

description:
I've always been a fan of Lovejoy's. I usually get their High Tea. Their sandwiches are good and their scones are DELICIOUS!! The decor at the tea room is really cute too.

Recently hosted a baby shower there and I must say, they have everything down to a T. I really appreciated that. The service was excellent!! For large parties (up to 20 guests), you get 2 hours for your tea time. The waitresses, especially Samantha, were very good about letting you know how much time you have remaining (which is good because when you're having such a good time, it's easy to lose track of time!) without being pushy or mean. Our tea and food were brought out as soon as all the guests had a chance to sit down. An area was set aside for the presents. They brought out a plastic garbage bag for all the wrapping paper/garbage in case we wanted to open presents. The leftover food was boxed up so that we could bring the leftovers home. They even helped us take a group photo outside, around the corner, in front of the Lovejoy's painted on the wall, which I think all groups do! The staff at Lovejoy's really think of everything so that hosting an event there is stress-free and quite enjoyable!!
author: Anne K.

description:
" Sorry Honey, but the jam is not homemade. I just saw a jar of Smuckers in the back." - my girlfriend who came back from the restroom!

Teas Worthy of Trying:
-Passonfruit Black Tea (aromatic, but has a stronger/darker taste)
-Mango Black Tea (very aromatic)
-Pomegranate Green Tea (light, couldn't really taste the pomegranate)
-English Tea (if you like milk tea - this is your cup of tea)

I had the Savory Tea (2 types of sandwiches + Pot of Tea), selected the LoveJoy's Special (Turkey + Cranberries) and Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese.  The Smoked Salmon was extremely salty (which is very consistent to previous reviews by other yelpers).  Turkey and Cranberry Sandwich was very simple, nothing special.

I'm not a scone person, but I was able to sample some.  The scones were exceptionally fluffy and light with the perfect hint of raspberries.

Since it was one of my girlfriend's birthday, LoveJoy's complimented the birthday girl with one of the petit four + candle (which was a definite bonus).

Definitely make a reservation before coming!  Service is exceptional! Parking wasn't too horrible - near residential area. 

Maybe High Tea is just not my cup of tea.
author: Steph L.

description:
Love love love!  

I was amazed that they let you split the tea service here.  It was fantastic and I will be back.  

The food, tea and service was excellent.  Be sure to make a reservation!
author: michelle D.

description: So much fun.  My daughter used to love to come here and wear her pretty dresses.
author: Ellen K.

description:
I love tea.  I mean, REALLY REALLY love tea.  There is NOTHING better than a perfect cup of black tea, with a bit of sugar and milk.  Herbal tea makes me feel better when I'm sick and without fail, I have a cup of black tea at least once a day.

So, for the girl who thinks that having a perfect cup of tea is the high point of her day (I'm simple.. what can I say) I didn't know it could get this much better!

Lovejoy's offers a beautiful traditional tea experience with a bit of whimsy and all the charm of an English tea room.  Beautiful porcelain tea cups, saucers and tea pots set atop lacey doodles with colorful tablecloths make the perfect tea party for two, three or up to 20 some odd people for larger parties.

And so came the bottomless pot o tea, tiered platters, complete with fresh, hot scones topped with Devon cream and preserves, and tiny crust-less sandwiches of our choosing, with cole slaw and mixed greens.

Heaven, perfection, and love all wrapped up into a high tea experience!  And they even had soy milk for me to put in my tea!!!!!!
author: Jacquie L.

description:
You go here for the experience obviously.
It's like a grandmothers house. All the saucers, teacups and pots are mismatched and many have chips on them.
The service is nice and helpful.

If you don't mind spending more money on having a nice, quiet time its nice to experience tea here at least once.

The food is Ok. Nothing to rave about. We got High Tea for Two. Nothing too memorable.

With nice company who also enjoys a nice tea time, Lovejoy's is fun for brunch sometime.
author: Nona T.

description:
So cute, so adorable and so picture worthy!  This place captures every girl's heart for a nice relax afternoon high tea.  

We didn't make advanced enough reservation and we called in 11am on Saturday to see if we would be lucky enough.  At first we were told that there was no opening, but by 1pm, they called us back for one cancellation.  So besides us being lucky, I guess they also managed their schedules pretty effectively. 

We went for the high tea package.  For the sandwiches, their choices made my brain surrender.  The pear and stilton was nice, so was the salmon mousse and the bay shrimp and mayonnaise.  The scones were wonderful, fluffy, sweet and tasty!  The tea choices were abundant and they came with tea pod, filter and a beautiful cup set.  

The service was good, only problem, it was so popular that we were only allowed to stay up to certain hours.  After 3.30pm, we were no longer so royal and had to pack up and leave for the next guests. 

As if they were not cute enough, there is a shop setup on the opposite side of the street for souveniors, anything from aprons to tea pots.  They know how to get to girls!
author: LeeLee C.

description:
This place deserves four stars for the ambiance, but the food was more a three.

Lovejoy's furnishings are a patchwork collection of Victorian armchairs, kitschy cat tea pots,  and charming British "keep calm, carry on" type art pieces. Nothing really matches but that's what makes the place just "work". 

As for the food, my friends and I tried the "High Tea".  On a three tiered plate came: 

    -chicken apple walnut, egg and onion, cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches; honestly this was pretty disappointing.  Perhaps they were in a rush when cutting off the crust because some of the "sandwiches" ended up being no larger than the size of my pinkie finger. 

-scones (good), coleslaw (meh), spring greens (I ate some, but it seems more like filler since placed under the sandwiches)

- a pot per person of endless tea; excellent tea!

With tax and tip it was about $25 a person. 

The service was a bit of a miss for me. A little over an hour in, and our server asked us if we were through with our plates; this happened two more times. I found it odd since there were no people waiting for the table, and most of the other parties in the room seemed to be lounging around just as long. Didn't really appreciate feeling rushed out. 

Loved the random mix of china, tea pots and cups they served everything on. This is a great place to hang out and catch up with your girl friends.
author: Leslie T.

description: It is way to overpriced for the cheap food they give. It is a sandwich with white bread and some filling and they charge like $4-5 dollars. Also I came with a friend and we ordered, after a bought ten mintues the waitress came back telling us we have to spend at least $12 each to be able to stay two hours. For one, I don't believe we wanted to stay for that long and two they should say that before we order. I mean are they going to kick us out because we don't want to order about $3 worth of more food. Any ways even though this bugged me I still looked at their menu but honestly didn't find anything we wanted, so we decided to get some little desserts they had in trays. The dessert isn't even made there they buy it from a bakery called Diana's. The tea was tasty but we only served ourselves one cup each then the waitress added more water completely changing the taste of the tea. After that they tea tasted like hot water. We were going to be fine with just one pot but we didn't even get to enjoy it. The rest of the food wasn't good it was very plain. Once we were given the check we were told we could stay there for as long as we like and I thought yeah about two hours worth. We paid and sat for a while( I wasn't feeling good and I wanted to sit until I felt better), but the waitresses kept on walking by and looking at us. It made us feel uncomfortable like if they were telling us to leave already.
author: Ivania M.

description:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is the first tea room that I've ever been to and I found it absolutely exquisite. The decorations perfectly suit the theme of a real tea party, and for some reason it strongly reminds me of that teacup ride back in Disneyland, which of course would make anyone think happy thoughts.

Anyways, my party of four and I ordered a Shepherd's Pie, two teas (Yorkshire Gold Black Tea & Pomegranate Green Tea), & various tea sandwiches, which were all very satisfactory and delicious. I'd recommend the Yorkshire Gold, as the Pomegranate Green wasn't really for me. The waitress said the Yorkshire Gold kind of resembles a coffee or English tea flavor, and I really can't describe it in words but I thought it was pretty good. The Shepherd's Pie is cooked in a loaf pan with a baked potato layer on the very top, followed by a mashed potato composition on the bottom mixed with peas and ground beef. It was a great appetizer to split among the four of us! The tea sandwiches served as the perfect snack as well, but definitely are not enough to fill you up. We got the salmon mousse tea sandwiches and the bay shrimp tea sandwiches, and personally I like the bay shrimp tea sandwiches more. The salmon mousse tea sandwiches have goat or feta cheese in it, which I particularly am not a fan of.

Overall, this place deserves 5/5 stars for exquisite customer service and a fancy decorative interior :)
author: Michelle S.

description:
Parking in the morning is difficult. Be sure to come a bit early since a lot of people will be waiting outside those doors (unless you make reservations at least a week in advance).

The food is delicious and the atmosphere is very welcoming (and endearing).

My favorite? Get the Queen's Tea!
author: Nina M.

description:
So I was really excited to try this place with a few of my girlfriends on a nice sunny Sunday. We made reservations ahead of time *HIGHLY RECOMMENDED* since this place is tiny and seems to be very busy at all times. The decor is very country imagine a scene from Alice in Wonderland where all the tableware, china and teacups do not match. Everyone in my party ordered the Queen's Tea since it was our first time there we wanted to try everything. It was $24.95 per person and we get our own pot of tea and a bunch of different things for us to sample.  

The presentation was really nice tall and filled with tons of mini treats.  The coleslaw lacked flavor. The crumpet that was served at the end wasn't bad either but by then I was stuffed suprinsingly because I thought I wouldn't be full from the looks of it initially. Rosaline's recommendations:-

-Mango Black Tea
-China Rose Petal
-Chicken & Asparagus Sandwich
-Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Sandwich
-EggSalad Sandwich
-Scones (make sure to load it with the devon cream and jam!!!)

So final recap if you come to Lovejoy make sure to try the SCONES and their CRUMPETS and spread the lemon creme all over. The reason why I gave it 3 stars is because the sandwichs was nothing special especially when I noticed they used Safeway branded breads and also my tea wasn't hot enough. If  I come back I wouldn't order the Queens tea again.  Till next time eat laugh and say YUM-O!!!
author: Rosaline C.

description: This place is cute and the idea is great.
author: Diana T.

description:
They've got gadgets and gizmos aplenty
They've got whozits and whatzits galore
(You want thingamabobs? They got twenty)
But who cares?
No big deal
I want more...

I want to be where the tea sandwiches are! I want to see, want to see them dancing... Er um wait, I'm getting carried away with my Little Mermaid references. Anyhoo... we came here for a friend's baby shower and sat in the window table, and everything was adorable. They definitely have a lot of gadgets and gizmos about decorating the tea room.

How is it that one can eat more sandwiches when they are cut into tiny pieces? I wolfed down my share in minutes then looked around to see the ladies I was with chatted and drank tea in such a dainty way and slowly noshed on their sandwiches. *sigh*

The 8 of us all shared 4 orders of the High Tea for 2.

I ordered the blood orange tea and then the chicken apple walnut sandwich and pear and stilton cheese. Both sandwiches were delicious and the tea was flavorful and really nice.  The best part was the scone however, which was warm and fresh and I caressed this scone with a healthy helping of devonshire cream. 

Fantastic experience here in terms of eats and a feast for the eyes, my only wish is that you could sit around gabbing longer, but alas they give you a limited amount of time for your reservation and need to get going soon after the timing ends.
author: Jessica C.

description:
For years, whenever I went to work or had to go downtown, I would take the J and pass by LJ's all the time but never had an excuse to go.

My friend hosted a party there over the weekend and I took my mom. Here was my attempt of explaining it to her:

Mom: What is this place we are going? A restaurant?
Me: Ok, so you remember Alice in Wonderland?
Mom: Yes!
Me: Ok, so remember the Mad Hatter and the Rabbit? How they sat at a long table and ate snacks and tea? THATS where we're going to. 
Mom: Oh.

When I went inside, I realized I was kind of right. I was surprised at the homey feeling it had. The sofas, chairs, cups and tea pots mismatch in a very cute way. The waitresses were really friendly and nice to our group even though we were hella loud. 

I was dissapointed at the food. It felt like some of the sandwiches had too much mayo and other condiments Disclaimer: I hate mayo, so if you can tolerate it, you'd probably like it.

I loved how the sandwiches were served in a tower-like thing, and there was salad inside it too. They had a wide variety of nice teas.

I'll give it another chance, most def a place to hit up when you wanna chill with your buddies on a cold, foggy day. But next time I'll ask to hold the mayo.
author: Sophia G.

description:
Though a Lovejoy's was definitely a bit on the more pricy side for starving college students, it was worth the splurge for my housemate's 21st birthday. We all decided to get a high tea and get the birthday girl the Queen's tea, and here are my comments from that day:

1.) The service was excellent. The lady took our order was very sweet and helpful in helping us pick out teas.
2.) The sandwiches were delicious. So good. And the salad was pretty good, and this is coming from someone who doesn't really like salad. 
2a.) Now, the food might seem like it's little. But it was enough for us. We even had to take some home for leftovers. Or maybe a late night snack.
3.) My friend's seasonal chestnut flavored tea was so sweet and delicious. To die for. All the teas were great actually. Did I die and go to tea heaven?
4.) The decor at the place definitely kept me interested. Mismatched tea cups and coat hangers all added to Lovejoy's charm.

I really wish I was in San Francisco right now so I can go and get some Lovejoy's, but my cravings can just wait.
author: Jessica H.

description:
After months on the waiting list (I exaggerate) (but only a little) (maybe), my family finally scored a table fit for royalty at Lovejoy's. We each got our own Me Tea, which allowed us to pick from a list of tempting sandwiches, scones, and other tasty teatime treats.

Their houseblend tea is phenomenal. All of their others are somehow also outstanding. I could have happily ordered every tiny sandwich on the menu, but opted for a special that day of curried chicken - good choice! The scones are just the right amount of moist and crumbly. Everything was delivered to the table perfectly inoffensively and our waitress gladly took all of my parents questions about the various teapots and cozies around the room.

Maybe it was because there was so much buildup for this place, but I was just so excited the whole time I was there - this high tea was HAPPENING, and only a mile from my apartment! Lovejoy's certainly lived up to the hype and I would love to go back eventually.

It was also surprisingly not crazy-expensive.
author: Lia S.

description:
Everyone who knows me knows that I do not have a sweet tooth.  I'm not a big fan of desserts and sweets so I think the other girls were way more excited than I was about the scones and pastries.  However, I was really impressed with the BLACK TEA! I really could not get enough of it and have never had anything come close to it.  It was  really rich and went down very smooth.  The sandwiches were good but not spectacular because if I can make it in my kitchen then its not spectacular. My fav was the salmon cream cheese sandwich though. I loved the collection of of tea pots and cups. Very fun place.

Overall, cute little place for a girls get together. We all had a great time. Would definitely come back ... FOR THE BLACK TEA!
author: Song C.

description:
BREWING THE BAY: British afternoon tea

This might be the strangest five-star review I've ever written. It's strange because I don't think Lovejoy's is superior to its competitors in any of the areas I judge a British tea room on, and usually that has to be the case to warrant 5 stars from me. However, sometimes things are greater than the sum of their parts and my overall experience at Lovejoy's was five-star.

Decor and Ambience: Like many British tea rooms, Lovejoy's is dotted throughout with fancy, antique teaware. The quaint setting is accented with old photos and Christmas lights. There's ample seating, although reservations are a must and the seating can accomodate parties large and small. Expect a pleasant buzz of chatter at all hours of operation

Teaware: The saucers, cups and strainers have lovely Victorian designs with Mid-Century modern materials. The tea trays were a little disappointing--dull and metal

Tea selection: Lovejoy's offers some unique options like vanilla rooibos along with classics like English Breakfast. I didn't find the former very good, but I'd definitely recommend the "house" tea, the Tea Room Blend. Overall, I think the menu offers a good selection of British/Western favorites, but those hoping for good Asian options might be disappointed

Food: I found the prices a little high, considering the portion size, but the quality is definitely above average. I got the "Me Tea". The smoked salmon and cream cheese tea sandwich came on fluffy white bread and the salmon was moist and delicious. The scone was a little dry, but the accompanying Devonshire cream was plentiful and rich. I saw that Lovejoy's offered pasties and I just had to order a beef one. When I lived in London, I had the most delicious beef pasties and it's been extremely hard for me to find good ones in the US. Lovejoy's had a fantastic filling of flavorful beef and diced carrots with just the right amount of seasoning. The pastry shell was flaky, but the ones I had in England were thicker and crisper. I also tried two petit fours: the strawberry shortcake and the raspberry Victorian wedding cake. We were told the insides were marzipan (which I'm not really a fan of), but they were more like cake. Both were very sweet and delicious, but I think I preferred the strawberry shortcake

Service: Fantastic. Friendly, warm, attentive and efficient. All servers knew their menus inside and out, and were clearly passionate about afternoon tea

All in all, I had a wonderful afternoon chatting with my two Boston girlfriends who had just moved to San Francisco. Enjoying the company of good friends while sipping hot tea and nibbling delicious food--is there any better form of paradise? :)
author: Josephine L.

description:
My friend & I were excited about our trip to Love Joy's since so many raved about this place! However, it didn't live up to the hype.

3 stars:
Love their name, service & attic shop across the street.
Like ambiance, tea & scones.
Sandwiches were a disappointment.

We've been to a less known tea room where all the food was delish, wish it would have been the same for Love Joy's.
author: Geraldine R.

description:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is nothing short of magical.  Comfortably nestled in Noe Valley, I always look forward to high tea here every time I'm in the area.  The tea room is a cozy size, with British paraphrenalia scattered about and dainty chairs and tables that make you feel like a hoity-toity fancypants (without the snobbish air, of course)!  I feel like a princess every time I've been there for high tea.

Three cheers for bottomless tea!  I am a tea fanatic and can't get enough of it!! Their ginseng green tea is superb, very light and not too bitter.  The ginseng is a plus too. I absolutely love their pesto and prosciutto sandwich (available only on Fridays I believe), the pesto is zesty and the prosciutto is ever so tasty.  Their chicken salad sandwich is divine, and don't even get me started on their smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwich! Yummy!!  Their scones are also to die for, and paired with the lemon curd...delicous!  Lovejoy's lemon curd is also perfect!  It's not too tart and has that perfect balance of sweet and tangy that creates a symphony of delight in your mouth!

I could boast about their shepherd's pie and brag endlessly about their delectable pasties as well as their cheerful and polite staff--always willing to give the absolute best service to their customers. 

I will definitely be frequenting Lovejoy's every few weeks or so because, accurately reflecting the five stars they deserve, they're as good as it gets!!
author: Paula G.

description:
Came here for a birthday lunch with my mom.  We made reservations so our table said, "Reserved for Royalty" - cute touch!  We picked the Queen's Tea which gave us two choices of sandwiches each, a salad, coleslaw, two scones with lemon curd (kicking myself for not buying a bottle) and a jam, fruit, 2 crumpets, and we each chose a tea that was refilled and kept fresh throughout our lunch.  We were so full by the end of it.  The turkey sandwich with a port wine cheese was so good.  I also enjoyed the chicken salad sandwich.  

The decor was lovely.  A warm inviting space with mismatched chairs and different style tables.  I believe two seating arrangements had comfy couches.  I loved the vintage tea pots, cups, and saucers.  

We had to go across the street to the Lovejoy shop and buy the apricot tea that we loved.  I also picked up a cup and saucer that I love!

The whole experience was awesome and I will definitely be back!
author: Aimee L.

description:
I only knocked down a star since its my first time enjoying high tea, so I'm unsure if its really "as good as it gets" but the going sure is gooooood.

I came here to reunite with three of my friends whom I've known almost all of my childhood, so we were bound to catch up and talk about the past year (since we haven't reunited with all of us together for a year or so)

We decided on High Tea for for four, enjoying the cucumber and creamcheese, bay shirmp, smoked salmon and cream cheese, and the chicken apple walnut. I had the pomegranate green for myself, which was delicious... and bottomless! Soo amazing!
