The service was very attentive and welcoming, it was the perfect place to spend from 3:00 till closing talking and updating each other on what was going on in our lives. We didn't feel awkward or feel like we needed to leave, it was like we were in our own house.

The decor is great, the mismatched tea pots and cups were adorable. We paid 25 each including tax and tip for high tea and petit fours, which is quite reasonable considering we each got bottomless tea, salad, coleslaw, 8 mini sandwiches, a scone and a tea biscuit. I also had the lemon curd petit four, which was tasty, albiet a bit sweet after having the tea biscuit and clotted cream scone but I couldn't resist how cute they were!

Most of the time my reviews focus on the food rather then the service (I will go back to a yummy place even if the service is so so) but you really pay for the experience/ambiance here. My time here was just amazing and fun.
author: Samantha D.

description: Super cute tea room with antique decorations and china. We came here for a bridal shower and the staff was accommodating but were strict on the 2 hour time limit.   I thought the tea was unique and delicious.  The towers of sandwiches and scones were aesthetically set up but I was a bit disappointed in the taste.  The sandwiches were very ordinary and plain and the scones were a bit too sweet.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I have been to Lovejoy's twice and each time is better than the next.  Their tea selection is amazing and the food is perfect.  The decor only adds to the uniqueness of this hidden gem!  It is a place for people of all ages - I celebrated my sister's 24th birthday there and my friend's bridal shower.  Get all dressed up or just stop in, either way you will have a great time!
author: Cassie Y.

description:
Between us we ordered two savory teas (one regular and one gluten free).
All sandwiches can be made gluten free and I had the Cucumber and Cream Cheese Sandwich (tasty but a bit dry) and the Branston Pickle Chutney and Cheese Sandwich (excellent).

We shared a plate of gluten free scones  (nice and light and just like homemade), the preserves and cream were good too. We also shared a plate of gluten free crumpets which came with Meyer Lemon Curd and were very very good indeed.

I ought to add that it was a great experience walking into a tea shop, a place that might otherwise be considered a temple of wheat flour, and be able to order such delectables as scones and crumpets gluten free--at no fuss at all, and so well made.

We were also very happy with the service, and can't wait to go back.
author: M P.

description:
I came here for a birthday party a few weekends ago.  I was really worried since I'm actually not allowed to have caffeine and I wasn't sure what the situation here would be in terms of teas I could drink.  I usually stick with ginger or peppermint tea since I know those are safe, but I didn't see them on the menu.  Good thing though!  I opted for the Forest Berries and Rose Hips.  This is the best tea I've had in a long time.  It's like sipping candy and it made me smile!  I loved it so much I rushed across the street afterward and bought two bags of this tea!

I got the "Me Service" since I had lunch before our tea service, so I just got the shortbread and petit fours and a crumpet with meyer lemon.  Delicious!  Everyone else was raving about the scones with the cream (I didn't have any) and the sandwiches look so cute.

One of my friends had the truffle chocolate tea and he added a splash of milk and proclaimed it was like drinking chocolate milk.  Yum!

I definitely want to come back here with my girlfriends at another time!
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
I've been coming to Lovejoy's for years now. It's perfect for Mother's Day, a date with the girls, and (in the future) my baby shower! I love the mismatched tea cozies and dishes and the service has always been top notch. The only downside is that in order to make a reservation (and this is a MUST DO) you almost always have to book 2-3 weeks in advance. They never answer their phones so you'll have to leave a voicemail and they call you back. Also, I wish they would use a different type of bread, I swear they become stale 10 minutes after being served. Try their house tea (it's a black tea) and put some of the fresh cream on your scones!

High Tea per person: $19.95 (choice of tea, 2 sandwiches, a scone, a shortbread cookie, and salad greens)
author: Vanessa T.

description:
You know the Queen Mum was ALWAYS asking me to tea when I lived in London*, and I found Lovejoy's to be as incredible as as the best places I went across the pond. Though even more wonderful because they have a healthy plate (whole wheat or gluten-free crackers, salad) and off-beat tea choices that us crazy California kids like but you wouldn't see at afternoon tea at Browns of London. I couldn't resist at least trying the scones and other traditional tea treats, and they were fresh and incredible. 

The service is sweet instead of fussy. I love that the seating is designed for two-tops as well as corner nooks with couches for groups--we had a festive baby shower there without bothering the serious afternoon tea goers. 

*I did live in London, and I even met the Queen Mum, but I only went to proper tea a few times, and sadly, never with royalty.
author: Gretchen T.

description: Loved the ambience and food! Specially the scones were delicious. Enjoyed the sandwich as well.
author: Rabita M.

description: Awesome high tea! My Canadian mother is visiting and I took her to Lovejoys. Absolutely wonderful service, such a cute atmosphere, and delicious tea. The food is really good, and I will definitely be coming back! I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a genuine English tea experience.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: It's been a while since I've been here but the place is SO dirty. There are cobwebs hanging from the ceiling in the restroom. You can see the kitchen also on your way to the restroom and it looked filthy in there. The scones are really good with the devon creme. I ordered the Vanilla Rooibus de-caf tea which was really good too. I prefer Samovar Tea Lounge which is a cleaner place (the downtown location has an awesome view).
author: Mel T.

description: Thank you yelp for this find! My mom surprised me with saying her and my Aunt from Japan wanted to hang out in the city that day with me. I told them I'd call then back once I figured out some (family-friendly) fun things to do. Got in the same day, they had a blast and I certainly earned my "awesome daughter of the day" badge. It also was so reasonable I was a a bit overwhelmed (like, I could actually afford to take my aunt and mom out for this much fun? - I've been to quite a number of high tea places in the city - it's usually pretty steep.) I have every intention of planning a girl's outting here again soon.
author: Kate R.

description:
My sister and I came in for a spot of tea a few weeks ago. the decor is very.. shabby chic. I am not generally a fan of this, but my sister really liked it. We got first pick of our table so we picked the table with the most comfy looking chairs near the window. We chose the queen's tea for two. I was pleased that you are able to choose your sandwiches, we chose:
chicken apple walnut: best sandwich!
special: chicken pesto: very good!
turkey and dijon mustard: meh. it was ok
Onto the teas. 
 we picked vanilla rooibis or however you spell it and the berry harvest thingie. It tasted like warmed up fruit punch. I did not like the selections of teas, it might just be me, but i feel like other places have better selections. the Vanilla was okay though! 

the scones were delicious of course, i liked the sandwiches. I too, thought the coleslaw is totally random. I asked if we could sub the coleslaw and greens for fruit, they said no. ugh. I hate when establishments say no to customers. the petite fours were okay, Actually, I guess everything was kind of just okay. it sucks because I love crown and crumpet, but I hate that you can't choose your sandwiches, etc. So I thought I'd try Lovejoy's, and I didn't want this review to be a compare and contrast to crown and crumpet but in my honest opinion, crown and crumpet is just the better choice. 
oh and for reference, we came from stockton, took the bart from dublin/pleasanton, and got off on 24th and mission and took a 4 minute cab ride to church and clipper. easy peasy!
author: ren u.

description:
I was looking for a kitschy tea room for my birthday, and Lovejoy's fit the bill exactly. We went on Halloween and all the waitresses even dressed up as men with mustaches ("We thought it would be funny to dress up as men since there are hardly any that come here.")

I ordered the "Healthy Tea", which was ginormous! I consider myself a big eater with a bottomless stomach, but I could not finish the plate--excuse me, I mean platter! The Healthy Tea came with one of the most delicious hummus (hummi?) I've ever tried and the yogurt brought out the sweetness of the strawberries and was a soft accompaniment to the crackers and veggies.

We also had the High Tea at our table, and the sandwiches, cookies, and such were all delicious. No complaints.

I'm not much of a tea connoisseur, so I'll just say that I ordered the Blood Orange Herbal Tea, and it tasted exactly as such.

The only complaint is that we sat next to a glass china cabinet and there was a picture inside of Barack Obama. They need to take that out. . .It ruins the whole atmosphere.

...Also have to add...We were there around closing time, and we felt a little rushed, so we hurried out. We were sitting outside for awhile waiting for our ride, and when we got home, we realized we had left our box inside the tea room on the couch. I don't know why they couldn't have given it back to us while they were cleaning up inside and we were waiting just outside the door.
author: Kym M.

description: I like this environment, I ordered a rose tea with egg&onion sandwich and turkey sandwich, it were good! But I perfer scone in here, it was soft and delicious. I think it's a best scone ever.
author: Maggie T.

description:
Such good service! 

I came here a week ago with my old friend, who recommended the place. 

The servers were really attentive and didn't rush us out the door. They were very good with refilling our pot of teas!

It was my first time at a tea room and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. 

The sandwiches I ordered wasn't that impressive but I really did enjoy the experience and the service.

They have seating for large parties but I think if you have more than 4 people you should definitely made a reservation instead of just showing up and testing your luck. Me and my friend were lucky to have seating available( the two tables in the front that are always open to drop in customers) , but the lady informed me that they were filled until March 2012. 

This is a beautiful place to bring a friend to treat them out for an afternoon of high tea and catch up!
author: Helen L.

description:
Went here for my birthday/father's day, and absolutely loved it! I had picked here because the Crown & Crumpet is in the process of moving, and couldn't have picked a better place.
The food was wonderful, a good variety, including both vegetarian and gluten free options. The chicken and asparagus tea sandwich was amazing!  The crumpets and scones were so good.
I love that the teacups, saucers and teapots are all different patterns and don't match, it adds a unique feel to the room.
The service was wonderful, everyone was polite and very prompt. I even got a birthday treat!
I will definitely be returning here in the future!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Lovely spot for tea lovers. The place is super charming... it looks like a grandma's house filled with cool decor objects and good food. 

The tea selection is really good and the sandwich options are pretty unique and flavorful. They offer a lot of different tea services, so you will certainly find one that fits your taste (and budget). 

All the servers are super friendly and they keep an eye on your tea to make sure everything is perfect. 

Definitely a good place to go for a "girls afternoon" or to take your mom or anyone that also enjoys tea.
author: Gisele M.

description: I don't think you can leave this place without feeling completely full. I've been here at least a dozen times, and every time has been enjoyable. The scone, the sandwiches & the cups of tea all compliment one another. I always try to find other high tea places, but no where else comes close in comparison.
author: Rachel L.

description:
My standards are very high since my mother is English and hosts formal tea all the time.  I came here during the holidays (after finding them on Yelp) and had a lovely time with a girlfriend of mine. I had the basic tea service with cookies, scones and little sandwiches.  The service was outstanding and the food was delicious.  
  
It is a very kid friendly atmosphere and there were a number of ladies with children at the location.
author: Nic B.

description:
The decor of this place is super cute.  I love all the different teapots and the mismatched plates and tea equipment.  The atmosphere is really nice.

Service:  We went on a very rainy day.  So it wasnt so crowded.  We had a reservation and even though it wasn't crowded, I highly recommend making a reservation.  There is a 2 hour maximum in which a table has time to eat - and there is a good reason for that - I am guessing most if not all, maximize this 2 hour.  We stayed until 10 minutes after closing.  The wait staff were super polite and accomodating.  They didn't rush us, and offered boxes.

Food: The food is really good here.  Obviously this isn't a foodie's choice if you are a hipster.  The scones though, man, it was so warm and fluffy and so good. The sandwhiches I had were:
Salmon and Cream Cheese: My favorite one by far, super flavorful.  Any of their sandwhiches with salmon is good.
Chicken and Walnut Salad:  A review recommended this.  It was quite bland and there really wasn't much to it.  Don't bother with this.
Sandwich of the day - Ham and Mango Chutney:  I thought this was pretty meh too.  An interesting combination at first, but nothing amazing.
I liked the crumpet - but none of my friends did.  A very fluffy and pancaky english muffin.  Slather  generous portions of butter, devonshire cream, lemon curd, and raspberry jam to get something truly amazing.  Those crumpets have holes for a reason.
The petit four - You have four option, a sugar cookie, some mini cupcakes and 2 types of marzipan mini cakes.  The plum rose marzipan cake was overwhelmed by the marzipan.  However the bittersweet orange one had a good balance of marzipan and flavor.  That one was good, We didn't bother with the other options as they seemed very plain.
All in all, if we did this, my friends agreed they would only do Tea and Scones, because really those were the highlights. but I like the crumpet, and only the salmon sandwich.
The fennel/caraway coleslaw salad was very good.  I didn't care about the green salad or the fruit on top.  I would have had the coleslaw, scone, and crumpet again.  But just one sandwiches(salmon) and no petit four.

Tea:  I tried the passion fruit tea.  It was very pleasant.  
I wasn't impressed by the masala chai.  But My god - I forgot what my friend got - I think the royal blend.  I never had tea like that before. The flavor was really complex, fruity and it even felt like there were multiple blends of black tea.  I was also very impressed by the black vanilla.  I had so many vanilla type teas I rolled my eyes when I saw the menu.  But when I tried my friends cup, I was blown away.  The vanilla flavor wasn't anything I have tasted before.  I hate it when I have vanilla tea or flavored anything because it just reminds me of extract.  This felt like a different species of vanilla, and tasted very organic and felt very "infused" 

My biggest regret is that they offered to give the remains of the tea in the pot to go.  and I thought it silly to take it with me.  Now I am having massive cravings for the royal blend and the black vanilla and I can't do anything about it.

Price doesn't usually affect my yelp reviews.  But for four people all ordering Queen's Service - it came out to $35.00 with tax and tip included.  Please do not come here to just try the tea and food, this really is a social and dining experience.  Come with good friends and make sure you order different teas(they are bottomless teas anyway!)
author: Derek C.

description:
I've been to high tea time at a few places, but this is the one place I would come back to!  My good friend and I had reservations for 3:30 this afternoon, and we had the best seat in the house next to the window!  

Service was prompt and friendly, and we caught up on all our girly talk over High Tea Time for Two - four kinds of sandwiches (we picked cucumber & cream cheese, smoked salmon & cream cheese, chicken & asparagus, ham & dijon mustard), sweet scones, cole slaw, salad and two pots of tea (I had the Blood Orange tea, very good -- my friend likes her stand-by Black Currant tea).  

I thought everything was yummy and just right for the two of us, plus it was reasonably priced.  We stayed for two and a half hours, and not once did I feel like we were rushed out the door - just right!  Thank you, Lovejoy's for a very enjoyable Saturday afternoon!
author: Maile N.

description: Decided to check this place out after reading some of the old reviews the decor is cute but too stuffy for my taste the servers like stated before are cordial but not warm(just like the trumpets and scones) the food is very unimpressive,small and cheaply plated do not read the 2 year old 4 star reviews like I did obviously this tearoom has changed and isn't 4 stars anymore
author: Aki M.

description:
My wife and I have been going to Lovejoy's with friends and relatives since Gillian and Muna first bought the place, and we love it.  

So when we planned our afternoon wedding, we decided that we wanted Lovejoy's to cater it.  No surprise, it was perfect.  Of course, the sandwiches & scones & petit fours were delicious, but the presentation was so impressive - our friends loved it!  

Everything was on giant silver multi-tiered serving stands, and there was a big silver urn for the tea.  The food was wrapped to keep it fresh until we served it, and there were fruit slices for garnish.  We also used Lovejoy's' wonderful trademark "mismatched" cups, saucers and plates.  It was so elegant and beautiful, and all of our guests enjoyed it.  

Also not surprisingly, making the plans with Gillian was so easy and pleasant; she could not have been more accommodating. 

 Lucky us - one of our guests gave us a gift certificate to Lovejoy's as a wedding gift - not that we need any incentive to go there as often as possible!
author: Kate B.

description:
Lovejoy's is a stunning medley of charm, passion, and character.

I take back everything I said about over the top. It was a lame statement of me to make. I don't think I really understood the high standard that I was experiencing at Lovejoy's until I visited other Tea Rooms in the city. 

Everything just melts together. Everything is darling. Everything feels right. Homey. And perfect.

And the food.

The food is what really makes Lovejoys stand out from all of the rest of the Tea Rooms in San Francisco.

It's the best around. 

The sandwiches are perfect. From the freshly cut bread, to the selection, to the fresh ingredients lightly placed inside each slice of wheaty goodness. Their Pear and Stilton are a must.

The scones - are always warm;  pillows of doughy, buttery goodness. And paired with the thick Devon cream and fresh jam preserves they are unreal. Think better than nutella on warm bread  - and that's pretty darn good.

And well...I could continue...

But I may get repetitive with the adjectives; beautiful, heaven, and perfection just keep floating up.

You can't go wrong with anything at Lovejoys. Anybody and everybody will appreciate it. Their food and tea is not cheap, but keep in mind that you're paying for the best and for a thoroughly unique San Francisco tea experience.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Of all the times we've been to Lovejoy's, today was disappointing. Four of us ordered two Queen Teas  ($27.99 each) and a couple different teas. The two Queen Teas came out on a single tiered dish, so we thought we were waiting for one more order by the look of the portion. A few of us ordered multiple orders of the same tea. One watery tea pot was brought out and we were told that three of us would need to share one pot. The ratio of tea to water was skimpy so no amount of steeping helped. Only hot water refill was offered, not more tea. What we'll do differently next time is request the Queen Teas to be served separately, and for each order of tea to be served in individual tea pots. For the price they charge, it's too bad you have to request this.
author: Redloci R.

description: Food was okay but 36 dollars for crust less sandwiches one good scone one bad crumpet one 1" petite four and all the tea you can  drink as long as you can get their attention to fill the pot. . . Hope that if you arrive early the weather is good as they will not seat you early inside and send you out to the bench.
author: David L.

description:
Make reservations if you're coming on a weekend, otherwise, good luck! Super cute place with flowery decor and "cutsie" stuff everyone. I was bit overwhelmed by this place since everything was so girly and I am far from girly if you know me. 

Overall, this is a nice experience to have and good for those baby shower events and such. As for food, it's OK and somewhat expensive for what it is, but I think you're paying more for the experience. Portions are small and bite size. They have a nice variety of teas to choose from which I like.

- Sandwiches: salmon good, bay shrimp good, egg ok, chicken salad ok, cream cheese mandarin orange ok
- Scones: delicous! and they are big
- Fruit: refreshing, wish they gave more with the meal

- Teas: chocolate chip was interesting and smelled strongly of chocolate chip but the taste wasn't that strong (good mixed with sugar & milk), japanese rice tea was good, jasmine was very flowery, dragon well was light
author: Linda C.

description:
I took a visiting friend here since it's been a long-time tradition to have tea every time we meet. Located right off a metro stop on the J Line,  I remember passing by the store when I was in 24th Mission but had concluded it was some sort of salon because of its looks.

We arrived 15 minutes before our reservation time, but got seated immediately with a cute sign on the table that said "Reserved for Queens". We ordered "High Tea for Tea", which gave us a substantial amount of food. When it says "four sandwiches" they actually mean four whole sandwiches, not four quarters or four halves like some other tea places. They slice it into quarters, so there were 16 quarters in total.

Savory:
-roast beef and horseradish: This had a nice zing to it provided by the horseradish, 
-chicken apple walnut: This probably had the most filling-to-bread ratio and it tasted like the chicken apple salad that they sell at Costco, which I actually liked
-smoked salmon and cream: Salmon tasted fresh and this was our favorite
-pear and stilton: your standard sharp tasting stilton

Sweets:
The scones were more like biscuits with raisins and I prefer more buttery scones, but props to them for still being somewhat warm when they came out even if they were a little dry. It was served with Devonshire cream and preserves and those were definitely done right!

The shortbread tea biscuits were surprisingly decent tasting. 
We got the Italian wedding cake and a chocolate apricot petit four a la carte. They were $2.50 apiece, which seemed quite steep for a wee piece, but I believe they get it from Dianda's bakery (25th + Mission) that also sells it for the same price.

Ambience: I definitely thought this place was more shabby than chic, like some kind of untouched-for-centuries, dusty house that I would be afraid to touch. I do prefer somewhere that has some finesse, while still keeping the Grandma and girly vibe like Lisa's Tea Treasures,  but this is more a matter of taste preference, so it didn't impact my rating. What did MATTER was the tables were cramped and quite close to each other, making it difficult to go to the bathroom. We could also hear a lot of different conversations. I would prefer more private tables with wider spacing, so I could just relax, but that's just not feasible in a small and popular place. I saw a bridal shower and I felt as if I would want a private room or alcove with less tables if I were them, which is offered in some tea places. The mismatched teapots/cups/strainers resulted in my friend getting a tea strainer that was not wide enough to place on her huge cup, so she had to do a switch-a-roo.

Service: The ladies offered to take a picture for us and were quite prolific in topping off our tea with more water. After some time, it seemed like they were a little too hasty in trying to take our food away before we finished, but nothing super offensive. One of the workers (or manager?) was on the phone, going over some business accounts at the table next to us for a good while, so that was off-putting.
author: Alice L.

description:
My mother & I participated in the ultimate female bonding ritual: High Tea at Lovejoy's Tea Room...

My first thoughts were, did i trip, fall down the rabbit whole & end up as a character in Alice in Wonderland?

LOOK AT ME:
This place is really unique & charming, almost reminds me of an antique shop; there are so many things to gawk at: chandeliers made from spoons, mirrors on the wall, the red British phone booth, a fireplace, hats hanging on a dresser, etc. All their silverware & chairs are mismatched. 

DRINK ME:
High tea for two was $35. We tried two teas: darjeeling black tea, which we drank with milk & sugar like we heard the Queen does & their "special find" of the day which was pomegranate green tea (totally try whatever "special find" they are offering. This one was exquisite.) Each tea was served in a different style teapot. 

EAT ME:
The tea sandwiches were dainty, delicate & delicious & were served on a two tiered porcelain carrier . We chose:
- cucumber & cream cheese (obviously)
- apple walnut chicken salad
- tomato & cheese
- "lovejoy special" of the day- ham & mango chutney
Also included were: salad, cole slaw, two scones & two tea biscuits. We could not stop raving about the scones, which were unusually moist & buttery (as opposed to dense & hard like other scones.) And the double devon cream & strawberry jam made it that much more decadent (a little *too* decadent says my scale.)

ADORE ME:
I just experienced Lovejoy's for the first time this week & I am already planning another trip back ASAP. Prices are decent for the extraordinary tea party experience you get & service was simply marvelous. Don't forget to sip tea with your pinky up (i swear, i DID NOT do this, but you should.)
author: Fancypants X.

description: What can you not say about this place? The decorative knick knacks, the various cups and saucers, and the friendliness of the staff is so warm and welcoming. My sister and friends took me here during my bachelorette weekend and it was a perfect start to our saturday. We all chose our teas, I got the darjeeling tea, and then proceeded to share the large tiers of finger sandwiches (too many to choose from, must go back), salad, coleslaw (which usually I'm not a fan of but they knocked it out by adding cumin seeds), the scones, the warm flaky crumpets with their delicious jam and lemon butter spread! Tell everyone to come to lovejoy's!!!
author: Nida A B.

description:
This place is way too cute. I want to have all my parties here!

I came here with my friend and luckily we got a seat because I don't think my friend made a reservation. The place filled up quick. I got the cream tea with a choice of tea that I cannot exactly remember right now because there's such a huge selection of teas. I wanted to try all of them! Okay, first off, I loved the decoration of this place. I loved the cute tables and chairs, I loved the cute table clothe, and I loved the cute teapots, and plates that served our food. The cream tea choice came with scones, devon cream, and fresh fruits. Omgosh, the scone took my breath away. It was melted in my mouth. I was expecting something super sweet, but nope, it was just perfect. Not too sweet, but not too bland. And the cream and jam were all so good that I kept trying to add both on the scone for every bite. When the tea came out, we had the chance to add our own sugar and cream, so I loved that. I had control over how much diabetes I wanted to give myself. jk. It was fun getting the chance to customize my drink. 

Overall, I really loved coming here. The atmosphere is great, the service is so friendly, and the food is to die for.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
5 of us girls came here on a beautiful day. We all had the high teas. We all got different teas, so we shared them. I must say, be prepared to go to the bathroom plenty of time if you plan on sipping a lot of tea. 

All of us got stuffed with the sandwiches, biscuits, cookies, and veggies. It was the right amount considering we drank a lot of tea.

I love how unique this place is, very cute.
author: Mandy D.

description:
As much as I was eager to give Lovejoys a try, I was very disappointed. It is overpriced for the quantity and portion of the little cakes, sandwiches, cookies and scones one gets. The tab can easily go over $50.00 for just two people. And, what is really disappointing is that price can buy a lot more someplace else. 

The atmosphere is charming and the service that day was good. Yet that was because they were not busy. I wonder what it would have been like if the place was full and all the staff were very busy. 

In these times with easy-to-make recipes, for cakes, packaged cookies and microwave ovens, etc. there is no excuse for any type of baked good to be so overpriced. Starbucks and Peet's makes a more hearty and hefty sized portion of scone, muffin and cake than what was offered to us. And, at a more reasonable price. 

Also, with regards to tea, even loose-leaf varieties, the selection of teas one can buy in the supermarket or at Peet's, Starbucks for that matter is always available.  

My friend and I would have done much better to purchase all the needed items for a tea service at home and saved some money if we had done it ourselves. 

Yet, it is nice to be served by a pleasant staff and have all the dishes, table clothes, and so on. But again, I do think the food itself should be outstanding and in more abundant portions to justify such a high price.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Bah the cuteness of this place is overwhelming. I'm serious, prepared to be enveloped by kitchy knick-knacks; it looks like your sweet little granny's living room but on steroids, like a princess's dream done in ice-cream.

The tea selection is huge and you feel like royalty getting served tiny sandwiches on these gorgeous platters.  It's not cheap so I'd save it for special occasions only but the atmosphere is SO MUCH FUN.  You must see this once in your life.  Rally your drunken gal-pals, or your the birthday party of your 6 year old and head over there!
author: Meg M.

description:
How can I not feel all warm and fuzzy inside sipping on a perfect cup of tea and eating dainty tea sandwiches at this charming and eclectic tea room, especially since this is where my cherry was popped? 

Ahem...I mean my Double Devon Cream cherry, that is. What did you think I meant?

I had to remind myself that I was in a tea room and restrain myself from ravenously devouring the light and fluffy scones (an oxymoron, I know) slathered with heavenly Double Devon Cream and preserves.

Scones don't normally get me all hot and bothered, but I'm tellin' ya it was the cream! It was love at first bite...
author: Anastasia B.

description:
I had an absolutely wonderful experience here with my friends. It was our first time coming to one of these tea places and we left satisfied and happy. They have choices that are more affordable (ex. a la carte items, tea sets of different prices) and this allows for more flexibility so you can tailor what you order to how hungry you are, how much money you're willing to spend, etc. (ahem, Crown & Crumpet, take note).  I believe we had the High Tea for four and this came with bottomless pots of tea for each of us. Their scones are so freaking delicious! I want some right now just thinking about it. Even though I discovered that Earl Grey was not my thing, I still thoroughly enjoyed the other teas at the table. 

When we arrived we were met with absolutely excellent service. They were friendly and patient when we had no idea what to order. I loved the interior, even though space was a bit limited. They had shelves full of trinkets, teapots, and things that made it feel very home-y. It was packed the day we went because it was a weekend but we had reservations so no problems there.This is my go-to place when I want to get tea. Great service, good food and tea, cozy environment.
author: Sannie L.

description:
I spent my childhood going to the Tudor House in LA with my mom, so I have pretty high standards for tea rooms... all of which were met by Lovejoy's! This place is absolutely, mindblowingly, crazy adorable! I love the mismatched plates and cups and teapots. I love that it feels like someone's super-cozy living room, and that the entire staff is incredibly sweet and treats you like family.

They were also really great about getting us a table at noon on a Saturday without a reservation. Someone had the table reserved for 1:30pm (seatings are usually 2-hours), but they let us squeeze in with the understanding we'd have to short it a bit. Still, it didn't matter. They took our order immediately and we waited less than 5 minutes before our tea came. 

We all ordered the high tea and we loved every bite. When that tower comes out and you see those dainty little sandwiches you think, "This isn't going to be enough!". And then... you start eating. You realize that the sandwiches are on a giant bed of nice, fresh salad, and suddenly you're only halfway in and you're totally full!

$20 for high tea, worth every single cent. And they are extremely nice about refilling your teapot as often as needed. The staff was very polite and gave us good info about when they needed the table so we never felt rushed. I really appreciated that they made the effort to fit us in! Also, they give all diners 10% off loose leaf teas at Lovejoy's Attic across the street. I can't wait to come back!
author: Rachel A.

description: OMG this place is heaven. They treat everyone -- grandmas, kids, grownups, you name it -- like kings and queens. And the food is delicious and the tea fantastic. We had 2 Queen's Teas and a kids' meal. Loved it. Can't wait to come back.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Tea rooms are to women what sports bars are to men.  Leave the boys at home and come here with the gals.  

I celebrated a belated birthday here, and it was a joy.  It's very cute and homey, which is what sets them apart.  A lot of British memorabilia fills the space.  (I loved the "Keep Calm and Carry On"  signage so much, I ended up buying one for my own place.)  You won't find any culinary delights here, but I thought the food was good.  Though very simple, I enjoyed all the finger sandwiches, the scones, and their luscious lemon curd, which they happen to sell at their Attic across the street (along with their teas).  We had the High Tea for Two, and it was more than enough food.  It was a very good mix of sweet and savory.  

I loved the bottomless pot of tea (I had the China Rose Petal), which proved to be very cleansing between my alcohol binges.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Came here for a bridal shower. I guess this place is too "grandma" for me compared to Crown and Crumpet. It's small here, and the food isn't even good. Service is slow and everything was super dusty. 

I still had fun with my friends, but the sandwhices were not fresh and they didn't give us different teas fast enough. The salad was wilted. Nothing seemed fresh and our space was so cramped. 

Since the bridal part paid, I don't know how much it cost, but not my type of place.
author: Karen H.

description:
I went to this place once years ago. I remember liking it, but not enough to go back. I actually kind of forgot about this place, and I live in the same neighborhood.. imagine that.
Recently, I wanted to take my grandmother out for tea, and remembered Lovejoy's. I guess we should have made a reservation, because the wait was 1 hour and a half. That was our mistake. BUT, I don't believe we will be making a reservation anytime soon. The place has the worst musty smell. That is simply it. Everything looked cute and I'm sure the tea is good, but I cannot imagine sitting in there for over 5 minutes.
Maybe if you bring a mask, or floral perfume this place might actually be worthy of 5 stars. 
Maybe we just happened to go in on their cleaning day or something... So if someone goes in and the smell has lifted, TELL ME, and I will check it out.
author: Giovanna C.

description:
I love the shabby chic feel to this space. It's beautiful and they have great food.

I also have had great success bringing friends with more particular eating habits here. I brought I friend who is on a gluten free diet and my friend who is vegan. Both of them said there was great selection of food that was made incredibly well.
author: Tina F.

description:
I've been coming to Lovejoy's for years, ever since it first opened when I was just a wee-thing. I love everything about this place, from the decor to the service to the tea to the food. It is such a treat every time I come here.
The only one star reduction is from my time here yesterday- I had originally made a reservation for 11:30 on Friday, but something came up so I called and left a voicemail on Thursday afternoon to see if I could change the reservation to 1:30. I never heard back from them, so assumed they were not able to change the reservation. We came in at 11:30, and apparently my reservation HAD been changed to 1:30, but no one bothered to call me to let me know. It was fine and we were seated right away, but that was annoying.
author: Emma A.

description: I love it her. It's cutely decorated and there is a big selection of food and tea. The staff is also super friendly. It's a great experience and a great place to chat with friends.
author: Stacy C.

description:
I absolutely adore Lovejoy's.  It is the quintessetial tea room.  Girly, dainty, chintzy, and oh-so-English, it's a definite winner.

Gentlemen:  enter at your own risk.

I have had both the High Tea ($17.95) and the Queen's Tea ($24.95), and I do think that unless you love crumpets (I don't) and petits fours (I do, but I can live without them after consuming a whole tea service), it's not worth the extra $7 for the Queen's Tea.  The High Tea is such a good bargain - so much food for under $20 - that it almost moots the point of the Queen's Tea, in my mind.

With both teas, you get your choice of tea sandwiches (I love the pear/blue cheese and the apple/cream cheese), tea (they're all good!), warm scone (with lemon curd, jam and clotted cream), coleslaw, spring salad (with mandarin oranges) and shortbread cookie.  The Queen's tea adds a crumpet, a petit four, and a lot of fresh fruit.  

All of the tea cups and saucers are mismatched, making it all completely adorable.  It's all for sale, too.  Just ask (they also have a shop with everything for sale across the street).  

I like sitting near the front, near one of the windows.  It's especially nice if you can get a seat on the banquette and tuck yourself in.  The place is always packed, and it's good to be able to observe the fray, rather than be a part of it.  Speaking of packed, reservations are a necessity.

The waitstaff is always friendly and helpful, although they sometimes look a bit beleaguered.

And the best part about coming here?  In addition to the delicious tidbits I hear from my friends over tea, I always end up hearing little snippets of other people's conversations (hey, the place *is* small), and I've learned more about complete strangers than I ever wanted to know.  Something about the tea must make them open up and spill all their secrets!!
author: Lis B.

description:
3.5 stars. I adore tea time. There's nothing like taking a couple of hours to slow down and enjoy some quality time with scones, sandwiches and friends. My BFF and I came here on a beautiful Wednesday afternoon. Our table was waiting in the middle of the room. It was fun looking at all the random knick knacks and mismatched plates and cups. We decided on the high tea for two for $34 (that's $17 each). We got four sandwiches, coleslaw, spring greens, two scones, strawberry preserves and double devon cream, two shortbread cookies and two tea selections. I chose the black mango tea and it was great. You don't need sugar or milk because when a tea is good, you can just appreciate it for what it is. I loved how many loose leaves there were in the pot. 

We chose the salmon & cream cheese, egg & onion, chicken apple walnut and asparagus & cream cheese sandwiches. All of them had the crust cut off and were pillowy soft. My favorite was the chicken apple walnut but none of the sandwiches were above average. The asparagus was a yellowish green color that looked like it was boiled too long but it tasted fine. The coleslaw was a little bland for me. Furthermore, I didn't like that the only taste I had was the caraway seeds that were mixed in. I had to spit out those little suckers after every bite. The salad was more like a garnish for the sandwiches to rest upon. I did like the little mandarin oranges in it though. 

The warm scone with raisins was delicious as were the shortbread cookies. Heaven is biting into a warm scone with cream spread and strawberry preserves on top. Lovejoy's is a bit hyped up but the service was fantastic. Our pots were never less than half full. I was also worried that I would still be hungry but the sandwiches and drinking so much of the tea left me quite satisfied.
author: Julia T.

description: Very cute. Great for kids. Tea was great hot chocolate was meh and watery. Yay for refills though. Genmai cha tea was great. Food was surprisingly good.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Hands down the BEST Tea House in the Bay Area!  Walking into this tea house made me feel like I entered another world!!  It had the cute, cosy, fancy english tea room.  Everything was overly decorated (in a positive way).  Felt like I was living a fancy. What a wonderful place to play tea time with the girls!
Came here to celebrate our secret santa party.  There was 6 of us and arrived here very hungry. As usual, my pregnant friend would like to order everything and we did...

Order:
-Hazelnut tea for me - Huge pot of tea!  Love this flavor.  Reminds me of coffee cause of the hazelnut flavor. 

Here comes the tower!

Top tier: sugar cookies

Second tier: scones ( light buttery fluffy goodness) served with two types of home made jam and home made butter! I was in love with the lemon jam!   I would drink a tub of it. 

Third /forth/fifth tier: all the tiny finger sandwiches:
Cucumber&Cream Cheese ( a must)
Smoke Turkey & Dijon Mustard ( not bad)
Egg & Onion ( doesn't give you sticky breath. It's very light)
Chicken- Apple-walnut salad ( love the bits of crunchy pieces)
Smoke Salmon &Cream Cheese (YES!!!)
Tomato&Cheese ( not bad)
Chicken & Asparagus ( its ok)

They came with crumpits ( which was ok to me) and a tray of desserts.  I ended up with a super rich chocolate brown with walnuts (WOW!!)

I don't know why we ordered a Sheppard's pie but I'm glad we did.  That pie was delicious!  I have no idea how I made room for that pie.  But man! that pie is a must!!

Definitely making this our traditional Christmas gift exchange spot!
author: Ying F.

description: Love the food selections, tea selections and the decor. I think I would choose this over Crown & Crumphet
author: Alyce l.

description:
My gal pals and I have been going here for the last 4 years and we just adore it!  We usually get the light tea, which includes: sandwich, scone, preserves, and double devan cream with fresh fruit and a shortbread tea biscuit.  I usually get the smoked turkey and dijon mustard, VERY good.  My friends have tried the following and loved it all: apple-chicken-walnut (a fav of mine), smoked salmon and cream cheese chutney.

It's a cozy little place with a quaint feel.  The presentation of the food is excellent!  I love the tea sets, i get a different one each time and I love their random, but delicate china.  We look forward to this tea party every year.  we love this place!
author: Marylouise R.

description: Love joys is ok. It's really expensive for not a lot of food. The tea is normal and the workers seem rushed. It's usually crowded  and if you don't have a reservation GOOD LUCK! I had a good time there and the decorations are cute. The parking is like normal San Francisco parking. You might need to look around a little for a spot. But over all it's nice for once in a wile.
author: Keira F.

description:
Lovejoy's is such a charming place to go for high tea. It's a place you would wear your Sunday clothes to, complete with grandma's pearls, hat, and lace gloves. Their mismatched tea sets add a nice quirky touch too!

In addition to their tea service, they also serve standard British fare like sausage rolls, ploughman's, pasties, shepherd's pie, and quiche. My mom and I shared a shepherd's pie and a Queen's Tea.

The SHEPHERD'S PIE was amazing! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=PeTed6UBTWeBk7jEVkTkLw) Perfectly seasoned ground beef topped with creamy mashed potatoes. And pretty too! The mashed potato is artfully swirled onto the top - details like this really add to their charm :)

The QUEEN'S TEA (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=A8V8DoiszacJREq7-b0w0g) was pretty good. It came with everything I wanted to try. I had a really hard time choosing the sandwiches because they had such a big selection! (Not that I'm complaining). The coleslaw and spring greens were aiight (I'm not what you would call a "salad girl"). The scone and tea biscuit were also good, but mostly because of the fabulous fruit preserves and lemon curd. My favourite was the crumpet though. They brought it out later, freshly out of the toaster. Amazing texture - crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside. We also got our choice of petit four at the end and I chose the cutest one (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=dZd79TtAvold1OhQdyiesQ).

All in all, Lovejoy's is a great place to go for afternoon tea - charming neighbourhood and decor, unpretentious, good selection of food, and not ridiculously overpriced.
author: Steph L.

description:
My girlfriends and I have been going to Lovejoy's for at least 10 years. I was introduced by attending a baby shower. I had the most fun. I love the mismatched tea cups and pots. The scones are amazing. 

Bring your besties and have a blast.
author: Leona G.

description:
My Bffy had a difficult time getting reservations for Lovejoy's which was so out of the way in SF, so we really really really wanted to love this place. But we didn't. 

To start with, the service was good and attentive. I also like how we get to choose our sandwiches, BUT Not only was the place packed... but it was loud. It was hard to have a decent conversation when the table next to you...was really next to you. Plus it's a tea room, we didn't want to raise our voices.

We had the Tea for Two for $35
- The raisin scones SUCKED ASS! it was warm, but it was like eating cake! it was too doughy, and surprisingly too big. I would rather pay more for a smaller scone ...that was a SCONE!

-We barely noticed the salad that our sandwiches sat on top of. It 
 looked like decorations so we didn't touch it. (well i ate the oranges)

- we choose 4 sandwhiches that were cut into 4s.
  Roast Beef and Horseradish was over powered by the horseradish  
  (and I love horseradish, it's a great kick to most sandwiches)

   Turkey and Dijon Mustard was over slathered with dijon..meh 
   (I also love mustard, it's my go to topping over ketchup and mayo)

    Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese was decent and they didn't   
    skimp on the salmon.

    Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise (the special of the day..blah!)

-Our pot of tea was also the day's special
  Strawberry black tea, it was perfect! 

For sweets we had the 1 Lemon and 1 strawberry petite flour.
The Lemon was eh...ok but the strawberry had way too much cream.
Each cost an extra $2! ...SKIP IT...and go get yourself some BI-Rite Ice cream.

As for decore... not really going to touch this, but it was eclectic...tacky? IDK!
author: Lynn T.

description:
This is a great place to have brunch and some tasty tea while snacking on bite sized sandwiches. Although I would advise men who are thinking about going here...You might want to bring a female friend or a girlfriend along because this place is a bit geared towards women. When me and some friends went inside to check out the tea they had, it was probably 98% female.

For myself I ordered the English Breakfast tea and a light snack consisting of small sandwich, scone, fruits and a biscuit at about 15 dollars, I do enjoy the whole tier tray thing going on there. Food on tiers are awesome. For a light generally snack, it's quite good, I recommend biting on some bay shrimp and mayonnaise sandwiches with your tea.

The interior was cool, very English mod. Everyone has their own teapot and cups to drink with which I found to be pretty nice.

All together, it's a nice little place to sip on some tea, but like I said, if you're a guy, bring a girl with you.
author: Simon L.

description:
After going elsewhere I felt I needed to add a positive review to Lovejoy's. We came here months ago as a group of 8 looking for a tea, scones, and fun. Had to make a reservation because the place is always packed and our table was ready when we arrived

At first it seemed expensive but I'd say you definitely get a great experience for the price. the place is lively and cute - with character all over. we shared four "queen tea for two"s and loved all our teas. they came loose leaf and were all unique and flavorful - loved the blood orange, earl grey, rose petal, and the others i cant remember

sandwiches were simple and delicious, not too small - the pear stilton my favorite. salad was light and coleslaw was very interesting, especially considering i usually dont like it. best part is definitely the scone. we all loved our scones - big, fluffy, and perfect with the devonshire cream and lemon curd. omg were those good. 

they were definitely busy but the service was still good - they checked up on us and sincerely seemed happy going about crazily attending to all their customers

when they came around with petit fours i mentioned i had been craving one for weeks and it was part of the reason we had come and she was really sweet giving me a little sign with my petit four. (cant remember what it said lol) sadly it wasn't too great and reminded me exactly of a debbie cake, but i like debbie cakes so not bad.

definitely come here with a group to relax, you should leave full and happy!
author: Sam H.

description:
I miss having tea time with my stuffed animals, thankfully there is this place where I can still pretend play. It was pretty accessible by BART (stop at 24th and mission) and a good 5 minute walk up hill from the station to Church Street that definitely worked up my appetite!!!

 This quaint cozy tearoom is an excellent place to catch up with a good friend. It's like walking into a vintage doll house and I couldn't stop snapping photos.

The waitresses were more than friendly to help snap photos for 2 giddy girls posing with their pots of tea and sandwich platters too.  If you don't like your tea cup or plates you can go choose another set from any that are placed out. Thankfully we arrived at an earlier time than the bustling period and were seated without reservation but they say its generally good to get a reservation.

Love Joy's is known for their tea services. When coming here I had to do it right and chose to order the Queen's tea even though it was a bit pricey. BUT for this kind of atmosphere and spending quality brunch time with a friend it was worth it and a treat to myself! 

In the Queen's tea , of course a bottomless pot of tea is included. I opted to get the Black mango tea after much debate between the other contenders of the pomogrante green tea and the blood orange. I do like fruit teas alot!!! My friend got the pom green so it was a win/win. They allow you to have a whiff of the dry tea leaves first to help with the tea selection but trust me the dry tea leaves do not do the black mango tea justice.

 Dry tea leaves are a bit musky but when it was steeped and poured out you can smell and definitely taste the mango scent and presence.  It was very fragrant and I liked that stand alone without the milk and sugar it still tasted delicious and I actually prefer it that way than with the additions.

 Being a tea junky I had 2 pots!!!! I love that the waitress comes from time to time to check if the tea is still hot otherwise they bring you a fresh hot pot back. 

Within the Queen's tea you get a choice of 2 sandwich selections.  My friend got the savory tea so we got to taste a total of 4 types of sandwiches.  They quarter the sandwiches into adorable bite size triangles. 
We selected the following:
1) Chicken-Apple-Walnut- You could taste the crispness of the apple still. The ratio of the 3 items were good and the mayo wasn't overly lathered to mask the individual flavors. 

2) Pear Stilton- With my recent discovery that I actually like blue cheese I got this one. The stilton was so creamy and gave such a great nutty taste and the pear was thinly sliced and retained the crunchiness still. It's a perfect combo! 

3)Cream Cheese and Mandarin Orange- this one was just ok, cream cheese and canned oranges. 

4) Love joy's daily special ( that day it was a smoked trout w/ capers). I loved smoked fish!!! The capers weren't too salty and the smoked trout definitely had the spotlight and wasn't masked. 

along with the sandwiches I also had a wonderful warm scone that was flaky and crumbly enough. I liked the strawberry preserve that came with it and used the lemon curd on it as well. The double devon cream was ok used in moderation but a thick slab of it on the scone was too rich for me. 

The queens tea also comes with fresh fruit , spring greens salad and coleslaw. Their coleslaw is interesting as its the first time i had fennel seed in one. It was pretty good. 

I wasn't too fond of the crumpet that was served. It was too big and hard to chew. Icouldn't cut it apart.

The sugar cookie /shortbread  was made perfectly and lightly dusted with sugar.

Last was the selection of a petit fours. I chose the orange creme one that had a ribbon of dark chocolate in it. It was a bit too sweet for me so when I come back next time I'll probably get the triple dark chocolate one which was the runner-up. 

The morning passed quickly into afternoon spent here chatting with my friend and we both enjoyed the service and hospitality. I would definitely bring my friends back here for a Girls day out. 

P.S: they give you a 10% off coupon if you visit Love Joy's attic found across the street if you like to bring back a souvenir of the tea you had or various tea cups pots etc.
author: Sharon Y.

description:
I loved loved loved having High Tea here!!

Came over here last weekend with few friends after hearing so much about the place. Reservations are hard to come by, and sometimes they forget to call people back. Therefore, my friend came here physically days prior to make the reservation!

The tea room was cutely decorated. There were so many random items all over the place, but somehow they worked together. After being seated, we each picked different types of tea and set - pinkies up! Everything was delicate and delicious. We especially enjoyed the scones and crumpets, which were buttery and yummy :)

Didn't realise how much food was served until we felt like taking a nap on the sofa, all for ~$20 per person!
author: Lois W.

description:
I've been to a few tea houses in the area and my husband was kind enough to make reservations at this one for our anniversary.  It was similar to other tea houses, but the menu was slightly more adventuresome.

They have a great selection in tea and even had more than one male (my husband) in the room.  It is a quaint spot that would be difficult to have a party larger than 4 in.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Oh my god, this place is the best tea room I have ever been to. 
let me just preface this by saying that I am part British, and i have been going to tea rooms since i could remember, and i daresay that this is the best tea room i have ever been to. 

The decor is soooo cute, and comfy, and this tea room has a great atmosphere and ambiance. It is just soo cute and comfy, and the people who work there are soo nice, attentive and helpful.

The service is great. the servers are very knowledgeable, helpful, attentive, and nice. They are always checking to make sure your tea is hot, and they are always making sure that the food is good and that you are happy with everything.

I have only ever gotten the queen's tea both times i've gone, and it was amazing both times. 
the first time i got the pear and stilton sandwich and the goat cheese, sundired tomato, and olive sandwich. They were both amazing and satisfaying, and perfectly balance. 
the second time i went i got the hummus and artichoke sandwich and the chutney and cheese sandwich. the hummus was okay, it was nothing special but it hit the spot, and the chutney was perfect. 

their scones were amazing, perfectly flaky, just the right amount of sweetness, and the perfect amount of raisins and currants. they were warm, and fresh, and amazing. the creme, jam, and lemon curd were also amazing and complimented the scones and eachother perfectly. 

the shortbread cookies were sooo good, they were thin and cruncy, and so perfectly sweet. 

the coleslaw is ridiculously delicious. I have never liked coleslaw and i am in love with their coleslaw. their sauce is amazing, and they put just the right amount of sauce on their coleslaw, and the rye seeds they add just make the coleslaw so much better than you would ever think coleslaw could be. 

the fresh fruit they serve is also really delicious, although i wish they gave you more

the crumpets were really good. they were warm and fresh, and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. they were amazing with the lemon curd and the butter. I'm normally not a big crumpet fan, so the second time i went i just got them to give me an extra scone instead of the crumpet, but  you must try the crumpets at least once. 

the petit fours are also amazing. the chocolate truffle with apricot was amazing, the walnut brownie was amazing, and the rose-water was amazing as well. they have a large and delicious petit four selection, and i have loved every single petit four that i have tried. 

finally, their tea selection is amazing. I love their darjeeling, and they always keep your tea hot, and make sure that it's hot. they have a really wide selection of non-caffein teas as well, and they are all delicious. 

lovejoy's just has the greatest atmosphere and service and it is seriously the best tea room I have ever been to out of los angeles and san francisco.

i made my friend who hates tea and pastries go to lovejoy's and she is now in love with tea time. that's how good lovejoy's is, it converted my pastry and tea hating friend to a tea time fanatic.

lovejoy's is a must try if you are ever in the bay area, it is an amazing experience!


just a side note, on the weekends, and even fridays, you should try to make reservations if you can, although they do also take walk-ins.
author: Rebecca A.

description:
I came here with a party of four on a Sunday afternoon, around 1:35pm, and luckily got seats within 10 minutes (not to mention I got lucky with parking!). The waitress was very pleasant, taking away plates when we were finished, and giving us clean plates so we wouldn't have to mix tastes. She was also very honest in giving her opinion about what was good on the menu vs. what was popular.

I ordered the Queen's Tea and had he China Rose Petal (black tea). I chose the Chicken-Apple-Walnut sandwich and the Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese sandwiches. This set came with coleslaw (ehh), organic spring greens (really plain salad), a raisin scone with preserves (yummm!) and double devon cream (a better version of butter), a crumpet with lemon curd (delicioussss and zesty), fresh fruit, and a petit four and a shortbread tea biscuit.

The tea was very aromatic. It had just the right amount of flavor. Adding sugar and milk to it made it easier to drink, but I enjoyed it plain.

The sandwiches are are cut into fourths. The chicken-apple-walnut sandwich was quite delicious. It was basically a chicken salad with chunks of apple and walnut. Smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches were very normal. The ones I make at home taste about the same. I didn't touch the cole slaw cause I don't like it. The organic spring greens were bitter (as usual), but I didn't like the dressing enough to finish it (lighter type of dressing). The raisin scone is soft on the inside, but has just the right "crunch" on the outside. it went well with the butter and jam, but i was really into the lemon curd. Iono about the crumpet. Are they supposed to be like half pancake, half english muffins? I didn't finish it (even when spread with the lemon curd!) cause it was just unappetizing. The fresh fruit had a good variety (strawberries, grapes, grapefruit, blueberries, kiwis). The petit four was a strawberry shortcake with marzipan. Very sweet and delicious. Shortbread tea biscuit is how you would imagine it to be like, but not as heavy as a "walker's".

I would give this place 5 stars because of the variety of foods offered, but I didn't like the quality/pairings of all the foods (eg. salad and dressing, crumpet). All together, for 2 light tea's and 1 queen's tea was $65 (inc. t&t).
author: Adorable T.

description:
I went here with few of my friends to celebrate the enchanting Royal Wedding of Kate Middleton and Prince William. 

When we walked into Lovejoy's we were all immediately stricken with potent smell. One that wasn't of some rose tea. Now I don't know about you, but when I'm tryna celebrate my royal wedding and sip on my delicious herbal berry tea I ain't tryna have the stench of sewage force its way up my nostrils. I was not feelin' that at all! 

We all ordered our teas and patiently waited. And waited. And waited. The servers didn't seemed as concerned with getting our orders to us as they did with other patrons at Lovejoy's and they almost seemed to exhibit a bit of 'tude whenever we asked for something or needed assistance. Hm! A brotha was just tryna get his petit fours! 

The tea was delicious. The sandwiches were adorable and tasty (nothing extravagant though). They're very simple, but I think that it's better that way. I had cucumber and cream cheese & salmon and caper sandwiches that, as mentioned above, were scrumptious. I ordered some sausage wraps that had an absolutely-yummy-as-yummy-gets dipping sauce. Mmm. The food and tea was a-okay. 

When it comes to Lovejoy's I believe my friend put it best, "It's shabby chic. Minus the chic."
author: Nick B.

description:
This place is amazing.

I've organized not one, but TWO tea parties here in the past few months, and they have been delightful experiences. The staff has made scheduling as easy as can be (although if you want to get a reservation here, you'll NEED to call more than a week in advance, as they book up VERY quickly!), the service while at tea has always been amazing, and the food, tea, and atmosphere are simply wonderful.

While I will admit that it's not my absolute favorite tea place in SF, my past experiences have made this THE place for hosting a tea party (larger than 4 people). The only two things I wish were different were the raisins in the scones (I don't care for cooked raisins) and a larger selection of teas. Other than that, Lovejoy's is pretty perfect. :)
author: Elle Q.

description:
Aw tea parties.  The two times that I have come here, me and two other friends have gotten the High Tea for Three. It's just High Tea for Two with an added person. It's pretty filling. I think it's the best deal, as it comes with small sandwich slices, salad, coleslaw, scones, cookies, and three pots of tea. China Rose tea is my favorite! 

I highly recommend that you make a reservation, because you may not get seating. There is usually one small table available if you get there as soon as the place opens, but it is really is meant for two people. I wish this place were bigger or spacier, but I think they intentionally make the place look overcrowded with nic nacs. I don't recommend it for people who are claustrophobic. I'm not, but the space still bugs me. However, I will come back, because the food, tea, and service is great.
author: April D.

description: Lovejoy's is my favorite for afternoon tea. I prefer it to the corporate hotel high teas as it feels like a real English village tea house. It's so charming that they use mismatched tea cups and saucers and the service is always helpful and friendly. The food is no better and no worse than any other tea shop I've been to and frankly, they're all overpriced but I appreciate that Lovejoy's has vegan options.
author: Marie S.

description: This was a great place for an intimate baby sprinkle! We had a reservation and sat in a corner booth (I say booth because 3 of the seats were bench style with so many cushions). The artichoke hummus and smoked salmon & cream cheese sandwiches were good, but the presentation of them was confusing - hard to keep track of what was what... It was a little loud, but also very cute. The scones and crumpets were made even more tastey by the lemon curd. yum!
author: Emma F.

description:
Whenever family or friends are visiting from out of town, I like to take them to this tea room. It's such a treat to go here: from the unique tea cups you get, to their scrumptious scones, to the cute hats you can wear there, etc. 

Lovejoy's is a cute, cosy place and I love going there.
author: M C.

description:
This place is special to me because my best friend of 11 years took me here, despite my initial hesitation to pretend I was a 19th century Victorian women and partake in tea and crumpet time. She passed on in August and I will always remember the great times we shared. So this review is for you Crissie, love and miss you always.

Upon walking in here I noticed I was one of only two males in this entire place. Crap. After being seated I noticed that the table to my right was "reserved for the princesses" or something along those lines. FML. With my head held high masculinity still in tact, I quickly glanced at the menu and chose the manliest items offered: peppermint tea with the smoked turkey and dijon mustard sandwich. While sipping my tea and taking small bites of my tiny ass sandwich, I couldn't help but think that the only thing I was missing was a dress and crown. Despite feeling out of place, I have to admit that the tea was bomb and the sandwich was like crack on bread.

I think I'll come back here one day, in memory of you Crissie. You took me to some random ass places and we had some good laughs, Love you sooooo much. You'll always be in my heart.

P.S.  When I do return I'll be wearing my blinged out crown and sexy ass corset dress. UH huh, yea, that's right. Imma be Queen BITCH for the day ya'll, sippin on some tea and eating some good ass sandwiches.
author: Alvin T.

description:
My friend and I love to get tea with the whole English tea time accompaniments.  We went on a Friday for lunch and luckily, she made reservations.  The decor is utterly quaint and reminiscent of flowery furniture seen in historical films.

We ordered the High Tea for two and got to choose 4 different sandwiches.  We got the Smoked Salmon & Cream, Cheese Chutney & Cheese, Pear & Stilton, and Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard.   Those sandwiches were quite filling, in addition to the gigantic scones and salad.  The scones were so delicious - we wanted more but were simply stuffed.  I opted for the Passion Fruit tea while she got English Breakfast.  We spent a good 2 hours just drinking tea and talking.
author: Rose C.

description: Someday I will purchase this place and run it. Until then, I am overjoyed to be a patron. This is not gourmet food (though it is delicious and creative) this is all about comfort and ceremony. A wonderful experience.
author: J W.

description:
Went here on a Sunday for a ladies pre-Valentine day out. I have to say I really enjoyed it here, the whole experience of it all.

The wait was 30mins at noon. We headed over to the antique counterpart next door while waiting, where you can get the Devon cream, lemon curd, and of course the teas! Anyway, that's for another review.

Back in the tea room, the place is tiny so it leans to more of a cramped than cozy feel, but that's your call. Decor reminds me of grandma's. Service is friendly but they do seem to push the time limit a bit much, that you start feeling rushed. Service is quick and the pots are never below half full also, kept at a good temperature, hot. The tea sandwiches are yummy, although quite pricey for the quantities given. At least the teas are bottomless.

Their scone/crumpet are quite plain, what makes them delicious is the Devon cream plus the preserves or lemon curd (You can buy the cream next door, I put it on waffles with the lemon curd, $8 for a small jar, eek!). You get a 10% discount on teas if you dined in the Tea Room. Their teas smell heavenly, I wanted to buy them all. 

Once you have your cream, curd, teas: You can invite your girl friends over and recreate this tea party at home for a fraction of the cost!

The petite fours are good but pricey, would skip it next time, save me the $2.50 for spending at the antique shop. All in all, would love to come back for another ladies day out, try out the other sandwiches and teas but mostly to spend time at the antique shop.

*Oh and there were flower vendors that were selling beautiful arrangements for great prices across the street. I believe they were called Bloom Boom. I'll post a pic, they say that they are at different locations around SF.
author: Mavi T.

description:
I guess I'm not really a tea person.

Came to celebrate a friend's birthday, and it was only OK.  I was definitely hesitant to come, as it reminds me of a small child having a tea party at Grandma's house. Nice, but not my cup of tea...ha.  No? Fine.

Out of all the items for our high tea order, I loved the warm scones (point!).  The service was nice, and I liked the variety of people who were there. It didn't matter if you were more girly, goth, or just wanted to have some tea. I don't like that it requires reservations. We called 2 weeks in advance and the 1PM - 3PM tea was full. Sucky.

The food was small portioned. Fair, as this is tea. However, after hanging out with people afterward, we found ourselves hungry after 3 hours. Some people were hungrier even earlier than that.  The sandwiches were only OK for me.  Fruit in sandwiches are just strange for me.  I also saw a large amount of canned veggies and fruits in the back...and realized almost everything I had came from cans. Interesting...

It was also a little pricey for me.  We averaged out at about 23 per person.  If I were more of a British tea person, I think I'd give it a 4.
author: Lily W.

description: Came here for the first time yesterday and loved it! I wasn't able to get a reservation. So I decided I would risk the wait times. I was given an estimate of 30 mins and was in before then. I'm in love with it's ambiance! The scones are honestly to die for. Don't forget the amazing lemon curd with it! I got the queens tea, strawberry black tea and Shepard's pie. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Lareine S.

description:
I came here recently with a big group (20pp) for a Bachelorette party. 

Comparing this to Crown and Crumpet in Ghirardelli Square, Love Joy is:
1. Not as "pretty" or "cute" but very real.. feels like I'm in someone's home with an antique setting of mix and matching tea cups, plates, etc. Nothing seems to match, but I really enjoyed it.. they're not trying too hard to impress, it actually made me want to check out the place a little more. 
2. Way better scones
3. way more food - we paid $20~$25 and had some extra sammies to-go!
each person got 8 pieces of sammie (not that I counted how many I've eaten, I know I ate more than that)   That is = 2 whole sammie btw, and you also get a small salad, 1 scone (pretty big), and unlimted tea.
4. Nice friendly staffs.  We were playing games and made so much noise.. basically taking over the entire tea room, sorry folks.

I'd rather come here than Crown and Crumpet, because the price is right and my stomach was satisfied.  

*Keep Calm Carry On*
author: Anna W.

description:
I'm in love with this place!  So, so cute.  With an extensive menu, really good tea, and actually really tasty sandwiches as well.

This place gets packed on the weekends so make sure to make reservations in advance.  Also, try to make sure that your party is on time as they do give groups time limits.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I hosted a friend's bridal tea party at Lovejoy's and it was fabulous. Organizing the event was easy and professionally handled. I ordered party favors (tins of tea with a special label for the bride) and they were laid out at each person's seat when we arrived. Lovejoy's is a cute, charismatic place, but it's also informal and relaxed. Brie was our hostess and she was very helpful and accommodating. Oh and the best part - I got my own gluten free 3-tier tray:)

I would recommend a visit to Lovejoy's for sure.
author: Nicola D.

description: I actually first heard about this place reading an issue of National Geographic Traveler, and mentally bookmarked that I'd have to return to this place to try it.  I am so glad I did.  We ordered the pomegranate green tea, which was piping hot, and tasty.  The decor of this lovely establishment is very cute -- I even saw a rack of hats that some people were trying on, and it was impressive to see all the sandwiches and other goodies you could order along with your tea.  Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and would definitely recommend.  BTW -- the reservations are a great idea, and even though they close at 6 and you plan on eating, you probably want to get there by 4:30.
author: Mel G.

description:
What are the rave reviews all about? Yes if you want to sip tea and eat stale bread sandwiches in a sardine can this is your place.  Ok I have only had tea in London, Victoria Canada and the Garden Court in SF and I realize Church street is far away but really!  They do not use the thin bread but instead thick American bread, think wonderbread. The parchment thin roast beef was undetectable as were many other fillings..We had the "high tea" which it was not, for $20.00 plus $9.00 for tea you get two sandwiches, some greens tossed on to the tier and a dish of coleslaw and scones and a cookie..
The Queen would be appalled!
We went with a group and you really don't get much however it is definitely popular. It was so cramped one could barely walk to the table. Our server when available was on the surly side. I really wonder why this place is popular. I was a guest and honestly next time I am invited I will suggest tea at my house at least the bread will be fresh and I will provide deserts as part of "high tea"  or save your pennies and go for real afternoon tea at the Garden Court.
author: rassors T.

description: First of all, can we talk about the ambiance of this place? Quaint atmosphere (very English style), a little pricey but its worth the experience! I ordered the High Tea, which came with tiny finger bite sized sandwiches. I selected the Cucumbers with Cream Cheese and Tomato with Cheese - I am obviously a big cheese fan. I also had the White Peach Tea, which was delightfully light and sweet! A perfect match for the tea sandwiches and pastries! I also tried the delectable Petite Fours! They all had very cute intricate designs.   I would  recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room , however, I could only see myself going to this place for a few occasions. It would be a perfect place to take your mother and sisters here for Mother's Day.  It's also a good  place  to catch up with your girlfriends. Portions are tiny , but it is pretty filling with the tea. Service is great. Reservations only.
author: Clementine D.

description:
I wrote a brief review elsewhere, and I'm just going to copy/paste it here because I am supremely lazy to do a proper one. Also because I said everything I needed to say, and any elaboration I may be inclined to do will more than likely be odd ramblings.

I had tea ... with my ladybug friend last Friday. It was a toss up between this place and Crown & Crumpet, but she said this place offered more for your dollar. The tea was great (I ended up buying a canister from their retail store across the street), their scones and crumpets should have been illegal, and their chicken apple sandwiches/devonshire cream/lemon curd were to-freaking-die-for.

The place was quirky with mismatched chinaware and fun, vintage décor. As much as I liked it, though, the more compulsive part of my personality begged for less clutter and more sophistication/minimalism. That's not to undermine the atmosphere, though. I loved it, and the service was wonderful.

* What I failed to mention was the type of tea (ceylon). To most people, it might not be something to write home about, but I could have this tea (instead of green) forever and ever. And while I'm skeptical of adding any sugar into my tea, after positive prompting from my friend, I caved and decided a small spoonful of sugar only makes it better. Yum!

Bonus: You get to try on hats if you'd like to, and I'm attesting to other reviews that they rarely let your teapot get more than halfway empty.
author: Ashley F.

description:
We got the High Tea for Two tea set.



Earl Gray. In a polka dot teapot. Their tea was really fragrant and delish. I haven't had such good Western style tea in a long time.  



Our tea set came with...

(Lower Level)

Mixed Green Salad. This was pretty good. They gave us a light vinaigrette dressing for it. NOMS. 

Coleslaw. It was alright, I'm usually not too big of a fan of coleslaw but this was pretty good, though I'd prefer it drenched in dressing. 

Our Choice of Sandwiches:

Roast Beef and Horseradish. This was pretty good, I liked how they offered horseradish instead of typical dijon mustard. The horseradish gave it more spice and brought out the flavors of the beef better.
