Bay Shrimp and Mayonnaise. This was my favorite by far, it tasted really fresh and delish. The tanginess of the mayonnaise definitely enhanced the fresh taste of the shrimp and hid the oceany taste. 

Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese. This was pretty good as well, just like my favorite lox and cream cheese sans bagel!

Chicken Apple Walnut Salad. My least favorite sandwich, mostly because I'm not really a fan of mushy salady sandwiches unless it's amazing and amazing this was not. It was just okay, nothing to write home about really. 

(Upper Level)

Scones with Strawberry Jam. These were alright, I think the scones at The Rotunda were better. These weren't buttery enough and were more dry. 

Shortbread Cookies. Didn't taste these because my friend ended up bringing them home. 

(Not Shown)

Petit Fours. Didn't actually try these unfortunately because we were THAT full. We couldn't stuff anymore in our stomachs!

Overall, I thought it was a good amount of food for my money. I was stuffed by the end of the meal. Their sandwiches are much better than their scones, assuming you pick good ones. Their service was pretty good, they were very busy yet very attentive. 

FYI: My friend tried to make reservations the day before and they didn't have any left. So make your reservations early! But they did tell my friend that they do save a couple tables for walk-ins but there are very few of those. And if you do attempt to chance it by walking in make sure you start waiting there at least 15mins before they open. We got there 20mins before it opened and there were people waiting already.

EDIT: Photos are no longer linked directly to this post, as Yelp does not like me posting my blog on my reviews. Please see food blog for photos.
author: Constance C.

description: Great place to spend a leisurely afternoon with your girl friends. Be sure to make a reservation though. Love the sandwich selections. There are so many teas  it is hard to choose. And the offer gluten free as well.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
So...

I finally made an effort to actually dine-in for their afternoon tea here.  We made reservations and gathered a bunch of people too!  :-) 

We went on Saturday, with a nine-year-old in tow.

We had their High Tea...four sandwiches (artichoke hummus, roast beef, smoke salmon and cream cheese, and chicken-walnut-apple salad), some greens salad (delicious vinegar-y dressing), buttery buttery [evil] scones with devonshire cream and raspberry preserves.  

I also ordered some sausage rolls for the table (they're two-bite appetizers basically).  They were not greasy, flaky dough, and savory filling.  Yum.

For tea, we had the China Rose Petal...which was a strong black tea with hints of rose.  I tried my sister's English breakfast tea, which is different from what I am used to (outside of this tea room).  I was a bit flummoxed by how bitter it was, and how it totally required sugar for drinkability.  

She tempted us with petit-fours as well...so the kid tried triple chocolate (dark, milk and white), and I tried the plum rosewater one which was just so different and so addicting!  

Service = as expected.  They are very attentive, friendly, and just great about refilling your teapots and great about taking photos for us.  

I'll definitely come back...

One of the plus factors for this place: they do not have overly flowery wallpaper, covered in same-fashioned dolls!  

Warning: This is NOT a cheap place.  Go for the experience, and if you don't enjoy it, don't waste money.  I don't want to hear any whining!
author: Fannie S.

description:
it's all personal preference - I like my tea time come with good tea, yummy food and nice environment. I loved my chestnut tea at Lovejoy's, food was ok good, but the environment was really not what I expected. It was old and kinda chaotic. 
i still had a good time because of great tea and super friendly waitresses. but probably won't go again since the environment is a big turn-off to me.
author: Paiyu G.

description: Best place to have tea in the city! Good food. Good tea! Casual in a good way! Strong thumbs up!
author: Michael S.

description:
i hate that being a native you sometimes take for granted that things are just always there.  The point is that I had driven by Lovejoy's tea room a million times and and have never thought to stop in and look. It looks antiquated and a little strange from the outside, but inside it is perfectly wonderful. 

Thoroughly doilied-up and mismatched china to boot.  The pots and china are all different colors and shapes, the food it it high-tea to the hilt. I felt obligated to drink my tea with pinky proudly in-air while delicately sipping my more than lovely english black tea. 

Point being - this is an amazing place to go with your lady friends of all ages, and it was reasonably priced for a high tea for 7 it rounded out to about $25 per person. 

I will certainly be bringing my female friends and family here for the future.
author: Kira G.

description: This place was cozy like a grandmother's living room, complete with decorative hats that you can put on and feel fancy. The teas were strong enough for me to add milk (because I put it in everything), and not have it turn into nothing but watery milk. We had ordered the Lavender tea, as well as and English breakfast. Along with the sandwiches were the most delectable finger sandwiches, which are incredibly deceiving. You'd think that there's no way you can get full on these dainty sandwiches, but you are in for a surprise. I had to be rolled back to my car because I was so full. I really appreciated the staff for keeping my pot of tea warmed up every now and then, which they don't do everywhere else. I would really recommend Lovejoy's, but would strongly recommend you make a reservation.
author: Tammy L.

description:
Had tea with a friend recently and was welcomed as if I'd never been away...I have brought many friends and loved ones over the years and I'm thrilled the ladies who own the shop are just as friendly and lovely as ever.  

Lovejoy's has a lively atmosphere, purposefully mismatched china and absolutely delicious offerings such as the Devonshire cream, freshly made scones, lemon curd and petit fours.  The shepherd's pie is delicious!

If you're looking for a perfect spot for a bridal or baby shower, birthday celebration or just a uplifting afternoon to indulge yourself, Lovejoy's is the perfect place!
author: Alacrity I.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday June 6, 2008 @ 5:15pm(they close at 6pm and the last seating is at 5pm, so I recommend coming earlier, but they were so kind to seat us.)
Company:  Michael who gave up Happy Hour to Accompany Me Here
Crowd:  Groups & Twosomes of Ladies @ Tea Time
Atmosphere:  Tea Party we've Dreamed of as Children Come to Life
Decor:  Utterly Charming!  Everything is Precious from the Apricot Window Curtains, Pale Yellow Walls, Seating Areas to the Unique Red Phone  Booth, Paintings and  Porcelain Teacups that Accent this Beautiful Room.  Small Wooden Tables covered w/ Doiley's and Cushioned Wooden Chairs and Benches along w/Seating Sections w/ Sofas, Wooden Loveseats, Coffee Tables and Comfortable Upholstered Chairs.  Very Cozy!
Service:  Very Warm, Helpful, Attentive.
Imbibe:  White Peach Tea!  Vast Selection including Apricot, Passionfruit & China Rose Petal Black Tea.  Served in Unique Teapots w/ Porcelain Cups & Saucers.  Thoughtful Touch!
Devour:  More than A Dozen Types of Tea Sandwiches such as Cucumber & Cream Cheese & Bay Shrimp 
Scones, Crumpets, Short Bread Tea Biscuits.  A Combination of All of The Above is Availabe in High Tea also for Two and Queen's Tea.  Wee Tea for children 10 and under.  
Notes:  Towards the End of this Wonderful Tea Time Experience, the Very Beautiful and Sweet Server Visits Each table with a Tray of Scrumptious & Various Petit Fours where we can Choose the Flavor of our Choice!  I got the Milk Chocolate w/ Apricot and was trying to Signal Michael to get the Strawberry Shortcake,  but he got the Nut Brownie cause it was huge, so we took the rest home!
Side-Notes:  Since we got there so late, we had the Cream Tea where got to Choose a Tea(Apricot), 2 Delicious Scones served with Preserves & Devon Cream and Fresh Fruit.
Total:  $71.38 w/o Tip
More Notes:  This Place is Very Popular on Weekends so Make Reservations since they Host a Number of Baby Showers!  They do reserve a few tables for walk-ins.  For the reserved tables they put up a cute little sign on a silver stand w/ "Reserved for Royals".
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
This tea room is FANTASTIC!!!  I have been coming here with my family and girlfriends for years and they never disappoint!!  The scones are heaven, and the sandwiches are adorable and so yummy &  they have a nice variety to choose from.   

Everything tastes homemade and the decor/ambiance is sweet and quirky.  This is a great place to take your Mom, Granny,or  girlfriend.
author: Amanda B.

description:
I have came here twice and I love this place the best so far. The food is delicious especially the scones! They are super busy on weekends so plan to go on a weekday or make reservations early. With my BF it took 1 hr plus and with my girls it took 3+ hours so prepare to be there for awhile. They are very attentive with reservations and will call you back to confirm and stuff.

The price is reasonable and there is a wide variety of teas. The food is pretty big portions and you get full quickly with the tea and scone. I love the smoke salmon sandwich the best. Tea-wise I enjoyed one of the green tea and the rose tea was nice as well.  Service is lovely even when they are busy. They constantly check if you need more tea which is a plus! Overall a wonderful experience and cannot wait to go back!
author: Shirley Y.

description:
Not sure what I can say about this wonderful little gem that hasn't already been written.
Been to a few Bay Area tearooms and without a doubt Lovejoy's is the best. Wonderful service, adorable decor. The rose tea is a must, get a bottomless pot. Sandwiches very good, not at all dry like some of the other places. Their scones are amazing and the petit fours delightful!
I've got to add the catering service is terrific. We ordered for my sis' bridal shower and everything was wonderful down to the adorable sandwich tiers.
Lovejoy's will forever be my favorite tea spot!!!
author: C J.

description:
This my favorite of all tea rooms. I've been going here for many years and it's as good as it ever was.

Meet a few of my friends here for a good British tea service on a regular basis. I had my baby shower here. It's great for showers!

I haven't been to a better tea room than Lovejoy's. Not even in England! There is a very large assortment of loose leaf tea and they keep the pot filled. Quaint decor with mismatched service placements.

Food is good too although I have to admit to never getting any hot items here. We ALWAYS get the Queen's Tea Service with finger sandwiches and scones. It's so good!
author: Tracy C.

description:
My first time to experience afternoon tea (even after having visited London)!!! What can I say about this? AWESOME! First of all, I didn't know that reservations should be made WAAAY in advance. I was worried that my friend (who's an avid afternoon tea participant) and I wouldn't be able to get a table. Luckily, there was an availability as we walked in. I love the whole feel of Lovejoy's. The decor, the tea sets and chinaware... exquisite!

My friend and I had the High Tea for Two for $34 (NOT per person) with 2 extra petit fours for a few bucks. We tried the Tea House Blend and Passion Fruit. We had 4 sandwiches: smoked salmon and cream cheese, chicken/walnut/apple salad, mandarin oranges and cream cheese, and the Sandwich special of the day which was chicken curry. There were 2 large scones along with jam and clotted cream and a couple of shortbread cookies. The coleslaw and salad were also pretty tasty (coleslaw is nothing like the heavy mayo based slaw so you don't feel as guilty eating it). 

I say this is a great experience to have at least once in your life (even if you're not a fan or you think it's too pricey.. YOU GOTTA TRY)! I don't think the place was too expensive and I believe it's worth it too! Afterwards, we crossed the street to Lovejoy's Attic to buy some tea and check out some cute things on sale. 

I'd love to come here again!
author: Faye F.

description:
I had an amazing experience at Lovejoy's. This was my first time at a tea salon so I wanted to full experience. We ordered the Queen's Tea, which is their biggest menu option and gives you a sampling of a variety of their tea parings. My favorite item was the scones. The crumpets were good too. I could have done without the little sandwiches as neither of our selections were particularly good. Since we arrived with a big appetite we also purchased the sheppards pie and this puff pastry with pork in it. Both of those entree items were amazing. 

Lovejoy's is a great place to have your first tea salon experience. We also noticed a large group of women that were holding a baby shower so I'd imagine that's pretty common at a place like this. 

If you'd like to experience the whole pomp and circumstance than I'd suggest you order the "High Tea" or the "Queens Tea". Each meal comes with a bottomless pot of the tea of your choice. If you're  guy (like me) and want to experience good food then I'd suggest you get a pot of tea and the sheppard's pie. 

Overall a little spendy, and the service is okay, but it's great food/tea, casual (not stuffy) environment, and Lovejoy's will make sure you have a great experience. Tip: Definitely make sure you book a reservation in advance. :)
author: Ken C.

description:
If I'll have to describe this place in one word I'd say it's CUTE! Love, love Lovejoy's décor - it might be a bit on the girly side so you might want to take your man elsewhere. Even their bathroom is simply adorable, complete with vintage portraits on the walls and crochet tablecloths.

The food is a bit expensive, but is totally worth it - everything is fresh and yummy. Try the sandwiches - they are tiny but we loved every flavor we ordered.

Oh and they have an equally cute shop just across the street - perfect for presents and favors!
author: Ata N.

description:
I don't know how to do that 1/2 star rating, If you can, pretend it is a 4 1/2 rating =)

4 1/2 because I just didn't feel comfortable spending well over $60.00 for tea, bite sized sandwiches and a limited amount of scones and other unique baked goods. Ok, $60.00 between two people probably isn't too pricey but still the portions were too small to even justify that price.

BUT, In terms of quality, I suppose I won't be so quick to condemn it.

Just when you think you've explored San Francisco for all it's worth, the city surprises you with something new and intricately patterned, like Love Joys. The place was decorated with all sorts of trinkets, reminiscent of Tommys' Joynt, possibly the female version of Tommys'. Because no two table displays are identical, expect every experience to be sweet and emanate warmth. 

The table is set to recreate english tea time, with its fine china and miniature utensils and antiquated furnishes it takes cute and endearing to a whole new level.  Tea is served in your personal sized tea pot and the you get the joy of letting your tea leaves steep, your own personal milk and sugar , etc., etc.

For the steep price we were able to get

Cucumber and Cream Cheese
Salmon and Cream cheese
Cured ham 

4 scones with the devon sauce? ( The devon sauce tastes terrible, that is in massive quantities, be as sparing as possible with it)

and then it was $2.00+ additional for the little cookies and chocolates they walked around offering. It was worth it but that immediately added $10.00 to our bill, it doesn't help that each one of them looked like a must to try
author: Myrtle M.

description:
I have been here so many times over the years now, I feel a review is way overdue. This is a charming little spot for a baby or wedding shower or just a great place to bring Mom and Grandma on their visit to town. The mini sandwiches are delightful (looking and tasting) and their array of teas would impress anyone who's well versed (not I). The atmosphere is just plain cute, though super stuffy when it's packed to the rim. And it usually is!

Reservations a MUST. Think ahead.
author: Meredith R.

description:
What a cute quirky place.  Had a wonderful time there with my friends last weekend.  We made a reservation, which I would recommend to do.  The place was packed, many ladies and girls enjoying an afternoon tea.  

The tea was delicious.  We ordered the earl grey and the vanilla roobios.  Both were phenomenal.  The mix matched cups were super cute, as was the mix matched china.  The scones were simply delicious with the lemon curd.  The little sandwiches were good, but the star of the show was the scone.  

The service was good, we spent almost two hours there and did not feel rushed which was appreciated.  I will definitely be back, it was a fun experience and a very girly thing to do.
author: T T.

description:
This place is the perfect place for me to feel super girly! I went here with my mom today for probably the 10th time and all throughout our tea time, I couldn't stop saying, "I love this place." I want my birthday here, once I get proposed to, forget the bachelorette party, I want my bridal shower here and once I get pregnant, I want my baby shower here!

Best place to go for tea and scones and tea sandwiches...oh, let's not forget the petit fours at the end of your meal. My favorite tea sandwiches are the roastbeef and horseradish, the salmon and cream cheese and the chicken and asparagus. Their dressing for the salad is delicious. Coleslaw is yummy too and their scones are heaven! I always save the scone for last! Soooooo good! My petit four was delicious as well, I got the triple chocolate. I came out feeling more than satisfied! So delicious! I wanna go back tomorrow!
author: Reese E.

description:
make reservations because this place gets booked quick and often, especially on the weekends and if your party is 4+.

friendly staff and service was attentive.
they had a variety of tea sandwiches to choose from; cucumber and mint, roast beef and horseradish, chicken walnut apple, smoked salmon and cream cheese, bay shrimp, egg and onion, salmon mousse, and much more.
i had the queens tea for two and one order is enough for two people!
they also let you choose your petit fours; mocha, vanilla, chocolate rasberry, orange.
i wish there were more tea options and seating is a bit tight in my opinion.

they take mastercard and visa. 
street parking can be a hassle, bring out your compact car!
author: Anita W.

description: Loved it! I'm British and have lived in SF for a year and half now. Lovejoys reminded me of a lot of the good stuff we left behind. Crumpets, scones and cheese and pickle sandwiches have never tasted so good. We had the queen's tea and were not disappointed! :-)
author: Harriet P.

description:
Well, I do have to say that this is a great place to have a ladies get-together (I did see a few bold men come in and have tea or check the place out... nothing wrong with them coming in, but I have to say it must've been really awkward to go to a place for tea parties... I noticed most of them didn't stay or left early), but the price tag is pretty steep. I'm really big on balancing quantity, quality, and price. 

But, if you are just coming for the experience with good friends, I can give this place four stars.

The food was good, but my goodness, it was 24 dollars (Queen's tea) for about 4 tiny sandwiches, a scone, a fistful of salad, some jam, lemon curd, a little cream and a small fruit salad on a tiered display and a bottomless pot of tea. Oh yeah, and a shortbread cookie and a petit-four. The tea I had was really good- I had the china rose.

Yet, I'm not sure if I want to spend that much on food when I can go to the store or make the items that I ate for about as much as was spent and serve 4 or 5 people. If I factored in the rest of my party's costs, we could have served bout 15-20 people! Now, all I need to do is go to goodwill to find some nice tablecloths, table runners, and various knick-nacks and dig through my great-grandmas china so I can decorate my house shabby-chic style. I should serve high tea at my house in that case. lol. This is just how I think. Don't let that deter you from coming here.

The place was really cute.
author: Janielle L.

description:
This is such a cute place! came here with the ladies for a book club meeting and what a great place for our purpose.  

Bottomless teas and friendly staff and food came out quickly.  The place is pretty pricey though, I ordered the savory tea, comes with choice of 2 sandwiches, came out to $18 with tax + tip, and the sandwiches were okay.  The salmon mousse was good, a little salty, but the chicken walnut was a little runny with too much mayo.  Tea was delicious!

Overall, a great place to hang out with the girls, it's a little pricey, but your'e really paying for the ambience.
author: Grace L.

description: I just love this place. I've been here many times and everything is perfect. I love the tea, the sandwiches, sweets and salads. Also the menus are perfect and well calibrate.The service is very nice, sweet and quick. Looks like you're in England with the Victorian style and you can have a relaxing conversation. Perfect to go with your girlfriends, boyfriend or even kids!!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I heart this place.  

Make your reservations in advance, come here with an empty stomach, and a head full of chit chat for the ladies, and go to town.  

Such delightful food and fun flavors of tea.  Good food and really great atmosphere.  

I can't wait to go again and enjoy a spot of tea with my girls.
author: Lu E.

description:
My mom and her side of the family are English, so I kind of know my way around an English tea.  And when I say tea, I mean tea and the food that goes with it.

Lovejoy's has an unsurpassed tea menu...and again, I'm talking about the food.  Their sandwiches are cute, little, de-crusted  combos of cream cheese & cucumber, cheese & tomato, roast beef & horseradish, ham & spicy mustard, cheese & chutney and on and on and on.  There is no skimping on that sandwich menu, believe me.  They serve Taylor's tea, among other choices, so that's pretty cool....but it'd be even cooler if they carried Sainsbury's Red Label!

And then there's the scones.  And the chestnut tea.  And the shortbread.  And the sausage rolls (not as good as my mom makes 'em, but still good enough to scare away any avid dieters).  And the petits fours (mmm, marzipan!).  And the pasties (savory pies, not nipple hiders).  YES.  They have delicious, savory pies here!  Yum.  Although, I'm sure a lot more men would come here if the pasties advertised were of the tittie-bar variety.  And yes, I just used "tittie-bar" while reviewing a tea room.

Which brings me to my next point:  this place has a lovely atmosphere for say, a lunch with the ladies, or a baby shower or just plain high tea.  But it can be a bit precious with all the crazy estrogen and flowered what-nots floating around.  Every time I come here, there is maybe one (bored or forced-to-look-happy) man for every 8 women sitting in the place.  And there are doilies.  Not like that's any different from my mom's house.  I'm just warning the not-so-feminine and the ladylike-lacking so you're not surprised if you get the evil eye for saying something along the lines of  "HOLY FUCKING SHIT!!!  THIS PLACE IS RAD!"
author: mary r.

description:
I came here yesterday with some family members for High Tea. I didn't play a role in the booking process but from what I understand, the reservation was made several months in advance. 

Parking wasn't too difficult on a Saturday afternoon and most of us found spots within a few block radius. Lovejoy's was packed and groups were standing outside, waiting and chatting happily. 

Inside was crowded but comfortable; cozy and inviting. Decor was a fun Victorian thrift store look with British overtones... kind of like Target's "Shabby Chic" line but way more authentic and personalized. 

The tea was amazing and our server was incredibly patient in describing each of the varieties to us. I normally dump ridiculous amounts of sugar in any tea I encounter but found myself enjoying both the Chinese Rose Petal and Vanilla Rooibos straight on their flavor alone. Sandwiches for our party of 6 were served on a huge 3-tiered tray, cut into triangles and adorably lined up around the edges. We wondered what they did with all the cut-off crusts at the end of the day. 

Of the vegetarian options, the egg and onion sandwiches were quite good. Cream cheese is pretty much good in anything (wontons, sushi, frosting); paired with Mandarin oranges or sliced cucumber is no exception. The pear and Stilton (English blue cheese) combination, though interesting, did not taste particularly good. Our sandwiches were served with a delicious spring green salad in addition to large warm scones, preserves, and Double Devon Cream (which I thought was whipped butter). The coleslaw, which seemed like an odd addition to our tea and real salad, was creamy but bland and remained barely touched the duration of our meal. 

Overall, Lovejoy's was a wonderful place for our group to get together, visit, and lose track of time. The ambiance lent itself well to feeling cheerful and relaxed and the tea itself was exceptional. It seemed a bit pricey for such dainty fare... I suppose it's more of an experience than an actual meal but we were all hungry shortly after leaving. Also, some of the flavor combinations really missed the mark. So, go with friends, but eat first.
author: Jenny J.

description:
A friend and I had never been to tea time so we decided to give Lovejoy a try. 

Don't get me wrong, when we first walked in it was cute. We didn't schedule an appointment because we didn't know we had to, but luckily it wasn't busy so our server just gave us a head's up for next time. The scones were bomb!! They have a wide variety of tea choices, too.

The only thing we didn't like was that there was a min. charge per person, so when we tried sharing an order and she didn't looked pleased. Again, she warned us for next time. heh.

We also felt a little bit rushed, even though the place was empty. She kept talking to us like "if you're not going to order anymore, why are you staying?" type of service. Tea time is for catching up with a friend, dude! We were there for less than an hour any way!

Overall, they're really strict about their rules:
seating time limit
no sharing meals if it's under 20 dollars
make an appointment

I'd rather hit up the Secret Garden Tea house on Lincoln. The scones aren't the same, but still delicious. The service is way better and they don't mind the sharing =p
author: Deb E.

description:
They have a good concept going here - not only is it high tea with all the cute and flowery frills, but they also have hats and decorations so that girls (of all ages) can come to live out their tea party plays.  And of course, extra kudos to the dads or male chaperones who come to join the festivities.

So as a fan of tea and tea-time, I was really looking forward to hosting a baby shower for my friend here.  Our group of 7 gathered to shower our friend about a week ago. BUT, unfortunately, I'm sad to share that our experience stops me from visiting again any time soon.

It's really difficult to enjoy your time when you are feeling rushed.  From the moment we sat down, we were reminded of the 2 hour seating time with a reminder every 20 min from there on.  We appreciated our server's patience in explaining the different sandwiches/teas and in accommodating to the dietary needs of our expecting friend.  However, we did not appreciate our server's constant reminders that the clock was ticking for our seating time or the constant monitoring of how much we had progressed in finishing up our time.  

I understood the 2 hour seating policy when I made the reservations and again when reminded upon being seated.  A third reminder would have sufficed.  But by the fifth reminder, we just wanted to get out of what felt like an inhospitable environment.  

The food was ok but the tea selection was great.  
The setting is true to its name, with all the many different teapots and hats to borrow.
But in light of what we experienced, I regret that what rings the most clear in our memory is being rushed out and feeling like being almost kicked out.
author: Carol K.

description: Once I followed a little white manic rabbit..and he lead me to Lovejoys. The place is an indoor tea garden of mix-matched pots and cups, waiting to be poured some of the most tastiest rooibos ;) the Pear and Stilton is served on a lilypad and I am in complete luxury. Thank you kind miss for the cake-lets. I don't know if I wanna eat em or showcase them :)
author: Lucy F.

description:
This is the perfect place for a bridal shower. I know because I was a guest at one here. The cornucopia of tea snacks was amazing and all very tasty.

UPDATE:
My bachelorette party started here and we had a wonderful time. Seven of us enjoyed the Queen's Tea which included sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, crumpets, scones (my favorite!), shortbread cookies, and petit fours. The food and tea were delicious and served on precious mismatched china.

UPDATE 2:
We went back for a birthday and brought some straight guys. Although the husband was worried he'd have to wear a hat (they have hats available to put on at a tea place near San Diego), I assured him that they didn't make you wear hats here. He survived lunch at Lovejoy's with his manhood intact. (More than survived - he and another male friend were comfortable the whole time.) The husband loved scoopfuls of the after dinner mints.

The Queen's Tea involves a lot of food. For $5 less a person you can get the High Tea which is still plenty of food. The only thing I felt like I missed by doing this was the crumpets.

Now that I've been here a few times I can better evaluate the food:

Faves:
Tea: Passion fruit
Sandwiches: Chicken walnut salad (least fave: fig and olive tapenade)
Scones!
Crumpets

Least Faves:
Fig and olive tapenade sandwich
Coleslaw - the rye seeds give it an odd flavor and I'm the only one who ever eats coleslaw in our group - I wish they'd give us crumpets instead
Petit fours - too sweet

Finish your tea experience by going across the street to Lovejoy's Attic and buying your favorite tea (at a much cheaper price) and tea set.
author: Kathleen M.

description: One of my favorite places in the world. I even celebrated my birthday there one year and booked the area in the back. The staff accommodated my friends,  my gifts and even set up a tea leaf reader to come in. Beautiful selection of teas. Prices are reasonable. Best bet is to make a reservation. They do have walk in slots, but not many. This place books up about 2 sometimes 3 weekends in advance. They call you back right away to confirm and the women are lovely. The food is delicious and beautifully prepared. I love the shepards pie. One of my faves. Grab your mom, aunts, nieces, grandmother and/or friends and make it a beautiful afternoon of tea and great company. Love this place.
author: C. M.

description: Went here for my friend's bridal party and it was the perfect setting. LTR reminds me of Alice in Wonderland meets shabby chic. Located in Noe Valley, LTR, has tea time all day with mini sando that complete any brunch or in my case bridal party. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the place which was a bit of whimsy and playful all at once. I definitely recommend this spot for bridal parties, Mother's day, or a brunch with the ladies!
author: C M.

description:
Lovejoy's Tea Room has really delicious scones.  And the black currant tea is to die for.

Other than that, I didn't enjoy much else.  After the initial, "omg this is so cute and cozy!" reaction I had, the whole ambiance of the place just felt kind of off to me.  Hodgepodge furniture squished together, no room to even stick out your pinky finger to drink tea like a snob!  

I understand that they are super busy, so I appreciate them fitting us in the 1 hour opening they had.  But the waitress was kind of strange and didn't provide us with attentive, fast service given that she wanted us to leave ASAP.  

My friend came in 3 minutes after we placed our initial order so the waitress said she would be right back to take her order.  But she never really came back until we were half way through our tea time.  

Eat your scones while they're hot!!
author: Anna T.

description:
If you're ever unsure of where this celebrated tea room is, keep your eyes and ears peeled for hoards of chatty, polished women standing on a street corner. You've arrived at your destination where the air is filled with lots of estrogenic energy and excitement.

I'm not a girly girl by any means. My friends wore pretty dresses while I had on dark jeans and a grey t-shirt. Though I love tea houses and bars, primarily hippie and zen joints, I was apprehensive about going to a 'girly girl' tea room. I braced myself for the worst, but was pleasantly surprised from the moment I stepped inside Wonderland.

Lovejoy's is UK whimsical meets SF quirky. The space is decorated with all sorts of random trinkets, lace pillows, mismatched tea pots, cups, and saucers, and couches. Sit at a 2 or 4 top where the tables are 'reserved for royalty'. With our reservations, the five of us got to sit on the parlor couches 'reserved for queens' next to a giant red telephone booth. 

We had two servers who were very helpful and attentive. Because I love variety, I like knowing what my options are and these ladies were on it! They gave their recommendations and then gave us options where we could mix and match to get the most out of our meal. What we got:

****Queen's tea - a three tier platter: highly recommended!****
Top tier: fresh, I mean FRESH blackberries, grapefruit, strawberries, kiwi, cantaloupe. Nuff said.

Middle tier: warm, fresh baked raisin scones with generous servings of raspberry spread, buttery cream, and lemon curd. This was by far my favorite tier -  conveniently placed at eye-level, these scones made it to my mouth and tummy in no time.

Bottom tier: light and refreshing housemade coleslaw, a bed of organic mixed greens, and bite sized triangle shaped sandwiches. The smoked salmon was fresh but a little too salty for my taste; the turkey with stone ground mustard was tasty, but my all time favorite was the apple, walnut, and chicken salad salad sandwich. Really light yet packed with flavor and served on both white and wheat bread.

We also had:

Chicken curry pastie: flaky and fresh but a little bland and nothing to write home about.

Ploughman's lunch - good to get if you like goat and bleu cheese, salt and vinegar chips, hummus, and chutney...but otherwise an odd combination. I'd stick with the Queen's tea platter.

Bottomless tea: we had the house blend (very strong and aromatic), mango decaf (didn't get to try), and Dragon Well green (lacked robustness, but probably because we didn't let it steep long enough).

I'll definitely be back for more scones and tea. Offering a unique and fun 'girly' experience in the heart of Noe Valley, Lovejoy's is great for lunch, birthday & bachelorette parties, or torturing a male companion. Just kidding. Sort of.
author: Patty L.

description:
I don't know what they put in the decaf Vanilla Rooibos tea at this place, but that stuff is the best drug on earth!! Every time I order it, I am on a high for the rest of the day. That high is mostly likely due in part to the tea, in part to the spoon of sugar I put in each cup, and also due to the incredible food served in the High Tea and the fact that I always have the BEST time with my girlfriends at this adorable place. The staff could not be more pleasant and it's fun to witness so many celebrations happening around you.
One tip, be sure to order a side of lemon curd with your High Tea. You will not regret it!
author: Michelle D.

description:
This is a wonderful place to reboot estrogen levels with a girlfriend. The little sandwiches, warm scones, and big pots of tea are grown-up versions of the tea parties I used to have in my backyard when I was 9. 
Important to note:
1) Do make reservations. The weekends fill up fast.
2) Don't expect this to be a quick lunch. Most places try to clear their tables quickly for the next party, but Lovejoy's caters to the female side and understand that girls tend to take a while. We like to talk! 
3) The High Tea for two is actually a lot more food than it looks like. If you have leftovers, they'll pack them up for you and even put a damp towel with the sandwiches so they don't dry out on the way home. 
4) Kids - always a touchy issue. The ones we saw there were well behaved and really enjoyed the authentic tea party. 

It was lovely to be a tea ponce for the afternoon!
author: Jess J.

description:
I really wanted to hate this Tsunami of Estrogen Palace. I tried really, really, really hard. The sheer nightmare of annoying chicks, baby showers, bridal festivities and grandma's doilies crawling all over the place just screams kill-me-now-bah-humbug. Not my style but I had to go b/c my gf picked this place for a reunion outing. 

After parting the giddy baby shower party to hobble inside, my blackened, shriveled-up, prune of an attitude softened when the hostess saw I was in a walker and repositioned the tight tables so she could provide me a tuffet on which to elevate my broken ankle. I never even asked, she just knew to do it! Despite it being Saturday and quite crowded, our Alice-in-Wonderland-dressed waitress provided nothing less than a perfect, proper, sweetheart level of excellent service. Never did we feel rushed and the food was pretty good, too. 

Never mind I had to pee like crazy after 100 pots of earl grey, but it was worth it to check Lovejoy's off the bucket list. Wouldn't go back unless I had to, but admittedly, it was a very nice experience.
author: Jen H.

description: What a great place! It's places like this that make me LOVE SF. My friend and I walked in without a reservation and were immediately seated (we caught a lucky break). We opted for the Queens tea. Everything on that tiered dish thingy was DELICIOUS! Even the fresh fruit was perfectly ripe.  I fell in love with the Lemon Curd...so yummy! I was esctatic when I realized they had jars of it for sale!!  The service was pleasant and timely. I can't wait to go back.
author: Gina G.

description:
Wonderful black tea here in the most quaint of atmospheres. Great china.
The tea was top-notch; what a large menu selection. Really enjoyed it!
I also had some lovely crumpets with fresh marmalade. Unfortunately I wasn't able to try the little sandwiches because I am lactose-intolerant. My friend said they were wonderful, though!
author: Veronica J.

description: I recently went there with my family excepting it to be a great tea place, but it wasn't as good as I expected. Service was nice, but food wasn't good.
author: Kaitlynne L.

description: This room to me felt a bit tacky. While it seems fairly traditional, the overall vibe I got was kinda cheap. It reminded me of a Cracker Barrel that had been taken over by Grannies. My friends and I ordered an assortment of things. Two "queen teas", sausage rolls, and Shepard pie. The presentation of the high tea was nice at first glance. It looks very full, but really it's just a whole lot of salad and fruit. Some other tea rooms offer little cakes and mini savory items which are more enjoyable. The Shepard's pie tasted very earthy which some people may enjoy, I found it to be a bit under seasoned and bland. Sausage rolls were slightly better than the pie but just not a lot of substance. The biggest turnoff was our waiter who while when ordering tea kept emphasizing the $9 charge. It was off putting and it felt like she thought we couldn't afford it. After spending $100 and leaving hungry, this place gets 3 stars for being whimsical, not terrible but just not great.  Just whelming.
author: Amanda E.

description:
Hosted a bridal shower at Lovejoy's this past weekend and it couldn't have been a better experience from start to finish.  The staff at Lovejoy's was such a pleasure to work with: efficient, organized, pleasant, and flexible.  Even when we exceeded the 20 person limit for parties at the last minute (and added gluten free requirements), and even though our big group (incl two babies sleeping in strollers) virtually took over the tea room, Gillian and the rest of Lovejoy's couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating.  Don't even think twice about hosting a bridal shower anywhere else!
Thank you Lovejoy's!
author: Lori M.

description: LoveJoy was my first tea room in San Francisco to try. This place is small yet it was packed. Great place to take moms, grandma's and friends. Reservations are a must to be seated. The scones were nice and warm.  They have the tallest towers of food I've ever seen. Lookign forwarding to trying others to compare.
author: Mira M.

description:
Tried this place a while ago with some girlfriends and had a great time. As I love tea I was impressed with the teas that they offer and they made it a point to make sure that I always had hot water and I was never empty.  The teas were super tasty and I loved that I had my own personal tea pot. 
=)

At first glance it didn't seem like out little tower of scones and sandwiches would be very filling but they proved to be otherwise. The  Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard was delish as were the scones!

Super important to make reservations in advance. The place can get kinda cramped and warm. I was wearing a sweater and wished I hadn't.

Overall it was a delightful time with girlfriends and I can't wait to do it again.
author: Lisette E.

description:
I was hoping for more when i came here. I guess i have high expectations but i really think a perfect tea room can be achieved in the bay area.

The food was a bit overpriced and you don't get a lot of selection on sandwiches or scones. You actually get one giant scone rather than a bunch of smaller ones. 

The location is random, but that makes it charming -- as are the mismatched settings/teapots. The service was really lovely; very friendly and definitely above & beyond. The food was pretty tasty and I was happy to see pasty on the menu. it's very cozy and casual.
author: Stella C.

description:
Tea for two, that's me and you...

There was a babyshower with very very bright reoccuring flash behind my table. If I would have been an epileptic, this would have been bad.

There was a hair in a sammy. It wasn't mine.

The waitress dumped the tray (thankfully, nearly empty) all over the table, just missing me and the tea of the girl at the next table.

Their answer for everything? Have another petite four. On the house.

Eh, works for me.
author: Danielle L.

description:
I love Lovejoy's!!!! 

1. Parking is always easy to find.
2. Its so homey and cozy! Their decorations & mixed matched table settings are so cute
3. Service is always outstanding. When I get my bottomless pot of tea, it's always fillled
4. Sandwiches are kind of small, but delicious! I always leave satisfied and not too full. 
5. I've been there about 2 times, and they already remember me.

 By far, the best tea place I've ever been to. I wouldn't recommend anywhere else.
author: M V.

description:
I can't say enough good things about this quaint little tea room. My 4 year old daughter and I had a "tea party" at Lovejoys to top off our girls day out. It was SO perfect in every way, from the mismatched tea cups/plates to the warm and cozy decor. It was perfect parts fancy/cozy/warm/authentic. I think we will need to make this tea room our mother/daughter tradition. 

Also note- I'm a vegan and they were SO accommodating to my dietary restrictions. They replaced cheese with chutney, and milk for soy milk. It was a lovely treat.
author: Danielle J.

description:
This place was very disappointing. The only things that are actually freshly made are the sandwiches and, even then, the ingredients aren't fresh. 

I had canned asparagus and canned chicken sandwich (It tasted like tuna! YUCK.)


I liked my tea, but who goes wrong with black tea?
author: Nathan V.

description:
I could not get enough of LoveJoy's today! Seriously, I *LOVE* this place. Love, Love, Love, Love, Love!!!

For awhile now I've had a growing suspicion that I should've been born British. I quite prefer posh, pretty, fancy things. I love etiquette, and in most circumstances, am known to be rather proper. I prefer the words "loo," "dodgy," and "cheeky" to our American versions of the same. I have a propensity towards verbosity, and have a general trend of using flowery, overly descriptive language to make my point. I appreciate correct grammar, syntax, and diction. And I often prefer my British (& European, well, foreign - in general) friends over most Americans whom I meet (shhh... don't tell). So to come into a tea room and be engulfed in reminders of a land I love, it was just exquisite! 

Beautiful mis-matched tea pots and tea cups abound, stacked finger sandwiches were ubiquitous, and friendly, happy women were happy to help and offer suggestions on tea/sandwich selections upon request. I really think I found my happy place today!

I showed up to meet a group of girlfriends for my late birthday celebration today (I am an Aries, but it's a rather long story), and was greeted by a bouquet of flowers from my friends (my favorite gift!) and shiny, happy faces everywhere. We had the loveliest of times, splendid conversation, lots of laughs, and bottomless tea, as well as our own bottle of sauvignon blanc to top it off. Really, this was such a fantastic afternoon/day, I want to just return and repeat tomorrow! 

Love, Love, Love EVERYTHING about LoveJoy's.
author: Sally M.

description: Absoultely ADORE this place.  It's soo cute and the tea is delicious!  Such a girly and fun place to have an afternoon tea.  The only downside is its prices really.  Pretty expensive...but fine for once in a while.
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
"I feel pretty! Oh so pretty! I feel pretty and witty and gay and I pity any girl who isn't me today..."  

Lovejoy's has me channeling my inner MARIA and feeling like dancing on the rooftops, respectfully, of course!  Just enough SHABBY CHIC with cute frilly accents to satisfy the girly-girl heart that beats within me.  Not overly pretentious nor overly saccharin.  One word that remains in my head following my afternoon tea here with a friend:  CHARMING.

In my opinion, securing an actual reservation for afternoon tea was the most difficult part of the whole experience.  It seems that weekend time slots book AT LEAST a week in advance.  Yet,  once we were confirmed everything else was SUBLIME.  By everything else, I mean the service, the ambiance, the food and tea selection.

My friend and I ordered the Queen's tea, which allowed for us to select 2 sandwhiches and came with salad, coleslaw, shortbread biscuit, crumpet, fresh fruit, crumpet, preserves, lemon curd, double devon cream AND a petit fours.  All were scrumptious!!!

Yet, a word of caution: if there are more than 1 in a party, they will charge based on the # of individuals.  This is kind of confusing.  It looks like we were charged $24.95 for the Queen's Tea and $24.00 for every extra person.  It's a bit tricky.

All in all, we spent about $67.30 (incl tax, but not tip).  A hefty price for tea, but so far, this has been my most enjoyable experience.

Parking in the area can be tough.  Public transport runs on Church Street.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Lovejoys is an excellent balance between high society tea and the casual tea lounge. If you want a table, make a reservation in advance or line up outside before it opens. This place fills up quickly for good reason. Their tea selection offers a good amount of variety. I recommend their chocolate truffle tea if it's available. Their shrimp sandwiches are delightful, as is the service.

Tip: Make sure to stop by their tea shop across the street. There are adorable tea favors, and you will get a coupon at Lovejoys to apply towards loose leaf tea.
author: Christine K.

description:
I felt like a little girl again playing with my tea set, except this time we had real tea and real scones instead of air and plastic scones. 

I found Lovejoy's online when I was searching for tea houses in San Francisco for my visit. I was expecting to go to a Japanese or Chinese tea house, but I'm soooooo glad I came across Lovejoy's in my search. 

The decor is very homey, cozy, and welcoming. Even the bathroom was decorated with antiques. 

We got there an hour before closing time so the kitchen was closed. We didn't mind since we were heading to dinner soon after. Scones and other side dishes were still available. The scones were fresh and light. We ordered the passion fruit black tea. They also brought around a tray of petifore. For an hour, I thought I'd died and gone to heaven.

Lovejoy's is every little girl's dream, no matter her age.
author: Amy C.

description:
We came for a girlie afternoon tea for 4, with reservations made, we had a cute table all set up. everything was dainty and cutesy, and with good company, it's the perfect set up for a nice light lunch. Parking was no problem at all. 

the Teas: 
- PASSIONFRUIT TEA - great no milk needed
- VANILLA ROOIBOS - great! add the milk, it adds a lil something

the food 
- SCONES WITH PRESERVES AND DOUBLE DEVON CREAMS - was great! even with the lemon sauce it was good 
- fresh fruit - you can't go wrong 
- shortbread tea biscuit
- ROAST BEEF AND HORSERADISH SANDWICH - tasty! 
- salmon and cream cheese sandwich was too salty... eh.. you should opt for another option. 

the service is amazing. the ladies come around often and warm up the tea for you every so often, to ensure that you have a nice relaxing afternoon there. And they limit reservations to 2 hour blocks, so be prepared to spend some time here. 

this is a great place for meeting up with the girls for a girlie afternoon, a special occasion or just enjoying great company. And afterwards go across the street to their antique shop to purchase some of the teas for your own tea party at home, or other fun kitchen knickknacks...
author: Judy N.

description:
[M]ona: 5 Stars
[W]ayne: 4.5 Stars
Average: 4.75 Stars

+ Great Ambiance
+ Excellent Service
+ Nice Tea Selection 
+ Cute Interior and Decor
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Good Food!
+ Good Tea!
+ Filling
+ Not a "girly" thing
+ 10% off at Lovejoy's Attic

[M] I took my good friend here for her birthday last year and she liked it very much. So this time, I decided to come here with Wayne and have him enjoy the experience as well. If you think Tea parties are for girls only then you're totally wrong hehe. 

We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon (reservations are recommended especially for the weekend) and there was a table in the center of the tea house waiting just for us. Since Wayne is a pretty big eater, we decided on the Queen's Tea http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=57N_lW3GA1ks-eR5xwMmwA for him and a High Tea http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=fn2qSFZVLENOMjuNJS3JQQ for me. The Queen's Tea comes with your choice of tea with unlimited refills, choice of 2 sandwiches, cole slaw, green salad, platter of fresh fruit, a scone with preserves and double devon cream, tea biscuit, crumpet with lemon curd and a petite four. The High Tea is just the same sans the fresh fruit, crumpet and petite four http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=9qzUBqc5axqMSGw-DIrsPQ. We opted for the Genmai Tea and Black Current Tea. For our sandwich selection, we had the smoked salmon and cream cheese, salmon mousse, mandarin orange and cream cheese, and bay shrimp and mayonnaise.

[W] I thought the tea was pretty good here. I originally chose the Afternoon Darjeeling tea and saw the Genmai Tea written on a blackboard in the back of the restaurant. The hostess was nice enough to help me switch out the tea even though they made a point that they normally don't after they have brewed it. The Genmai http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=pOcaHOwOkJQRQSUJVsx19A was light and ricey. Kinda like the ones from Japanese and Korean restaurants. The sandwiches were pretty good. I especially liked the salmon and cream cheese sandwich as well as the mandarin orange and cream cheese was really refreshing. The crumpet http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=9KKmlGQB8rVk3Sc3ypRWOg looked like a sponge to me but was also good. The scones were really filling.

[M] The Black Current black tea has a nice fruity aroma but doesn't taste as it smells. It was a bit strong and bitter and needed some water to tone down the flavor. My favorite tea selection at Lovejoy's is the China Rose Petal Black Tea and Strawberry Green Tea. The hostess recommended us the Chestnut tea. Perhaps we will try that next time. 

[W] Overall experience was nice. I didn't feel out of place since to my surprise, there were quite a lot of men in there. I always imagined tea parties were for "girly-girls" but Mona totally proved me wrong. We would definitely be back.
author: Mona C.

description: The best part besides it being Carol's Bridal shower and meeting her other friends is the Scones. They were really really good, so ladies save room for the scone! Tea service was nice, the day we went was really really hot and they have no air-conditioning...bummer.
author: K T.

description:
Since I'm morally-opposed to "girly-girl" type of things/places Lovejoy's makes me feel a little, well, less joy.  Plus, I personally don't like cucumber sandwiches with the crusts cut off.  But, it was a good spot for my cousin's bridal shower because it was nice and calm and cozy so we could all really enjoy spending time together.

Now, if only it weren't so very pink and flowery.  Ugh.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
High Tea is one of my favorite things.  Usually in the late afternoon, it's an opportunity to nosh in place of a traditional dinner.  When the idea came up to have an outing at Lovejoy's I jumped on it.  I've never been to the establishment before but I am always on the lookout.

Lovejoy's is a lovely little tea room that serves some of the best raisin scones with lemon curd I've ever eaten.  You get to choose from different tea services, I chose the "Queen's Tea," which gives you a choice of two sandwiches, organic green salad, coleslaw, a scone, and crumpet, preserves, Devon cream, lemon curd, and of course, your tea.  I chose the Dragon Well green tea.  

The food was delicious, the tea was perfectly steeped, the atmosphere was pleasant, and the service was excellent.  I love Lovejoy's and would definitely return.
author: Courtney S.

description:
I went here for a tea party for my friend's birthday.  This place is so quaint! my friend ordered an arrat of little sanwiches and snacks that were serves in cute silver towers.  We each got to chose our own tea and were each served a large scone.  The tea selection is large.  We each chose a different tea so by the end of the day  tried 7 teas which were all really tasty.

This is great place for a girls day out.
author: danielle l.

description:
What a wonderfully cute place to enjoy high tea for two hours with your favorite ladies =)

My cousin planned a pre-Mother's day get together here for the lady cousins and the aunties/mommies. My mom and I have never done something like afternoon tea before, so I was all for it!
 
There were 8 of us, so we decided to order four "high tea for two." You are allowed to order 4 different sandwiches for each "high tea for two." Luckily none of us were picky about the choices, so we made it simple and just ordered one of every sandwich they offered. Yes, 16 different choices for us ladies to choose from! 

Our waitress was nice enough to point out every crustless sandwich that was on the two 3-tiered trays that came to our table. But with 16 different options and 8 hungry ladies, it was difficult to remember what and where each sandwich flavor was. Everyone just ate off the tray that was within reach. 

I'm not a vegetarian, but I do appreciate the my fruits and veggies. And they have quite the variety of veggie options for sandwiches - artichoke hummus, apple and cheese, and cucumber and cream cheese, just to name a few. Who knew mandarin and cream cheese would taste pretty good?

The sandwiches were yummy, but the scones were warm and DELICIOUS! I'm normally not a fan of scones, but these paired with either their cream or blackberry(?) jam were divine. And the little shortbread cookies were the right size for a rich, buttery treat.  
Our tea pots were never empty. Mango and chamomile was our table's favorite. We also had earl grey and a special one of the day. 

Tea and sandwiches may not make you stuffed, but we walked out of here laughing, smiling, and bellies (and hearts) satisfied =)

My mom had such a good time, she wants to go back for her birthday!

NOTE: they have set seating times for high tea, and they don't fool around. They were kindly letting us know how much time we had left before the next party arrived. So if your lunching with a group, make sure to come on time to get the most of it! Don't forget to give yourself enough time to find parking in this residential area.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
We had a great time at tea on Friday! Company could not be beat! :D

We all had the Queen's Tea and I'd go with that again. You get a scone and a crumpet, salad and cole slaw, and this fruit feast, bottomless tea, 8 finger sandwiches and a petit-fors [albeit I coulda skipped the slaw, salad and crumpet].

We ordered the: Egg & Onion, Apple-Walnut Chicken, Pear & Stilton, Chicken &  Asparagus, Albacore Tuna & Celery, Cucumber & Cream Cheese, Chutney & Cheese, Roast Beef & Horseradish. I give my favorites vote to Egg & Onion, and the Pear & Stilton. I did not like the chutney and was told to skip the asparagus.

This is my 5th tea this year. I've been to the English Rose in San Carlos twice [lousy service and food poisoning], Teas the Season in San Mateo [tasty & clean, less homey, close to home] and Tea at the Fairmont in San Jose [expensive!! and tiny, but glad we did it once]; by far, Lovejoys was the best.

They had the cutest environment, most plentiful and tastiest food [fresh, too!], personable service, and it certainly was the most economic choice for what was served. I won't hesitate to come back and bring friends - or another hat!
author: Angela H.

description:
My cousin and I, who are very big fans of afternoon tea decided to try Lovejoy one afternoon. We had visited before but were too late, so this time we wanted to make sure we would be able to get seated! 

We waited for over half an hour to get the opportunity to sit in what we felt like was "someones grandma's poorly decorated and somewhat musky, cluttered home". We also had the pleasure of sitting 10 inches away form another party. Yay. 

We had high hopes that all would get better, seeing that their selection of tea had interesting touches and their menu of snacks seemed very tasty.

WRONG. 

The tea was just OK and as much as I do NOT want to be reminded of what I ate there, I will share. My cousin and I ordered "tea for two" w/ a choice of 4 sandwiches. We chose the cucumber, salmon, chicken/asparagus and artichoke hummus sandwiches. After starting to taste our way through the sandwiches we came to a realization. I've made better cucumber sandwiches while drunk, the salmon's texture was very grainy and odd, artichoke hummus was not impressive whatsoever and for Christ's sake the chicken AND asparagus felt and tasted as if it was canned, preserved, aged. The other accompaniments - scones, mixed greens and coleslaw were mediocre. The cream and curd were far from fresh.  The man sitting less than half an arm-length away from me mentioned to his wife and mother in law that these scones were by far better than the scones sold at Starbucks. Enough said.

After barely touching our food we decided we needed to run far far away because we could no longer settle.
author: Ashly d.

description:
PINKY IN THE AIR NOT REQUIRED HERE

It's almost an oxymoron that a tea house not be fancy, but only in San Francisco.  Where high-tea and afternoon-tea is almost synonymous with fancy dresses, heels and pearls, Lovejoy's the complete opposite. 

Don't be surprised if your waiter is inked up or pierced out.  Expect the dishes and flatware to be mismatched. Come hungry because you'll get big portions.  Don't faint when you don't end up spending a fortune on finger sandwiches and tea  Once you come here, you'll never go back to the Sheraton Palace or Ritz Carlton for tea. That is, unless you're 70 years old and still use hairspay and wear pantyhose.
author: Rita S.

description:
I booked Lovejoy's on the strength of yelp reviews for a bridal shower I was hosting as matron of honor for my best friend.  Lovejoy's staff was absolutely amazing helping me to arrange it -- everything was very simple.  I reserved the group several months ahead (they're very popular), and then they just had me tell them the size of the guest list, even though they and I both knew the number of attendees would be far smaller, they were just earmarking more than enough space for me.  Then I simply had to confirm the number of guests 48 hours before the event -- incredibly short notice, really convenient for last minute changes.

So!  For my group, I ordered the high tea + crumpets because I love crumpets.  I thought that on a per-person basis for a nice event, it was very reasonably priced.

When I arrived half an hour early, our tables were already set up, and there were two tables set aside as gift tables, which were very nice to have.  I had plenty of time to lay out favors and seating cards as my guests trickled in.  Hot tea in an assortment of flavors was laid out immediately for guests to enjoy, and then they could order specific flavors as well.

Ten minutes after 4 o'clock, tea was served on large multi-tiered trays.  Everyone tucked in, and then crumpets were served about 10 minutes after people started winding down on the tea trays.

Tea pots were promptly refilled as they were emptied; the service was absolutely fantastic; and the food was more than anyone could eat.  I had a large bag of leftovers to take home, and that was a big bonus!   
Everyone at the tea party let me know they had a fabulous time, and I highly recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room for any event that needs a good cup of tea.  :)
author: Tasha D.

description:
I love love love Lovejoy's. Nothing made me more sad when I was moving to the 'burbs than that I won't be right next to this perfect little treasure. If you are planning on a weekend visit make a reservation ASAP. This place is always busy!

While it is very cramped inside, there is a level of personal touch you can't beat. Nothing really matches here. Everyone gets a different pot, cup, tea strainer, you name it...it probably won't match. I think it makes the visit a little more exciting as you don't know what you are going to get. The tea is delicious and the trays come with a lot of food for a tea house. I was actually full when we left.
author: Crystal P.

description: Went with a friend. It's a 10 min walk from the Bart stn. They were very accommodating even though we came close to 20 min late due to traffic. The teas we ordered tasted really good- Rose petal and the citrus tea. Very flavorful. The decor is cute. This place has ample food options for vegetarians.  I liked the chutney-cheese sandwich while my friend preferred the artichoke hummus one. All in all a interesting experience
author: Divya R.

description: We had a high school group reunion at Lovejoy's and it was really great.  The decor helps you feel like you've stepped out of your everyday environment and taken a little trip to London.  This is a great place to bring your Mom, Auntie, niece, nephew (yes, boys too can enjoy sharing this experience), girlfriends, etc.  Crumpets were toasted and buttery with Devon cream, couldn't get enough of those! Assorted sammies were good too.  Our group wanted a photo taken and the owner helped us out by taking a photo outside in front of the hears painted on the side of the building.  When my god-daughter is old enough, I will definitely take her here.
author: Susan F.

description:
There were around 9-10 people at our party and we had 3 different kinds of tea.
Sadly I was unable to try the petite fours this time, maybe the next time.
Everything was very good.
The scones were flaky and buttery and sooooo good. YUM!
Even the cream and jam were very good, not too sweet and perfect thickness.
The sandwhiches were perfect size.  In the beginning I thought It would not be enough for all of us but in the end we had left over sandwiches.
 The place was crowded as always.
The service was great and always attentive.
Next time I will definitely have the petite fours.
Parking was a pain, we parked 3 blocks away.....you know those walks... straight up the hill.... :)  at least it burned some of the calorie intake even though it was freezing outside....
author: Emy B.

description:
Compared to Crown and Crumpet, this place is just as good if not better. 

We ordered High Tea for Two:
1) coleslaw: delicious but not too creamy.
2) Egg sandwich: very good and I like how they didn't put too much mayo.
3) smoked salmon with cream cheese and cucumbers with cream cheese: LOVE (there is no way in hell someone can mess that up).
4) Bottomless Dragon tea:  light and fab!

The pastries were very good as well.

I recommend reservations because it gets packed.
author: Liz Q.

description:
I went here with 3 friends and my friend's little one.  
I really love the atmosphere, the decor, and the food is pretty good.  The little finger sandwiches taste fresh and light.  We also ordered this shepherd's pie type of thing, totally forgot what its called, but that was a winner.

Now the teas, I recommend Chestnut and Mango Black Tea.  

Over all the experience was great and I would definitely come back :)
author: Jacqueline D.

description:
I love it! Came here as a party of five for my birthday this Sunday. I made reservations a couple of weeks in advance so we were lucky and had no trouble getting a table.

The service was excellent! The sandwiches were yum! We had the cheese and chutney, salmon mousse, chicken and asparagus and cream cheese and cucumber. For teas we tried the Yorkshire blend (a personal favourite of mine since my college days in West Yorkshire) and the Darjeeling. All were good but the Yorkshire gold really was excellent.

My only slight qualm was the mismatches furniture; I've been to plenty of tea places with mismatched furniture and tableware and it's hella cute but there were certain combinations that kinda made the zen feel weird.

Either way I'll be going back!
author: Kym P.

description:
I was first taken to this place by a friend. Of course me being a meat and potatoes kinda guy my response was, "Tea? Finger sandwiches? Are you kidding me?"

Walking in, the decor made me want to turn and run without looking back, but I sat down and was willing to suffer through whatever girly nightmare torture my friend had in mind for me.

We each ordered a pot of tea and a multi-tiered plate of food. And crumpets on the side. I learned the proper way to pour tea (pour the milk and sugar in the cup first, then the tea). We had the peach and the vanilla. It was aromatic and heavenly. When the food arrived, we nibbled and noshed. Surprisingly, I was full by the end of the meal of tiny sandwiches and tea. I survived and enjoyed the experience. I guess there is something to the whole European Tea culture.

Later in the month I took my niece and her roommate there for brunch. They were ecstatic. They've never done anything like this before and kept thanking me. We ate our fill and took a drive around the City looking at landmarks. It was a good day.
author: David P.

description:
I really, really wanted to like this place more than I did. The food was just okay, except for the scones and the lemon curd. Those were super delish. 

The atmosphere was quaint and eclectic. It just did not live up to the legendary status that I've heard described here on Yelp and in my own friend group. Mildly disappointing for the price. It was nice for a one time experience. Maybe it just wasn't my cup . . . well, you know.
author: Ang B.

description:
Exquisitely dainty.

Even if you don't dress up, you feel transformed for the duration that you're there.  Everything about the place just reminds you to be a little more polite, savor what you're consuming, enjoy the Noe Valley sunshine, and appreciate the company you're with.

Typically, my friends and I get the queen's tea (for however many people are present) with black currant tea (it is quite good), the green apple and cream cheese, mandarin orange and cream cheese, and artichoke and hummus sandwiches.  Now that Jessica T. mentions it, I don't recall if we've ever tried the pear and stilton sandwich, but we'll do so next time for sure.  The lemon curd and devonshire cream pair wonderfully with the baked goods.  The fruit and greens are great to break up the richness of the sweets and sandwiches.

Dainty is the theme here, but don't be deceived.  The queen's tea is rather filling and they also offer heartier fare.

Reservations highly recommended.  

Going to Lovejoy's - also highly recommended.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Very cute and quaint place with tasty teas and finger foods. Unfortunately, I was very put off by the service. After promptly arriving for a 1:00pm tea service reservation for a baby shower, the hostess allowed a pick of reserved tables for our party. After everyone in the party was seated and settled in, the hostess came back and informed us that our party needed to move to a cramped table available in the corner because a regular had called in and wanted our specific table. So the party, including the pregnant guest of honor, had to pack up, presents and all, and relocate to the back of the room. We obliged politely, not wanting to make a stink on a special occasion. I can appreciate catering to regular patrons where possible, but this was very unprofessional. There is also a two hour limit for the seating. Service seemed a little cold and rushed. At 3:00pm we were promptly rushed to pack our things and leave before we could even eat the dessert they had just delivered to our table.

I really enjoyed the tea service and quality of foods. The prices are steep for tea, and I was very disappointed in the level of service we received, which dampened an otherwise very happy occasion.
author: Tammi H.

description: This is my favorite place for afternoon tea in the City.  Not my husband's favorite but I think it's the decor and who can blame him?  It's so whimsical and cozy.  So for a more husband-friendly afternoon tea spot go to Leland Tea Company.  For a good time with girlfriends come here.  I always get the high tea and I order the chestnut tea.  The scones are always warm and amazing,all the tea sandwiches are tasty, and the salad is just enough to make you feel less guilty about the milk and sugar you put in your tea.  Only thing I don't care for is the coleslaw - too much fennel?  But make sure you make a reservation if you want to go on a Saturday or Sunday - because they can book up a week or two in advance.  It is so much fun and well worth the money.
author: Jean T.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE Lovejoy's and cannot wait until Lovey's opens in Pacifica.  I have been drooling for weeks now.  Tomorrow is the grand opening.  Happy Happy Joy Joy!!
author: Caisa S.

description: I've been here a few times, and its got a great atmosphere and is definitely worth going for tea. I took my niece for her birthday recently and the hostess was so incredibly sweet in getting us in last minute on a Saturday with no reservation. She took our name and called back several times in her efforts to accommodate us- which she did! The antique & homey atmosphere is great for parties or showers- although it does get a little loud/rambunctious on weekends when there are often lots of large parties and lots of kids. It was hard to have a conversations with 14 pre-teens singing and talking loudly right next to us- but hey- they were having fun :-). If you want a more quiet experience weekdays are best. The food is good, not anything special but fine. (The scones & cream are the exception- they are really exceptionally DELISH!) My only real complaint was that one of the waitresses (not ours) was pretty rude when my niece and I were trying on hats to buy- she snatched them out of our hands as she rushed by and rudely told us to use the ones for guests- before asking us if we were planning on buying them (which we were and did). Other than than the service was good, our waitress was attentive, and I would definitely go again.
author: Karina N.

description:
Who could say no to an all-girls' bonding session, complete without a steaming pot of English Breakfast with milk and sugar, scones and clotted cream and strawberry jam, and tea sandwiches?

Especially in a quintessentially English teahouse such as Lovejoy.  

The tea room is filled with a combination of long benches, straight-backed chairs with cutesy cushions, comfy sofas, and wooden buffet cabinets full of Victorian cups, teapots and whathaveyou.  The patrons of this oh-so-popular place comprise of understandably 99% women, smartly (and sometimes overly) dressed, daintily sipipng on their loose-leaf tea or munching on the perfectly cut triangular-shaped sandwiches.  

The sandwiches are delicious - we had a selection of salmon and cream cheese, roast beef, chicken apple and walnut salad, tuna, smoked turkey, and cucumber, so are the scones.  Light years better than the Rotunda at Neiman Marcus, sans the ladies with botox and Burberry scarfs, Lovejoy's is a definite gem in the quaint neighborhood of Noe Valley.  Reservation is a must, especially around prime tea time of 3PM and parking in the area could be tricky - your best bet is that the Parking God has mercy on you the day you plan on visiting Lovejoy.
author: Ange L.

description:
Lovejoy's is Adorable. It manages to give you the high tea feel without feeling pretentious or overwhelming.  

I went with a group of seven and the staff was very accommodating.  Even taking several photos of us all dolled up in our pretty dresses and hats. But going back to what I love is the fact that you would feel just as comfortable in jeans.

A few tips: give yourself a couple of hours if you are going for high tea with a group. Don't be fooled by portion size, you will get full.  Order different teas so you can share. Enjoy the process and appreciate your company.

My favorite part of tea was the scones with devonshire cream. I'd probably go back and have just that and be content.  Also, if you like the tea services, they are on sale across the street at the Lovejoy's Attic.

Cheers!
author: Benita S.

description:
I absolutely love LoveJoys! It brings me back to my younger years when my parents would bring my sister and I here for a delicious afternoon brunch of tea and sandwiches!

This place is so quaint and adorable in it's own little way. I love their passion fruit tea and those scrumptous raisin scones slathered in butter and lemon curd! I'm in my happy place whenever I'm in there enjoying their bite-size goodies. Ohh, and how about those petite fours?! They are delicate sweets of marzapan and chocolate...mmMm Oh how I wish I was there again!
author: Roxie T.

description:
My girlfriends treated me to afternoon high tea for my birthday and I loved it! It's a great place to unwind hopped up over tea scarfing down finger foods and accompanied by attentive conversation. It's really the type of place for all ages and occasions. Contrary to belief...
   -we were able to get full
   -there were just as many males as females the day we were here
   -it was pretty casual but it wouldn't be unusual if you really wanted to "dress up"

We stopped into their shop across the street where I got schooled on Digestives :/
author: Madelyn Y.

description:
In the last few years, I have nurtured a love for afternoon tea. Something about sitting around a wooden table with a lace tablecloth, or antique-style sofa with a few friends and a nice pot of tea really resonates within me. One would think I feel like a pretentious bourgeois snob, and I am not hypocritical enough to deny it; however, just let it be known that being San Franciscan automatically ingrained a bit of elitism in me. That being said, Lovejoy's Tea Room was not the first time I've taken afternoon tea, and it certainly won't be my last.

We came to Lovejoy's for my friend's birthday and hoped that we did not miss our stop while riding the J-line. The exterior did not impress me, but the moment we stepped inside, it was as if we were transported into another world. In contrast to the brightness and cuteness of Crown & Crumpet, Lovejoy's interior looked antique and mismatched and absolutely lovely. The cups and plates were all unique and pretty. Of the three tea rooms I've been to thus far, the interior design of Lovejoy's is my favorite by far. 

Luckily for us, it was a slow Friday afternoon and we were immediately seated, despite our lack of a reservation. Score! In preparation for documenting my friend's birthday, I brought my camera so I ended up obnoxiously taking pictures of the interior. We made our order, of High Tea for four and the Queen's Tea for the birthday girl.

Food was mediocre. Honestly, the best thing about the food they gave us was the dressing for the salad. I got the smoked salmon with cream cheese, and Lovejoy's special, which was chicken and pesto. Both were unimpressive and was much too creamy. The Devon Cream made me feel as if I were eating butter. I've had better scones elsewhere. The strawberry preserves they gave us was definitely not homemade, and reminded me of smuckers (didn't even spring for Bonne Maman!), and the lemon curd was not tart enough.

But the tea was fantastic! I loved the pomegranate green, and the China Rose Petal tea was a perfect sweetness (this is from someone who does not like herbal teas). Those were my favorites of the five we order. The waitress was also really nice.

Usually, I'd give three stars for mediocre food, but the decorum, service, and company made the entire experience much more enjoyable than the food. This is a fantastic place for just a lovely day out.

Bottom-line: you come here for the setting, the company, and the tea; but not the food.
author: Annie Y.

description:
I went to Lovejoy's Tea Room on one of my weekly "mommy-daughter" days. My mom and I went to enjoy a morning tea. We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones). I had the apricot tea and my mom had english breakfast.
