My only wish for this place (and I am not going to take stars away for this... because after all... it just means the business is doing well and they should not be punished for that!) is that it would be easier to get in. You really need to plan way in advance if you are to secure a reservation on the date and time you desire. It is a wonderful place to go in a big group and bring people of all ages. You see all types of folks in here. 

This is an overall charming experience. Just make sure you get there on time. If you are driving... get there earlier to secure parking (parking is hard in this area) or take public transportation. 

I need to make a reservation to go back soon! And the owner Muna is FABULOUS! Thank you for paying such great attention to my food allergies. You made me feel normal... unlike other places where they make it sound like I am a nuisance for having restrictions. I just rather be breathing. ;)
author: Amelia M.

description: I've experienced Lovejoy's Tea Room two ways- as a guest at their place, and as a bride whose wedding they catered.  In both capacities, they are outstanding.  The food is good (especially the scones!), the service is helpful, and the tea can turn even the most caffine-wary person into a fan.  When I worked with them on my wedding, they were prompt and helpful and their services were far cheaper than many other comparable menus- and probably had better food!  They are a delight, however you choose to experience them.
author: Mira G.

description: This has got to be one the best places in the bay. For the price you really get a ton. The teas are all excellent it really is the drinkers preference and the cucumber sammys are to die for. This is a place you definitely want to come hungry to. Plan to spend some time here as you really need to take your time to enjoy it. Also I would recommend a reservation as this place is always full.
author: Eisa m.

description:
This is a local favorite and it's not hard to understand why after you've ventured in here for high tea.  The service is great and the food is absolutely delicious.  Bring a friend and split a high tea for two.  Guaranteed you will depart relaxed, refreshed, and in a happy spirit.

If you come here on the weekends, reservations are recommended during breakfast to lunch hour.  If you drop by closer to closing time after 2pm the crowd dies down and you can usually find a table for two.
author: Cathy L.

description:
Tea lovers alert:  Lovejoy's is simply delightful.  A quaint and cosy little tea room with great tea selection and to-die-for pastries and tea sandwiches.  I'm simply speechless. 
Inexpensive, delicious afternoon teas, and a nice little place to catch up with friends.
 If you live in the city and enjoy afternoon teas, you really have to visit.
author: Nip Y.

description:
Ladies, what could befit a rainy miserable day more than tea and buttered scones at Lovejoy's? Enjoying crustless finger sandwiches, sausage biscuits, and petit fours with my two of my best friends as we enjoy a light banter about shoes, makeup, boys, and periods(nothing that will hurt our little heads like math, sports, or politics -- that's man talk, tee-hee).
 
And there's so much estrogen circulating in the room, we're all on the same cycle now.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
DOUBLE

DEVON

CREAM!!!

Yes, I AM shouting, and yes, it IS necessary!  Miss Lovejoy's double devon cream and berry jam on flaky, buttery scones would certainly feature on my "Last breakfast on Earth" menu.  But of course, I wouldn't stop there.  I'd go all out and order the "Queen's tea," featuring the aforementioned scones, double devon cream, jam, lemon curd, variety of sandwiches (favorites: fig & olive tapenade, salmon & cream cheese, chicken w/ asparagus, & apple and stilton), crumpets, salad, fruit, petit-fours and a pot of specialty tea per person.

Oh wait, that is what I did, just this very afternoon.  Does this mean today is my last day on Earth?  Well, it's been good.  Glad I did it in style: taking my girlfriends out to eat scrumptiously rich and satisfying food.  We ate for nearly 2 hours.  That may sound disgusting, but as a matter of fact, it was pretty - because we were so darned happy to be there, and gettin' hyphy on tea!  

Someday I want to wear a proper hat and white gloves to this place - maybe I'll wait till my hair turns a natural blue!   

Notes:
1. Do make reservations before coming.
2. They have some seasonal teas - had the chestnut black today and it was sensational.
author: Ravena F.

description:
Mad Hatter: Would you like a little more tea?
Alice: Well, I haven't had any yet, so I can't very well take more.
March Hare: Ah, you mean you can't very well take less.
Mad Hatter: Yes. You can always take more than nothing.

I love Alice in Wonderland for its spirit of adventure, mismatched quirkiness, witty prose, and cast of characters.  It is all culture and tradition, seen through a child's eyes, and turned upside down. 

I love Lovejoy's for the same reasons.  Every chair, cup, serving platter and utensil is different and wonderful, straight out of your English grandmother's attic.  

Drink Me:
Unlike poor Alice, you can have all the tea that you want, a bottomless pot!  My favorite is the Black Currant.

Eat Me:
There is no shortage of savory and sweet treats here:  lemon curd tarts, scones, double cream, cheeses, chutney, toast points, cucumber sandwiches, petit fours - all cut and shaped into small sizes perfect for popping into your mouth.  You can get them in different assortments (Queen's Tea or Ploughman's Lunch, for example), or a la carte, depending on how hungry you are.  

The staff is extremely nice - I have been there both for a group event, and for an intimate lunch, and both times we were treated very well.  The place is usually full no matter what day of the week you are there, so reservations are a must. 

Lovejoy's is a place that you want to linger - filling your cup again and again with delicious hot tea, and savoring a rare moment in the middle of the city.  Going there for lunch with the fabulous laura b. is like the perfect icing on the most scrumptious cake.  Whether you are an underground Alice or a Queen of Hearts, Lovejoy's will tickle your fancy.
author: Liz S.

description: I recently hosted my daughter's 13 year old birthday party here and it was wonderful!  As always.  I always leave here with a genuine smile on my face, it's a great place to do some mother-daughter bonding.
author: K B.

description:
How have I not written a review for this place after having tea here a handful of times?

Some gf's told me this place is better than The Secret Garden in the Sunset. I HAD to try this place!

I've tried almost ALL of the tea sandwiches and they're yummy! Definitely more filling than Secret Garden. And you get so much more food too.


Make your reservation waaayyy in advance cuz this place fills up very quickly.

There's one tea that's not on their menu and I haven't gotten a chance to try it cuz either they're out or it's not in season. My gf told me about it. I don't know the name of it but it's strawberry something. They'll know what you're talking about when you ask them.

Kids can order hot chocolate instead of hot tea. They get a HUGE mug full with whipped cream on top. They also get a "bottomless" small pitcher too. I tried the hot chocolate once and I've got to say that it is sooo bland. I couldn't even taste any chocolate. If you're going to get it, maybe ask for extra chocolate?

The employees are always on top of things even though it's crazy busy in there. They make numerous stops to your table and make sure your teapot is full and always HOT.

Definitely a repeat customer!

This is in Noe Valley and parking is a HUGE PITA (pain in the ass). 

The J Church stops right in front of this place.

They have a gift shop across the sreet. They have a lot of cute things but it's so expensive. At the end of your meal when the employee brings you your check, they include a coupon for 10% off anything in their gift shop.

Antique-y girls' tea.  Teeny sandwiches were divine, daarhling.  Now wouldn't think this would be filling after doing Bay to Breakers, but got surprisingly full after eating all that came with the high tea.  Scones with jam and cream were delectable.  Cookies good. Plentiful (damn big, it hurts my wrist to pour) pots of tea.  Too much estrogen in there though.
author: Peg S.

description:
Lovejoy's certainly doesn't need another review, but I've just got to show my love - especially since I'm going to try Crown & Crumpet tomorrow & I'm feeling a little guilty.

The food, the service, the mismatched dinnerware & the cozy feeling I always get are all of the same reasons I return again & again. 

This is the perfect tea house for special occasions like birthdays, showers, or to just celebrate life alone when you feel like treating yourself to a wonderful treat.

I've never brought any Lovejoy's virgin here that didn't RAVE about it & become an instant fan only to return time & time on her own or with me (when I'm lucky) over & over.

Rain or shine, Lovejoy's is perfect ANY time.
author: Amy D.

description: Today I came here for lunch with a friend and had a blast!  The teas and sandwiches were delicious.  We had the High Tea for 2, the first tea our server recommended a black tea, so we went for the English Breakfast.  The second tea we tried was the Decaf Chocolate Truffle, the aroma was lovely and light.   This was my first High Tea experience, and will definitely come back again.
author: Em A.

description:
i love lovejoy's!
i've been there several times for birthday tea parties. it always feels like a special celebration, and an excuse to get a little dressed up. i love the decor of mix matched china and doilies. all the people who work there are super nice and helpful with reservations and large parties.
annnd, you can get your tea leaves read! it's a really fun added touch and the woman who does it is truly talented!
oh- don't forget to check out their shop across the street-
author: Lis G.

description:
You get less attitude at a MAC counter.  

Go with someone who knows the protocol of the place because if you walk in and ask if you need reservations you'll be ignored then, if you're really lucky, you'll be told to wait and be ignored for another 20 minutes before you give up and leave.  It could have been that they were holding the various empty tables for people with reservations but only god knows because they sure didn't tell me.
author: Teri G.

description:
What a CUTE tea house. 

1. They aren't stuck up or snobby, as I've been warned that tea houses can be - I'm a newbie to the tea scene, but the server was very patient and helpful.

2. The atmosphere is ADORABLE. Cozy seating areas make you feel more at home than at a restaurant.

3. The pricing is reasonable.

Recommendation: Make a reservation... The place gets full and one time they couldn't accommodate a reservation. Also, street parking only - so keep that in mind when trying to make it to your reservation.
author: Rosemarie d.

description: It's kinda girly, but the food and tea are great and its a pretty unique experience.   I took my mom there and she liked it.
author: Michael E.

description: I was having a deep thought about Lovejoy's the other day.  I could make you tea, sandwiches, and scones at my house for about 10 dollars total.  I don't think it's worth it to go here unless you love large groups of loud women, small children, and high prices.  It is a cute concept, but something you could easily do at home.  It is not rocket science to make a tea sandwich.  I think it's more the novelty, maybe somewhere to take your out of town mother or grandmother.
author: Julia D.

description:
It's a tea party for Adults!

Went with my girlfriends and it was a majority of our first time experiencing high tea. Fell in love with the decor (very eclectic). Our waitress was very nice. She suggested the "high tea for two" instead of each of us getting the "high tea" because it was the best value for our group size.

Tea for two came with a bunch of tea sandwiches that we picked out, salad, scones (that never tasted sooo good), sugar cookies, and bottomless tea (we each got to pick out our own tea).
author: Ai B.

description:
Um no.....no.
 I had heard rave reviews for this Noe valley spot, and what a hudge let down.
We had a pot of overbrewed TRB ( their suggestion )....
Our tea came out in a rickety old pot with a craked leaky lid.  I was sure the handle would break off.....ewww paper napkins on old dingy tablecloths covered with ripped lacey doiles.
The tea sandwiches are not elegant but just tiny and over priced, bland mushy pieces of white bread with margarine spread.  I fet like I was eating toddler food.
 How english.  The room is stuffy, the decor is cluttered and frumpy. I suggest the Garden court at the palace hotel orTthe Ritz for an authentic classy High Tea delight.
author: audrey w.

description:
I am not a foodie, but I do know about afternoon tea. It's in my background, if not in my DNA. Lovejoy's is an outstanding and authentic experience. If you like British-style tea (which is obviously a meal, not just the tea), then this is it. More than the best in the city, the best I've had outside the UK. If you don't like traditional British tea, there are no concessions to American taste here. The complaints on yelp reflect a lack of familiarity with this tradition, in my opinion.
The ambience is a bit over-the-top Anglophilic, feminine, and precious- just go with it! The tea is excellent and perfectly prepared. The sandwiches are tiny, crustless, and delicious- my favorites include the ham and (spicy) English mustard, egg and onion, and, of course, cucumber. The scones, which were fine, are now excellent- they started with a new backer relatively recently. I never have room for the petit fours, but the two times (out of zillions of visits) that I've had them, they have been delicious. I also recently ordered catering from them, and it is really easy and very reasonable. I have 1 complaint- too hard to get a reservation!
author: SF Soccer Mom S.

description:
Love LoveJoy's!
A place like this wouldn't be justified if Love weren't in the title. I'm a fan of tea and any time's tea time for me! Walk into this place and it's like you were in Grandma's comfortable, warm, ever-so inviting front room, complete with couches and perhaps a rocking chair (that I'm sure if you wanted, you could buy too!). 

Ok, so atmosphere is set, how about some vitals and beverage? Oh yes. Have the scones (complete with devonshire cream), have the tea sandwiches as they are imaginative and beautiful which is only surpassed by their scrumptiousness. If you're a bit hungrier, try one of the full plates. And for God's sake, have the tea. It's all that tea should be. 

There's just so much food & drink to chose from. After your meal, do splurge on a petit four or four. Grandma would have wanted it that way. Sip, sit, taste and love.

I'm a Lovejoy, she's a Lovejoy, he's a Lovejoy - won't you be a Lovejoy too?
author: Katie W.

description:
I've been to Love Joy's Tea Room and the sister store, The Attic, across the street and each and every time it is an unforgettable experience.  This time it was for a high tea time for a special 13 year olds birthday. I've been here for Mother's Day, birthdays' for the young and more mature, this is a true gem!

You need to make reservations because it is a known spot. Once you arrive you enter a living room looking space with tea pots, doyles, couch's', tables, and coffee tables spread about.  I've sat in 5 different spaces  and each space is special and unique in it's own way.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  You can tell these ladies like what they do.  They will also take a picture of the whole table because you want to capture the moments spent in Love Joy's.  

You start with a menu of teas (I love the strawberry tea) and different options of high tea and hot appetizers.  The high tea has a menu of sandwich's', each person picks two (I love the smoked salmon, and the chicken asparagus) You also get cole slaw, salad w dressing, scones with butter cream and preserves and butter cookies.  Everything is so good and the hot Shepard's Pie is the best Shepard's Pie I've ever had, great balance of all ingredients. You can end your meal with a petifore (truffle), which might be a little too much after a high tea but it is a delightful treat.

I have never seen a guy in Love Joys so save this one for the special ladies in your life!
author: Frankie F.

description:
Never have I ever felt so comfortable waltzing into a place with Ralph Lauren jeans, a Gucci leather oversized hobo bag and rhinestone-encrusted Havaianas. Being the aristocrat I am.

Like being "locked in my grandmothers bathroom on acid". Frumpy high noon tea; a total freakin nightmare. Perfect for baby and bridal showers and other saccharine cute events. I give this place 4 stars just for making me laugh every time I pass by it.
author: David S.

description: It was an ok experience, not bad but I didn't feel that it was worth the price per person.  We had the queen's tea, it was about $30 per person with tax and tips.  Perhaps I had too high of expectations after reading all the reviews.
author: David T.

description:
I absolutely loved this place!! All of the antiques and different table settings add so much to the feel of this place. The staff was also really nice and helpful. We ordered the High Tea for two and it included cole slaw, spring greens, scones, shortbread biscuits and a bottomless pot of tea of your choice. You have your choice of four different sandwiches. We chose the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roast beef and horseradish, fig and olive tapenade and chutney and english cheddar. I have to say that my favorite has to be the fig and olive tapenade. It was more on the sweet side rather than the salty but very yummy. The cream and jam that I put on the biscuits were to die for! I am not kidding! It was so good. 

The sausage rolls were warm on the inside and had a crust on the outside that was super flaky. A nice little addition to the High tea for Two.  

At the end of tea time for us they had a tray of many different petite fours that you could choose from. I had the strawberry shortcake petite four which was good but I think by the time they came around with the tray I was too full to really enjoy it. My sister had the lemon one which I liked better.

This was a great place to relax and enjoy a cup of tea with some goodies. The set up was so cute and definitely a place I would like to go back to when i visit San Francisco again. Thanks sis for taking us to such a fun place!
author: Dominique H.

description:
The food was fine, and at $16/person, the high tea is a bargain, but they don't understand proper tea brewing:

You do not leave the tea in the pot to continue brewing. You strain the brewed tea into the pot. The Ritz Carlton and other (more expensive but infinitely better) places know this. 

You also use enough tea. And if you don't, you definitely do not "top off" the pot, especially without asking first. 

What an annoying hostess! She came to our table EIGHT times in the 50 minutes we were there to pester us about her "bottomless pot." I've never experienced so much fuss (and debate!) resulting in so little quality. 

I stopped her from topping off a pot that was already too weak, and thereafter had her question and debate my every reply. 

It was also unsanitary: Some pots and cups were so chipped, with the underlying clay so blackened, they were serious bacteria sources. Also unsafe: The mismatching is taken too far, with lids falling off and such.

And apparently you're supposed to figure out that the 2nd mismatched saucer under your cup is the only plate you'll get to eat off. Try eating salad greens with dressing off a 4 inch saucer, and then having to use those same 4 inches to cut and butter your scone.

Finally, as many others point out, the tablecloths are overly worn and the seating uncomfortable and overcrowded. The group at the place of honor, the couches around the coffee table in front of the mantle, were struggling not to spill everything in their laps and were clearly very uncomfortable.

We won't be back.
author: Laura R.

description:
My friend had Lovejoy's cater her wedding, and it was the cutest luncheon idea ever. They provided quirky mismatched china and silver, and the selection of little crumpets, scones, and finger sandwiches was perfect. For a unique event I give it an A++

I've eaten there too, and it makes me wish I had a daughter or some very girly friends to share it with. It was a bit wasted on my husband and the male friends we were with. That many floral patterns and even they started craving a manicure. Next time I'll make it a girls brunch to remember. Excellent food and teas, even entice this tom boy back...
author: Annie D.

description:
A great place to bring a group of girlfriends or your momma. This place is all about the experience/atmosphere. I've been going here for 10 years, and unfortunately they decided within the last 5 to have a $7.50 minimum per person- which is not cool if you're not hungry and just want tea- but i guess it's because they have limited seats.

I can't speak to the food, but crumpets with devonshire cream and curd is yum if you've never had it. Think somewhere between a panna cota and whip cream.

They also have a ribena, not sure what it's made of, but it's a cold current or berry drink that i've never seen elsewhere.
author: Sasha T.

description:
Psst, don't tell anyone. I actually love tea sandwiches.  I don't know what it is about it... but, I can't help it.  The tea service for two is good -- you can choose a nice variety of sandwiches to share, get yourself some scones, and each get the tea that you want.  Where could you go wrong??!!

btw -- the tea shop across the street is nice if you want to take some home.
author: R M.

description: I came here on Saturday for my girlfriend's birthday and baby shower. i have been going here for years - at least once a year for some event, birthdays, showers, girls' gatherings. I have always enjoyed this place - the feel of grandma's living room, the delicious little sandwiches and scones, the bottomless tea. The service has always been fine but this time not so much. I am not sure if she was the manager but at the least, she must have been working there a while because she was training the our sweet young waitress. But this woman seemed a little brutish and snooty. We asked our waitress in training for some extra plates, forks, and knives so we could cut the birthday cake. The brutish woman came over and scolded this poor girl in front of us - "you can't just give cake plates out. we charge for that!" Then the brutish woman gave us the explanation - "i'm sorry, she is new and should have told you we have a cake cutting fee..." blah blah...Then the woman took her aside behind that curtain with the food and I can see and hear that woman continue to yell at that poor girl! So unprofessional! First of all, I felt awful this girl was getting yelled at. We should have told that woman in the first place that we had a cake. Second, is it really necessary for people to be treated that way and in front of customers! If it was me, I would have told that woman to shove a sandwich up her a**. It saddens me that other humans can treat their fellow humans in such a demeaning way. I don't know if I can go back there as long as that woman works there.
author: Jen R.

description:
Girly perfection. Very Victorian, very tasty and very adorable. My gal-pals and I celebrated a belated Christmas gift exchange at Lovejoys. We called earlier in the week for a Sunday reservation, but they said they were booked. However, I popped in at about 1pm on Sunday and was able to score a table that would be ready in about a half hour. Perfect! 

We crowded into the back corner on a couch (and chair), which is perfect for us. We were able to giggle and be our usual obnoxious selves. Between us, we ordered three Light Tea services and one Cream Tea. Everyone was happy, the crustless sandwiches were great with the Pear & Stilton as a standout. Fresh fruit was perfect and ripe, scones were super-tasty. We were actually full after two hours of delicate edibles and never-ending tea. 

Aside from slightly cramped quarters and the occasional freakishly heavy teapot, Lovejoy's a great, girly afternoon. I'm definitely taking my mom here the next time she's in town.
author: Erin M.

description: I came here with a large group of women for the queen's tea service. YUM. The vanilla roobois tea was wonderful. The finger sandwiches were also great-- my favorite was the tomato and cheddar and the cucumber and cream cheese. The scones were delicious and I absolutely loved the lemon curd and clotted cream that you topped them off with! It's a really fun thing to do with girlfriends on an afternoon. I've been to Samovar and Tal-y-tara as well and must say that Lovejoy's is hands down my favorite.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
Sweet! Almost as sweet as the tea!

I'm from England, I was born there, grew up there, was educated there, experienced my first 'everything' there... except this. Yes it's true, I have never ever had "high tea" and couldn't honestly tell you what it was until after living here for almost six years.

Last march Oscar took me here for my 26th birthday lunch and it was lovely! It was not at all what I was expecting, completely informal and more like a trip to Grandma's house than tea on the lawn with the queen. Being part of a generation the UK so quaintly labeled 'Generation-X', I feel that such age old traditions have somewhat passed us by (not that kids in the 60's or 70's particularly practiced large amounts of earl grey consumption - but I am sure they knew what 'high tea' was). And as with anyone born in the early 1980's, I would imagine that unless you are from British royalty the chances are you didn't either. Ok moving on...

The tea and sandwiches are the up-most of British tradition (apparently) including white bread with the crusts cut off (I knew so many boys that would insist on that in junior school) a real porcelain pot of tea (sugar provided but not essential) and scones and jam for dessert (but obviously scoffing down prior to tea is allowed too - or instead of).

Definitely somewhere worthy of treating someone special too, the place is both unique and eye catching. A totally different 'cuisine' and likely something they have never had, or thought of having - and I can't imagine anyone who wouldn't enjoy it. This would do well even in the modern day, chain bar, chain store, chain coffee, chain England.

Enjoy, darling!
author: Jack G.

description:
my momma loves her some tea. she has a whole shelf in one of her kitchen cupboards devoted to it, no joke. when she came to visit me this past summer, i knew i needed to find a tea room to take her to. i found Lovejoy's last minute & easily made a reservation for the next day.

as soon as we walked in, i knew i chose the right place.  Lovejoy's packs a lot of femininity into a small space, with lace table cloths & mismatched floral chairs.  we were seated immediately & our table had the most adorable "reserved" sign on it. we ordered the high tea for two &, damn, it was tasty.

chicken salad, salmon & cream cheese, artichoke hummus, & bay shrimp sandwiches- amaaaaazing.
coleslaw- it was coleslaw.
salad- basic but the dressing was yummy.
scones- i don't remember the flavors but they were still warm & they were delicious.
biscuits- could have been a little fluffier but the devon cream & preserves that were served with them made up for it.

in between stuffing our faces with all of those yummy treats, we went through three (yes three) pots of tea. we had the mango first, which was perfect and not too sweet. then we switched over to the vanilla rooibos... i swoon!! it was aromatic, smooth, & sexual. k maybe not sexual but it was really that good.

overall, my mom & i were both very impressed with the food, tea, & the service. Lovejoy's is really my cup of tea...hardy har har.
author: Lizzy L.

description:
Great date spot. Memorable ambiance, good food/tea, you won't have to sell any of your organs to eat here...it's surprisingly well-priced. 

Cream cheese and cucumber sandwiches are a must. The scones and tea were great. Service by one of the women working there was amazing. The other server was kinda standoff-ish. 

Overall a place you have to go to if you haven't. We'll go back.
author: Mike D.

description:
Where to go for High tea and Scones? Lovejoy's Tea Room!!  It's the perfect setting for a Girl's day out, Birthdays, and Baby Showers. My girlfriends and I go to Lovejoy's every year; it's become an annual Girl's day out tradition. We all dress up in our cutest outfits and heels and meet at Lovejoy's for tea once a year.  

We usually order High Tea for Two, but we make it for High Tea for Four. Everyone gets to pick a tea and two sandwiches each, so it's perfectly even! The presentation of all the tiers of tea sandwiches, salad and scones is so cute and elegantly organized!!! Even though it doesn't look like it would fill up the 4 of us, it does! By the time the staff comes around to offer a petit four, we all have to say no, because no one can eat another bite! 

All the tea sandwiches and tea selections on the menu, whatever you decide to choose, it will be delicious! I've never had a sandwich I did not want to eat or drank a tea that I did not want to drink. I recommend the blood orange tea; it doesn't require sugar or cream and tastes fabulous on its own. All the tea sandwiches are mouth watering delicious, I cannot pick one that stands out on its own, they are all worthy of being ordered and eaten. Oh and the scones?? Yum! Double Devon cream and jam on a warm scone? So good, it's like heaven in your mouth! 

To make sure you get a table for your party, I highly recommend calling early for a reservation.  The place is small and they only keep one table open for walk ins. Your reservation is only good for 2 hours, so arrive on time to get the most out of your Lovejoy's Tea room experience.  

The staff is friendly, helpful and attentive, BUT they will give you subtle hints to place your order even if you're waiting for the rest of your party or to pack up the last bite of your scone (apparently they have cute mini bags just for it) and if you're really taking your sweet time, they're not afraid to ask you to leave and they do it with a smile!!! =)
author: Karen L.

description:
This was my first afternoon tea ever!  And it was awesome!  We walked in, and I could smell the estrogen in the air.  Ladies and more ladies.  Oh, and one dude who was having afternoon tea by himself.  That was cute.

Aite, here's the rundown:

THUMBS UP:
+ The service was awesome.  The waitresses are all SO SWEET.  They come and ask you if you want to have your picture taken. They wear their cute little outfits.  They smile a lot. We arrived one hour before our reservation time, and they still seated us.  Seriously, they made us feel totally welcome and at home.  
+ I don't know how I feel about all the pink stuff.  PINK EXPLOSION. It kind of weirded me out especially because I'm not a very girly girl at all.  But, in this case, I thought that even though the decor was definitely overdone, it still had charm.  Go big or go home, yeah?  Yes.  
+ The bottomless tea.  Not the bestest tasting ever, but it's bottomless.  Drinking equivalent of all-you-can-eat is always a plus in my book.
+ We split a High Tea for One ($17.95), and the scone was FABULOUS.  It tasted like a biscuit to me, but slightly sweet.  With the butter and jam, it was perfect.
+ Our order had a really good mix of different tastes: sweet scone, the healthy greens and cole slaw, the savory and sweet sandwiches, the shortbread cookie.  I thought everything was very well-paired.
+ Um, it's afternoon tea!  

THUMBS DOWN:
- The food, though well-paired, wasn't really spectacular.  

Final word:  Who actually goes to afternoon tea for the food?  No one!  It's all about just being there, pretending to be a lady (not easy!), and enjoying yourself with your girlfriends.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! 

If I could, I would overhaul my room and make it into a mini LoveJoys.  My bff took me here for my birthday and we had a lovely time.  The finger sandwiches are divine and this is the ONLY place I've found outside of England that serves CHUTNEY AND CHEESE sandwiches!!! You don't understand how excited I was to see it on the menu... I was seriously was squealing with delight!  Hell, I'm squealing as I type. The tea here is also excellent... I recommend the house blend and Darlingjee, yum.
author: Mischen C.

description:
My college alumnae group has an annual tea at Lovejoy's every year, and it's always been my favorite event (and yes, I went to a women's college).  The food is delicious - scones with cream, mini tea sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, and cookies are all included in the High Tea service.  And of course, there's the tea itself - pot after pot of any tea from their long menu (my favorites are the house blend and the peppermint).  And all of it served on lovely china in a cozy, pretty, exceedingly feminine setting.  

This year I organized the tea.  It was amazingly easy, and the women at Lovejoy's were so professional and pleasant to work with.  It's easy to see why there always seem to be so many groups here. They're also very accomodating: it turned out that one of the women in our group couldn't have dairy, which I didn't know about until the event.  No worries - they whipped up a delicious-looking salad for her, and she was very happy with it.

P.S. I have never seen a man in here, but I'm told that they have been spotted.  So for any man out there who's secure in his masculinity and wants to hang out where a bunch of women are, this is an ideal destination!
author: DD B.

description:
You must be fully aware in advance that this establishment is in Noe Valley (in the same manner that those who complain about the hipsters in Ritual should really consider that Ritual is smack dab on Valencia).  Truly, I have never seen so many pregnant women in their late twenties, early thirties in one single place.  I counted at least five pregnant women....and on further reflection, as pointed out by my tea-mate, where else would you hold a baby shower considering the ban on caffeine and alcohol during pregnancies?

My friend and I had High Tea for two which included four crustless sandwiches (each sandwich cut into fours), two scones, two cookies, double Devon cream (same thing as clotted cream) strawberry preserve and a choice of tea that was continuously refilled.  For sandwiches, we ordered:

Roast Beef and Horseradish (too little roast beef for me, and not the best roast beef I've had either)
Cucumber and Cream Cheese (because it's a must for high tea)
Hummus (I love having hummus as a sandwich)
Fig and Olive tapenade (the best of the four sandwiches...what a wonderful combination.  The sour sharp tang of olives pairs perfectly with the sweetness of figs)

The clotted cream was wonderful.  For those who have never had clotted cream...if you like butter, you will love clotted cream.  

High Tea for two was $34.95 (I think that included the tax).  

It's a very girly place, so wear something a little precious, catch up with your gal friends and giggle away over girl talk.
author: Sooj O.

description:
Now I remember why I never reviewed Lovejoy's on Yelp! When you have 365 reviews, who needs one more? But oh well... 

There hasn't been anything I've ingested or imbibed at Lovejoy's that hasn't been tasty or worth the price. It evokes going to a dotty, dear old Aunt's house resplendent with doilies and chintz, and settling in to be well fed over a long period of time. It's shabby chic all the way. If you can't imagine yourself happy being surrounded by chintz....then you're me BEFORE I tried Lovejoy's. I've set my pinstripe suit and high heels and modern style on the shelf for the luxurious, melting, home-like atmosphere of Lovejoy's. 

Whether you're a party of 2 or 12 (I've been in both), I highly recommend reservations. That said, splurge on the high tea. The sandwiches are all tasty (I won't go into them here, just read all the previous gazillion reviews), the scones and cakes are lovely, the jams are fruity and sweet, and the cream...speaks for itself. Any tea you select will be steeped properly before it's served, so patience, dearies. Also, they have a lovely shop that's worth your perusal, and I always end up with a few little sachets of my favorites. Try the vanilla roobois. You'll thank me later ;)
author: Krisztina F.

description:
The perfect venue for your next girlie event. Make sure to reserve your spot weeks in advance because Lovejoys fills up fast. The tea room is fairly small so expect to sit close and cozy on a selection of chairs and couches with your friends and neighbors. 

My friends and I ordered the Queens Tea which initially left me skeptical if the amount of food would be enough to fill me up. This coming from someone with a small appetite. We ended the meal with plenty leftover and extremely satisfied. The tea was excellent (my favorite: Blood Orange Tea), the food was delicious, and the servers were very attentive. Who knew mini crustless sandwiches could be so filling??!
author: CL S.

description:
Lovejoy's is tons of fun -- just be sure to make a reservation in advance. I'm a big fan of the Queen's Tea which is lots n' lots of food. The service is very friendly and it's a great place to sit and catch up with friends.

The only thing that bums me out is how LOUD it is in there! I've only been on the weekends, but there is always some crazy-ass baby shower that forces everyone else to have to scream even though they're sitting just a couple feet away from each other. But, it's a fun time either way. 

Eat the pear and stilton sandwiches -- you won't regret it! :)
author: Tamara M.

description: Everything about this Tea Room is lovely. I felt like I had stepped into Alice in Wonderland. A fantastic place to go with girlfriends (or friends/SOs of any gender, really). Excellent selection of tea, scones and jam to die for, and every last plate and cup is unique and adorably British. I will be coming back soon!
author: Emily H.

description:
I was foolish enough to drive to Lovejoy's, do not repeat my mistake as parking in this area is like squeeze blood from stones.  Really, I really felt it was that painful and impossible.

Besides the whole parking issue, the tea, the crumpets, the finger sandwiches and all the sides were to die for, especially the scones.  Would definitely come back if I'm in the area.
author: CalBear H.

description:
I had the pleasure of going back for my sister's b-day celebration.  

Just as charming and enjoyable as before.  Ironically, our server was Sarah again who is adorably sweet and a great server.  We all had the Queen's tea and sampled each other's endless pots of tea.  This time I chose the Apricot which had a nice soothing flavor.  

At this visit I sampled a couple of different sandwiches (since there were 7 of us), all super delicious: 

-chicken and asparagus ( chunks of asparagus)
-artichoke hummus
-lovejoy's special (a must try)
-ham w/english mustard ( nice dose of spicy mustard)

As before scones and crumpets were to die for.  I love to love LOVEJOY"s
author: Dorothy F.

description: I had a great time here with my friends for my birthday. Their teas are amazing and my friends were able to bring gluten free items just for me and they plated it for me and made sandwiches it was great!
author: Lisa J.

description: Went here on Saturday afternoon for 2 of my friends bdays- had a party of 6 and sat in the cutest living room area.  It was such a fun time- everyone working there was really helpful.  One in my party eats gluten-free and they allowed us to bring some bread for her sandwiches.  Definitely can't wait to go back again!
author: Mary D.

description:
Lovejoy is like a giant Victorian doll house. It has unique character.

Having pretend tea parties with my dolls was one of my favorite play  when I was a child.  Having tea at Lovejoy reminds me of that. Only now the tea and food are real and so are the companions. :)

One time I sat next to a group of old ladies wearing dresses and big hats having tea - just like an old English movie.
author: C L.

description:
( REAL MEN DO HIGH TEA ) there now I've said it.
 With all the rave reviews what more can be said about Lovejoys.
You can enjoy a wonderful high tea for half the price most of the hotels
in the city charge.
Great atmosphere mismatced tea pots,chairs.tables,sofas etc.
Both women and men of all ages have a great time .
That's what makes Lovejoys Tea Room so cool.
It's fun to bring family and friends that have never been before.
It gets very full on weekends so make reservations or call to see if they
have room. They do take walk ins as they did one recent Sunday .
I took my sister once and she loved how the card on the table said 
RESERVED FOR THE QUEEN.
author: Bill H.

description: I've been waiting to visit Lovejoy's for ages.  We arrived half an hour before they opened on a Saturday morning and luckily got one of the few tables that hadn't been reserved.  The tea was always hot (and pots frequently refreshed), the sandwiches were perfectly fluffy, and the company was charming.  I love eccentric little cubby shops, and this one fits the bill perfectly.
author: Lauren R.

description:
My New-Englander upbringing taught me that "tea parties" were squarely a feminine endeavor. But while I agree that Lovejoy's would make a classy joint for a bridal party, I have to insist that the experience may be universally enjoyed!

Men, fear no tea room - the sandwiches, while small, are scrumptious. Here, there's a delicious shepherd's pie, which will satisfy a normal appetite (I have an outsize one, so this was a perfect "main dish"). And it's likely you'll get the lion's share of the scones from the ladies, if you're patient.

I recommend a less obvious time (like, not on a weekend) - because the decibel level is more tolerable. Then again, if the sound of 'birds chirping' is relaxing to you, by all means go on Sunday around 2 o'clock.
author: Razoo D.

description:
My friend and I both enjoyed our time at Lovejoy's Tea Room the other day. I loved the atmosphere of the place. The decorations that adorn the walls and the mismatched cups and saucers gives Lovejoy's a quirky and rustic atmosphere. I had this perception that tea service would be all proper and formal, but at Lovejoy's it was really relaxing. All the tables were quite close, but I still could have a nice conversation without having to shout at each other.

We got the high tea for two, which includes shortbread cookies, scones, salads, sandwiches and two kinds of tea. As both of us were tea novices, our helpful waitress recommended Tea Room Blend and China Rose Petal. Both were really yummy, with the tea room blend being a little heavier and more bitter, and china rose petal as really fragrant yet light. Our waitress would reheat and refill our tea as well, which was very nice. As for the food, before it arrived, I was a little concerned that I'd still be left hungry. Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about that at all, mainly because of their scones, which were really filling. The raisin topped scones came out warm, and while they were flaky and a little dry, adding the devon cream and jam more than made up for that. It was really delicious and I don't think I've ever enjoyed a scone that much before. The salad was fresh. I got the smoked salmon and cheese and the bay shrimp and mayo sandwiches. Both were nice, but I preferred the smoked salmon and cheese. The salmon and cheese really went well together. Ended with the shortbread cookies, which were nothing special, but good enough. The scone and the teas were the highlights though!

I would definitely make a reservation if I wasn't coming in early. We went right when it opened at around 11 without reservations and we got a table easily, but we saw about half the tables already reserved for later. And when we were about to leave the room was packed and there were a couple people waiting outside. Also there is a two hour time limit, but we never felt rushed. I probably wouldn't come regularly since the prices are a bit high, but I'd definitely return for a special occasion or if I wanted to do something different with my girl friends or mom.
author: Amanda K.

description:
"TEA PARTY! TEA PARTY"  *bounces up and down*

Girl, I was going to Lovejoy's when it was a couch and a coffee table in the middle of an antique shop and I couldnt've been happier to be there.. Until she turned that couch into a whole doily-draped gingerbread tea house with full-on sugar-spoons , mismatched tea and saucer adorableness and piles of crumpety sandwichy things and I swear if there is a more estrogen-rich experience in this town I would pay to see it.

You pay about $30 per person but you get loads of really, really tasty cookies, sandwiches and snacky bits. You leave tweaked on tasty tea and stuffed full of food, but there's amazing shopping on 24th street a block away. Go get some Mary Janes to complete the experience.
author: Missy B.

description: Love this place. Really cute and charming. Great tea and scones to die for.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Great little place to get a cup of tea and sit around with the girls or guys!  I highly recommend making a reservation and getting their about 30 minutes for parking.

You won't regret your experience because the servers are very friendly and knowledgeable.  Again, please make reservations, it makes thing a whole lot easier!!
author: Dorothy S.

description:
Let me start by saying that I'm not a tea drinker. I'm not a coffee drinker either. So the idea of sitting down ON PURPOSE and have tea and crumpets is a little over the top for me. 

However, I made a visit recently when my best friend's bridal shower was hosted there. Such a cute place. Our server was oh so cute and sweet. She clearly explained how to make the most of our experience there and gave tons of great suggestions on what kinds of teas, sandwiches and desserts to order. It ended up being a really nice time and I will definitely go again. Well, I'll go when the occasion calls for it. I still think having tea and crumpets is over the top.
author: Heather L.

description: The best tea room in the Bay Area.  This is my go to spot when it's time to catch up with the girlfriends.  Everything is yummy...especially the scones with Devonshire cream.
author: ena p.

description:
4.5 stars...

Another bachelorette party highlight, this was the last stop of our weekend.   My girls thought of everything and ordered a "Queen's Tea" which included, for our table of 11, 3 enormous tiers of food. I came thinking that perhaps I'd need lunch afterwards, but those teeny tiny sandwiches are surprisingly filling - you get a choice of 6 different kinds of sandwiches for the Queen's High Tea (we chose cucumber + cream cheese; shrimp + mayo; roast beef with horseradish crme; pear & stilton; egg salad; smoked salmon + cream cheese), light salad; a scone with double cream and preserves, cookies, crumpets and petit fours... I was so full that I could not bring myself to finish my petit-four; several girls agreed likewise, and I got to take what was not consumed home.

All in all, a very delightful place to visit - the places settings are charmingly mismatched hodge-podge china pieces, service is exceptional and yes, their chestnut tea is one of the most beautifully unusual tastes you'll encounter.  I wish they had some for us to purchase and take home.
author: Claudine C.

description: This has been the loveliest brunch I've ever had!!! Delicious!!! The sweetest waitress ever. Wonderful decor and atmosphere. just perfect!!!
author: tamar b.

description: This is the best tea-room EVER. It is like having tea at the Mad Hatter's in Alice and Wonderland +  a Beatrix Potter book.
author: Kelley M.

description:
A very lovely neighborhood place to have unpretentious tea with girl friends. They accommodated 2 vegans, and a gluten free person (brought corn tortillas due to other allergies). This is a really comfortable place to check out, yummmy too. The tea was absolutely lovely and ample. They always made sure we were tea'd up but were never intrusive. The space is admittedly tight but it allows for everyone to talk to each other I would do it again and I'm the gluten free one!
They also have a lovely woman doing readings that was a fun thing to do for our group.
author: Eldar B.

description:
Been an avid fan for Lovejoys since my good friend invited me here for her birthday party.  Ever since then Lovejoys has been my guilty pleasure!  Owners Muna and Gillian are absolutely fabulous!  My favorite hostess/server is Sarah :o)  She makes everything the BEST.

Great price, FOOD and Tea is simply delish!  I'm hosted a baby shower her for a small group and it was just the BEST.

Come to Lovejoys.  It's the BEST TEA place in town.  I just can't go enough.  Support your local Noe Valley business.  

It's my favorite spot to take my family and friends.

RS
author: Ria D.

description:
I was here not to long ago and absolutely love it.  A friend and I threw a bridal party for my cousin.  It was so girly, she loved it.  The atmosphere is quaint and I love the fact that all the china and silverware doesn't match.  It gives it that little extra charm.  The tea is delicious, I recommend the Mango and Rose teas, and the tea sandwiches and scones are quite tasty as well.  
If you enjoy a little afternoon tea I suggest checking out this place, you will not be disappointed.
author: Cynthia C.

description: LoveJoys is nestled in Noe Valley and I LOVE this place!  The variety of teas they had available to choose from was fabulous and the selections of sandwiches, cookies and salads were so delectable!  They also have choices like "Service for 2, 3 4, etc."  It was a little Tea House with a very cute set up and a gift shop area.  The prices were very reasonable compared to some of the other tea houses I've been!  And if you bring small children (like a little girl), she gets to have her own hot chocolate in a cute little cup of her choice.  You get a ton of food and we all left very full and unable to finish our meal!  Such a great place!
author: Judy S.

description:
Their tea sandwiches rocked.  I had them cater a party, and they were fantastic.  The chicken walnut tea sandwich the ham and mustard, cucumber and cheese.
Oh and you must try the scones with CLOTTED CREAM.  I felt my arteries clogging as I engulfed my scone - also don't forget the jelly, wonderful!
Reminded me on London's tea houses.
author: Pug P.

description:
It's official - this place is awesome! Man, writing this review makes me wish I was there right now!... (pics to come soon)

Came here for a going away tea for one of my best buddies. Thought it'd be nice to dress up and be girly - funnnn!

We reserved a table - which is highly recommended because they have many events going on ALL the time - and were greeted by a card holder with a sign that said, "Reserved for royalty." Cute. Nothing matches but everything is pretty, frilly, flowery, cutesy, charming, lacy... you get the picture! And that's what makes tea so fun! 

My friends ordered a cheese plate - which I am indifferent to because I don't like cheese but they loved it - and I ordered the curry puff. I am a curry puff weakling! Any kind, any day, curry in a flaky pastry - I am your girl! And it was mouthwateringly delicious as well as filling! It came with beans and salad but I didn't care much for those.. heh. 

We ordered the High Tea for Two (I think...) and had a wonderful time exploring different levels of heaven! The scones, the creams, the sandwiches, the fruit - delightful. We had the darjeeling and a vanilla tea? I can't remember but it was gorgeously scrumptious. The waitress came around with petite fours which were dainty and delicious! It was like biting into little pieces of art =)

What a fun experience with wonderful friends - just awesome! This is a great place to be!
author: Christine C.

description: Hosted a birthday party here for my 6-yr old: 5 kids + 6 adults.  They made it easy and fun.  A memorable experience for everyone.  They were particularly patient and kind to the little girls.  This may become a b-day tradition!
author: East Bay P.

description:
I come here annually with one of my friends.  These simple, variety of sandwiches are so delicious.  We usually order the sampler where we get to choose 4 different sandwiches.  Sampler comes with a scone, mini mixed greens salad, cookies, and your choice of specialty tea.  Your crust less sandwich choices are:

   Cucumber & Cream Cheese
   Chicken & Asparagus
   Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese
   Chutney & English Cheddar
   Tomato & English Cheddar
   Bay Shrimp & Mayo Egg & Onion
   Cream Cheese & Green Apple
   Cream Cheese & Mandarin Orange
   Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard
   Artichoke Hummus
   Salmon Mousse
   Sliced Pear & Stilton Cheese
   Chicken, Apple & Walnut
   Fig & Olive Tapenade
   Ham & English Mustard

Lovejoy's is a funky girlie kind of place.  I've seen showers and birthday parties thrown here.  Tea is served in funky assortment of teapots and mismatched cups and saucers among a Victorian setting.  

Parking may be difficult to find.  The J Church trolley runs on this same street.
author: Nanette L.

description:
Pinkies up, ladies! If ever there was a time for daintiness, it is here in the cute, cozy, eclectically cluttered warmth of Lovejoy's tea room. I took my BFF here to celebrate her impending nuptials, and we were very elegant and refined, except when we were moaning over delicious crumpets and jam with fresh cream or cooing and giggling like little girls at the lovely little petit fours that look like tiny, tiny gifts wrapped in sugary frosting just for us. 

The atmosphere at Lovejoys is relaxed and comfortable, with mismatched china and tables covered in lace and floral tablecloths. Things could get tacky and grandmother-y pretty easily with too much of either of those things, but here it is pulled off perfectly and is nothing but charming. Lovejoy's charm is no secret, either - be sure to call ahead for a reservation or risk gazing in at the loveliness from a lonely street corner!

If you're looking for tea for more than two, this is also a great place to throw a party. They are happy to host your birthday party, baby shower, wedding shower, etc. You can even have a psychic on hand to read your tea leaves! Is another visit to Lovejoy's in my future? I sure hope so!
author: Amie S.

description:
This is one of two tea rooms I've been too, and I'm going to say, this tops it.  We had reservations of course, highly recommended, as they seemed pretty busy from start to finish.  The team room was sooo, cozy and quaint.  Made me feel like I was in someone else's grandmother's tea room.  I liked how the tea cups and plates were all different, but complimented each other well.  The seating and the tables were all different.  Some benches, chairs, armchairs, etc.
We ordered High Tea for four ($17/persom).  Great selection of sandwiches, some coleslaw, salad, scones with preserves and double devon cream, shortbread and each of us had a tea selection.
We ordered some blood orange tea, which was my favorite!  There were three other ones that were good, but I was so taken by the blood orange, I don't really remember. 
It was a great place for 4 friends to get together, catch up, and enjoy a great filling lunch!
author: Roenna N.

description:
This place is ultra darling. I came here for my bridal shower and my BMs did a perfect job fitting everything we wanted to do in the 2 hour timeframe Lovejoy's gave us. We had a group of 11 and they sat us in the back corner table which provided enough privacy for all the little embarrassing moments and wiffles. 

All their teas were really good, including the houseblend. There was plenty of food from the $18.95pp menu. We even had leftovers! The sugar cookies are wonderful and the scones were moist and fresh. 

The service was top notch. We asked to have our leftovers packed and they even put a moist paper towel in with the box of sandwiches to make sure the bread didn't dry out. 

Lovejoy's will hold a special place in my heart =)
author: Mary R.

description:
This is my 10 year old daughter's favorite place to eat.  Turns out I am also a complete sucker for High Tea.  A total carb, sugar and caffeine fest.  Really doesn't get any better than that.  

The little sandwiches are always just right.  I even love the coleslaw.  But the clotted cream, oh the clotted cream - like butter and whipped cream got married and had the perfect child.  If only those wonderful scones didn't have raisins in them.  Hate raisins.  Love Lovejoys.
author: Molly T.

description:
I really wanted to love this place since i hear so much good things about it.  plus, i love all things girly and this place cant be more girly! 

I went for my girlfriend's bridal shower and was quite disappointed.  the food seriously sucked....all the sandwiches tasted weird to me...wet pasty inside, dry bread outside. nothing made me go "YUM" at all.  also, I definitely had better tea in my life.

the 3 stars go to good service and fabulous ambience.
author: R A.

description:
There is no better English tearoom than Lovejoy's.  I had frequented this establishment before they moved to their new location on Clipper. The orig. location was a lot smaller and but now they are able to accommodate baby showers and still have room for parties of 2's.  I always order the High Tea for 2 if I'm with a friend with this you get:

1 pot of tea (great selection from black, green or fruit teas) my favorite is the Tearoom blend. Do it like the English and drink it with milk
 4 sandwiches (my favorites are bay shrimp w/mayonnaise, chicken and asparagus, turkey with horseradish mustard, and egg and onion)  
Cole slaw w/poppy seed salad 
Green salad with mandarin orange slivers with a vinaigrette dressing
2 raisin scones (OMG I've died and gone to heaven goodness)
Devonshire cream and strawberry preserves to go on those awesome scones and finally 2 shortbread "I can't believe its butter" cookies.

If you're into English teas this is the place to be.  The prices are very reasonable and staff is extremely attentive.  
Once you walk through the door you will forget all your worries.  Just concentrate on enjoying the time with you friend(s) and renew yourself spiritually.  Reservations are recommended.
author: J. C.

description:
Laura Ingells Wilder went mental here with the decor.  Our waitress looked like the Girl with the Pearl Earring (interestingly, when I made this comment in the restaurant, I accidentally said "pearl necklace" which got a hearty chuckle from my dirty friends). The Blood Orange tea knocked me over.  I picked out the raisins from my delicious scone like a five year old.  I can't get enough Egg & Onion tea sandwiches.  The shortbread cookies taste great dipped in clotted cream.  In fact, anything would taste great covered in clotted cream.

Basically, it's a little spendy, and any guy you bring here will break out in hives, but it's a lovely tea room and has lovely food and if you bring a child here, she will literally crown you a queen.
author: Jill K.

description:
A lovely place for tea, I love  this place, I would love to come back here with my boyfriend and introduce him to all kind of tea they serve.
On the menu: High tea for 2 is the best. 
Great place for get together with girlfrineds too. 
I will be back.
author: Ty N.

description:
I completely agree with a lot of the reviews about this place...

This is my VERY FIRST TIME to do tea and I wouldn't have tried it unless my sis in law invited me to go for one and I LOVED IT!  I also think that it helped that we picked the right place, for me being a "first-timer."  

I loved the ambiance and just that old rustic english country side feel "thingy" which definitely helped my appetite and my willingness to drink black tea with milk...(before, I was like..."huh? milk in tea? unheard of")...and now I'm a convert.  Service was great and super friendly. I was skeptical about how they served the sandwiches (being so small because of English culture being so dainty and "lady-ish...) but surprisingly enough, the quality and taste of the food served together with our tea was exceptional and it was enough to fill me up.  We had the Tea for Two and just PERFECT...we left the place not feeling overly indulged...

I would love to try it again and this time will be bringing my daughter in.  Who knows, if she likes it, we might have a small birthday get-together here again.  Btw, love those CRUMPETS!!!"
author: Grace D.

description:
A delicious place for 90 minutes (your maximum time allowance, if they're busy) of delightfully pretentious tea-sipping with your chick or gay friends. Make sure your pinky is pointing up and out when you sip your tea. 

Yummy scones served with double devon cream!
author: Trixie J.

description:
This cute little tea room makes me feel like a bull in a china store.

I don't let that stop me though.  Its not very often that I get to go here but when I do...its tasty!

It is just so incredibly hard to not completely rub that devon cream all over my face and shovel hands of it into my mouth like a cave man scoops the last bits of food out of his bowl made of wooly mammoth bone (or whatever fine materials he makes to use as bowls).  

And those scones! oh those delicious scones made of flour and magic and other fairy like fantasy things.  I have never in my life been a fan of scones.  Id rather put a cake like muffin in my mouth.  But damn, these scones are amazing.

and what is better than one big sandwich?  How about a lot of little ones....arranged on a three plate tier?!?!  devine...

The little high tea snacks alone give it 5 stars....

oh yeah. and they have tea there too.
author: Angela C.

description:
It was love at first sight as soon as I stepped into Lovejoy's this morning for my friend's bridal shower. What a charming and quaint place.

-Warm, cozy decor including colorful and comfortable antique furniture.
-Delicious, smooth teas; herbal vanilla (unique flavor) and breakfast tea.
-Quite the collection of unique teapots and tea sets!
-Selection of little sandwiches, including beef with horseradish, smoked salmon, and bay shrimp with mayonnaise. 
-Delicious, warm, buttery scones with raisins topped with fresh strawberry preserves (my absolute favorite!). I. Love. Butter.

The staff was incredibly accommodating, sweet, and patient. I highly recommend Lovejoy's for any type of shower or special girly get together. What a lovely place.
author: Laura D.

description: We met for a "girls'" tea party...but we brought a guy, who enjoyed it as well. Two of us shared the Queen's Tea, which is the full-service, and the others ordered à la carte. The possibilities are kind of endless here. There's a good selection of tea, as they blend their own, which they also sell in a little store across the street. And a nice selection of sandwiches and sweets to choose from, along with hot dishes, pasties & Shepherd's pies. Oh, loved the "reserved for royalty" sign at our table!!! Classy touch!
author: Alyssa P.

description:
Every time family or friends visit (or even in-town friends gathering) I try to work in Lovejoy's. The atmosphere is fantastic, like going to my grandmother's house for tea (not that my grandmother ever served tea, she was more of a coffee person). Mismatched, antique everthing with little doilies everywhere. I love, love, love the variety of little sandwiches and oh, the scones! Perhaps it's my inability to make a scone that won't damage your teeth, but I'm in melty awe of their scones.  

Their Yorkshire Gold Blend (bottomless pot!) goes so well with everything. I find myself vibrating by the time I walk out of there, but it's hard not to keep pouring myself another cup and doctoring it with the provided milk and sugar so long as it's there.
author: Cherie T.

description:
This is definitely my favorite tea room in the city. I can spend hours here. It's a perfect place to sit, talk, and relax with friends while enjoying some tea and treats. Their little sandwiches and pastries are delightful and they have a nice tea selection.

Lovejoy's has a very comforting and friendly atmosphere, along with a nice staff. It'll make you feel right at home. Plus the place is worth going to just for how great it looks. It's beautifully decorated with a lot of interesting knickknacks here and there. Even their bathroom is stylish!
author: Lei I.

description: Cute grandma-esque tea room.  Little sandwiches were yummy!
author: Jessica N.

description: The only thing missing from today's tea were fancy hats for the ladies, and tall top hats for the gents!  Everything from the ham/mustard sandwiches, crumpets to the scones were beyond delicious (a VERY dangerous place for those on a perpetual diet, like me). The lemon curd was near-orgasmic!  Best of all, the pot of vanilla rooibos really sent me over the top.  The incredible aroma aroused an urge to drink in as much as possible... I even considered eating the teapot, or at least lick the strainer (I did neither).  Hours of fun and conversation with friends/family, a bona fide San Franciscan past time.
author: Peter C.

description:
Absolutely splendid, lovely, quaint and all-around wonderful tea room.  Attended a birthday tea party here and just loved it.  We were a party of 15 on a bustling sunny Saturday afternoon/evening (4-6 p.m.).

The dining portions were more than generous - hearty, dainty tea sandwiches on a bed of mixed greens w/walnuts and mandarins and balsamic dijon vinaigrette, fresh fruits, warm scones, shortbread tea biscuits, warm crumpets, lemon curd, strawberry preserves and petits fours!  

Oh, and step away from the Double Devon cream, because seriously, as my friend Sarah says, "EVERYTHING is better with cream." And at this place, you may as well take it in intravenously.  Strawberries, blueberries, pineapples, scones - you name it, I spread cream on it.  And yes, they sell this stuff, too - don't even bother looking at the nutritional value (I use the word "value" lightly).

The tea service was prompt and lovely and everything was described to us as they were served.  We had a relatively spacious layout in the back of the bustling tearoom, but it all felt very cozy.

Customer service was extremely personable, professional and warm.  The minute I walked in/out, I was making making a mental list of others with whom I would love to experience Lovejoy's again.  Very old school, English tea vibe with a quaint "attic" just across the street where they sell many of their wares and teas.

I think this statement from their website sums it up rather well: "...our tea room reflects the diversity of San Francisco, blending together the traditions of tea service with an eclectic, quirky and playful spirit."
author: Olma M.

description:
Frou-frou tearooms aren't my cup of tea, so to speak, but Lovejoy's is a good one. The restaurant is lavishly decorated with all manner of tea-related items and art, and although the ambience verges on precious, it's fun, too. Service is friendly enough.

I'm not a tea connoisseur, so I can't comment on the quality of the tea served, but the food was surprisingly good. I expected my Ploughman's Lunch (a selection of toast points, cheese, chutney, hummus, fruit, greens, and chips) to include only tiny portions of each item, but I was actually stuffed and unable to finish everything, in the end. I appreciated the freshness of the fruits and greens (surely not authentically British), and my dining companions seemed to enjoy their tea sandwiches.

As others have suggested, Lovejoy's seems like a great venue for a bridal or baby shower or other girly activity, and reservations seem to be almost required.
author: Tara M.

description:
I chose LoveJoy's to co-host a baby shower and I was really happy with how everything turned out (including Mom-to-be). 

It's British style afternoon-tea dressed up in Victorian decor. Loose tea served in unique teapots and teacups, accompanied by a wide selection of dainty finger sandwiches (vegetarian options are available). I really liked the artichoke hummus and fig tapenade sandwiches. And the dev cream! It's essential with the warm scones. 

I recommend LoveJoy's for groups no larger than 8 (we had 17, so we were spread out between two tables). Overall, it offers a nice change of pace from the boulangerie/coffee scene. Just make sure to call beforehand for reservations - especially if you're planning on going during the weekend.
author: Karen L.

description:
It's about the scones! It's about the glorious antiques! It's about the lace table cloths, the warm customer service and chattiness of other patrons... It *is* Sense and Sensibility come alive! 

I once had tea at the Hotel Picadilly in Picadilly Circus, London. It was *not* as good as LoveJoy's by any means. Lovejoys has *true* "high tea" atmosphere and offerings. 

Treat yourself to a tea service or antiques teapot across the street in their little antiques shoppe. They also offer a bevy of loose teas for your enjoyment at home. It's the best.

I went with a sista-friend but, there were men there as well... Gorgeous mediterranean he-men but... I digress, LOL (tea, girl TEA!) Yes, ahem. Tea. 

All of your favorite teas (Darjeeling, Earl Grey) are available and some you may wish to try (exotic smoky black teas are my fave). I came home with several tins.

*** You can find exceptional tea pots at estate sales for a song! The last one I found came with sugar and creamers to match and they were from the forties!!! 

At Lovejoys, spring for the High Tea spread. The sandwiches are to *die* for... and you've NEVER tasted such cold-slaw and salad. All of this comes to you on a Lazy-Susan (translation for the guys - a tiered tray) with delectable delights on several tiers. Come with someone whose conversation you enjoy. It's like a little bit of heaven.
author: Now V.

description:
High tea in SF? I was so surprised and delighted to be informed of the existence of Lovejoy's by my s/o's hairdresser. 

We made plans to go a weekend morning with another couple, and when we arrived it became apparent that things aren't exactly traditional in terms of decor. We were told we'd have an hour wait and offered to call us via mobile when a table was ready. We were seated in closer to 30 minutes.

High tea for four included eight tea sandwiches (picked from a menu of fifteen?!?), bottomless tea (eight or so choices here), salad, scones, devonshire double cream, jam, cookies and other bits. 

It was heaven. Service, aromas, atmosphere, everything. We stayed for around four hours... And never felt rushed to clear the table. 

Go. It'll do you good.
author: G Z.

description:
What a treat it was to go to Lovejoy's! After finally trying it this past weekend, I can see why it takes some planning weeks in advance to score a table here. They have a wonderful selection of teas to choose from, as well as combinations of food, depending on how hungry you are. All of the food items were delicious, and I have to admit, I was pretty full by the end, given how generous they are in terms of the items included in your service. The one food standout for me was definitely the petit fours - so many different flavor varieties, and the way they were decorated was so beautifully done! 

Ladies, if you're looking to have an estrogen fest with your girlfriends/mom/grandmothers, it doesn't get any girlier (and more charming!) than this place. Can't wait to go back!
author: Rachel G.

description:
I brought my best friend here for her birthday and was completly charmed. The mismatched tea pots! The baby tea sandwiches with no crust! So cute! Recommended for every occasion that merits celebration, and even ones that don't. 

My server was super cute and funny, and my apricot tea was just right, not too sweet. The pear and stilton tea sandwich was AMAZING also.

Highly recommended!
author: Clare G.

description:
I will definitely go back to Love Joys! It was a very pleasurable experience.

We had ten girls go for high tea.  We had gone for two birthday parties.

High tea was great! Sandwiches were great! I dont like scones but I LOVED their scones! They were so moist! They have a great selection of tea!!
author: Carol K.

description: Love Lovejoy's.  Always a charm... scones are so heavenly, the sandwiches are perfect and the tea selection is grand.  : )
author: Bin M.

description:
Tried this place out last Sunday with a group of 6. We all ordered a variety of things to share. The finger sandwiches were delightful, perfectly proportioned and tasty! Their scones were fresh and made with quality ingredients. Shepherd's Pie was a hit with everyone and definitely worth a try! This place sure makes me miss London!!

I personally ordered one of the Black Teas - Vanilla with Lavender, couldn't really smell the vanilla, but the tea was soothing, especially for my sore throat!

Make a reservation, the place was packed! Bottomless tea with a restaurant filled mostly of women customers, having only 1 restroom was a little more than inconvenient. Prepare to stand in line for a while.

-1 star for the excessive humid conditions inside. They must have special mold-resistant paint, otherwise, I don't know how they keep the place from rotting. They definitely need a better ventilation system for the place.
author: Franny L.

description:
I went here with a friend a couple of weeks ago and had a great time for the most part.  I ordered the salmon mousse and chicken salad sandwich combo while my friend had the special of the day (chicken pesto) and the stilton and pear.  We were both blown away by the flavor and freshness of everything we were served.  The scones were a favorite with us both (though I despise raisins and hated to have to sit there and pick them out) and the double devonshire cream was the best I've had since I spent time in England! 

However, I do have one complaint which is why I didn't give Lovejoys a full 5 stars.  At the end of the meal, the server approached us with a tray of petit-fours and asked us if we'd like one.  Since this was our first visit and we wanted to experience everything, we agreed.  Little did we know that the tiny little cake that I found to be so-so wasn't complimentary like we imagined, but was $5 charge PER PERSON on our bill! You have to be kidding me guys. Firstly, it was all of 1in x 1in. If any money at all, the most it should have been was $1.50.  Secondly when you approach someone and you are going to charge them, one of the following should be said "would you care to purchase a petit-four?" or "would you care to add a petit-four?" or "would you care to order a petit-four?" NOT "would you like a petit-four?"  That just makes it sound like it was part of the meal or free.

This may sound silly and juvenile, but we were both laid off over a year ago and this was a much saved for celebration (her birthday).  Budgets are our lives currently and every dollar counts to us.  It was just shady.  Shame on you.

Beware of the $5 petit-fours ladies!
author: Shara S.

description:
I have to start by saying they should not let me in here.  I'm clumsy, have a loud laugh, and think tea tastes like pond water.
But, a friend's baby shower was held here a few weeks ago, so I braved my clutzyness and did my best not to knock over any teacups and high trays of food.  It's very frilly in here--lots of doilies and pastels.  I felt like I wasn't girly enough to hang here.  But, the staff were friendly and helpful.  They explained the tea options and I even found one I liked!  
The tea sandwiches are so dainty, I felt like I had barely eaten anything after 10 of them.  The Stilton and pear sandwiches were my favorite and I inhaled the apple and the cucumber ones.  The cole slaw was bland and tasteless, but it seemed like that went with the understated, well-behaved ambiance.  
And, best of all, they tolerated our loud laughter, frequently getting out of our seats and running around to take obnoxious photos, and big baby gifts taking up space.  We also had a tea leaf reader, who made my day when she told me I'm moving to Italy to become an artist!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Lovejoy's singlehandedly made me obsessed with afternoon tea 4 years ago.  

On a trip to San Francisco, my sister wanted to bring me to tea.
"I dont really like hot tea", said I, having only experienced boxed lipton or green tea. 

I gave it a chance, and immediately fell in love with the charm of this place.  It's so quirky and cute!  I loved how we sat at a couch and ate the scones first (upon recommendation of the waitress) because they were hot. 
I didn't know about fruit flavored herbal teas until I went to this place, complete with cream and sugar.  

I was so hyped up on sugar and caffiene after that experience that I was shaking!

I absolutely loved my first time there, and remembered it fondly.  It's what made me want to find a place in Hawaii that served afternoon tea.  The little gift shop is also a joy, 'cause I got high quality tea souviniers for my friends and such!
author: Candice D.

description:
I loved the food so much. I give their lack of heat (ho heat at all, it was ice cold in the place, I had to keep my coat on.) 

  I ordered the Queens Tea.  I just loved the scones (hot) and the sandwitches.  The green salad was fresh as well.  I wished that they included formal serving service with that price.  

Again, my major  gripe was that is was Cold as heck in there.  The place does not  have any heat at all.  No space heaters, no central heating.  So don't go on a cold day because you will freeze in there.
author: Vanilla C.

description: this is one of my favorite places ever. nice people, nice customers, and a wide variety of tea an treats. they also have an antique store across the street where you can buy some of their teas. i would recommend this to anyone!
author: Cecily B.

description:
My first ever high tea experience was right here at Lovejoy's this past Sunday, and I'm so glad I came here!  My girlfriend and I were on a mission to grab brunch in Noe Valley, and when Chloe's had a line out the door, we popped on over to Lovejoy's to see what the wait situation would be like, only to find no wait at all.  

Done and done!

We chose the High Tea for Two with the cutest and most delicious finger sandwiches (Chicken Apple, Turkey Dijon, Egg and Onion, Chicken and Asparagus) -- perfect portions for a light brunch!  Service was great and attentive and the ambiance made me feel like I was whisked away to my Grandmother's attic.  

I would definitely recommend this as a great alternative brunch spot -- you won't be disappointed!  ;-)
author: Katie C.

description:
My friend took me here and I can't thank her enough! This place is so little and cute.  It's the perfect place to eat with a friend or a group of your girlfriends.
