We had the high tea for 2 which comes with a choice of 4 different types of sandwiches (2 of each kind per person so 8 total per person), scones with clotted cream, and a salad. You also each get to pick your tea. I chose the mango tea which was really fragrant. We had the chicken apple walnut salad sandwich, the salmon and cream cheese, the salmon mousse, and the pear and blue cheese. They were all good but my favorite by far was the chicken apple walnut sandwich. I had a petit four for dessert. It was good but probably better to look at than eat. 

I didn't see a lot of men here but I do think that if guys would actually give it a chance they wouldn't mind this place. But they also have meatier stuff like shepard's pie on the menu if you think that tea and sandwiches aren't going to cut it. 

Bottom line, this place has good food and tea. Yes, its a little pricey. But its definitely a worthwhile experience. I'd say try it if your curious and chances are you'll become hooked. I can't wait to go back to this place! I'm planning on taking my bridesmaids =)
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
I am clearly not one of the first reviewers for Lovejoy's and certainly will not be one of the last, so what can I possibly say about the legendary tea room nestled in a quiet part of Noe Valley...that hasn't already been said?

An old friend and I stopped by Lovejoy's for a spot of afternoon tea on a Thursday afternoon, and the place was absolutely humming with business.  There were groups with mommies and their little girls bouncing around the room, hyped up from all the caffeine and the sweets.  There were tables with mixed genders...and honestly, the guys looked a little awkward and out of place, no matter how much they profess love the yummy little finger sandwiches and warm scones.  It was definitely loud with chatter and laughter, but Michele and I were able to reminisce about old times and catch up each other on new gossip from our lives.  I was just at her wedding in La Jolla a few weeks ago and of course she was so preoccupied then, we hardly had a few moments to talk then.

A perfectly "delightful" afternoon!  I'd highly recommend the black currant tea -- it was fruity, without being overly sweet.  And yes, the scones are truly delish here....nicely warm and I'm sure that they're made with insane  gobs of butter to make them so lovely and unscone-like!
author: Evelyn K.

description:
Hi.  We had tea there on Saturday.  We were 15 minutes late for out reservation but were treated nicely and seated promptly. The ambiance is like a tea party for a child but still ok for adults.  There are mostly women who were either having a girls day out or having a shower of some sort.  The tea was delicious.  The little sandwiches and pastry were good, the fruit ok.
The scones were very good but they was lacking lemon curd. Only strawberry jam and clotted cream were served on the tray.  My cup was stained and the cutlery was unpolished - sort of a shabby "chic" ambiance.  I would not say that this was the best tea I have been served but it was very nice for a Saturday afternoon.
author: MICHELLE B.

description:
Well, at least we looked like we fit the part. 

My friends and I capped off the end of a bachelorette weekend with a tea party for 11 here. Dressed in our colorful sundresses, we giggled in anticipation as we walked to our table and saw the "Reserved for the Queen" sign. For many of us, it was our first high tea experience. After we seated ourselves, our server met us with a warm smile. She poured us two kinds of teas to begin with, one caffeinated, the other Vanilla Roibos herbal. She then came back with three-tiered trays holding crust-free sandwiches, salad, scones, and fresh fruit. It was all so lovely.

Less than eight minutes later, the tray on my end of the table, which I shared with three other friends, was empty. We scarfed down those yummy sandwiches so fast that our kind host came back with an incredulous look on her face. I'm pretty sure we broke the record for quickest disappearance of food. One of my friends was breathing deeply as if she'd just finished sprinting. The other was slathering the double Devon cream on anything she could get her hands on. The bachelorette's mother who was sitting near us kept offering me sandwiches from her tray because she and the others were nibbling at a normal tea party pace. I politely turned her down because I had held my own and devoured my fair share of the tray.

So much for a leisurely two-hour sitting. We were outta there in one hour. I highly recommend the sliced pear and stilton cheese sandwiches, the chestnut tea, and the lemon petit four. Just don't go with my friends and me, unless you got quick hands that is.
author: Anna Marie P.

description:
I love this place!!!!!!!!  Went here with my mom for mothers day.  We ordered the high tea for two.  Before I arrived I expected to leave hungry.  I mean how could some tea satisfy my empty stomach?  Boy was I wrong.  I was stuffed!  Delicious sandwiches.  Sliced cucumber, fig, smoked salmon, hummus, etc.  They were sooooooo good.  The scones with the Devon cream were scrumptious.  What a wonderful place.  The tea was amazing.  They gave us a bottomless pot.  I didn't know it was possible to drink this much tea in one sitting.
  Lovejoys definitely has character.  I love the look and comfort of this place.  Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go again.
author: Lauren B.

description:
My, my, my... upon entering this lovely tearoom, I was immediately swept away into another world. A world where it is sweetly comfortable, welcoming, and soothing. Just like visiting an old friend or grandma. 

We had the Queen's Tea during a chilly afternoon, and it was quite delightful to sip a nice variety of hot tea to warm the soul. I was particularly fond of the fruity teas, such as mango and peach! Everything was wonderfully delish! Scones with double devon cream, salmon & cream cheese sandwiches, and chicken walnut apple sandwiches were yummy!

I am definitely returning!
author: Sharon S.

description: This is hands down the best tea room in San Francisco. It's absolutely adorable and  has delicious sandwiches and tea. It's perfect for a girls lunch or to bring your mother for a special occasion.  I have always wanted to have my Bridal Shower here, but sadly they can not accommodate parties larger than 20.
author: Christina H.

description: I love how home-y this place feels, like you're taking tea at the Japanese Tea Gardens or on a Sunday picnic in the park. Lovejoys' puts on absolutely no "airs" and the food is pretty good. Another place where we like to go for tea, just a bit pricey but entertaining and fun.
author: fuck you p.

description:
I have visited Lovejoy's Tea Shop at Clipper in San Francisco for a number of years for special occasions and I am NEVER, NEVER disappointed! I have given them FIVE STARS because they DESERVE THEM.

Definitely call for a reservation if you want to guarantee seating! It is always hopping yet it feels very intimate when you are seated. The eccentric decor, the comfortable "grandmother's" home feel is perfect for a visit to a tea shop. The food is ALWAYS fresh and delicious.   My favorite "Queen's Tea" comes with the whole works! Your waitress comes by and checks with you during your visit. She brings the teapot, I enjoy the house blend, and the fun begins!

There are delicious hot scones, savory sandwiches (you chose from the menu two choices), a fabulous green salad and coleslaw, sliced fruit, lemon curd and devon cream, at the end she comes around with a platter of petite fours - the "wedding cake"  and the "orange" are lovely as are the other choices.

When you visit Lovejoy's time slows down - one hour will feel like two.  If you can't stay, Lovejoy's does takeout and you can have your own party at home.

 You will not regret going to this wonderful teashop.
author: Teresa P.

description: Very fun!  I came here with a girlfriend and we had a really good time.  We ordered one Queen's tea and one shepherd's pie and we had food leftover.  We got the black tea with lavender which was really good, the asparagus sandwich, and the lox sandwich.  The scone was delicious with the jams and butter, and the sandwiches were good too!  I liked how it came with plenty of salad - so you don't need to order an extra salad - and the little fruit on top was tasty!  There are also extra little things that come with the Queen's tea like a crumpet - it was pretty bland, but i'm assuming that's just what it tastes like - and a petit four at the end.  I think i had so much tea that I could barely eat the petit four.  When i went home i devoured my leftover sandwiches and the rest of the shepherd's pie - and total after splitting with my friend was only around 20 dollars!  Would definitely recommend and come again.  A nice place for bunch or a small get together with girlfriends!
author: Sophia D.

description:
I'm not so sure about this place.  The service was kind of cold and hurried, and the place did not seem so clean with all the doilies on the tables.  (I'm guessing they don't wash them each day by the looks of them.)  But the worst part was when someone actually stopped by to see how things were going, I mentioned that the grapefruit had white dots all over it that looked like mold, and she said that they were fine a few days ago, would I like a replacement?  I said no, and she hurried off even before I could mention the shriveled blueberries.

Not worth the hype.
author: Eileen W.

description: This place is the best. It is so cute, and the perfect place to go and sit with your girlfriends, while eating sandwiches, scones, and endless pots of tea. I've been to high tea at other tea spots around the country, and nothing compares to the feel you get at Lovejoys. The sandwiches are nothing gourmet (white bread and mayonnaise!), and the tea is great but nothing exotic, but that is what they are all about. It is a classic high tea place, not a new-age or vegan or hipster hang-out. I love the mixes of tea cups, plates, and pots, the creaky wood floors, and the wait staff. Definitely call ahead and make reservations if you want to go on a weekend, though.
author: Dana O.

description:
Note to my sister and my best friend: I would like my bridal shower here.  I may not be engaged yet, but a girl has got to plan.  Thank you in advance!

***************

I love the joy I get from being at Lovejoy's, my favorite tea room in the city.  I've been here about a dozen times, and each time was even better then the last.  The ambiance is so eclectic: mismatched tea cups, china, silverware, linens and decor, but somehow it all works and you're transformed to another time and place.  

The Queen's Tea is always a good pick when you're hungry, and my little goddaughters have enjoyed the Wee Tea selection.   As for tea sammies, I've devoured the cucumber & cream cheese, chicken & asparagus, bay shrimp & mayo, artichoke hummus, and the cream cheese & apple...all of which were SO good.  Actually, everything on that tiered silver tray is delicious, especially that perfectly flaky scone.  For my bottomless pot of tea, I stick to two of my faves: vanilla rooibos and passion fruit.  They're so good I always march across the street to purchase a canister to tide me over until my next visit.  

Tip#1: If you're making a reservation ahead of time (which you should do anyway) make sure to ask for a table near the door.  It gets a little stuffy inside!  But sweating is part of the experience here at Lovejoy's!  

Tip#2: Have plans right after tea?  Cancel them.  They don't rush you here, so just relish in the environment and enjoy every minute.  Trust me.  You won't want to leave.  Drink as much tea as humanly possible.  

Tip#3: Need a present for your mother, girlfriend, best friend that's a girl, niece, daughter, goddaughter, co-worker, etc.?  Get them a Lovejoy's gift certificate for a party of two and package with some goodies from the Attic across the street.  Trust me.  The female bonding it promotes will win you points.
author: Courtney B.

description:
Love Joy transports you back to another time. The decor is quintessentially what I associate with English tea only more relaxed. Ther plates and cups are cute and nothing matches so it's interesting to look at the patterns of the teaware.

First place I've ever been where they serve the mini sandwiches with the crusts cut off. For those of you who have watched the movie "Brownsugar"

 I need you to be happy for me. I need you to be there for me, just like you asked of me. So - so I can have tea and eat cucumber sandwiches with the crust cut off!

It was 5 of us all getting the high tea which includes salad, scones, preservatives, double devon cream (YUM!), 2 mini sandwiches of choice, and of course tea.

We all shared our sandwiches. We got the smoked turkey & dijon, salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, chicken apple walnut, roast beef & horseradish, and fig and olive tapenade.

All the sandwiches were good and I was surprisingly full off the food. It 's a cute place to spend time with your girlfriends.
author: kimy l.

description:
I've been to this place since it was at the other location on 24th and Church.  Since then I have moved out of San Francisco, but I still occasionally return to this tea shop!!!  Their sandwiches and teas are wonderful.  Love their Devonshire cream and jam with the crumpets/scones.  And I have (to date) NEVER left the place hungry!

Note: Block off two hours for this experience of having a nice, easy comfortable tea and get away from civilization!!!  You *deserve* it!  (Also, make sure you go on a day when it's typical foggy San Francisco too!)

Of course, I can only go here with a female friend.  The decor is too "feminine" for my "macho" hubby to feel comfortable, even though he LOVES tea!  That's okay though...more finger sandwiches and Tea Room Blend tea for ME!!!  :-P~~ *evil grin*
author: Joanna R.

description:
Great place for English Tea in the city!  I've been going to Lovejoy's for years and I even dragged my husband here recently and he liked it as well.  He said it reminded him of enjoying tea in England!

The decor is, dare I say, shabby sheek, but after many years in business it's leaning a bit more towards the shabby side.  My tablecloth was just a tad too worn w/one too many tea stains, and the pillows need some re-filling and re-covering by now.

The service and tea are still great though as one can tell by how packed it is at peak times, especially on weekends.  I always call ahead first to make a reservation or check to see if I can get a table last minute.
Most will love Lovejoy's for its simple charm and lack of pretension.

Favorites/the norm: High Tea for Two 
-beef w/horseradish, chutney and cheese, chicken w/asparagus & pear w/stilton---you will be surprisingly full if you eat all your sandwiches, salad, scones w/butter and jam and cookie!  save some jam for the cookie too =)
CHINA ROSE is my tea of choice and the Vanilla Roobois seems to be a favorite if you need to go decaf (what's decaf?!)

My last visit: there was a pretty annoying group next to me (half a dozen little girls hyped-up on sugar whilst their Moms chit-chatted with one another and let their girls run wild.  Not Lovejoy's fault, but beware of sitting next to a party like this if you are not entertained by children who are obnoxious and ill-behaved!  Ever heard of "indoor voices?!?!").  

Suffice to say, lots of groups here on the weekends in general, so bring your group and join in!!!
author: TC C.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said?? Been here more than just a few times, my husband likes it too - he never wanted to come in the first place thinking he would starve to death but the food choices aren't bad and you *can* have a real lunch here and leave with a happy, full stomach. Just don't look at the bill. Anyway, all the tea connoisseurs out there will say that the authenticity of the tea experience here isn't quite authentic. But it comes close. Darn close. Close enough where if you know the real deal about tea you'll complain. But that just means it's cuz they're thisclose to the way it should be! Ok, soapbox aside, the devonshire cream and lemon curd is to die for, and if you can spring for it have the 'high tea for two' or the 'queen's tea'. If you love tea, sandwiches, and have never had crumpets, you're in for a real treat. 

Oh, and PS - it's all STREET PARKING only. Don't forget to call for a reservation or you'll be waiting outside for a while during their busier times.
author: cat g.

description:
I couldn't ask for a better tea spot! I have been there so much that the ladies know my tea flavor and order upon sight, and every time I've been there I've never been disappointed. I've even had them cater some events we've held, and they are always a hit.
I take all my out of town guests there and it is always surpasses their expectations.  If you're not very hungry, think carefully about your order! It's no lightweight's tea service. You will leave full if you get anything more than the basics.  Everything is fresh, organic when possible, and yum yum yummy!
author: JAllison M.

description:
One of the few tea places where the male to female ratio is often 1 to 1.  Lovejoy's is SF's premier tea parlor and though it doesnt retain the same quaintness as something farther removed would, it does do a good job of bringing afternoon tea to the masses.

The best part about the tea service is that you get to choose your sandwiches.  However, it's also a drawback since that means there are no seasonal offerings to peruse.  With the volume of people it serves, it's a wonder that Lovejoy's is still able to retain some of the homemade charms that you would find in a less popular tea room.  The sandwiches have been consistently good on my visits here and the menu has a larger assortment of hearty foods to satisfy big appetites.  There's a huge selection of teas to choose from and dont miss the petit fours if you've still got room in your belly.

Four stars for the food, minus a half star for the underlying commercialization of the place.
author: Monica T.

description:
Really good service. 

Quaint decor with many antique and vintage details -- table settings, tables, chairs, wall decorations, antique fine china and serving pieces.

The interior is small, and while the tables are close together, it felt cozy. I have to admit, that while walking to our table, I was scared I was going to accidentally bump and break something. (I have a hard time imagining someone maneuvering a baby stroller through here.)

I love the fine china! Who would have thought mixing-and-matching would work so well. 

I think it's the original floor, it's warped; while we at at the table half of us thought we were tilting forward, the other half tilting back.

You need to check out the bathroom, cute decor. (The sign about the original plumbing. Only one unisex bathroom in the establishment.)

I think the largest table holds up to 6 people.

I wouldn't recommend having a party for more than 4-5 kids. Kids should be approx 7 yrs or older. (If you're looking for a place where kids can play, take them to something like Chuck E. Cheese, or Super Frank's.)

Saw a father-daughter-grandmother tea time -- very cute.

HIGH TEA

Tea: Single Estate Ceylon was very good.

Sandwiches:
1) Smoked Salmon was delicious. Smoked salmon had a smooth flavor, and melted in my mouth. (Better than a bagel with lox!)
2) Chicken Apple Walnut was also delicious.
3) Chicken Asparagus was interesting. I didn't expect the asparagus to be pureed.
4) Egg & Onion. If you you like egg salad. (I'm not a fan of egg salad sandwiches.)

SCONES: to die for! Moist and fluffy, with delicious clotted cream.

Shortbread tea biscuit: yummy; but would chose the scone over the shortbread if given a choice.

Good experience.
author: Bella B.

description:
Everyone should have an English grandmother.  Or at least tried English tea service once in their lives.  Really.

If you've ever had tea with your grandmother (or played tea with your stuffed animals), this place will jog some fond memories.  It's a quaint English-style service of tea.  I've gone for a number of special occasions and it's done up in all that good old fashioned English-lace-mismatched teacup decor.  The delicate-ness of their sandwiches, scones and cookies, and the Devonshire cream will expand your waistline. 

So wear something (((expandable))).  Reservations are a must, especially on weekends and with mom's day coming up, it's a popular place. 

And if sitting around English antiques isn't enough for you, check out their small shop across the street.  Bottoms up!
author: Jen L.

description:
Lovejoy's is so adorable. I LOVE lovejoy's.
1) Bottomless tea. They have wonderful fruity herbal teas so you don't have to get totally caffeinated, although they have this queen's blend or something (can't remember the name) that's very good and caffeinated.
2) Very very generous HighTea. You will be full and trying really hard to finish everything
3) Lovejoy's is the only tea room I have been to in the bay area that serves Shepherd's Pie. It's f'ing good too.

I get such a good vibe from Lovejoy's. I love how it's decorated in the spirit of a back alley english tea house with mismatched porcelain and well loved tea cozies. All of the chairs are different, the tables are different sizes and shapes, and if you get lucky you can sit on a couch.

I think I'll make a reservation this week!
author: Annie T.

description:
My girlfriend and I have been here many times, and each one of them has been special.  This is one of those places where you feel like the people that own it and work there are in it because they have a passion they want to share.  They go out of their way to make sure your experience is relaxing, delicious, and memorable.

We always go for the High Tea for Two.  I recommend trying their Hazelnut tea, it's amazing.

For sandwiches, I'd suggest: Roast Beef & Horseradish, Chicken Apple Walnut, Hummus, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, and the Chutney.

Be sure to book your tea time a few days in advance, weekends usually book up quick.  However, last time we were late in getting a reservation, and tried calling them before they opened on Saturday.  We lucked out since there was a cancellation, and we got a spot right at the opening time.

Can't wait to go here again!
author: Chris Q.

description: Darjeeling tea and tea sammiches is darling! Kitschy decor, fun feathered hats, and pastel colored teapots...It's tea time here all the time.
author: Oanh N.

description: I love this place.  Yes, it's mostly women and young girls here, but it's really a relaxing place for everyone.  We've even had a book club meet here and it's been great!  The tea and sandwiches are great, and it's a great date place also.  You have to reserve ahead of time most of the time, but it's definitely worth the time and effort.
author: Brian C.

description: Enjoyed tea there today with 4 Mothers and 4seven year old girls.  The menu had a very good selection of food and teas.  I recommend reservations, was pretty busy.  Service was attentive and my tea was piping hot, the way I enjoy it.  I would go back again.
author: Mike W.

description:
I think this will always stand out in my mind as one of the best things I did on vacation in San Francisco.

I took my boyfriend with me on a mid-afternoon jaunt to Lovejoy's.  We ordered High Tea for Two.  I was a little worried that even though it *sounds* like a lot of food, the portions would be dainty.  Not at all!  We're both champion eaters, and this was enough to fill us up.  

I was absolutely in love with the Artichoke-Hummus sandwich, but we were both enamored by the Pear & Stilton sandwich.  The scones were so wonderful (the boyfriend prefers the American version of scones to these, the British kind, but I thought they were great).  The devonshire cream and strawberry preserves you can put on the sweet stuff is phenomenal, too.  The boy couldn't turn down buying an orange-chocolate petit four from the tray that was brought around by the owner.  That was also good.  :)  We had the Tea Room Blend-tea as well as Blood Orange tea.  Both were excellent (particularly the Blood Orange, which was surprising in its deliciousness).

Beyond the food, though, the atmosphere is above reproach.  It was so cozy, calm, friendly and just....happy.  I felt so at home here, and I've never been too much of a girly-girl.  The waitstaff was beyond attentive, but not at *all* obtrusive.  There were several tables full of people, but they still noticed when you needed a clean plate for your scone.  Our waitress complimented our sandwich choices.  I'm sure they do that all the time, but it was a lovely touch because it *seemed* genuine, even if it wasn't.  

I truly wish that this place existed in Madison.  I would go as often as I could!  Please take advantage of this gem of a restaurant if you can.  :)
author: Heather T.

description:
This place takes you to a Merchant Ivory set without the annoying characters. Yummy tea sandwiches, delicious scones, and fabulous tea served in mismatched teacups and cute pots. Not your grandma's teahouse...or maybe it is...if she's got panache.
Perfect place for a chatty date.
author: Nathalie P.

description:
The food here is pretty fabulous. My only complaint is it's a very noisy restaurant! If you are looking for something quiet and intimate look somewhere else. Lovejoys is however a fun little tea room where you can try a variety of flavors. Located in the hills of San Francisco, it's faily easy to get to and there is lots of parking along the streets. The room almost reminds you of Alice and Wonderland. Should i drink the bottle and eat the cake? Of course you should, It's an adventure for sure. 
Great for mothers day, bridal showers, baby showers, and all those girlish fetishes. Although my brother even liked it. Make sure you come with an appetite though because they give you a lot of food! It can serve as breakfast, lunch, and dinner! 
Go ahead, dive down the rabbit hole and check out Lovejoys!
author: Whitney F.

description:
The interior is like a jumble shop, and utterly charming.

When considering the price, this is probably the best afternoon tea is the City. My typical visit is about $30 for two people.

Unlike other tea rooms, you can choose which sandwiches you would like. Most tea rooms have a set menu, which can be challenging if you have food sensitivities.

Parking can be a challenge as there aren't any lots nearby. But it is super accessible on the J-Church.

The only downside is it's in a small space, and things can be quite tight.
author: Sasha R.

description:
4.5 Stars - Tea sandwiches are something I NEED.  I need to have tea with friends and make simple conversation while drinking tea with milk and sugar and eating tiny food made for my ease of consumption while looking dainty and my shear joy of its presentation.  

Lovejoy's only improvement could be letting me pick out what cup I get - because when I get one I don't like it really bums me out and possibly taking me on short notice instead of being so popular that they are always booked... success is hard. ; )
author: Alicia W.

description:
Ho Hum. Average I'd say. Maybe I have certain expectations for tea-time as I'm English but I'd have to say Lovejoy's is only so so. Sure, it has a really nice atmosphere - quaint mismatched china, cute olde-worlde decoration - and the waitresses were nice, but where you get to sit in the room makes quite a bit of difference and the food, well, it just isn't that fabulous for the price. Nice selection of sandwiches, but they're teeny, and a good selection of tea, but the Devon "clotted cream" with the scones was horrible and not the genuine stuff at all. Maybe it's really hard to get here, but this was clearly not the real, delicious, super-rich, mccoy, and instead had that distinct UHT long-life flavor to it. Yeuk. 

Overall, cutesy and sweet place, but really overpriced for what you get and the food just isn't that great. Also, all the women there in their pastel-colored chanel-style suits and high-heeled shoes ooing and ahing over the bridal/baby shower gifts get a little annoying. Unless you're one of them, I suppose

Also, fyi, but this is just me being nit-picky, but if they're going for the Anglo-styley with the tea-room thing, they should know that in Britain sandwiches, cookies, tea and scones is called Tea, not High Tea. High Tea is an early dinner kind of meal, usually for kids who don't eat late, where you eat something like baked beans and bangers, or fried eggs on toast. 

Hmm, yeah, sorry, that was a bit nit-picky.
author: emily c.

description:
I have been here two times and I have had great food and service both times. 

On my most recent visit I reserved a table for a group of 8 girl friends for my birthday. They were all new to this tea room and the whole tea experience but they all raved about Lovejoy's for days. We had the High tea and it was enough food and tea for us to leave satisfied and full.

I tried many of the tea sandiwiches but chicken apple walnut was my favorite. The tea room blend and the pomegrante green tea were good.  All my girlfriends LOVED the warm scones with preserves and devon cream. I wish I had one right now.

Lovejoy's is a  great spot to gossip over tea with friends.
author: Lisandra F.

description:
This is very much a Bohemian tea room, so expect eclectic -- not coordinating -- tea sets and flatware. Great for just meeting up or for an event. My cousin and I hosted a bridal tea shower for her little sister here. It was a grownup tea party for the girls at heart -- and I'm a guy's girl so that's saying a lot. A lovely spread of assorted tea sandwiches ranging from smoked salmon, cream cheese and watercress to roast beef with horse radish. Of course scones and clotted cream were on the table. To add to the event we blocked off an hour with the clairvoyant tarot card reader -- so accurate some of the guests returned on their own to have follow up readings!

Lovejoy's also offers party services for little girls 4 years of age and up -- this includes elegant clothing for tea party dress up! This is where my daughter will be having her 4th birthday for sure...
author: Tanya P.

description: Take your mom. Take your sister. Take your best friend. Take them all. I even go here with my ex. The service is great. The sandwiches and tea are wonderful. And the owner is so nice. It's great to have somewhere like this in the city.
author: Angela K.

description:
I can't fight the urge to break out the British accent whenever I go to a tea room. It was on full tilt at Lovejoy's.  My companions and I had "a jolly good time" there - it's got that packed to the rafters antique store kind of feel to it.  I wish I had worn a flowery dress with a hat and neat white gloves. 
We all went for the Light Tea Service, and between the six of us, we got a good selection of the sandwiches to share and 3 different teas.  The Fig & Olive Tapenade and the chicken apple walnuts were my favs.  
The scones were yummy, too - still warm and sweet w/raisins. But they were taken to the next level, with the BEST Double Devon Cream.  I don't care if it's a heart attack on a butter knife - MMMMM.  
Definitely make reservations early.  Our group lucked out on a last minute cancellation.
author: CINDY K.

description:
The good: There is a wide selection of teas.  The pots and plates are so cute.  The food is delicious, whether it's a scone, a tea sandwich, or a "heartier fare."  Oh, if you order an entree, just share it.  Went to tea with 4 ladies, and we each ordered our own Shepherd's Pies... we all went home with half our pies!

The bad:  Parking.  It's San Francisco - parking is hard ANYWHERE.
author: Audrey B.

description:
You can't go wrong with LoveJoy's on a Sunday afternoon with your best girlfriends... so cozy and just plain perfect.  Such a great place to feel dainty or just catch up and close the week with great conversation.  It is quite difficult to get a reservation towards the end of the week, but we actually got called in on the wait list once and it was perfect timing although Abi was soooo hungover from her unofficial birthday the night before. 

Great atmosphere, delicious food, cute decor, and fast service.

Sandwhiches I LOVE: Chicken and asparagus, Bay Shrimp, and Smoked salmon.

Tea I LOVE: Passion Fruit

If you don't like tea, the hot cocoa is delicious and comforting.
author: Chrysantha C.

description:
Mismatched antique cups and an atmosphere just like a grandma's house. Lovejoys is an adorably cute tea room that is the perfect place to meet up with girlfriends to chat over tea and little snacks. I went to Lovejoys with 2 girlfriends and had an awesome time. We were seated on the red couch in the back which was perfect because it made us feel like we were chatting it up in one of our living rooms. 

For the three of us we ordered the High Tea for Two. We got a bottomless pot of tea, 4 sandwiches of our choice, scones, salad, and cole slaw. 

Service was fast and friendly, the 3 of us spent 3 hours hanging out at Lovejoys and the waitresses in no way made us feel like we had to leave. Instead they offered us tasty Petit Fours and allowed us to finish up our girl talk. I'd definitely recommend their little cakes, i particularly enjoyed the orange butter cream sponge cake one. I'd also recommend making reservations. The place gets packed quickly and only a few tables are available for walk ins and because they allow you to sit in there for as long as you'd like most tables don't clear out for a couple of hours. 

We had such a great time we've already made plans to come back again! Great place for gal pals to chat up a storm.
author: Nicole L.

description: Deeeeelicious, adorable, great service, a highly recommended experience - they were even gracious and welcoming when I showed up by myself without a reservation.  The tea selection is excellent, and the scones are insane.  High tea for one, yum!
author: M P.

description: This place....is perfection. There's an assortment of really cute and quirky wooden chairs, tables, and china and it's just oh-so-charming. When you make a reservation, they reserve a table that says "Reserved for Royalty/Queens/etc" which is the cutest thing ever. Also, always make a reservation, even if it doesn't seem like it would be a busy day. My friend and I got the Queen's tea, which included sandwiches, scones with jam and clotted cream (SO FRICKING GOOD), petit fours, fresh fruit, crumpets, and two pots of bottomless tea. We went for the tea house blend (which is very similar to Irish breakfast) and the dragon well with pomegranate leaves. We spent about two and a half hours enjoying the atmosphere, the delicious food, and tea. The service and staff are amazing! They kept warming up or adding hot water to our tea and making sure we were satisfied. Of the sandwiches, chicken asparagus was definitely both our favorites, but everything was miniature, bit-size, and tasty. I LOVED it! Lovejoy's is definitely kind of expensive, but it's well worth going all out rather than trying to get the cheapest options. Plus, it's a place to sit and enjoy the ambiance for a while, to catch up and chat. I will definitely be coming here again!
author: Jing P.

description: I rarely give 5 stars, but this place deserves it. I took my hubby here today for a birthday tea party and I was blown away. The tea service was fantastic, the food was out of this world delicious, our server knew her teas and recommended what we should drink for each tier of the lunch tray. It's so beautiful on the inside and the tables and mismatched china were perfect. I can't rave about this place enough. Seriously, go and have the best two hours of your life!
author: jason m.

description:
This is probably my favorite place in San Francisco.

If you're going on a weekend, you must book WAY ahead, but it is SO worth it.

Why do I love it so?

- Fantastic teas (and bottomless tea pots)
- Delicious warm scones with double Devonshire cream and jam
- Tea sandwiches to die for
- Yummy petit fours
- Mis-matched antique furniture, cups and dishes
- AMAZING, ATTENTIVE, SUPER FRIENDLY service
- AFFORDABLE

A full tea service with scone, bottomless pot of tea, two kinds of tea sandwiches, and a tea cookie is something like $13.  I had high tea at the Palace Hotel once, and it was $50 per person (!) for lower quality product and service.

Lovejoy's is all the fun and sophistication of high tea, without all the snootiness and pretense. Whether you're dressed as a pauper or a prince, you'll always be treated like royalty here.
author: Brendon C.

description:
Came here with my sisters and my nephew (a girl's day out, with the exception of my nephew). They have seatings at 11am and 1pm on the weekend so we took the 11am. When we got there a few minutes before 11, there was a wait outside since they don't open the doors until 11. Right after they open the doors, the places fills up instantly with everyone who made reservations.

We ordered a few teas (they even had caffeine free ones, which was perfect for my then-pregnant sister) and some sets of high-tea food, which included various sandwiches and scones. Some tasted better than others, but I guess we eat a lot, because after we left, we went off to eat some more food elsewhere. The decorations in here are also nice with old English style furniture, and couches as well, and also various styles of teapots.
author: Anita C.

description:
Lovejoy's is like an uber cute Victorian dollhouse come to life. Decorated with frilly pink curtains, antiques, and little teapots, this is the ideal place for girlfriends to catch up over a tea party setting. Great place for a bridal or baby shower too.  The teas are great, and the scones are to die for. Staff is very helpful. Boys: KEEP OUT!

Tip: Be sure to make reservations at least one week in advance! This place books up fast! If you feel like dropping in, be prepared to wait at least an hour.
author: Cee J.

description:
I enjoyed my visit to Lovejoy's today.  I went with three of my girl friends.  We ordered a variety of sandwiches and three different pots of tea.  We were welcomed with friendliness by the staff and our table, which was at the back of the teahouse included a comfy red couch.  

I've heard so much about this place I think I came in with high expectations.  For the most part, everything was up to par and delicious.  I think my only issue is that I've been to other tea places that I actually enjoyed more.

I'll come here again but it didn't make me dance or twinkle my toes.
author: Juliana T.

description:
I love going to high tea here. Price is reasonable and the food and teas are tasty...

My fave tea sandwiches are: chicken asparagus, chicken walnut, and roast beef with horseradish. Yum!
author: J V.

description:
Love this place because they give soooooo much food. I did the "queen's tea" with 10+ other girls and we could not even finish everything. 

The sandwiches were good, but I was most impressed with the scones and lemon curd and clotted cream. I thought clotted cream was supposed to be not good- but I really liked it! I only tried two teas since that's all they gave us, it would have been better if we tried more varieties around the table. 

I'll definitely be back again.
author: Retired B.

description:
The best tea spot EVER!

My gf and I enjoy afternoon tea, sammiches and crumpets and so far Lovejoy's ranks #1 on our list.  We tried a few other places in the East Bay, and although the tea selection is not unique to Lovejoy's, the food definitely is.  Their menu selections far exceed anyone's expectations thinking they cannot get full from tea & crumpets.  Believe you me, when you order the "Queen's Tea" service - you'll walk out feeling quite content.

Ask any of my gf's (girl & guy friends) - I'm always raving about this place and it is evidenced by the fact that I'm here every other month! LOL!
author: Aurelie N.

description: At first, I thought the name - Lovejoy's Tea Room - was pretty funny so this would be a great place to have afternoon tea with the girls. Place opens at 11 and already a full house. Luckily, I reserved a table way in advance for my party and got the best seats in the house next to the lovely window. it was a nice set up. Lovejoy definitely had alot of attention to details which included cute plates and cups. My friend and I even flip the plates over to see where they bought them from (Japan and England). I docked one star for being too squishy. You almost feel like you're walking on eggshells in that place hoping not to knock something or someone over because it's so tight.  We ordered 5 "high tea for 2" meal sets which came with 5 different choices of tea and 2 sandwiches per person. The sandwiches fill us all up good and scones came after which really put me in a food coma. Overall, a great place to celebrate anything - promotion, engagement, birthday, etc.
author: Kelly C.

description:
My friends and I had the tea for 2 and added an extra 17.99 for 3 people. All I can say is the food and tea were amazing! The tea for 3 came with 6 selections of different sandwiches, (3 mini sandwiches of each type), salad with a horseradish balsamic vinegar dressing, Cole slaw, 3 cookies, 3 HUGE scones and 3 pots of tea.
The tea was bottomless; I had the mango tea which was very fruity and tropical. I also tried the passion fruit tea and the chamomile tea which were also very good. They are all loose leaf teas so they gave us a strainer to put on top of our cups when we poured our tea. 
We had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, bay shrimp with mayo, roast beef with horseradish, egg with onion, turkey with cranberry, and a walnut with chicken and apple sandwiches. My personal favorites out of all of them were the smoked salmon and the bay shrimp. =)
The service was great, they kept filling our teapots with water and constantly asked if everything was ok. The only downside when you drink like 10 cups of tea was the bathroom issue. There is only one bathroom with one toilet. The line was long and I had to wait impatiently for the bathroom since I really had to go. 
The bill came out to be about 22 a person and I would definitely come back
author: Shirley W.

description:
I went here today for lunch and highly recommend it! 

I had the savory tea which comes with two sandwiches and a bottomless pot. I chose the vanilla rooitis tea, turkey and dijon sandwich, and cheese and tomato sandwich. I also ordered a chicken curry pastie. All were so delicious! All of this for about 20/30 bucks which seemed well worth it! 

The decor is really cute and girly, it's a great place for lunch with girlfriends or a celebration although I'd also come here on a date-night with my bf.

I think it would be neat to add some cordials or champagne to the mix although I do recognize that this is a tea-house and not a bar so it's probably considered inappropriate. 

I recommend reservations even in the middle of the day on a weekday unless you don't mind a bit of a wait!

I was surprised at the lack of a wait for the loo considering all the tea consumed! 

I will definitely come back here in the future. :)
author: Kristi D.

description:
This place is over-the-top in the best way. Sample all kinds of teas. Get recommendations from the servers. Also, a good place for afternoon snacks.

Reservations recommended since it can fill up quickly. Relatively good prices too. 

Bring friends and have a nice time!
author: R K.

description:
Is it any surprise that most of the reviews of this place are written by women?  This is a great place to get together with your girlfriends after someone takes a vacation and pour over photos together.
The relaxed atmosphere and the smell of tea make this a little get away well worth the wait.  I highly recommend Yorkshire Gold!
author: Kristine K.

description:
I have been going to Lovejoy's for a long time, and it's pretty good.  I would say the best tea house in town, although there aren't many to choose from.

Likes:
+ Scones, but I think they should use yellow raisins instead of regular
+ Ambience and mismatched china are fun and girly
+ Very yummy sandwiches.  I like chicken apple walnut, egg and onion, and bay shrimp with mayo
+ Good tea selection
+ Fruit is always ripe and fresh
+ Service/friendliness has improved over the past couple of years

Dislikes:
- They grab my tea pot before I can stop them to "top off" with more hot water.  It dilutes my tea.  I like my tea strong.
- I don't like how if I order tea service with other people, we have to share a serving of jam/cream.  I want my own little container!
author: Kandi K.

description:
I love this place.  Once you're inside you don't really feel like you're in a restaurant in the City, it feels like you are transported to a different time warp.  I love their assortment of teas, sandwiches and desserts.  This is definately a place for a girl's day or a bridal/baby shower.  The place isn't so big so you can't expect to have a big party there but it might be worth asking.  

This place is really special.
author: Daphne A.

description: bring back afternoon tea! when/where else can one completely gorge oneself on sandwiches, pastries and clotted cream, all whilst lifting a pinky and wearing something with petticoats? and if you're going to hop (or roll) onto that bandwagon, there's no place better than here. comfy seats, attentive yet totally unrushed service, and best of all, delicious food.
author: Sasha R.

description: this review is based on my phone calling experince. They just don't answer their phone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have been trying to call them for hours since they open but never for once they answer their phone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I was trying to make a reservation for my sister's baby shower for a group of 15-20 people. I called on tuesday and left a message because they don't open until wednesday, and surprisingly they call me back but when I try calling them back, they don't answer their phone!!!! Can you please just answer your phone or let us make a reservation on your website so you don't have to talk us if you do not want to????!!!!! Thank you!
author: Jason W.

description:
Went here for the first time with our 18 year old daughter. It was a fun time, and she loved it. The cuteness of the place, the outfits the servers wear...all that was just right, as you'd expect it to be. And, it didn't feel like a chain - more like someone's creative idea for a restaurant. They could even go more British...play some Henry Purcell in the background or something. Have pictures of the horse races.

Anyway, the thing to get here is the cream tea, or the tea with scones. The scones are good. My wife got the high tea, which comes with sandwiches. They were fine, but nothing particularly great. Right, it was probably Safeway bread, not some freshly baked bread. 

The tea is good quality. Perhaps not insane quality, but good quality.

I had the Stilton and pear salad, which was very good. I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had, but perfectly good for the moment. I suppose you'd never waste a really top-notch Stilton this way, but for the salad, the cheese tasted good.

All in all, a fun thing to do, and we'll hope to come back.
author: Mister K.

description:
How cool is this place??!! Me and my good friend stopped in for lunch the other day and had such a pleasant experience. Let me first state that when you walk into this restaurant you feel like you're sitting in the middle of a London cafe. Although I have never been to London, I imagine it to be exactly this way. The decor was so fun! It's more of an afternoon spot you go with some girlfriends...not really a date spot. 
The tea was very tasty. You get so many options to choose from!!! the best part is that they keep refilling your kettle and each person get's their own!
Their sandwiches are delicious. Small, yet very flavorful! Again so many delicious choices, you really can't go wrong. However I must say that their scones were to die for. As I put the first bite in my mouth I think I literally died for a second. It was heaven. They were warm and oh so buttery. They bring out the scones with their own special butter and jam which takes it to a whole other level. 
Overall my experience here was awesome. I can't wait to go back.
author: Niki F.

description:
Overall, It's a very nice place, great decorations. We had a large group and were able to sit there as long as we wanted. Serving staff was really nice to us.

I don't think I would go there again soon - for two of us, we spent 55 dollars and we had tea, two small sandwiches, a scone, some mixed greens (the kind that you would buy at Safeway in a plastic bin), some coleslaw, and a crumpet. For our large group of eight, we spent $225 altogether. For the money spent, even though yes the ingredients overall were nice, it just is a very extravagant lunch where you leave feeling waterlogged on tea but not necessarily full full. Not that you have to feel like you should unbutton your pants and roll out the door, it just feels like a lot of money for tea and white bread sandwiches. But if you go there feeling hungry, you need to drop 30-35 to leave feeling satisfied - otherwise, you will find yourself eating like a whole tub of jam, butter, and cream.

However, the things I did like were the devon double cream and the lemon curd. The coleslaw was good - they had caraway seeds in them - not too sweet.

Again, for the money, we got as much tea as we wanted, but we each received a knife, spoon, and fork, with no serving utensils for anything. They put the greens and the coleslaw (plus the sandwiches, etc) on these big tier trays but they don't have serving utensils. So you just use your fingers or try to use your one spoon that you use to stir your tea to scoop greens onto your plate. It just ended up a bit germy and messy. I was using my knife I had just slathered with cream and jam, etc and then had to use it as a serving utensil for the coleslaw, etc. They didn't refresh plates, so if you had used your one small plate to eat salad, you also had to use it to serve your sweet stuff and it all got mixed together. By the end, it was pretty gross.

Also, they use these thin textured square napkins (the kind we grew up on when we had people over) for their hand towels in the bathroom. They don't work so well...get bits of paper falling off - almost like drying your hands with toilet paper. But that's being a little picky.
author: P B.

description: Adorable tea service in a setting to match. I had to Queens Tea which is $24.95 per person and comes with two sandwiches of your choice (I had artichoke hummus and pear with stilton), coleslaw, greens, scones, devon cream, preserves, crumpet, lemon curd, fruit, petit four, and a biscuit and of course your choice of tea. It was 5 years ago and I still think about it and need to return. Its not an everyday thing, of course. But it is a wonderful luxury every once in a while.
author: Mr. E.

description: Old fashioned place to meet with girlfriends for tea sandwiches, scones, petit fours.  This is a great place for a certain type of person looking for a certain type of ambience.
author: Cathy L.

description: I've been a fan of Lovejoy's since its original location @ Church/24th Sts. Great place to take my Mom when she visited from NY. About 3 mos ago 3 friends & myself went to Lovejoy's. We got there early thinking there might be a place for us. However, we just missed out as the tearoom was packed.  One of the owners was very accommodating & said for us to come back in about 45 minutes: there would be  table for us.  Sure enough, there was  Very nice table set-up. Excellent service. We ordered the High Tea along with crumpets & petit fours.  It was a very relaxing 2 hrs, & was hard to leave.
author: Pam R.

description: Very old English grandmother.  Delicate sandwiches, fresh-baked goodies, everything devine you'd expect from good afternoon tea.  It's a unique experience.  I love the antique decor of the whole place!  Better than the tea experience at Stanford Court Hotel, Fairmont, and Westin St. Francis (when they used to serve tea).
author: Kristen S.

description:
perfect place to bring my bridesmaids!  we got all lady-liked-up for some tea and yummy crumpets... it was the most ideal setting to start the chaos that is wedding planning!

at about $16-17 each, i was able to treat everyone out to one of the best tea experience around... 
-no too stuffy
-great selection of sandwiches
-huge list of teas
-friendly servers dressed in the most adorable outfits
-cutesy and dainty tea sets that you can even purchase!
-awesome website to plan ahead:)

we were lucky to get the large window seating area for more privacy and a nice view of the street.  loved the atmosphere and food... we were seriously stuffed after the first few courses! 
can't wait to go back!!  it'll be my go-to tea house with special guests and possibly my future daughter!  holy crap!!!  i love this place so much that i'm thinking that far in advance!
author: becky f.

description:
Wow!
Came here with 3 other girls (the place is packed with women). We each had the Queen's Tea.

1. The warm scones with lemon curd and cream was divine (and I've never described anything as divine in my life)
2. Had the  Smoked salmon with Cream Cheese and the Chicken apple walnut tea sandwich (How can I go back to eating bread crust ever again?)
3. I also tasted my friend's cheese and chutney (a little too strong for me)
4. There was A LOT of food. Fruit, coleslaw, crumpets, tea biscuits, and dessert. I wish I could eat them all. 
5. The Lady Grey tea (not on the menu) was really good. Earl Grey with Mango! 

Will definitely go back for more.
author: joanna c.

description:
My friend and I had a wonderful time there today.

We had "high tea for two" that come with 2 scones, 4 sandwiches, coleslaw, salad green, shortbread, and of course, bottomless tea.

I had black current tea, which I thought was perfect match with the food we've had.  Food was pretty good, but what I liked the best was the shortbread tea biscuit.  It didn't look like a lot of food as those sandwiches are quite small, but we were almost too full by the time we left the tea room.  It was $32 for 2 of us - reasonable in my opinion.

This place is pretty girlie as you can imagine.  Reserved seats have small card that says "reserved for queens."  Too girlie for guys unless they don't mind to be referred as queens.

Making reservation in advance is recommended since they seem to be booked almost every weekend.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Tea, cuteness, and mini-sandwiches... this place is right up my alley. 

Lovejoy's is a quaint little tea room that offers a variety of teas (duh!), sandwiches, and sweets. My bf and I had the High Tea for Two ($34) and the Crumpets ($5.25), and were more than satisfied. We tried the cucumber & cream cheese, smoked turkey & dijon, artichoke hummus, and the roast beef & horseradish sandwiches. Don't be fooled, these mini-sandwiches are bite-sized, but can really fill you up. The scones were yummy with the preserves and double devon cream. The teas we had were the Apricot black tea and the special during that time, which I don't really remember. The teas were nice and went well with our food, but nothing too exciting. The High Tea for Two also came with coleslaw, a salad, and biscuits which weren't anything to write home about.
The best part of our meal... were the crumpets with lemon curd. They were absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delish. Mmm : 9

Being in this place made me feel warm and giddy. I would definitely recommend Lovejoy's and hope to make a trip back there soon!
author: Phoi B.

description:
Lovelovelove this place. It makes me feel like I'm at my grandma's house with all the lace, and cozies and doilies and shit. Plus, I feel real right and proper and a bit British--which I am clearly not.

The food is yumyum. Tea sandwiches, good salads, scones with clotted cream to die for, tasty sweets, and neverending tea service!

The crowd is mostly ladies: bachelorette parties, bday parties, bridal showers, which I would normally hate, but I can tune that shit out in this place. If a bridal shower from Burlingame and white pumps don't annoy me, then you know this place is the jam. 

Just don't talk about blowjobs while you're there. It's not polite lady conversation and is frowned upon by your neighbors who can hear every word because the tables are pretty close.

That's all. I can't wait until I get back there...
author: Jennifer J.

description: Oh, how I love thee Lovejoy's!! It's a great place to hang with the gals for a little party/get-together. You can get totally hyper off the bottomless cups of teas. The service is impeccable. We were treated so kindly by the staff. Loved the food too! Make sure to get some heavenly Devon creme and biscuits. Also, try the petit fours, they are hard to find and delicious. The sandwiches were great too, like the cucumber cream cheese. It's a good time.
author: Brooke A.

description: At first I was a little bit iffy about going to a real ass tea party place, because all of the girls in my family just wanted to have some "girls only family bonding" here but I must admit, I really really liked it here. The atmosphere is so cute and it was overall a good place to have some conversation. The sandwiches we ate were pretty refreshing and the tea was OK, but GAD the petit fours, goood lord those were soo moist. I would go back just to eat petit fours. YUM.
author: Christine G.

description:
The finger sandwiches are divine and the tea is a cold weather rescue. Perfect for baby shower and lunch with neices. I cant believe its so popular that one must have reservations- but you better believe it baby
I dont think the decor is all that great, but maybe just not my personal taste.
author: Melissa B.

description: The scones, clotted cream and jam were a delight! As were the rich little butter biscuits. The chicken cranberry walnut sandwich was very bland, though. The sandwiches generally weren't very inspiring. It was a nice tough to include a an organic salad bed, but you have to scoop the salad onto your plate. They also serve a not insubstantial amount of coleslaw, but it tastes awful. The service and tea was divine.
author: Kimmie M.

description: Went here with my family for Father's day/birthday brunch and we had so much fun.  The food was great, fun atmosphere for a non-stuffy high tea. Very successfully gave myself a food coma with all the yummy sandwiches, scones and tea.  Great for a brunch with your girlfriends, but the men did seem a little awkward :-)
author: Brooke C.

description:
Awesome!  Brought my parents here and we each ordered a Light Tea.  On paper, it sounds like light fare (choice of one sandwich from a list of over 15 --- I got the chicken apple walnut, they got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, both good --- a scone with dev cream and preserves, fruit and shortbread).  Oh man, it was more than filling.  Especially with the huge pot of tea we each got (I got the Vanilla Rooibos).  My family loves loves afternoon tea and this place has pretty much all the same stuff as the Ritz, but at a fraction of the price.

What makes it 4 instead of 5 stars?  The pot they gave me was so freakin huge and full it was majorly heavy when I went to pour my tea, while my dad got a daintier pot.  They should have considered who they were giving the mongo pot to.  Also, the grapes on the fruit tier were DIRTY.  They were still covered in dirt/mold.  Obviously not rinsed.  We just wiped them with tea-dampened napkins before eating them.  But still, I'll go back again and again.
author: spiff e.

description:
I'm no newcomer to afternoon tea, having even
experienced three in London - at the Ritz, the Savoy
and at Brown's.  Less than thirty minutes drive from
my Daly City home, I'm delighted to have experienced
Lovejoy's, at the recommendation of a dear friend
and colleague who has long been insisting that we
go there.

We recently treated another colleague for her birthday
and totally indulged.  What a lovely afternoon!!  We
splurged on high tea, even adding crumpets, a 
fruit plate, and some extra sandwiches...and there was
little left.  Everything was spectacular.  My friend had a 
mango tea, I had passionfruit - a nice change from my
usual Earl Grey - we shared several gourmet sand-
wiches - chicken and asparagus, roast beef & horse-
radish ( wonderfully piquant ), sliced pear and stilton
cheese, smoked salmon and cream cheese - to name
a few.  The scones, topped with clotted cream and 
lemon curd, though laden with calories, were devilishly
delightful.

At the end of our feast, we were served some scrumptious petit 
fours, followed by more tea, and happily waddled our way into the afternoon.

I purchased the beautiful strawberry teapot that held my
passionfruit tea....everything there is practically for sale...
at the teahouse or in their gift shop across the street.

Lovejoy's is a special place for an afternoon with the 
girls or one of the guys who appreciates some place 
special and unique.
author: Carmen H.

description:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is a cute little place to hang out with your girlfriends and sip some tea!

A quaint little spot to relax and enjoy tea in the middle of busy San Francisco!  The tea is very good, and the price is not bad.  The tea for two is good for two people... with it, you get your choice of tea as well as a dessert tea! yum!  They have a good selection of teas...Taylor's tea room blend is my favorite- very smooth.  Their pear and stilton sandwiches are delicious, and they even have shepards pie! :)

Afterwards, you can always go accross the street to their store where you can buy tea, tea pots, and the sort.  Great place to cozy up and spend time with friends!
author: Kimberly F.

description:
I feel very girlie when I come to this place for tea. It's very charming, very feminine. Shawls are thrown over couches -or on the flowery upholstered chairs, lace dollies are scattered here and there, and you drink from delicate tea cups, and eat tiny sandwiches (with the crust taken off). I like that the furniture and even the tea wear is mismatched. Sort of what one might expect in granny's old house. 

For me, the place feels like what I imagined when I had my tea parties as a young child. Well, except for the fact that the food and tea are real and so are the people (no, Mr. Brown Bear or Mrs. Rabbit in attendance). 

But Lovejoy's  can get stuffy. The place is always packed with people. The hot pots of tea also add to the temperature a bit. Reservations are HIGHLY suggested!

Anyway, I love the fact that this quiant place will "top off" your tea pot, thus insuring a very HOT pot of tea. The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . . gosh, everything is delicious.  

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.

It's a wonderful place to get away from it all and relax.
author: Audrey S.

description:
Freaking adorable. Seriously. 

I came here with two girlfriends for some tea and catch up time. What more could you ask for from a tea house? I filled up on little tea sandwiches, crumpets, scones, etc etc etc. The Queen's tea was a good amount of food and let you sample a variety of things. mmmmmmmm :) The service was friendly, refilled our pots often and with a smile, and didn't kill me when my purse was constantly in their way (my bad :( ) A little on the pricey side, but really aren't high teas supposed to be decadent anyway?

Warning: girls, unless you want to break up with him, please don't bring your boyfriend here. Or a date, or a male for that matter that won't appreciate the cutesy girly factor. He will not enjoy it. The frills will kill him. Trust me.
author: Tara O.

description:
I often have a birthday tea here. They're good for accomadating my group though they limit it to 25 people.  Their scones are good, though they have eggs in them so I can't eat them anymore. They were good about swapping out crumpets instead. 
The tea is great. And why else would you go for afternoon tea if you don't enjoy great tea?
author: vickie j.

description:
Fantasic bonding spot for the ladies. ;)  Not that men are not invited, but they would certainly be engulfed in an aura of estrogen.  This is a popular spot for bridal showers.

The Queen Tea is the default option.  Comes with a bottomless teapot of your choice (the Imperial Tea Blend is always a good choice, and Mango is my new fave, and i normally dont' like fruity teas).   The tower of food (literally) that comes to your table will brighten up any day.  

Thought this is in the middle of the city, the place has an air of country elegance.  The staff is friendly and will always explain everything you are wondering about on their menu.

The J train stops right in front of the store, extra points!!
author: Jane N.

description: My sister, cousins, and I came here for brunch on a Sunday. Luckily, we came at opening time and were able to get a table. You definitely should make reservations because you probably have a 25% chance of getting a seated as a walk-in. I heard their reservations book out 1-2 weeka in advance. We had Queen's Tea and High Tea - it was a nice combo of sandwiches, sweets, and fruit. This is a cute place to come for girl time. I just wish the place was bigger and not as cramped.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I am obviously in the minority, but I just don't get it.  They have a huge tea selection, and the sandwiches and salad are delicious.  However, I feel like the decor is sort of shabby chic with out the chic part.  When I was there (around the holidays), it was drafty, cold and kinda tired.  I love going for tea, but I would not go out of my way to go here.  I just think there are way cuter and cozier places in the city (see my reviews of Crown and Crumpt, Dartealing and Samovar).
author: S C.

description: Excellent! Great tea selections..loose leaf served by the pot.  Had an flavorful Ceylon "endless pot" great value. Wonderful scones and Devonshire cream and fresh fruit.
author: Joseph S.

description:
LOVE this cute tea place! 
Was here to celebrate a birthday, and the staff was very accommodating. 
We made reservation a month ahead, and we were seat right away even though we arrived 15 min late. 
Ordered 'High-tea for 3', and an entree of Chicken Pasties. 
I love their salmon tea sandwiches, and also their scone with cream. 
We had 3 pots of tea for a party of 4 people, and it's more than enough. 
The mango decaf tea is my favorite, and the English Yorkshire tea is good with milk and sugar. 
The wait staff even offered to help us take a group picture. 
Overall the experience was everything we expected. 
Highly recommend this to everyone who's looking for a yummy afternoon tea place in the city.
author: Joy H.

description: I can't say enough good things about Lovejoy.  The place is adorable with couches and tables of all sizes (and floral patterns).  My girlfriends and I will gather there ever so often to pretend like we have interesting things to tell each other over a cup of tea and some finger sandwiches.  The scones with jam and clotted cream are too tasty to pass on. And so are the smoked salmon and chicken and asparagus sandwiches.  But really, we go for the ambiance and delicious mini cakes they serve at the end of the meal.  Get the italian wedding cake...it's the only reason to get married!
author: Kamael S.

description: This place is adorable, and perfect for a girls' day out. I've gone twice now, and both times got the High Tea with 3 of my friends. It doesn't look like all that much food since it's so light, but I was surprised at how full I was by the end. It's great to go with multiple friends so you can try different types of teas and sandwiches. And the scones, oh god, the scones - so so good! I would never come here too often (it's on the expensive side), but it makes a great treat.
author: Kristen B.

description:
Some friends and I went here this past weekend to celebrate Lewis Carroll's birthday.  It's a charming, whimsical place in Noe Valley.  A bit crowded - I suggest making a reservation.  Definitely not stuffy - this is not "tea at the Ritz."  No white glove service here.  What you get are mismatched china, hodgepodge seating arrangements, and assorted bric-a-brac scattered around.

The ham sandwiches were a bit heavy on the horseradish, which I didn't mind, but some might.  The shrimp, cucumber, and fig sandwiches are also good.  The homemade scones are amazing - light and buttery, melt in your mouth, smeared with clotted cream and jam.  Yum.

Nice selection of teas, and I like the different "levels" of tea you can get based on how hungry you are - if you just want a tea and scone, you can get that.  If you're a little hungrier but don't want to spoil dinner, go for the Light Tea which is a scone + 1 sandwich + fruit + shortbread.  There are larger teas as well.

Service was quick and friendly, and they refilled our tea pots with fresh hot water.

I'll definitely be going back, and taking my mother with me!
author: Asteridae A.

description:
Why as a tea, scone, and tea sandwich lover I have waited so long to visit Lovejoy's is beyond me! What a delightful, mis-matched but perfectly quaint tea room with a wonderful selection of teas (brewed to order and refreshed at no charge), scones and their best friends Devon cream and wonderful jams, as well as a delicious selection of tea sandwiches and salad that are sure to please everyone at the table.

The perfect place for Mother's Day, birthdays, Sunday afternoons, and almost any occasion!
author: Mariangela S.

description:
So cute!

I took an SF-resident English friend here once.  She was so charmed that it was one of the first places she took her mother when her mother was visiting from England.  

I guess that's slightly more quaint than Americans visiting McDonald's abroad? (ok, scratch that last comment - i just realized i stopped in to order French Fries at McDonald's in Prague a few weeks ago.  but hey, a good french fry is a good french fry - snobbery be damned!)
author: Liz O.

description:
Let's see...

cute mismatched teaware.  Check.
tasty sandwiches with crusts cut off.  Check
DOUBLE CREAM.  Check.
scrumptious pastries and scones.  Check.
fragrant, tasty, and bottomless teas.  Check.

Five checks.  Five stars.  

Oh, and make reservations.
author: Danielle Y.

description:
I came here on a Saturday afternoon with a friend.  We were promptly seated, our orders were promptly takenand our food was promptly served.  Typically, this would be GREAT!  Except that I was really hoping for a more leisurely afternoon tea.  A tray of petit fours was brought around as we were still picking at our tea tray (yummy but pricey at $2.50 a petit four!).  The tea food was fairly standard although their devonshire cream was FABULOUS.  The tables were a little close for comfort.  I felt strange trying to have a heart-to-heart pow-wow with my friend when I could clearly hear everything being said at the table next to us.

Due to the lack of space and the feeling that I was being rushed out of there despite the fact that there was no wait and the place was almost half-empty by the time we left, I'm hesitant to go back and try it again.
author: T. C.

description: The best tea service I have ever had in the states. They even make the shepherd's pie fresh daily. Love the scones.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
For your next girls date, come to this place!

This cute little restaurant is definitely one my new favorite spots. It was packed with people when we came, but the hostess went out of her way to accommodate our party of 9, which was really nice. (hint, make reservations!) The best thing to order is the high tea for two, queens tea seems a bit overpriced for the additional candies you get. The teas themselves are delicious, especially the seasonal ones. And the scones were the best I've had since actually being in England - seriously.

The funniest thing we saw while we were there was a dozen 8 year old girls having a birthday party. They were all dressed up and I swear one even had on white gloves... Okay, that was a little scary. But don't let that scare you away from trying the place. I promise, you'll love it!
author: Samantha C.

description:
Awesome - the only reason that this isn't getting 5 stars are because prices are a bit steep. ALSO, book a reservation on the weekend - you are NOT getting in if you casually show up on the weekend; from what I understand, it's pretty empty on the weekdays...

Definitely get the services listed on the left side so that you get the most variety for your money - the teas, sandwiches, scones - they are all great....

This place is like going back in time to your grandmother's cottage in England, it is totally unreal...
author: Neha A.

description:
This place is da bomb!  Great service and excellent selection of teas.  Be sure to make a reservation for the weekend or during lunch on a weekday.

Maybe the best teaspot in SF.
author: Alan T.

description:
My first ever tea party was here and I can still remember it. 

The atmosphere is quaint and homey. The place is a hodge podge of everything comfortable and warm. The tea and food is delicious and everyone gets their choice of their own tea in their own little mismatched cup. It was about $25 for a fulfilling tea. The only thing about this place that it is small, you need to reserve in advance if you are going on weekends, and that you may be seated on uneven seats (couches and chairs at different heights) which make it harder to take tea in from having to lean over as an odd angle

The hostess was extremely nice and charming and so were the petit-fours!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Who knew that a cucumber layered with cream cheese in between 2 slices of bread could be so good.  Maybe it's because the crusts are cut off and the sandwiches are cut into cute little triangles.  The salmon, cream cheese and caper sandwich is to die for.  As are the scones.  Deelish!

The tea room blend is their specialty and it's definitely a good pot of tea.  I went into tea overload and was jittery for the remainder of the day.  But the experience definitely stays with you.  I highly recommend this place for a girls' weekend.  It's a great way to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.
author: Alison N.

description:
Hooray to the English for inventing high-tea. I never had this much fun since I last served  tea to my childhood friends, Mr. Teddy Bear, Cabbage Patch Kid Nina, Barbie and her little sister Skipper.

This is THE best: baby-wedding-shower-girly birthday party-mother's day-grandmother's day- I need some girlfriend time - any thing that has to do with estrogen-I can finally wear my new BCBG wrap dress except in church TEA HOUSE! 

The sandwiches are devine, the tea selection plentiful and the ambiance oh-so-kitchy-frumpy-frilly-girly!   Looooove it!
author: Clarice V.

description:
I've never been a fan of fu-fu restaurants and dining. "Give it to me big and give it to me good" has always been my motto. So needless to say that when the gf informed me that we were joining some friends for English tea time, my first question was "Do I have to go?" I'm fairly glad that she forced me to under promises of big food after if I was still hungry.

This place does do tea right. The decorations remind me of the old lady across the street's house that smelled of dust and strong perfume. There are tables of course, but there are also couches, love seats and chairs creating an environment that is both old-fashioned and fun (there's even a replica of an red English phone booth). I didn't try them myself, but I've been told that the hats in the parlor are available to borrow for the patrons during their tea-time.

Anyways, skeptical of the entire menu, I let the gf order whatever. I added a meat pie to make myself feel like I was going to eat something substantial. We settled on a tower of assorted tea sandwiches and scones with English breakfast tea and something else.

The tea was actually quite tasty. I enjoyed it as much as anyone who doesn't really like hot beverages could.

The tea sandwiches were awesome! My particular favorites were the bay shrimp salad and the pear with Gorgonzola cheese. Also, the meat pie WAS filling, and tasted great with a heap of homemade mashed potatoes on top. Yum!

I'm glad I was pleasantly surprised by the food and tea. I probably still wouldn't go back of my own free will, but I must give credit where credit is due. If you like tea, this is the spot.

*Note: Better make reservations, because this place is packed and you'll be waiting for a while.
author: Alex H.

description:
I absolutely adore this place!!  After hearing so many good things, my mom and I decided to throw my sister a bridal tea party here last October.  From the moment we walked in, every aspect of the tea service did not disappoint.  Considering there were 13 of us, the service was prompt and definitely on point and we never had to ask for a HOT pot of tea as they were constantly topping off our pots.  What a concept!

Since that first experience, I've been here numerous times and I never get tired of it.  The mismatched furniture, dishes, tea cups and teapots... the lace and doilies... the variety of sandwiches... the salad... the coleslaw... the SCONES with double devon cream and jam... the shortbread cookies... and of course, the bottomless pots of hot tea.  Heavenly!

My favorite is the High Tea, which comes with all that I mentioned above.  I've had the Queen's Tea but frankly, I don't care for the fruit or the crumpets and if you change your mind and want a petit four, it can be added on for an additional $2.50.  I highly recommend the Vanilla Rooibos tea - my absolute favorite and I actually don't even ask for anything else anymore.  

Although it may not sound like it, you will get full off of what appears to be a petite meal.  The best part is that it's not that greasy, gross full but a satisfactory full.  You will definitely want to call in advance to make reservations.  They do have some open seating but it's first come first served and it fills up quick.  Be sure to plan to spend at least 1 1/2-2 hours - the service is not slow but you'll find yourself taking your time to savor the tea and food and enjoy the company you're with.  

Have I mentioned how much I adore this place?!
author: Raquel U.

description: Went to a friend's baby shower and this place was too adorable. The decorations made it seem like you were really having a tea party. The food was good and the teas were delicious.
author: Jenny T.

description: I've been imbibing on tea ever since I can remember. My favorites are fennel-infused and sage (not together). After leaving home and not having Mom to steep tea for me, I went through a stint of settling on tea bags. Since moving to San Francisco, I graduated to loose-leaf and tea rooms. Lovejoy's is probably my favorite tea room in the area. I've enjoyed many girls' outings here as it would be remiss to bring a guy to these establishments.
