We almost didn't a get a nice, cozy seat because we didn't have reservation, but the waitress was nice enough to work it out for us. So my recommendation is to always make reservations no matter which day you go.
author: HsuMeow L.

description: Unpretentious, comfortable, tasty, super fresh, super fast (but without hurrying YOU), just right on the nail.
author: Caroline C.

description: Just went here for the first time the other day with my girlfriend on a Sunday afternoon... I LOVED it!!  So adorable.  Everything from the dishware, decor, waitress, food, etc.  We ordered the Queen's Delight for 2 and it was delicious!  We had so much food, tea sandwiches, scones with lemon curd, jam, fruit, cookies, salad and bottomless pots of tea.  The atmosphere was cozy and pleasant.  Our waitress was amazing and we left feeling so happy :o)  I want to go there every Sunday...
author: Amanda G.

description:
My roommate from college days set up a tea with the girls here.  It was a wonderfully warm afternoon, and perfect weather for high tea.  

The food was light and delightful.  The tea was not too strong, not too weak (I had the mango black tea).  The mismatched china was super-cute.  There are a couple of benches outside for early birds (such as myself) to wait.  They were generous with the seating, and gave us quite a spacious spot in the tea room.  They didn't rush us, and we hung out for quite some time.  

The only drawback was the occasionally snooty clientele; one such lady practically knocked over one of the wait staff carrying a very large tea service, which I was annoyed to realize was headed to our table.  OK, I realize you had to go to the bathroom and all, but watch it!  That's my food!  It's not Lovejoy's fault, but such a cute place will eventually draw some less than ideal customers. 

Price was about $20/person including tip, which I think is fairly reasonable considering it includes bottomless tea.
author: Catherine Y.

description: I took my bf there once last month, we had a 2:30pm reservation. First off, don't make a reservation that late because it will totally screw up your appetite for dinner. I actually didn't eat dinner that night. LOL. We ordered the High Tea for Two with a Shepard's Pie on the side. OMG the food was to die for and soooo outrageously delicious. Loved it, my bf loved it. I would definitely recommend going there for tea time without all the fancy pancy stuff. It's super casual which made me like it all the more. Thumbs up.
author: Linda X.

description: So darling!  This place is a little slice of heaven in Noe Valley.  Just like hours spent catching up with girlfriends on comfortable couches in your Grammie's living room (O.K maybe not my grandmother's, but maybe my husband's).  I don't like sandwiches, and I'm not into tea.  But funny, I think the sandwiches and tea at Lovejoy's are delish.  Grab a bunch of friends and go.
author: Ann L.

description: I went for a bridal shower on Saturday. The service was very accommodating and friendly. Everything was excellent! I had the spearmint green tea and the amount of food they bring you is a great deal for the price. Yum...I loved the mini sandwiches and the crumpets! A perfect place to get together and gab with the girls!
author: Lisa K.

description: Cute cute cute!  It was a gorgeous day in SF and I walked into Lovejoy's in a good mood.  Eyed the couches on the side, and was so excited when my friends and I were seated there.  The name of our menu selection escapes me, but we had our choice of 2 sandwiches each (I had the smoked salmon/cream cheese and pear/stilton).  Yum.  The scones?  SUPER yum.  Over a bottomless pot of the house blend, we chit chatted and cooed at the adorable decor.  Kinda pricey when you think about what you're actually eating, but the overall experience makes up for it.  Perfect for a girly good time.  :)
author: Christine C.

description: AMAZING experience!  We had a bridal tea there and loved every minute of it!  They sat us near the window and we had plenty of space for 9 girls!  The scones are to die for and the tea selection is amazing.  The customer service was top notch and I hope to go back there on my next trip to SF!  Also, they sing "Happy Birthday" beautifully!  Such harmony!! :)
author: Theresa T.

description: I wish I had more time to come here.  I love the mismatched settings and quirkiness of the place.  Would agree with others that you should definitely make a reservation - it's quite popular.  Parking can be somewhat challenging.
author: Bridget T.

description: Baby shower? Bridal shower?  Hanging out with the girls? This is the place for you.   I usually get the high tea (ok so no Bob Marley references) which has a scone with clotted cream and jam, 2 kinds of sandwiches (from a large delectable list), slaw and salad and a shortbread biscuit.  I always leave happily stuff and my eyeballs floating from so much tea.  As fair warning, the place is woman heavy with the occassional guy visiting.  The tea, the food, the space is so condusive to hanging out , you'll hang around outside chit chatting and visiting for another hour.  Best to make reservations because there is such a demand and space is at a premium.
author: Gwyneth T.

description:
Just celebrated my birthday here. What can I say? It exceeded my expectations and I have very high expectations. Starting from the service: extremely  polite, quick, understanding, not intrusive yet pay attention to all your needs.
The food was fresh and just amazing. The atmosphere was magical.
Great choices of tea. I would reccomend this to people of every age. There were older people but also 9 year old girls celebrating another birthday party.  It's every  girlygirl's dream.  If  Jane Austen  were alive she would have given  it 4 stars. Not 5 because she would not be able to play the piano for her friends. But we are still talking about Jane Austen here.
author: Maria L.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying out Lovejoy's
I went away with feeling under whelmed.

We went on a Sunday and it very crowded and loud.  We had a reservation and were seated right away.

The waitress was friendly but seemed frazzled. There was a baby shower going on behind us...maybe it had been a long day.  After the baby shower was a bridal shower.  All the coming and going made it difficult to enjoy our tea.  Especially while being bumped into every few seconds by the various shower goers and Lovejoy staff.  

The Queens Tea was enjoyable and the waitress was quite prompt on keeping our teapots full.  The finger sandwiches were yummy.  We didn't care for the communal salad.  At first we thought it was decorations for the sandwiches.  The scones were D-lish!

I would not go out of my way to go back to Lovejoy's.  It was OK but to me not worth the drive up to San Francisco.  I would rather stay local and visit Lisa's Tea Treasures.
author: DeDe Y.

description: I've been in here now dozens of times! And now with my little one 6 months old and a 2 year old cousin visiting quite frequently I can say they are amazing about the little ones coming in for a spot of Hot Chocolate! They made my little cousin a yummy cream cheese and jelly sandwich and her own pot of hot chocolate with whipped cream! She was in heaven! The lovely bunch of ladies even gave us a roomy seat so we could spread out and take our time. These women are always so wonderful! If you've yet to go... GO! Bring the family!
author: Jessie J.

description: "Such a cute little tearoom! Love the pasties, scones and array of sandwiches...great for girly high teas...sorry guys! The Lovejoy's antique store across the street is amazing too!"
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Girls have testosterone, too. I really feel mine when I come here. But god, I love this place.
author: Allison L.

description: I felt like I was the American Girl Samantha doll in this place. Everything was surreal, from the little girls in dresses sipping tea with their mothers to the towers of warm scones, fresh fruit, and finger sandwiches. I recommend Lovejoy's to everyone for the food and atmosphere, even to the men who think they are too manly for a place like this. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because I'm not a tea connoisseur. It tasted good to me though!
author: Susan L.

description: I love this place. I love tea. My girlfriends and I usually come here at least 4 times a year to catch up since we don't see each other as often. The last time I went here, I was with my boyfriend. He loves those sausage rolls. :-)
author: Pippi L.

description:
i just love this place. i'd go a lot more often if you didn't have to think so far ahead and make reservations a week in advance. but then i'd just get fat from the clotted cream which i JUST WANT TO SPREAD ON EVERYTHING IN A VERY THICK LAYER. i bring my girlfriends, mom and sister here; my fiance would think it was too girly.

11/07 update: dropped 2 stars b/c my best friend/maid of honor was here from PA for the week of T-giving. i made reservations 2 weeks in advance, with a real person, for wednesday, after which i made appts for us to try on wedding dresses (important day, being the pt). we dragged ourselves there for 11 (bit of a late night) and they were CLOSED. i was very angry.  i left a message complaining about it and never heard back.

2/08 update: okay, okay, you guys rock. took my mom and sis from the east coast there last week and they were totally blown away. i love being able to take out-of-towners to places like this and help them fall in love with this city and understand why i moved so far away!
author: Cristabel L.

description: I went here again for the second time this past weekend for my friend's birthday.  We were a group of 5 so she made reservations, which was a good idea since it was really crowded that day.  Again, like the last time we all ordered the High Tea options, each getting to choose 2 sandwiches and a pot of our own tea.  This time I chose the salmon and cream cheese and chicken and asparagus sandwiches.  Both were pretty tasty, but the asparagus was mushy for me, but otherwise edible.  I probably wouldn't order it again though.  I did try my friend's shrimp and mayo sandwich and that was tasty also.  I chose the black currant tea since I was in a berry mood (I drink green tea religiously every other day of the week) and that was pretty tasty alone, but even better with the cream/milk and a teaspoon of sugar to satisfy my sweet tooth.  High tea is definitely more than enough for one person since you get 2 sandwiches (quartered, so you get 8 pieces each), plus salad, coleslaw, sugar biscuit and scone.  The scone was good, but don't forget to try the devonshire cream with it!  The servers were really friendly and informative anout their menu so it was all around a good experience.
author: Tess E.

description: I love the whole ritual of afternoon tea, and this place hits it just right.  This is not your Ritz Carlton tea experience - its much more laid back.  Ecclectic decor comes with a hodgepodge of tea cups and saucers.  The seating is packed in with various different couches and chairs.  You feel a little like the owners decorated froma  flea market, but that adds to the charm.  The tea is top rate and the food is what you expect.  Reservations are a must.
author: Jessy B.

description: This was a wonderful afternoon tea...the server took her time and explained everything to us...I am new to this whole tea thing.  the tea was wonderful...the food was incredible...it was very crowded for a rainy Sunday...
author: Nancy P.

description: Incredibly adorable place for a group (of women).  The service is polite and warm, and who doesnt love stacked food?  Splurge on the "Queens Tea."  Its quite a fun experience.
author: Cathleya G.

description: Good luck getting in.  This place tends to get packed early.  And if you're a gal, feel free to come wearing your "Merchant Ivory" period dress, white gloves and hat.  If you're looking for something a bit more "substantial" than finger sandwiches, try the pasties, though hopefully someone at the table gets an order of the scones w/ double Devon cream.  Devine!
author: Anonymouse C.

description: I'm always a big fan for afternoon tea. This is just a wonderful place with girlfriends, or even hubby to spend some quality time together.
author: Elisa C.

description: not only do i LOVE this quaint little tea room, but my boyfriend will make reservations for us to go without me begging :) the blood orange tea is outstanding - i could sit for hours and consume pots of this tea!
author: ashley d.

description:
This tearoom is wonderful! Reservations are a must but considering they have a cancellation wait list, this is a piece of cake! Despite the message machine saying they were fully booked for the weekend, I left a message including dates and times - requesting placement on the wait list - and my call was returned within hours! I immediately had a reservation and when another engagement popped up, rescheduling was super easy! Actually, I had to reschedule twice...but the woman returning my calls never expressed frustration at all!

So our tea date arrived and my mother and I happened to show up 10 minutes before our reservation. We found a parking spot immediately (perhaps it being 4PM helped) and were seated at once. A minute later, another woman asked us if we were ready to order. Of course we weren't because we were so busy taking pictures of the cute sign on our table that said Reserved for Royalty and were also settling into our lovely seats by the window! The room was packed with mismatched couches, chairs, tables, teacups, teapots and decor but this made it so much more comfortable. I felt I could talk as loud as I wanted, spill tea, whatever, and no one would notice. We finally decided on Queen's Tea (for two) and from the lengthy sandwich list, chose the chicken apple walnut, cucumber and cream cheese, pear and stilton cheese, and bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwiches. They were all deliciously different in their own ways, however, my favorite was the bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwich. With the help of our patient server, we picked Taylor's Tea Room Blend and Yorkshire Gold and both were perfectly flavorful. We shared both teas and ironically ended up preferring the one the other picked. To every cup we added cream and sugar and seriously, I couldn't stop drinking. It didn't help that our tea pots were refilled every 10 minutes! Our sandwiches came on a bed of "spring greens" which had dressing on the side, and Queen's Tea also came with coleslaw (my mother said it was quite good), scones that had raisins, double devon cream, lemon curd and preserves, fresh fruit, crumpets, shortbread cookies and a petit four for each of us. The fruit wasn't too ripe, but that wasn't a big deal anyway, and we were full by the time the crumpets had arrived (fresh out of the oven by the way). 

Because I had so much tea, I had to use the restroom 4 times in an hour! After my mother and I left the tea room to check out their antique store, the Attic, I had to use the restroom again! Since Lovejoy's was closed, I didn't want to try using their restroom and I would've gone to a gas station but my mom was driving and refused to make another stop. So I went back to the tea room and surprisingly, the staff was so nice and didn't mind at all! Not even hints of irritation!

Definitely going back soon!!!
author: Aisha W.

description: Planned my best friend's birthday party at Lovejoy's for 6 of us, and ended up having 7 - they accommodated us with no problem.  The decor was cute, quaint and perfect for a ladies tea party.  It sort of reminded me of Alice in Wonderland with its mismatched cups and whimsical style.  Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.  All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.  Warm, delicious scones and flavorful little tea sandwiches were the highlights, and they had plenty of different sandwiches (and teas) to choose from.  The service was good, and we all had a great time.  I would absolutely go back to Lovejoy's again for tea!  Oh, and the price was very reasonable.
author: Tera M.

description:
Lovejyoy's Tea Room has been a perennial favorite for over 10 years.  It's very popular for holidays so make sure to book way in advance.  The large farmhouse style space is eclectically furnished with mismatched couches and tables covered in lace frills to create a comfy Regency sitting room feeling.  It's generally popular with the girls for baby/bridal showers, and the gay guys wandered down from the Castro, sometimes there's an occasional token guy thrown into the mix.  The pots of tea are on endless refill, so make sure to order decaffeinated if you go in the afternoon or you'll be up into the wee hours of the morning (as evidenced by the time stamp on this review...).  The mini crust-less sandwiches are cut into the cutest triangles and arranged perfectly onto the tiered stands, interspersed with salady bits and coleslaw sprinkled with caraway seeds.  Everyone gets a delicate sugar cookie and a large moistly crumbed scone which one covers with lashings of clotted cream and strawberry jam.  

After your 2 hour slot has expired, the staff will very politely and tactfully move you out of the space.  You will spend another hour standing outside their door chatting and laughing, periodically dashing back in to use the facilities due to the endless tea.
author: SatisFahYing A.

description: Embrace your inner eccentric (read crazy) old cat lady and come have some tea and finger sandwiches. The service is great, and the place is always full of baby showers and the accompanying "oohs" and "aahs" at yet another One-zee (sp?), and I love the fact that none of the china or flatware matches. It gives teatime the wink and smile it needs. Be sure to make reservations on the weekend, as Lovejoy's is a popular spot with the ladies (take note guys!)
author: Madhavi K.

description: My sister had her baby shower here.  It was a little pricey, but worth the experience.  There's a variety of sandwich's and teas to pick from.  You can't really go wrong.  Don't come looking to eat to be full.  It's more of chatting over tea and snacks kind of an experience.
author: Joanne H.

description: This is the best place, ever!! My niece told me about it a few years ago, and my husband and I fell in love with it. We both agree that, even though we've had good experiences at tea houses even in London, this is by far the best food, tea and service for the money. Love it, love it, love it!! Besides, the owners are absolutely another joy and so is their staff. We now realize that we have to make reservations because the place is always packed!!
author: Rocio V.

description: Very sweet place - totally female energy. Lots of frilly tablecloths, fab mismatched teacups and the best bottomless pots of tea and petit fours (I recommend orange or plum). Best place to reaffirm your sisterhood or find comfort after a tough week.
author: Julie B.

description: I LOVE this place.  Relaxing, fun, great service and food.  A special place to meet.
author: Susan A.

description: I just love this place.  They have a great assortment of teas, along with yummy sides dishes.
author: Juanita P.

description: This place is seriously awesome, and seriously delicious.  The hodge podge assortment of silverware and dishes, good tea, and scrumptious sandwiches make this place well worth the visit.  Be sure to bring a camera, because the food they bring out will certainly be picture worthy.  This is walkable from BART, so you have no excuse not to stop by if you live in the Bay Area.
author: Evan K.

description: Comfortable and cosy little English tea house. Quaint place with lots of cute trinkets and bric-a-brac. The tiny sandwiches and scones were delicious however, the sausage rolls were mediocre. My mum would love this place....great for high tea. Definitely secure reservations on weekends. They were full two Saturdays in a row when I called during the week.
author: Yan M.

description: This is a great, cozy little place. The decor was eclectic and cute-I really liked the mismatched teacups and saucers. Seemed very authentic-in fact, there was an middle-aged english woman sitting next to us who seemed quite pleased with everything. Especially with the cross-stitch of teapots hanging on the wall that she was convinced she had made back in the day! We ordered the "Queen's Tea"-the most deluxe one. It was fun to try it all, but if I went back, I would order the tea with just the sandwiches and the scones. The warm scones with devon cream and strawberry jam were delicous! I also liked the mocha petit four. Very much a ladies' place.
author: Linnea M.

description: I crave the sandwiches sometimes, and the teas are really good. It's close enough to what I'm used to in England, but I don't go as often because it is still pricey. The atmosphere can deter some men. My male friend got tricked into coming and was totally uncomfortable when we stepped in, but once he got some food and tea, he was totally enjoying the experience.
author: S. P.

description: Love it!  The service was good, the food was great (real devon cream and lemon curd--delicious!)  Yes, it's a little pricey, but it's average priced for other tea rooms I've been to, and much better!  They serve my favorite vanilla rooibos (sp?) tea, which is a plus.  Oh, and they make an awesome shepherd's pie!!  As others have said, you should definitely have a reservation.
author: Kristie S.

description: Yummy, yummy, yummy, yummy food! And so adorable! This is the perfect place to come with girlfriends to eat up and get lots of sustenance before hiking over a few blocks to 24th street for some serious shopping. I would also highly recommend this place for bridal showers or any kind of shower as it's just perfect. They're really accommodating, they were willing to change adjust one of their sandwiches for me as I don't like raw onions and they're very solicitous constantly checking to make sure you're ok. The food is really good and I like how they give you fresh fruit. I got the Queen's Tea which was a little too much food for me, I think the High Tea would be plenty. I can't wait to go back!
author: Cathy T.

description: I brought my mom here when she came to visit. We loved it - delicious little sandwiches my favorite was the fig and olive (still dreaming about the sweet salty goodness). Actually  everything that I had there was tasty and perfectly executed. Even their fruit was perfectly ripe. The service was friendly. The only thing that kind of annoyed me about the place was all the little knick-knacky things that were EVERYWHERE! I know that that makes it more grandma's living room - but it stresses me out - not that it is going to stop me from going there again. We should have tea time all the time! yay!
author: Rhiana M.

description: I love to put on my hat and gloves and best dress to go here. It's a great place to catch up with a friend over a lovely cup of tea. It's tiny and busy so it's best to plan ahead rather than dropping in. The scones and sandwiches are so yummy. You can't help but feel dainty and ladylike when you're dining here.
author: Audrey Jean T.

description: I was hesitant in writing this review because I don't want it to become any more difficult to get a reservation on the weekend, but I also would be very upset to see them go out of business, ever. So do come here! It is truly a magical experience. The owner, methinks, is so very kind and makes you feel as though you are the only group of people in the world that she wishes to speak with. Their Jade Tiger, and Tea Room Blend are heavenly! I do adore this place!
author: Lindsey H.

description:
02.06.11 - high tea with one other, for my bday. ordered the queen's tea

1 star for the choices tea (tried the passion fruit, it was great!)
1 star for the scones! yummy!
1 star for the great service (never had to ask for a refill of the tea pot)
1 star for the amount of food you get, make sure you go hungry
1 star for the take your time eating, enjoying your tea and company because they do not rush you out- so make sure you make reservations.
author: Jay R.

description: I love this place! It's really cute (sorta gives you the impression of your grandmother's house with all the flower print), parking is not really an issue, and they have a rather large variety of teas to choose from. The only reason why I didn't give this place a higher rating is because the food is not amazing. The scones are great, especially if you eat them with the cream provided, but the tea sandwiches are nothing special (think generic white bread). The place is also pretty small and if you come here at a prime hour (like sat afternoon), expect to wait. Reservations are accepted so I recommend that. I would recommend this place mostly for the experience.
author: Barbara O.

description: This place was great. The staff is friendly, fun, and attentive. I enjoyed trying all the teas and finger sandwiches. We went with a pretty large group so I got to try many different tea varietals and foods. The atmosphere is exactly what I hoped for and is inviting and visually fun to look at.
author: Josh B.

description: Wonderful cup of tea. made for an enjoyable afternoon with a fancy tea room, playing dress up and downing those warm cups of caffeineted taylor's tea room blend. what a mouthful. the eclectic assortment of various tea services and mismatching teapots made for a well-loved, worn in feel. the scones were heavenly, soft and delicious. like little warm biscuits and definitely not the abhorred rock like ones. however baked goods that are really good, usually tend to involve a lot of butter. anyway, the cream and strawberry preserves combined with the scone and fruit was to die for. but then again, the warm tea, and warm scone made me really happy since it was freezing outside. some things just taste better in vivid contrast.
author: Faye P.

description: My sisters in law rave about this place. I have yet to go, but they purchased me the cutest apron and delicious tea from this place...so I know the experience will top it all!
author: jenn w.

description: I really like this place - It's cozy, things don't match which gives it a fun, quirky personality. One critique: NO PARKING!
author: Alice C.

description: What's a better way to escape adulthood than getting a bunch of girlfriends together and have an old-fashioned tea party? I really like Lovejoy's because it feels like you're walking into your kooky grandma's attic. It's super girly (there's lace everywhere, I mean, it IS tea time) and the tea sets are adorable - plus it's quite endearing how everything is mismatched. You have proper tea, scones and finger sandwiches but it's not stuffy and noone drinks with their pinkies high in the air.  It's a very cozy tea room and the staff is very helpful when helping you decide what tea to order. It's not any more expensive than other tea rooms that I've been to. Just make sure you make a reservation because Lovejoy's gets booked out pretty far in advance.
author: Queenie C.

description: This is the BEST place for high tea in SF. I've been to other tea rooms, but Lovejoy's always comes out on top. It could be because the service is on point. Reservations are recommended. Sometimes when you call, you'll get an answering machine. The greeting will tell you if there are any upcoming dates that are fully booked, which is helpful. If you leave a message, your call is returned promptly. Its very girly inside, but its all part of the high tea experience. The menu has good variety, but their high tea for two is my favorite when visiting Lovejoy's with my sis. They have a great tea sandwich selection, and the bread is super soft. The salad is fresh and the scones come out warm! Then they give you petit fours to end the meal. Try this place and you'll never want to try another tearoom in the city.
author: Joyce G.

description: Perfect afternoon tea. Way more food than it looks like on the menu for the price, excellent service, great atmosphere.
author: Rachel B.

description: Great place to go to catch up with a girlfriend - quaint atmosphere, light lunch, and excellent tea.
author: Gina C.

description: Absolutely love this place!  Truly an unforgettable experience.  I dont understand why a couple of reviewers called this place pretentious and overpriced.  You go to this place for tea service, light snacks, and most importantly enoying the ambiance.  If you're looking to get the biggest bang out of ur buck, stay home and drink Lipton.
author: Lauren S.

description: Entering Lovejoy's Team Room is like returning to your grandma's parlor. The decor is dainty, charming, and welcoming - all without being over the top. This is a perfect place for a bridal shower, baby shower, or girls' day out. Reservations are strongly recommended. The selection includes delicious tea sandwiches, delectable scones, and a wide variety of tea (herbal, black, and beyond). I strongly recommend that if you like tea, high tea finger foods, or girlie restaurants - this place is for you! Reservations fill up long in advance around the time of holidays, especially Mother's Day. I cannot say enough good things about this place. It is a place that makes memories.
author: Evin B.

description: Super duper cute tea room. I live super close and made it for the first time today! It's the perfect tea room - mismatched china, doilies on tables and the ever helpful waitstaff always ready to refresh your bottomless pot of tea. We managed to snag a table for two right away after seeing the enormous wait at Chloe's. This is a great place for girls to catch up over perfect crustless tea sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and delicious strawberry preserves. I like that they add salad and coleslaw --- yay for some veggies! We also tried the sausage rolls, they are tasty, as well. Go here for some good convo steaming pots of delicious tea. There's just something about having a cup of tea out of a porcelain teacup and the process of daintily  using a tea strainer, pouring cream and spooning sugar with a tiny spoon. Yay!
author: Jennifer C.

description: It was kinda fun to come here as the atmosphere was different and cool, but the food was blah and it felt rushed.  I can understand that the place closes at a certain time, but they took away our half full tea cup as soon as we paid the bill.
author: Denise L.

description: This is the tea experience. I have been doing teas and tea rooms since I was young and this is far the most memorable. Went there during the holidays with friends and really enjoyed it. Sandwiches are outstanding with lots of choices even for us vegetarians. Fruit, salad and quiches are very fresh. Scones are heavenly right out of the oven, crumpets a delight and service incredible. Teas are lovely and a good variety. Dessert was perfect. I wish I could eat there once a month. A great value for the money. I would reccomend reservations even though they save some small tables for walk ins.
author: Sherene K.

description: Lovejoy's is absolutely wonderful!  The atmosphere is very welcoming and people from all walks of life dine there.  The staff is very pleasant and are helpful.  The food is OUTSTANDING!!  I am extremely picky, and a lot of the times I eat somewhere something is wrong with my order or not up to my standards, Lovejoy's blew me away I had NO complaints about the food at all.  My girl and I got the tea for two and it was more than enough food, she even had to take her yummy scone to go.  I got the ham w? mango chutney and chicken, apple, walnut sandwiches, and my girl had the shrimp and the roast beef and horseradish sandwiches, they were all delicious  To top of the visit there was the cutest elderly English woman having tea, her presence made the visit have a more authentic feel it was awesome. I will be driving to San Francisco at least once a moth to have tea at Lovejoy's. The one and only complaint I have is that due to the door being open there were a couple of big fly's inside.  Lucky the fly's did not bother me when our tea was served, and eventually the door was closed.   Thank You Lovejoy's for the amazing experience and see ya soon! 5 stars all the way!!
author: Libby Lu D.

description: One of my most favorite spots in town. A great place to go with a group of girls or your best friend, daughter, or niece...but not your boyfriend or husband. This girlie tea house is as authentic as they get outside of London. Try the Queen's tea...and you'll enjoy a little taste of everything. The scones with lemon curd, fresh cream, and homemade preserves are my favorite menu item...but the tiny sandwiches, quiche, fresh fruits and sweet treats are lovely, too. The atmosphere is the best--antique furniture, beautiful old china (every teapot, cup, and saucer is different), and lovely sunlight streaming through the windows makes this perch unforgettable. The red vanilla tea is as good as it gets...buy some across the street at Lovejoys attic and take a bit of the tea room home! You need a reservation!
author: Catherine P.

description: Great Price for Afternoon Tea. Nice Decor. Great Biscuit. However all flatwares are unmatched. Make sure you have reserved table before going.
author: cynthia l.

description: We had a perfectly cute little baby shower at Lovejoy's, combining the atmosphere of kitsch and the decaf necessity of tea.  I left there exclaiming in my (very bad) british accent about out marvelous time...just lovely!
author: Kim N.

description: Eeek, so much fun at this place!  every time i've gone, i've had nothing but a great experience, friendly staff and great ambience.  it's fancy but not too stuffy or snotty.  great place to have brunch with your girlfriends or take a date.  yay for high tea!
author: Janet K.

description: I went on a Sunday afternoon, there were a lot of women in this joint, not many dudes (see other reviews for the types of events folks come here for). Demographics aside, there are some great teas available, if you're a tea nut or British you'll be happy. I had sausage rolls which were good (not amazing but good) and really really good scones with clotted cream and jam, no they were really good. I'd definitely go back for seconds.
author: Nathaniel R.

description: Just finished enjoying a lovely bachelorette tea in honor of one of my dearest friends at Lovejoys.  7 of us lovely ladies gathered on sweet couches covered in doilies and other hand knit items and dined on the best tea sandwiches, 5 different types of tea and had the best service.  We ate and lounged and dined and chatted for over two hours!  It was a delight as usual and I will continue going back!  I'd been two times before, one time to have a pre-surgery meal (we were stuffed!) where my husband joined us (he's probably one of the biggest guys guys ever and enjoyed it) and another time in full hats, gloves and 'dressed for tea' regalia with my mother and aunts.  Reservations are a must.
author: Crystal K.

description: We ordered their sandwiches, scones, and crumpets for our high tea party in the office and I have to say their food is delicious. This was my very first high tea party and it was complete with strawberry preserves and double devon cream. Highly recommend them for your tea party because they have all tiers you can rent and most importantly they deliver.
author: Jelly F.

description: A couple of my friends and I had our annual Christmas lunch here, for the first time and it was such a wonderful experience (for the little girls at heart).  We had to do a prix fix menu, which was fine because the variety of food and tea that came out was divine.  We had a great time and a lot of conversation was about the food (in a good way).  Looking around at the other tables, it was so nice to see all the happy faces.  Our waitress was great and very informative, since we've never been there before and had little experience with crumpets. =)
author: Rei and Rick ..

description:
I went to my first Lovejoy's experience today with a couple of my friends and my friend's bf. Waiting outside till it open for afternoon tea, I can see the cutsey decor and all the mis-matched  Kate Spade tea dishes. The tearoom is very quaint, small and cozy...thought it was spatially larger from the looks on their website, but I was wrong. My friend opted to order us non-experienced tea partiers  2 High Tea for Two. We ordered the Cucumber & Cheese ; Smoke Salmon & Creme Cheese (very tasty); Creme Cheese & Mando Orange ; Bay shrimp & mayo ; Smoked Turkey & Dijon..can't remember the rest. 
The first 3 sandwiches was really tasty and filling. The Bay shrimp & mayo and the smoked Turkey dijon are another story. Yes they are filling, but the shrimp in the Bay Shrimp tasted very watery and wasn't wiped down enough. As for the Smoked Turkey & Dijon, the dijon used was very spicy...has a lot of horseraddish, to the point where I almost choked and had to take it outta my mouth. So if u likey the spicy, then you can choose the dijon & turkey sandwich.
The scones however...we're warm and fluffy on the inside and the mullberry jam that matched with it was perfect with the raisnyness of the scones!! I could eat those every morning (ok maybe not to the point I get sick of it.)LOL.
Each of us had our own pot of tea. My friends got the English Breakfast Tea, Earl Grey tea, Mango flav Black Tea and I got the Passion fruit flav Black Tea. I didn't try the others, but the Passion Fruit tea was ok. Couldn't really taste much of the Passion Fruit flavor as I'm used to in Japanese tea.
The High Tea also had cookies, which my friends say were good, but I couldn't eat anymore after stuffing  myself w/ my diuretic tea and sandwiches.
Cost wasn't as bad, like $64 something, we split the bill so it didn't really hurt us as much.
All in all my Lovejoy's tea experience was ok. I couldn't really give it a high enough score yet...I need to go to other tea places to compare it to this.
author: Trish G.

description: I've been wanting to check out Lovejoy's for awhile now and finally had the chance a few weeks ago.  So I wore some pearls, put on some white gloves and went to high tea with my friend.  And it did not disappoint.  We both got the Queen's Tea and it was A LOT of food!  We sat there for over two hours, sipping on bottomless pots of tea and  indulged on sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets, and scones with jam and clotted cream (what I live for!).  The tearoom is very, very cute and quaint and it's a great atmosphere for a lovely get together with your girlfriends.
author: Helen T.

description:
I went to Lovejoy's for the first time with a close friend on Saturday morning. We were greeted warmly by the waitress and seated promptly as we had reservations at 11am (which is when they open). The decor is adorable and the atmosphere is cozy, clean, and friendly. 

We ordered the High Tea for Two which came with tea biscuits, scones, tea sandwiches, and two kinds of bottomless tea. We chose a hot tea and an iced tea, and a variety of tea sandwiches such as salmon and cream cheese, chicken and asparagus, egg and onion, etc. It was way too much food for the two of us, but everything was delectable. We ordered a side of crumpets with lemon curd - I had never had crumpets before but it complimented the hot tea so well. The scones came with devon cream and jam...YUMMY!

The waitress saw my camera on the table and graciously asked us if we would like our picture taken. We were attended to very often as different waitresses came by to make sure that our teas were filled to the brim and the food was to our liking. 

I am definitely coming back here.. I think it would be a great place to take a girl friend out for her birthday!
author: D L.

description: Came here for my bridal shower. After getting pampered for mani/ pedi n salon treatment, we were looking for a day feeling like royalty and love's joy definitely completed the day. We Enjoyed every minute of it. First thing to do: make reservation!Service was really great. We went with the Queen's tea and left pretty full from mini sandwiches, tasty scones, and delicious tea.  After delivering the tea, our server came back to check and make sure the tea was ready. I accidentally dropped all the loose tea leaves to the pot and our server brought a new one, without being asked. Very happy with that. At the end they offer pieces of dessert. They're so cute we couldnt resist, too bad the taste didn't live up to the look. The whole experience was great, will definitely come back.
author: Mona K.

description: Warm, comfortable space with yummy tea & snacks.  Great for the holidays or a special occasion!
author: Jessica R.

description: Whenever I'm in the mood for a traditional English treat, I come here.  The decor is very characteristic, country, floral and English.  I love the English afternoon tea sandwiches, scones and their special scone spread/butter are all very tasty.
author: Gina W.

description: This is the perfect place to get together with the girls.  I recommend getting the queen's tea.  Food is always delicious and the atmosphere is unbeatable.
author: Jaclyn M.

description: This is a great place to have a baby shower or bridal shower. The tea sandwiches and tea cookies are good. I was craving coffee but really enjoyed sitting and chatting and having tea. The mixed matched china gives it a relaxed flea market sort of feel.
author: marissa n.

description: Lovejoy's is such a treat, and I'm so glad it exists -- if only they were open seven days a week and/or were open later! I've been coming here for years, and am a big fan of their high tea -- the bay shrimp and egg and onion sandwiches are my favorites, and the scones are heaven. Be sure to get the Tea Room Blend.
author: Sharman G.

description: iF YOU WANT THE ULTIMATE GIRLIE INDULGENCE...THIS IS IT!!! My BFF Caroline invited me to a private tea party for two for my birthday yesterday. We had "High Tea For 2". We chose to drink the Rose Petal tea. Along with tea we got an array of finger sandwhiches (salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, turkey & dijon, and chicken & asparagus). The best part of our meal were the traditional english scones....the best scone i have ever eaten in life no lie, like a mix between a bisquit and a scone. Then we ordered crumpets & lemon curd and sausage puffs a la carte. The sandwhiches were accompanied with a green salad and cole slaw. For dessert we each had a shortbread cookie and a petit lil cake that we inhaled in 2 bites. The service and experience was phenomenal. I adored every second of it. Go there with plenty of time to enjoy and relax. It took us 2 hours for our experience and we loved it. The tea pot was kept warm and full at all times. Great service as well.
author: Yolanda O.

description: Fun place to go for high tea. The detail of the scones and pastries was a bit lacking, not too fancy. More of a lady like lunch. BUT don't get me wrong the tea selections are great and just going with friends is so much fun you will get swept away! Lovely, just not fantastic!
author: julie q.

description: This place is so cute.  The vintage girly tea house things decorate the room, and the waitresses all wear vintage aprons.  Their fresh baked scones and mini sandwiches are unreal!  This is my favorite place to get tea in the area, and they have a shop across the street that sells more vintagey tea things.  Most of the time I think it's just women in the place, but guys don't be intimidated by the general frilliness.  No one should have to miss Devonshire cream on a fresh scone with strawberry jam.  It's so tasty it hurts.
author: Erinn B.

description: Took my husband here this past weekend.  He went to the UK in the fall and has been mad about tea since.  This was the first experience for both of us so I'm trying to be reserved about my rating.  We picked High Tea for two.  We picked their blend and their strongest.   Their blend was described as smooth but ended up very strong.  The strongest ended up smooth????   The scones -- yummy.  I hate dried scones -- aka Starbucks.  The sandwiches were good, nothing to write home about.  We did try the pear & stilton cheese.  That was new and if you like blue cheese, this is something to try.  It was a great experience but I'll come back and edit this review when I've had a few more teas...
author: Chris I.

description: Such a darling place.  I've enjoyed 1:1 tea with friends, as well as hosted a bridal shower at Lovejoy's.  May be a bit too girly for some, but it's such a charming place, you can't help but get into the Lovejoy spirit and extend your little pinky.  Reservations are a must!
author: Boomer Fwang ..

description: I LOVE TEA!!!! I've been planning to visit this place for years now, so you can imagine the hype that had built up in my head prior to finally making my way there to enjoy the fancy goodness. It did not disappoint! Ambiance was fabulous...crocheted doilies abound, beautiful china, comfy seats of different varieties. We had the High Tea for Two, an excellent choice. You get to pick two types of tiny sandwiches for each of you and then finish it off with a delicious scone with jam and devon cream. Each person receives their own tea pot so you can share and try different varieties...if you are so inclined. All in all a fabulous experience,  I will definitely be back. The thing I like most about it is that it wasn't super stuffy and snobbish as some tea joints can be. You can be completely casual or you can come dressed to the nines with your hat and white gloves. Either way, everyone there seems to really be enjoying themselves and good vibes abound. I want Tea EVERYDAY!!!
author: Jnzl D.

description: Unlike the many faux tearooms in SF, Lovejoys understands that exceptionally fresh, loose leaf tea brewed in piping hot water (refreshed often) is the heart and soul of any tearoom. Add to that  a hearty helping of delicate, fresh and delicious tea sandwiches, buttery currant scones served with huge dollops of real Devonshire cream, hot, buttery, holey crumpets and the room goes a little fuzzy as you slip into warm bliss. The friendly, attentive staff (decked out in vintage aprons) and the mismatched china make it all the more fun. In your tea-induced coma, don't miss all the great, fun and funky gift shop across the street: Lovejoy's attic. Unlike the "Secret Garden" tea room--you will find NO FAIRIES or TIARAs here. Beehouse teapots, vintage aprons, a few (genuine) old lady tea hats and lots of tea (fresh looseleaf) and tea accoutrement -- including very hip Japanese Beehouse teapots.
author: M W.

description:
cute cute cute!
things i loved about this place:
 the decor
food - good quality fruits,  yummy hummus artichoke crustless sandwiches!
oh, you must must get the lemon curd! it's delish!!!
will come back again.
author: Mayson J.

description:
Once a month, my cousins and I get together for HIGH TEA  @ Lovejoy's Tea Room. It's intimate and a great location to wind down and be surrounded by great company. From time to time, we are  also surrounded by people hosting a bridal shower or celebrating some sort of special moment.

Their menu is amazing and is loaded with all the sandwiches you can possibly come up with and the list of tea selections cover everything from fruity tea to green tea to black tea....basically options are everywhere. In regards to pricing, I personally think it a lot cheaper then having HIGH TEA @ Neiman Marcus or @ The Westin St. Francis .

FYI: The only down side is PARKING. We all know parking in S.F can be a challenge and it may be the case when it comes to Lovejoy's.
author: Ted. G L.

description: Cute and very girly!  Loved the passionfruit and mango black teas.  And the scones are to die for.  Can't wait to return.
author: Big e.

description: This place was a great find.  My friend and I were just looking for a decent lunch spot, and this was so much more!  High Tea for Two was delicious and more food than we could finish, and the tea was  as good as any you'd get in the UK.  Highly recommended.
author: Lori D.

description: I can't say enough good things about this unique restaurant. It's the best place in the Bay Area to have tea; sandwiches are excellent, ploughman's lunch wonderful, scones and Devonshire cream to die for. Ambience is wonderful -- classy, idiosyncratic, clever, relaxing. The only negative is that it's fairly pricey. Makes a nice special-occasion treat.
author: Thomas R.

description: A cup of tea in the afternoon is so civilized. Really enjoyed the cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches, the scones are also very good. Suggest reservations--it can get pretty full. Nothing better on a foggy day.
author: kelly f.

description:
Very quaint place! I haven't had afternoon tea for years and this place definitely brought back memories. The mismatched china and furniture was a bit strange at first but I got used to the unique feel within minutes. The environment was relaxed and not stuffy at all.

The tea is pretty good. China Rose Petal was the best out of the four options we tried (mango, berry, green tea). The food is allright- not spectacular, but the service was good. Our server was friendly, had a sense of humor, and was very enthusiastic about taking pictures for us. 

I think the only downsides would be the single bathroom and the fact that it gets quite busy on weekends so call early for reservations.

Overall, loved it and would definitely come back.
author: chrissie s.

description:
My friends and I go to Lovejoy's every chance we get and I can not say enough about how FABULOUS Lovejoy's actually is.  It's starts the moment you walk in the door.  You are virtually stepping into the most  inviting, cozy, eclectic, and oh so vintage English style parlor and are greeted almost instantaneously by the warmest and most genuine smiles you will ever see.  It's like going to grandma's house for  a family reunion.  It is filled with happy people laughing and chatting, kids playing dress up and smell of delicious food wafting through the air.   For anyone who is feeling home sick I suggest going to Lovejoy's, I guarantee the feelings will disappear by the time you leave.  

There is an amazing selection of  wonderfully tasty food, tea and sweets.  The tea sandwiches are by far the best I have had...EVER! The scones which are my favorite thing on the plate, so warm, flaky and so delicious, I am sure heaven will serve these. The tea is outstanding.  After you have finished with your meal they bring around a wonderful selection of petite fores and truffles for you to choose from if you wish.  Seeing the platter of treats and the wonderfully glowing face of the server gives me such mixed emotions.  I am excited about diving into sweets being offered and sad because I know at this point I am almost finished with my tea and will have to be leaving soon.  

Lovejoy's is an amazing way to spend the afternoon alone, with that special someone or with a group to celebrate a special event.  It doesn't matter what the reason is just GO TO LOVEJOY'S once and you will return again and again.
author: M. Allan P.

description:
My friends and family frequent this place as a tradition.

I'm always pleased with the gracious service, and always feel like I'm visiting family---the functional version ;)

Outstanding selection of tastey tummy fillers, and decent selection of tea.  My only "con" with this place is that it's hard to get in since it's so popular, so call in advance for reservations!
author: Julie B.

description: This place is just beautiful...the scones and fig tempanad sandwich is just delightful.  Everyone makes you feel right at home and fulfilled.  Ever need just to catch up with a friend, sit for a while drink eat and enjoy, this is the place to be.
author: Edessa C.

description: Sitting amidst the miss-matching tea sets and doilies, you'll feel like you're in the living room of the English Nanna you never had.  And this Nanna is intent on stuffing you silly with cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches and delightful petit fours.  Thankfully, they have some healthier options like organic spring greens and hummus, but that is the extent to which they depart from the typically 'deep in Devonshire' English menu.  I wish they'd infuse it with a little more 'New British cuisine,' like having more wholemeal bread (or 'brown bread' as our they call it on the other side of the pond).  Still, this is the place to go for your clotted cream, scones, lemon curd, and little sandwiches.  This is ideal for girlish and lady-like get-togethers and they handle groups exceptionally well.  No matter how busy they are, the waitresses don't seem to mind capturing your picture-perfect tea party on your camera when asked.  They even take the extra step of shooting extra pics and positioning the 'reserved for royalty' sign in the photo frame.  Delightfully kitschy and one of those instances in which it's more 'British' than what you typically get in Britain.
author: Juno P.

description: My preggie friend swears by it so how can you not indulge her.  She's pregnant. Anyway, I felt the $40 tab for 2 High teas was a little much. It's cute, try it once. However their menu is one of the less expensive ones out there for  tea rooms.
author: Eesayah O.

description: As rabid an Anglophile as I am, I detest tea . . . the beverage (although iced will do), not the lovely little afternoon break that's de rigueur in England, even to this day. In London, the best are offered on Oxford Street in Selfridge's - a grande dame of a department store overshadowed only by Harrod's - and Fortnum and Mason in Piccadilly. Here in the heart of Noe Valley we have this cozy  tearoom with its Laura Ashley-inspired decor providing a replica good enough to pass muster. Scones with strawberry jam and clotted cream (Devonshire's gift to mankind), toasted crumpets, and tiny cucumber, pear and stilton cheese, or smoked salmon sandwiches minus the crust evoke memories of every high tea I've ever enjoyed. The assorted place settings, mismatched furniture, and preponderance of doilies are eerily reminiscent of my friend Gerald's flat in St. John's Wood, and the waitresses look like extras in a classic film from Shepperton Studios. Pricey, but a lot less expensive than a ticket on British Airways. The general consensus among reviewers is that this is a place for the ladies who lunch. The way I see it, what better place for a group of guys from the Castro than a place that specializes in a Queen's Tea?
author: Gourmet G.

description:
I went to Lovejoy's for the first time after reading the rave reviews here on Yelp. I usually go to Tranquitea in Pacifica and have experienced a NZ teatime. My thoughts:

Pros:
-TEA SANDWICHES & SCONES. Lovejoy's has an excellent assortment of tea sandwiches. You get to choose from 16 delectable little sandwiches, of which I enjoyed the Chicken-Apple-Walnut and the Chicken & Asparagus. High Tea for Two is an awesome deal.

Cons:
-LACK OF GENUINE CUSTOMER SERVICE. My mom went in to get a table while I found parking. Even though they had four women working, I wasn't greeted at the door and we were only asked how our meal was right at the beginning (when we barely took bites of our food). They topped of my tea without asking if I wanted it topped off (my idea of being wasteful). When the woman served us Petits Fours at the end of our meal, she picked the dessert up w/ the tongs and put it on my dirty lunch plate. Oh, and the Petits Fours were warm.
-PASTRIES. I've had meatpies overseas, and I really did not enjoy the meatpie here. I ordered the Curried Chicken, and it was definitely too spicy to be enjoying with tea. The pastry shell was not flaky and was quite soggy. It reminded me of one of those microwave pastry deals, but worse.
-AMBIENCE. The set-up was very cute; however, it did need some tidying up. Our tablecloth was stained with food and the place seemed like it needed some dusting. The area that had tea cups, teas, and collectibles for sale was a bit disorganized. This area drastically needed some cleaning up. Although some might appreciated the mismatched tea sets, I did not.

Although Lovejoy's has a nice assortment of teas, it wasn't anything that you wouldn't find at any other tea room.

Overall, Lovejoy's was not the pleasant little tea room that I envisioned it to be. I didn't feel like I was truly having High Tea and felt more like I was eating in a San Francisco diner.

DON'T BOTHER GOING HERE.

My recommendation: Tranquilitea in Pacifica. Parking is easy and I guarantee you'll have a heavenly High Tea experience :)
author: Carrie A.

description: Good atmosphere, settings, decorations, and services.  It is a really nice place to eat in, but the food is just so-so and not much varieties.
author: elise c.

description: Okay all my fellow Anne Shirley fans, throw on the country apron, your best Anthropologie outfit and prepare yourself for a memorable afternoon at Green Gables.  Cherry cordial isn't served here, nor is there a likelihood you'll meet your Gilbert (but it's perfect for those drawn to the more refined, leg crossing, floating pinky finger male species), but the warm crumpets, divine sandwiches (fig & olive tapenade - my personal fave) and eclectic decor will make your girlish dreams come alive.   I've thrown a couple bridal showers here for my queens and religiously sip tea at Lovejoy's when mum's in town.  The service is fitting, a little noisy if there's a large party, but overall, great price for quite a different experience from the 5 star hotel tea rooms.  Oh, and I might add that LJ's is light years better than the more fabricated 'Lisa's Tea Treasures' chain.  Finally, check out the recently set up sister shop across the street so that you, too, can acquire similar pieces for your Lovejoy's at home.
author: Irene S.

description: My cousin held a bridal shower for her daughter at Lovejoy's.  Everything about the tea room was really nice: service, food and tea.  We enjoyed trying all of the herbal and black teas - my favorite was the black tea lovejoy blend.  It is a great tea room for any occasion or no occasion for everyone.  We loved Lovejoy's and can't wait to return!
author: CityGirl W.

description: The quintessential High Tea Room! I absolutely fell in love with this tea room. A great place to go with the girls or even bring some firm in their sexuality man-friends. A great afternoon. Their preserves were wonderful, I'm almost positive they make them fresh. The tea, especially blood orange, was delicious. I highly recommend the Artichoke Hummus sandwich for a tasty, vegetarian tea sandwich. The service was great and we even got a 10% discount to buy a tea pot at their store across the street. So much fun, go for the tea stay for the treats!
author: Hayley C.

description: Gawd how this place annoys me.  I probably wouldn't care if we weren't neighbors. Saturdays and Sundays it's hard to park in my 'hood because of Lovejoys.  Herds of women flock to this tea and doily heaven. On the weekends (esp. when it's cold) the windows are dripping from the condensation and heat inside from all the women gabbing. People constantly block the street to load their cars with gifts from their respective showers (wedding, baby, puppy adoption- whatever) and then stand there and gab while causing traffic to pile.  Or they walk to their cars parked in front of my house and stand there cackling and shrieking for up to an hour saying their good-byes and how they are so happy for so-and-so who was having the party.  I consider myself a normal reasonable girl (ok maybe I hate being obligated to attend showers) but dealing with their customers all time makes me want to pop someone's balloons!
author: All About Town ..

description:
Deeeelicious!!!!
Just went there today for the first time after having heard stories of wonderful sandwiches and teas. We made reservations for 1pm, but got there around 1:20, since our bart was running late (you can take the 24th/mission station, and walk about 10mins).
It was pretty packed when we arrived, but our table was there, w/that little "reserved" sign on it. The service was great. Our teas came out in less than 5 mins.
We got the High Tea for Two plus one. Three of us ordered two types of sandwiches each. The fig & olive was not very popular, only one of us liked it. The pear & stilton cheese was very good. Chicken & asparagus delicious. Roastbeef and horseradish a little too spicy for me. Cucumber and cream cheese could've used a little more taste, but ate it all anyway. Salmon and cream cheese, I didn't eat, but the other two loved it. The teas--passion fruit tea was sweet and yummy. Chinese rosehip very aromatic. I got the forest berries, which smelled and tasted like cough syrup! gasp. I told our server I really did not like it, and she asked if I wanted a replacement :) Hooray! I got an earl grey instead, since that's what I know and love. It was great. The scones were very fresh and warm. Cottled cream did wonders. I even had room for the cookies. YUMMMM. Would love love love to go back!
All three of us were soooo stuffed! But in a good way. Next time, I will try their Shephard's pie. Miss those...

Oh, there is only one bathroom. And don't use the lotion, it smells like shit!
author: Aiko L.

description: this is absolutely my favorite tea place.  it is great for a girls' afternoon out.  (probably a little frilly for boys)  high tea is a must.  they have some of the greatest tea sandwiches.  one of my fav places in sf.
author: Sia K.

description: delightful!  we made a reservation Just In Case, and when we got there (a couple of minutes late, due to transit misjudgements) just after seating was supposed to have stopped (although it was fairly empty, and they let someone in a half-hour later and fed them what they could since the kitchen was closed), they still showed us to our adorable table (in the window, where we could watch the dogs go by) and fed us lovely things.  the biscuits, which are made offsite, i'm pretty sure, were a little high in baking soda...  but i suspect it was just that day.  our server was a sweetheart, although the impressions we got from the owner (? the person very much In Charge sitting in the back) wasn't so good.  but, they appealed to the tea snob that is my partner, and we'll go back, i'm sure, if only because it charms my partner into bed.
author: Puck F.

description: i love, love, love, lovejoy...if you love high tea, scones with jam,  and delicious tea sandwiches... AND feeling like your in grandma's living room then you will LOVE lovejoys! its a sweet little place only to be reserved for those who will appreciate it...like me...
author: Amaly B.

description: finally visited lovejoy's for the first time-- what a cool place!!  my friend took me and i really loved it.   just given the name, it's obvious this is a girly place (think i counted only a couple of guys when i went), but such a neat thing to do.  loved all the sandwiches we ordered, and the scones were fantastic-- really buttery and so good after putting on MORE butter and jam.  for sandwiches we had the chicken/asparagus, salmon/cream cheese, roast beef/horse radish... and i can't remember the last one.  but they were all good.  but it's really not about the tea or the food so much-- it's more the experience and the atmosphere--can't wait to go back.  another sf gem.   yes and make reservations.  we wished we had.
author: Yvette H.

description: is a romantic yet casual tea place.  I love their pastry which is made fresh daily from the local bakers in the neighbohood.  Sound idea for baby / bridal shower.
author: Gabrielle L.

description: This was the first time I've ever had afternoon tea. I thought the place was really cute and the food was delicious. It's a bit pricey and not something you'd do often. But get a bunch of people together and it's great to way to spend an afternoon. Go for the High Tea or the Queen's Tea for the most variety but make sure you come with a hearty appetite. My favorites were the scones and crumpets. The decor is really quite ecclectic--assorted flatware, wall decorations.
author: Lisa C.

description: Went here for brunch with 2 friends. The atmosphere is really kitschy with lots of knick knacks--kind of feels like what a sweet old grandma from england's house would be like. The chairs, tables, china--all odds and ends-nothing matches, but that's what gives this place its charm. We ordered the "High-Tea for 2, with an extra added on" which comes with a choice of 2 sandwiches per person, a green salad, scones with devon shire cream and jam, and cookies. For the sandwiches we ordered chicken apple walnut, chicken & asparagus, and pear & stilton. They were all very good, but the pear & stilton was my fav. For tea, I chose yorkshire gold which was a stronger black tea. Everything was very very delish, and I at 1st thought it wouldn't be enough to fill me up, but by the end I was stuffed. It all culminated with the scones and devon shire cream--Oh my god--pure heaven.  Good service, cute ambience, and yummy scones and tea! loved it!
author: S A.

description: Quaint, elegant and tasty!  All that I expect from a traditional tea room.  Other than being a tad bit pricey, it was a great place to take my mom and sis to celebrate Mother's Day!
author: Hannah R.

description: this is a great place to pretend to be high society or a 4 year old girl.  or a 4 year old high society girl.  either way this place is fun.  plus the tea and food are good.  and you don't have to cut your own crust.
author: jen b.

description: I have been bringing my parents here and meeting here with friends for a few years and I LOVE IT!! Having a connection to England myself, it reminds me of those days - such sweet sandwiches, sausage rolls & baked beans, amazing scones with clotted cream! Need I say more?! The only downfall is it's usually really busy and the prices are high!
author: Michelle D.

description: if you love tea this is a great little place to come and have a light meal with tea. It has a great atmosphere and is a great place to come and steal a quiet moment by yourself or get together with a few girlfriends.
author: kate w.

description: This place is the best.  The "Queen's tea" makes you full without realizing it and everything is baked fresh right out of the oven.  The decor makes you feel like you are really transported to a English Victoria tearoom.  Very nice place to relax with your friends during the weekend.  Haven't been to another place quite like it.
author: a f.

description:
Just spent some time in London, and I have to tell you, Lovejoy's is still my favorite. Plus, no one offered me a petit four when I was in London!
I love everything about this place. The teas are of the finest quality.  When you get one of the comprehensive teas, it comes with mixed greens and Cole slaw.  There Cole slaw is great; caraway seeds.   They bake their own shortbread cookies.  
The tea sandwiches are great.  My favorites are salmon mousse,  egg with capers and  onion, pear and Stilton and cucumber.  The pet it four at the end is the topper. My faves are the wedding cake and the  lemon.
I often  go there for lunch if in between clients.  They have super Shepard's Pie and a nice Plowman's lunch-making Love joy's not only for those with female genitalia. (My point is that I have taken my uncle there and he said it was not enough food; he should have order the Shepard's  pie.  And when I do see the occasional guy at Lovejoy's,  he  is typically eating the Shepard's Pie).
Oh boy, I have really dug myself a hole here.  Hard to type with foot in mouth.
Go to Lovejoy's. You'll "Love" it!
author: Alulubeth O.

description: I was lucky enough to come here for a bridal shower.  To be honest, born and raised in Texas I had never experienced afternoon tea with crumpets.  I loved the whole experience.  The different types of teas we chose were absolutely delicious.  I believe we ordered about 4 different types of sandwiches. Being a vegetarian, they had plenty of options to choose from.  The fresh fruit and salad added the perfect touch!  During the time we were enjoying our sandwiches, our host had booked a tea leaf reader.  She was amazing!  I was not expecting that, and she blew my mind away.  Keep in mind that when you do want to book her it is for an hour and I believe the rate is $95.00.  In conclusion, this was a great experience, and I think that everyone should try it once.  Although the crowd is typically older, it is still fun, especially with a lot of your girlfriends.  I HIGHLY recommend this place.
author: Samantha R.

description:
I did one of those semester abroad things in London, and one my absolute favorite things about the brits is their High Tea. Finger sandwiches, warm scones split open and smothered with double cream and preserves and a hot pot of tea were enjoyed (almost) daily by my engorging little self. 
Upon my return to the states, I just about gave up the dream of ever having such a luxuriously delicious afternoon until I came to know Lovejoy's Tea Room.
First of all, it's adorable. The walls are covered in little antiquey thing-a-ma-bobs (all of which are for sale), the tables adorned with lace doileys and cloths and every woman who works there is almost ridiculously kind. (On a personal note, I also enjoy that most of the time the tea room is a women's space, sometimes a few men will be here and there).

Next, to the food and tea. Hot pots of neverending tea accompany your high tea selections or you can buy just a pot for $8. All the teas are amazing, and the servers come by every 10 minutes or so to check on the tea level and refill it. Everytime I've been there I've ordered the High Tea for Two to share with my girlfriend, a freakin' steal at $34 bucks. You select 4 types of sandwiches to share, a warm scone each, with strawberry preserves and double devon cream, 2 shortbread tea biscuits, coleslaw (with caraway seeds mmmmm) and spring greens/dressing. I order the cucumber/cream cheese sandwiches (they cut off the crusts!!!), The Stilton and Pear, The Artichoke Hummus and the Tomato and cheese (I'm a vegetarian, though I'm sure their meat sandwich selections are just are delicious). 
All of this is served on a layered silver tray, which makes me feel a bit like a princess, I can't help it.
At the end of the meal, though I've always been stuffed, they bring around yet another beautiful tray with petit fours for an additional $2.50. Omg, just get one, ok?
Everything about this place is enjoyable, calming, nurturing and delicious, and I feel again like I am in the UK. I tried to think of a reason to give it only 4 stars, but I really can't. 
An amazing place to bring out-of-town guests, or to enjoy a lazy sunday brunch with your love or a good book. 
Oh, and their strawberry preserves would make sawdust taste like mana from heaven. How the hell do they make them?
author: Robin A.

description: nice little place for high tea. good food and neat little sandwiches. space was tight, though. there were three of us at a table and with all the little plates, pots, cups, and trays to be mindful of, it was hard to maneuver.
author: Kan L.

description: A cute, jam packed (or should i say 'preserves') tea house complete with kitschy antique tea sets lining the wall and kitschy antique waitresses serving you, it's an adorable place for a date to catch up with a girlfriend or a low-key bridal shower.  Not a lot of elbow room, but that's how Miss Manners would have wanted it!
author: Anjali K.

description: Now, there are plenty of places to have an impromptu get together for tea, but if you want to make it a special date (and you should! value your girlfriends!), call two weeks in advance and book yourself a table. You can wear anything from jeans to your party dress, it's all acceptable. Your tea will be served and timed perfectly, with plenty of cream and sugar, should you need it, and enough strainers so that you'll never have to mix flavors. Beware the giddiness of too much caffeine. There is an hour and a hall seating time (which we tend to use and then some), but we have never been rushed out of a table. We like to order the queen's tea- don't eat anything before hand, all those sandwiches and salad, scones, crumpets, cookies and lemon curd is more than plenty, but everything is too yummy to leave behind! Lovejoy's feels indulgent, and is therefore a great place to celebrate life's exciting events. I've seen many a shower or small party here. Mostly, though, this teahouse always reminds me how important it is to honor our friendships and indulge them with time, space, and conversation over perfectly steeped tea!
author: Jessica R.

description: I hosted a large party and ordered tea sandwiches from here based on the raving reviews I read on Yelp.  I agree with everyone that the food is good.  However, I was very disappointed when I got home to a large room of people and discovered that they had substituted some sandwiches without notifying me.  I think their food is good but they lack professional catering experience.  Go here with your friends, but don't use them if you have a party.  Or make sure to carefully look over your order *before* you get home.
author: Kim L.

description: Excellent food, tea, atmosphere and service. Reservations are almost required and the more advanced the reservation, the better.
author: Jeremy S.

description: I was invited to a baby shower at Lovejoys and wasn't sure what to expect as many tea rooms can be a bit stuffy.  Lovejoy's is not that.  It's comfortable and there is no mistaking that it's an English tea room.  The service was fantastic and even though the place was packed the two and a half hours we were there (group of 15), they were extremely attentive and even took care of my non-dairy needs.  I had asked for a non-dairy tea sandwich and expected to get one or two pieces - as happened to me on a recent visit to the tea room at the King George Hotel where they are very inattentive  - but to my complete surprise, they brought out a platter full with a couple of different options.  I think no matter what the occassion, you'll enjoy this place!
author: Amy M.

description: I think this might be the girliest place on earth and I love it!  Its the best place to meet up with a girlfriend for a lovely brunch before heading down the street to Angel's for a mani/pedi.  I have always found the staff to be uber pleasant, great at making recommendations on which tea you might  like and so accommodating.  I love the High Tea for Two.  Delicious and really fun.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Atmosphere is everything!!

Yes, the atmosphere is so cute, but if you look at the prices, you realize you're getting ripped, especially if you see the price of a package of crumpets in a local supermarket. And $7.95 (I think that's what it was) for a pot of tea!!! You're definitely getting ripped. I think of  Higher Grounds in Glen Park and their pots for about two bucks. Yes, it's an endless pot, but I can only drink so much tea. I may be in the wrong situation to appreciate this place properly, since I was the only solo customer there, and an endless pot of tea might be good for a group, and pooling your money for a large platter of goodies might pay off. And as for atmosphere, granted I may have more slow digestive system than average, but it's hard to fully relax and appreciate the atmosphere as much as you might when the server asks you if you're all done because other parties need your table. Probably this is great for girly parties, but for those truly living the revered Jane Austen's lifestyle (a single woman alone), you might want to make a different choice.
author: Cat S.

description: Absolutely the best English tea room in San Francisco. My older sister first brought me to Lovejoy and have introduced it all my girlfriends. This charming place filled with antique is perfect for bridal showers and birthday parties. Be sure to check out the store across the street. Best scones ever!
author: Millo M.

description: Cute little place. I came here last week with my flower girls and we had a great time. The tea is amazing and I don't even really like tea. My only complaint is that it is too pricey for finger foods, but the kiddies were happy so that's all that matters.
author: Natalie F.

description: What an amazing experience!  We recently had a birthday tea with 9 girlfriends and it was by far the best high tea experience any of us had ever had!  We brought in our own champagne (they have a corkage fee) and we ordeded an incredible selection of sanwiches, fruit and salad accompanied by the most amazing scones and crumpets.  The service was the best any of us had experienced!  It was a rainy day in San Francisco and we endulged in our window seat and enjoyed the incredible food, tea and sweets...this is a must do!
author: Laurie G.

description: I really think Lovejoy's is a joy.  About 20 years ago now (yikes!) I tasted my first scone, visiting my sister who was living in Scotland.  I've been back to the UK a few times since and feel about scones & Britain the way I do about bagels & NYC. It's nearly impossible to get a good scone with all the fixin's here in the US, but Lovejoy's does a remarkably good job. Beyond that, though, it's a joy to sit there with the china tea cups, the wonderful tea, the delicious treats. (Why are simple, little sandwiches with the crust cut off so dang good?)  The staff is wonderful, accommodating and cheerful.  They promptly fit us in even when the recording had said they were not taking any more reservations and our server was totally on the ball.  The idea that you are not only able but encouraged to linger over endless pots of tea and nibbles is great.  I was a bit surprised at the rowdiness of the crowd and, consequently, the loudness of the place.  This isn't a deal-breaker for me at all, just something worth noting since it's been mentioned before.  In our case it wasn't screaming children, but it was a large group of excitable women for a wedding shower, I'm guessing.  So, if you're looking for a very upscale, quiet, formal place for tea, this isn't quite it.  But the trade-off is that it's not at all snooty, the prices are reasonable, service is excellent and food delicious.
author: Fran C.

description: I am so impressed with Lovejoy's. The sandwiches,scones, and tea(s)are wonderful. The hostess's were great, I would definitely go back. I've been raving about Lovejoy's ever since I sat down at our table. Lovejoy's has become a new tradition for me.
author: Linda K.
